original: lan gnyis sam gsum du bskul bar bya dran par bya ba ni tshig gi bdag nyid kyis de lan gsum pas lhag par bskul bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan gnyis sam gsum du bskul bar bya dran par bya ba ni tshig gi bdag nyid kyis de lan gsum pas lhag par bskul bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should remind him twice or three times means that one should remind him verbally up to three times, not more.

original: lan bzhi lan lnga lan drug gi bar du zhes bya ba ni sngar bskul ba lan gsum byas pa'i 'og tu phyogs su cang mi smra bar bsdad pa yang lan gsum byas te bskul ba dang / bsdad pa dang gnyis ka la spyir lan drug tu bgrang ba yin gyi phyogs su bsdad pa 'ba' zhig la lan drug bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: lan bzhi lan lnga lan drug gi bar du zhes bya ba ni sngar bskul ba lan gsum byas pa'i 'og tu phyogs su cang mi smra bar bsdad pa yang lan gsum byas te bskul ba dang / bsdad pa dang gnyis ka la spyir lan drug tu bgrang ba yin gyi phyogs su bsdad pa 'ba' zhig la lan drug bya ba ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that one remains silent in the direction six times.

original: bskul ba lan gsum las lhag gam bsdad pa lan gsum las lhag pa byas te /
analyzed: bskul ba lan gsum las lhag gam bsdad pa lan gsum las lhag pa byas te /
translated: If one urges more than three times or remains silent more than three times,

original: gos grub na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gos grub na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then even if the robe is finished, there is an offense of wrongdoing.

original: phyogs su zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyogs su zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the direction means🔽in which direction?

original: phyogs gang du zhe na de'i phyir phyogs bzhi po de dag tu zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: phyogs gang du zhe na de'i phyir phyogs bzhi po de dag tu zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it says, “in those four directions.”

original: de dag tu mi dag phal cher gnas pa las dgongs so //
analyzed: de dag tu mi dag phal cher gnas pa las dgongs so //
translated: It is from the perspective that most people live in those directions.

original: 'bod gnas zhes bya ba ni las 'dod pa'i mi dag 'bod pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: 'bod gnas zhes bya ba ni las 'dod pa'i mi dag 'bod pa'i gnas so //
translated: A place where people are summoned is a place where people who desire work are summoned.

original: khyim gnas zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: khyim gnas zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa'i gnas so //
translated: A place where people live is a place where they stay.

original: ha cang myur ba zhes bya ba ni tshig myur ba'o //
analyzed: ha cang myur ba zhes bya ba ni tshig myur ba'o //
translated: “Very quickly” means quickly with the words.

original: thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni mi sdod par ro //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni mi sdod par ro //
translated: “Without hesitation” means without delay.

original: brjod cing zhes bya ba ni zhal ta byed pas so //
analyzed: brjod cing zhes bya ba ni zhal ta byed pas so //
translated: “To speak” means to speak as a messenger.

original: gzhan gyi tshig gi skabs zhes bya ba ni skul bar byed pa'i dge slong gi'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshig gi skabs zhes bya ba ni skul bar byed pa'i dge slong gi'o //
translated: “The occasion of the words of another” means the occasion of the words of the monk who is the instigator.

original: de'i don cir yang ma grub kyis zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ci tsam yang ma grub kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i don cir yang ma grub kyis zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ci tsam yang ma grub kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “If the meaning is not accomplished” means if the result is not accomplished.

original: shes par gyis shig @119b ces bya ba ni rang gi rdzas tshol cig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes par gyis shig @119b ces bya ba ni rang gi rdzas tshol cig ces bya ba'o //
translated: “Understand” means “Seek your own wealth.”

original: cho ga zhes bya ba ni ris pa rjes su bsgrub pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: cho ga zhes bya ba ni ris pa rjes su bsgrub pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “The rite” means “The subsequent practice.”

original: de'i sems bsdu bzhes bya ba ni yongs su dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de'i sems bsdu bzhes bya ba ni yongs su dga' ba'o //
translated: “To gather his mind” means to delight him.

original: go rims de lta bus ma byas par gang cung zad len na thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rin rung ba ma yin pa dag len na nyes byas su 'gyur ba dang / ma 'dres par zhal ta byed pa ston na nyes byas su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: go rims de lta bus ma byas par gang cung zad len na thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rin rung ba ma yin pa dag len na nyes byas su 'gyur ba dang / ma 'dres par zhal ta byed pa ston na nyes byas su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: This means that it is a minor offense if one takes what is not the proper price, it is a minor offense if one teaches a monk who is not a relative to be an attendant,🔽it is a minor offense if one urges or reminds a monk who is not a messenger, it is a minor offense if one does not inform the donor when one has not obtained the goods,

original: pho nyas ma smras pa bskul ba dang dran par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ba dang / ma thob na sbyin bdag la sgrogs par mi byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ba dang / bsgrags nas zhal ta byed pa stobs pa na sbyin bdag la bsgrags zin to zhas spangs pa mi smra na nyes byas su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: pho nyas ma smras pa bskul ba dang dran par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ba dang / ma thob na sbyin bdag la sgrogs par mi byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ba dang / bsgrags nas zhal ta byed pa stobs pa na sbyin bdag la bsgrags zin to zhas spangs pa mi smra na nyes byas su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: and it is a minor offense if one does not tell the donor that one has already informed him when one is teaching an attendant who has already been informed.

original: sbyin par byed pa'i sems bsdu ba rjes su bsgrub pa khas mi len pa'i zhal ta byed pa las gos len na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sbyin par byed pa'i sems bsdu ba rjes su bsgrub pa khas mi len pa'i zhal ta byed pa las gos len na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is a minor offense if one accepts cloth from an attendant who does not accept the request to collect the intention to give.

original: mi ma yin pas sbyin par byed cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mu bzhi pa gnyis kyi go rims ni dang po dang dbus dang tha ma gsum char mi ma yin pa ni mu dang po'o //
analyzed: mi ma yin pas sbyin par byed cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mu bzhi pa gnyis kyi go rims ni dang po dang dbus dang tha ma gsum char mi ma yin pa ni mu dang po'o //
translated: The first, middle and last are all nonhuman is the first alternative.

original: dang po dang dbus gnyis mi yin la tha ma mi ma yin pa ni mu gnyis pa'o //🔽dang po dang dbus gnyis mi yin la tha ma mi ma yin pa ni mu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: dang po dang dbus gnyis mi yin la tha ma mi ma yin pa ni mu gnyis pa'o // dang po dang dbus gnyis mi yin la tha ma mi ma yin pa ni mu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The first and middle are human, but the last is nonhuman is the second alternative.

original: dang po dang tha ma mi ma yin la dbus ma yin pa ni mu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: dang po dang tha ma mi ma yin la dbus ma yin pa ni mu gsum pa'o //
translated: The first and last are nonhuman, but the middle is human is the third alternative.🔽The first is human, but the middle and last are nonhuman is the fourth alternative.

original: dang po mi yin la dbus dang tha ma mi ma yin pa ni mu bzhi pa ste de dag ni mi ma yin pa sngon du btang ba'i mu bzhi yin no //
analyzed: dang po mi yin la dbus dang tha ma mi ma yin pa ni mu bzhi pa ste de dag ni mi ma yin pa sngon du btang ba'i mu bzhi yin no //
translated: These are the four alternatives that begin with nonhuman.

original: de bzhin du dang po dang dbus mi yin la tha ma mi ma yin pa mu dang po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dang po dang dbus mi yin la tha ma mi ma yin pa mu dang po'o //
translated: Similarly, the first and middle are human, but the last is nonhuman is the first alternative.

original: dang po dang tha ma mi yin la dbus mi ma yin pa ni mu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: dang po dang tha ma mi yin la dbus mi ma yin pa ni mu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The first and last are human, but the middle is nonhuman is the second alternative.

original: dbus dang tha ma mi yin la dang po mi ma yin pa ni mu gsum pa'o //🔽dang po dang dbus dang tha ma gsum char mi ma yin pa ni mu bzhi pa ste gang dag ni mi sngon du btang ba'i mu bzhi yin no //
analyzed: dbus dang tha ma mi yin la dang po mi ma yin pa ni mu gsum pa'o // dang po dang dbus dang tha ma gsum char mi ma yin pa ni mu bzhi pa ste gang dag ni mi sngon du btang ba'i mu bzhi yin no //
translated: The third alternative is that the first and last are human, but the middle one is not.🔽The fourth alternative is that all three—the first, the middle, and the last—are not human.

original: dang po dang dbus dang tha ma gsum char mi yin pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed gyi rgyu yin pas mjug tu bstan te nyes pa lji ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po dang dbus dang tha ma gsum char mi yin pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed gyi rgyu yin pas mjug tu bstan te nyes pa lji ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The fourth alternative is that all three—the first, the middle, and the last—are human. This is stated at the end because it is the most serious offense.

original: skur pa'i spang ba ste bcu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: skur pa'i spang ba ste bcu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the tenth rule, on lying, is finished.

original: // / srin bal zhes bya ba ni srin bal 'byung ba'i srin bu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: // / srin bal zhes bya ba ni srin bal 'byung ba'i srin bu las byung ba'o //
translated: Cotton is the product of the cotton plant.

original: ma log ces bya ba ni sbyor ba las so //
analyzed: ma log ces bya ba ni sbyor ba las so //
translated: “Not reversed” means not reversed from the preparatory stage.

original: ma spangs zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: ma spangs zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi'o //
translated: “Not abandoned” means not abandoned from the actual basis.

original: so sor ma spangs zhes bya ba ni mjug go //🔽gsar pas gsar pa zhes bya ba ni dper na shing thog gsar pa @120a * //
analyzed: so sor ma spangs zhes bya ba ni mjug go // gsar pas gsar pa zhes bya ba ni dper na shing thog gsar pa @120a * //
translated: “Not relinquished” means not relinquished from the conclusion.

original: dang lo tog gsar pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dang lo tog gsar pa lta bu'o //
translated: “New for new” means, for example, like a new fruit or a new harvest.

original: rnyed pas gsar pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnyed pas gsar pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The new is called new because it is not old.

original: dper na rgyal srid gsar pa dang / gzhung gsar pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rgyal srid gsar pa dang / gzhung gsar pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a new kingdom or a new government.

original: gsar pas gsar pa yin par dgongs so zhes bya ba ni dkon pa'i phyir dang / srog chags gsod pas skur pa 'debs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gsar pas gsar pa yin par dgongs so zhes bya ba ni dkon pa'i phyir dang / srog chags gsod pas skur pa 'debs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The new is new because it is rare and because it is the cause of the slander of killing living beings.

original: / nang tshangs can zhes bya ba ni ras bal can gyi rnam pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: / nang tshangs can zhes bya ba ni ras bal can gyi rnam pa lta bu'o //
translated: The inner is like the form of cotton.

original: blings pa zhes bya ba ni phying pa'i rnam pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: blings pa zhes bya ba ni phying pa'i rnam pa lta bu'o //
translated: The outer is like the form of a mat.

original: gnyis ka yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka yin par dgongs so //
translated: The inner and outer is intended as both.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka yang dkon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka yang dkon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are rare.

original: chun po zhes bya ba ni ke du'o //
analyzed: chun po zhes bya ba ni ke du'o //
translated: The bundle is the ke-du.

original: mda' ba zhes bya ba ni sgo nga'o //
analyzed: mda' ba zhes bya ba ni sgo nga'o //
translated: The arrow is the egg.

original: phung po zhes bya ba ni bkram pa'o //🔽'byed par byed ces bya ba ni 'grol bar byed pa'o //🔽'jig par byed ces bya ba ni sel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: phung po zhes bya ba ni bkram pa'o // 'byed par byed ces bya ba ni 'grol bar byed pa'o // 'jig par byed ces bya ba ni sel bar byed pa'o //
translated: The heap is the spread.🔽To split is to open.🔽To destroy is to remove.

original: rmel bar byed ces bya ba ni spu nas sel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rmel bar byed ces bya ba ni spu nas sel bar byed pa'o //
translated: To tear is to remove by the hair.

original: srin bal gyi spang ba ste bcu gcig pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: srin bal gyi spang ba ste bcu gcig pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the eleventh rule is finished.

original: // / nag po 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni nag po nyi tshe'o //
analyzed: // / nag po 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni nag po nyi tshe'o //
translated: Only black means only black from a black animal.

original: rang bzhin gyis gnag pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin kho nas gnag pa gnag dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gnag pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin kho nas gnag pa gnag dag yin pa'o //
translated: Naturally black means naturally black, not dyed black.

original: sngo bas gnag pa zhes bya ba ni phyis sngon pos kha bsgyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngo bas gnag pa zhes bya ba ni phyis sngon pos kha bsgyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Dyed black means that which is dyed black later.

original: 'dam kha zhes bya ba ni 'dam rdzab gyi sa nag gis kha bsgyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dam kha zhes bya ba ni 'dam rdzab gyi sa nag gis kha bsgyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Mud-dyed means that which is dyed with black mud.

original: kham pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis kham pa dang / gro bo dang sre bo la sogs pa nag nog can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kham pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis kham pa dang / gro bo dang sre bo la sogs pa nag nog can gang yin pa'o //
translated: Blackened means naturally blackened, or blackened by soot, charcoal, etc.

original: blings pa yin par dgongs so zhes bya ba ni de ches bya ba dka' ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blings pa yin par dgongs so zhes bya ba ni de ches bya ba dka' ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He thought of it as being dyed means that it is difficult to dye.

original: bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang ba ste bcu gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang ba ste bcu gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the twelfth rule, about only black wool, is finished.

original: // /'khob bal zhes bya ba ni mgo dang rkang pa dang lto nas skyes pa'i bal dag ste phal cher sa la rgyu ba'i phyir sa rgyu ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: // /'khob bal zhes bya ba ni mgo dang rkang pa dang lto nas skyes pa'i bal dag ste phal cher sa la rgyu ba'i phyir sa rgyu ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The wool of the border is wool that grows on the head, feet, and belly. It is called of the border because it is mostly worn by those who live in the border regions.

original: nag po 'ba' zhig mod pa dang rin mnyam pa la ltung ba med pa ni bslangs pa'i phyir dang 'dod pa che ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nag po 'ba' zhig mod pa dang rin mnyam pa la ltung ba med pa ni bslangs pa'i phyir dang 'dod pa che ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no offense if one exchanges an entire black blanket for an equal value, because one is not greedy.

original: cha gnyis sre ba'i spang ba ste bcu gsum pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: cha gnyis sre ba'i spang ba ste bcu gsum pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The thirteenth training rule on exchanging is finished.

original: // / grang ba zhes bya ba ni grang ba'i rig pa'o //
analyzed: // / grang ba zhes bya ba ni grang ba'i rig pa'o //
translated: Cold means cold weather.

original: rlung che ba ni rlung mang ba'o //
analyzed: rlung che ba ni rlung mang ba'o //
translated: A strong wind is a great wind.

original: stan gyis mi thub pa zhes bya ba ni stan du gding ba dang bgo ba dang sngas dag tu dgos pa zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stan gyis mi thub pa zhes bya ba ni stan du gding ba dang bgo ba dang sngas dag tu dgos pa zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A mattress is a mat, a cloth, or a pillow that has fulfilled its purpose.

original: bal sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'i phyir dang gso ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bal sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'i phyir dang gso ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One should give the wool means in order to grow it and in order to nourish it.

original: ral ba zhes @120b bya ba ni dum bur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ral ba zhes @120b bya ba ni dum bur gyur pa'o //
translated: A fray is a torn place.

original: rdol ba zhes bya ba ni bu gu dod pa'o //
analyzed: rdol ba zhes bya ba ni bu gu dod pa'o //
translated: “Split” means having a hole.

original: dge 'dun gyis gnang ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gnang ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis yongs su spangs pa'o //
translated: “Granted by the Saṅgha” means relinquished by the Saṅgha.

original: 'dir gsol ba la sogs pa la lag gi gla smos pa ni dge 'dun la gcis pa yin pa'i phyir nges pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gsol ba la sogs pa la lag gi gla smos pa ni dge 'dun la gcis pa yin pa'i phyir nges pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the mention of wages for work in the request, etc., should be understood as certain because it is a service to the Saṅgha.

original: gnyis pa rtsam la nyes byas su 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni snga ma brtsams pa nyid na phyi ma rtsom pa ni snga ma byas zin nas phyi ma rtsom pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa rtsam la nyes byas su 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni snga ma brtsams pa nyid na phyi ma rtsom pa ni snga ma byas zin nas phyi ma rtsom pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The second is a minor offense when begun, because beginning the latter while the former is still being done is like beginning the latter after the former is finished.

original: byas zin na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyis brtsams pa shos sngar zin na yang sbyor ba'i ltung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas zin na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyis brtsams pa shos sngar zin na yang sbyor ba'i ltung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even when finished, it is a minor offense, because even if the latter is completed first, it is still a downfall of preparation.

original: snga ma la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma byas par de brtsams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma byas par de brtsams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no downfall for the former, because it is begun without doing the other.

original: snga ma zin par byed ces bya ba ni brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma zin par byed ces bya ba ni brtsams pa'o //
translated: “When the former is finished” means when it is begun.

original: byas zin na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni stan ma'o //
analyzed: byas zin na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni stan ma'o //
translated: If one has already made it, there is an offense of wrongdoing.

original: lo gang la stan byas pa'i lo de nyid la stan gnyis pa yang byas nas zhes bya ba ni snga phyir brtsams te ngus gcig tu zin par byas nas so ;
analyzed: lo gang la stan byas pa'i lo de nyid la stan gnyis pa yang byas nas zhes bya ba ni snga phyir brtsams te ngus gcig tu zin par byas nas so ;
translated: If one makes a second mat in the very same year in which one made the first mat, it means that one begins the second one before the first is finished, and then finishes it.

original: / ma zin pa gtong ba zhes bya ba ni phyed zin pa med pas de la dngos gzhi med do //
analyzed: / ma zin pa gtong ba zhes bya ba ni phyed zin pa med pas de la dngos gzhi med do //
translated: If one gives up the unfinished one, it means that there is no actual basis for an offense, because there is no half-finished one.

original: lo drug pa la byed na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni lo drug gi 'og tu phyed na ste /
analyzed: lo drug pa la byed na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni lo drug gi 'og tu phyed na ste /
translated: There is no offense if one makes it in the sixth year, it means that if one makes it in the sixth year or after,

original: lo drug tshun chad du bcang bar byas zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lo drug tshun chad du bcang bar byas zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one has already made it in the sixth year or before.

original: 'gres lnga pa'i bsdu ba ni phyi ma zin par byed pa dang / snga ma zin par byed pa dang / gnyi ga zin par byed pa dang / gnyi ga brtsams te gtong ba dang / lo drug gi 'og tu byed pa la ltung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'gres lnga pa'i bsdu ba ni phyi ma zin par byed pa dang / snga ma zin par byed pa dang / gnyi ga zin par byed pa dang / gnyi ga brtsams te gtong ba dang / lo drug gi 'og tu byed pa la ltung ba med pa'o //
translated: The summary of the five groups is: making the next one before the previous one is finished, making the previous one before the next one is finished, making both before either is finished, giving up both before either is finished, and making it in the sixth year or after, without an offense.

original: lo drug tu bcang ba'i spang ba ste bcu bzhi pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: lo drug tu bcang ba'i spang ba ste bcu bzhi pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The fourteenth downfall requiring expulsion has been explained.

original: // / gding ba zhes bya ba ni so sor gding ba dras pa dag go //
analyzed: // / gding ba zhes bya ba ni so sor gding ba dras pa dag go //
translated: The term bed refers to a bedspread or a mat.

original: phul lo zhes bya ba ni byin pa'o //
analyzed: phul lo zhes bya ba ni byin pa'o //
translated: Given means offered.

original: rdzas las byung ba'i zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang ste rdzas las byung ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas las byung ba'i zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang ste rdzas las byung ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term material refers to a monastery, because it is the result of material things.

original: bsod snyoms mngon par bsgrubs so zhes bya ba ni mnos pa'o //🔽rdol ba zhes bya ba ni bu gu 'byung ba'o //🔽ral ba zhes bya ba ni dum bur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bsod snyoms mngon par bsgrubs so zhes bya ba ni mnos pa'o // rdol ba zhes bya ba ni bu gu 'byung ba'o // ral ba zhes bya ba ni dum bur gyur pa'o //
translated: The term alms refers to a vow.🔽The term hole refers to a hole in the bed.🔽The term torn refers to a bed that is in pieces.

original: bkram pa zhes bya ba ni chal bar bkod pa'o //
analyzed: bkram pa zhes bya ba ni chal bar bkod pa'o //
translated: The term spread out refers to a bed that is spread out in the wrong place.

original: ae ma zhes bya ba ni ma mnyes pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: ae ma zhes bya ba ni ma mnyes pa'i tshig go //
translated: The term alas is a word of displeasure.

original: smad nas zhes bya ba ni mi rigs par ro //
analyzed: smad nas zhes bya ba ni mi rigs par ro //
translated: The term criticized means criticized in an improper way.

original: drod mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni tshod mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: drod mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni tshod mi shes pa'o //
translated: The term not knowing the right amount means not knowing the proper amount.

original: so sor mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par mi rtog par ro //
analyzed: so sor mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par mi rtog par ro //
translated: The term without discernment means without clear discernment.

original: drod ran par yongs su longs spyad pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su gzhal zhing longs spyad pa'o //🔽spang zhing yongs su longs @121a * //
analyzed: drod ran par yongs su longs spyad pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su gzhal zhing longs spyad pa'o // spang zhing yongs su longs @121a * //
translated: “One should enjoy in moderation” means one should enjoy after having measured.🔽“One should enjoy without attachment” means one should enjoy without being attached to the object of enjoyment.🔽“One should enjoy without clinging” means one should enjoy without clinging to the object of enjoyment.🔽“One should enjoy without storing” means one should enjoy without storing up for later.🔽“One should enjoy without hoarding” means one should enjoy without hoarding up for later.🔽“One should enjoy without rejecting” means one should enjoy without rejecting anything.

original: spyad pa zhes bya ba ni brgya la brgya lam na longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: spyad pa zhes bya ba ni brgya la brgya lam na longs spyod pa'o //
translated: “One should enjoy without indulging” means one should enjoy without indulging in any one thing.🔽“One should enjoy without excess” means one should enjoy without excess.🔽“One should enjoy without being greedy” means one should enjoy without being greedy.🔽“One should enjoy without being insatiable” means one should enjoy without being insatiable.🔽“One should enjoy without being addicted” means one should enjoy without being addicted.🔽“One should enjoy without being infatuated” means one should enjoy without being infatuated.🔽“One should enjoy without being confused” means one should enjoy without being confused.🔽“One should enjoy without being deluded” means one should enjoy without being deluded.

original: dus su yongs su longs spyod pa zhes bya ba ni dgos pa'i dus su longs spyod pa'o //🔽brtag cing yongs su spyad pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba brtags te yongs su longs spyad pa'o //
analyzed: dus su yongs su longs spyod pa zhes bya ba ni dgos pa'i dus su longs spyod pa'o // brtag cing yongs su spyad pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba brtags te yongs su longs spyad pa'o //
translated: “One should enjoy without being intoxicated” means one should enjoy without being intoxicated.🔽“One should enjoy without being arrogant” means one should enjoy without being arrogant.🔽“One should enjoy without being haughty” means one should enjoy without being haughty.🔽“One should enjoy without being proud” means one should enjoy without being proud.🔽“One should enjoy without being conceited” means one should enjoy without being conceited.

original: khad kyis yongs su longs spyod na zhes bya ba ni khad kyis khad kyis ltos pa dang bcas par yongs su longs spyod na'o //
analyzed: khad kyis yongs su longs spyod na zhes bya ba ni khad kyis khad kyis ltos pa dang bcas par yongs su longs spyod na'o //
translated: “One should enjoy without being greedy” means one should enjoy without being greedy.🔽“One should enjoy without being stingy” means one should enjoy without being stingy.🔽“One should enjoy without being envious” means one should enjoy without being envious.🔽“One should enjoy without being jealous” means one should enjoy without being jealous.🔽“One should enjoy without being angry” means one should enjoy without being angry.🔽“One should enjoy without being spiteful” means one should enjoy without being spiteful.🔽“One should enjoy without being deceitful” means one should enjoy without being deceitful.🔽“One should enjoy without being cunning” means one should enjoy without being cunning.🔽“One should enjoy without being fraudulent” means one should enjoy without being fraudulent.

original: kha dog mi sdug par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kha dog mi sdug par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //🔽ci'i phyir kha dog mi sdug par bya zhe na /
analyzed: kha dog mi sdug par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kha dog mi sdug par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //🔽ci'i phyir kha dog mi sdug par bya zhe na /
translated: “One should enjoy without being deceitful” means one should enjoy without being deceitful.🔽“One should enjoy

original: de'i phyir sra bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te gnyis pas sra bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so ;
analyzed: de'i phyir sra bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te gnyis pas sra bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so ;
translated: Therefore, the second line states, “in order to make it firm.”

original: / spyod par byed na zhes bya ba ni so sor gding ba nyid du spyod par byed na'o //
analyzed: / spyod par byed na zhes bya ba ni so sor gding ba nyid du spyod par byed na'o //
translated: “If one uses” means if one uses it as a personal mat.

original: so sor gding ba zhes bya ba ni stan 'og ma so sor thams cad kyi steng du gding bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor gding ba zhes bya ba ni stan 'og ma so sor thams cad kyi steng du gding bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Personal mat” means that it is to be spread out on top of all the lower seats.

original: mtho gang gi spang ba ste bco lnga pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: mtho gang gi spang ba ste bco lnga pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the fifteenth rule is finished.

original: // / rnga mo'i rgyab 'dra ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / rnga mo'i rgyab 'dra ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Like the back of a camel”

original: 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dpe bstan te /
analyzed: 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dpe bstan te /
translated: The word “like” indicates a simile.

original: des na bal yul ni rnga mo'i rgyab 'dra bar mi mnyam pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽khur zhes bya ba ni rgyab khal lo //
analyzed: des na bal yul ni rnga mo'i rgyab 'dra bar mi mnyam pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // khur zhes bya ba ni rgyab khal lo //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that the land of Nepal is uneven, like the back of a camel.🔽“Load” means a load on the back.

original: tho 'tshams pa zhes bya ba ni zhes 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: tho 'tshams pa zhes bya ba ni zhes 'debs pa'o //
translated: “To harass” means to beat.

original: rdul phra rab ces bya ba ni rdzas brgyad skye ba'i chos 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: rdul phra rab ces bya ba ni rdzas brgyad skye ba'i chos 'dus pa ste /
translated: The so-called atom is the smallest unit of matter, the smallest unit of the phenomena of origination.

original: nyi zer gyi rdul gyi bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i cha gcig la rdul phra rab gcig go //
analyzed: nyi zer gyi rdul gyi bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i cha gcig la rdul phra rab gcig go //
translated: One atom is the forty-ninth part of a louse egg.

original: 'dul ba las drug 'gyur du bsgre ba ni mar 'bri ba'i dus kyi tshe mi nyam chung ba'i sor rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dul ba las drug 'gyur du bsgre ba ni mar 'bri ba'i dus kyi tshe mi nyam chung ba'i sor rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Vinaya states that the measure of a cubit is six fingerbreadths, because in the time of decline, the human body is small.

original: chos mngon pa las bdun du bsgre ba ni bskal ba dang po'i mi nyams che ba'i sor rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos mngon pa las bdun du bsgre ba ni bskal ba dang po'i mi nyams che ba'i sor rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Abhidharma states that the measure of a cubit is seven fingerbreadths, because in the time of origin, the human body is large.

original: zhva la sogs pa'i don du de tsam dag khyer ba la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhva la sogs pa'i don du de tsam dag khyer ba la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no offense for carrying that much for the sake of shoes, etc.

original: bal thogs pa'i spang ba ste bcu drug pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: bal thogs pa'i spang ba ste bcu drug pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The sixteenth case is concluded.

original: // / ka ka ni zhes bya ba ni ma sha ka'i gzhi cha gcig ste 'gron bu nyi shu'i rin gyi ming yin no //
analyzed: // / ka ka ni zhes bya ba ni ma sha ka'i gzhi cha gcig ste 'gron bu nyi shu'i rin gyi ming yin no //
translated: The term kakani is the name for one-sixteenth of a mashaka, the value of twenty cowries.

original: dang la kha zhes bya ba ni rdzing bu'i kha ste wa 'bab pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: dang la kha zhes bya ba ni rdzing bu'i kha ste wa 'bab pa'i gnas so //
translated: The term mouth means the mouth of a pond, which is the place where water flows out.

original: btso blag mkhan gyi lag pa ltar dmar ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshon rtsi'i las byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: btso blag mkhan gyi lag pa ltar dmar ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshon rtsi'i las byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The term red like a dyer's hand means that which is the result of one's own dyeing work.

original: ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don ni 'khrur 'jug pa'i spang ba'i skabs su bshad pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don ni 'khrur 'jug pa'i spang ba'i skabs su bshad pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the words that set forth the downfall should be understood as explained in the section on the downfall of accepting a bath.

original: bye brag tu na sngar gos @121b rnying pa zhes bya ba'i gnas su 'dir lug bal dag ces smos par bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu na sngar gos @121b rnying pa zhes bya ba'i gnas su 'dir lug bal dag ces smos par bya'o //
translated: In particular, the term old cloth in the previous section should be replaced here with the term wool.

original: sngar gyi 'chag tu 'jug na zhes bya ba smos pa'i gnas su 'dir rmel du 'jug na zhes smos par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi 'chag tu 'jug na zhes bya ba smos pa'i gnas su 'dir rmel du 'jug na zhes smos par bya'o //
translated: The term to make it weave in the previous section should be replaced here with the term to make it felt.

original: bal rmel du 'jug pa'i spang ba ste bcu bdun pa'i tshig rnam par bshad par rdzogs so /
analyzed: bal rmel du 'jug pa'i spang ba ste bcu bdun pa'i tshig rnam par bshad par rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the explanation of the seventeenth downfall, the downfall of making felt.

original: // / grong dpon zhes bya ba ni grong gi dpon po'o //
analyzed: // / grong dpon zhes bya ba ni grong gi dpon po'o //
translated: The term village headman means the head of a village.

original: sngon gyi gdugs rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni deng gi nyi ma nyid sel bar byed do //
analyzed: sngon gyi gdugs rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni deng gi nyi ma nyid sel bar byed do //
translated: The former days refers to the present day itself.

original: ches snga ba zhig na zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa'i nyi ma sel bar byed do //
analyzed: ches snga ba zhig na zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa'i nyi ma sel bar byed do //
translated: The very former refers to the day just past.

original: mngon mtshan can zhes bya ba ni rdzas grags pa'o //
analyzed: mngon mtshan can zhes bya ba ni rdzas grags pa'o //
translated: The well known refers to the well known substance.

original: rung zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'o //
analyzed: rung zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'o //
translated: The proper refers to the appropriate.

original: gser zhes bya ba ni dngul dang de gnyis ka'i rdzas mtshan mas btab pa dag gis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gser zhes bya ba ni dngul dang de gnyis ka'i rdzas mtshan mas btab pa dag gis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The gold refers to silver and the substance of both marked with their respective marks.

original: bdag gir byed ces bya ba ni bdag gi ba nyid du 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gir byed ces bya ba ni bdag gi ba nyid du 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: To appropriate means to hold as mine.

original: brda sprod pa'o zhes bya ba ni smra ba'o //🔽skur ba 'debs par mi bgyid cing zhes bya ba ni slar skur ba 'debs par mi bgyid cing ngo //
analyzed: brda sprod pa'o zhes bya ba ni smra ba'o // skur ba 'debs par mi bgyid cing zhes bya ba ni slar skur ba 'debs par mi bgyid cing ngo //
translated: The grammarians are the rhetoricians.🔽Not to slander means not to slander in return.

original: ha cang thal bar mi bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das la yang dag pa ma yin par sgro 'dogs pas ha cang thal bar yang mi bgyid do //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar mi bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das la yang dag pa ma yin par sgro 'dogs pas ha cang thal bar yang mi bgyid do //
translated: Not to go to extremes means not to go to extremes by falsely ascribing to the Blessed One.

original: gsungs pa'i rjes su smra ba zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa kho na'i rjes su smra ba'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa'i rjes su smra ba zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa kho na'i rjes su smra ba'o //
translated: The expression who speaks after the Lord means who speaks only after the Lord.

original: chos smra ba zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mngon sum du ma gsungs kyang don gyis go ba nyid kyis chos smra ba'o //
analyzed: chos smra ba zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mngon sum du ma gsungs kyang don gyis go ba nyid kyis chos smra ba'o //
translated: The expression who teaches the Dharma means who teaches the Dharma even without being directly taught by the Lord.

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos brda sprod par bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni lam gyi chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston par bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos brda sprod par bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni lam gyi chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston par bgyid pa'o //
translated: The expression who gives the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma means who teaches the Dharma in accordance with the path.

original: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol ba las so //
analyzed: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol ba las so //
translated: The expression from others means from opponents.

original: chos dang mthun pas zhes bya ba ni rigs pa yang dag pas so //
analyzed: chos dang mthun pas zhes bya ba ni rigs pa yang dag pas so //
translated: The expression in accordance with the Dharma means by means of correct reasoning.

original: smad pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos zhes bya ba ni smad cing pham par 'gyur ba'i chos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: smad pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos zhes bya ba ni smad cing pham par 'gyur ba'i chos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The expression a Dharma that is a basis for censure means a Dharma that is censured and defeated.

original: mi 'chi ba lags sam zhes bya ba ni mi 'byung ba yin nam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'chi ba lags sam zhes bya ba ni mi 'byung ba yin nam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression is not dying means is not ceasing.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'i yo byad du rung ba'i rab tu byung ba'i chos ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'i yo byad du rung ba'i rab tu byung ba'i chos ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “not a śramaṇa’s practice” means that it is not a practice of one gone forth that is suitable for a householder.

original: sh'akya'i sras kyi chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sh'akya'i sras kyi chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “not a Śākya’s practice” means that it was prohibited by the Bhagavān.

original: lan gnyis lan gsum gyi bar du brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni rgal ba las tha brda bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin gyi don yang dag pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum gyi bar du brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni rgal ba las tha brda bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin gyi don yang dag pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
translated: “Up to a second and a third time” means that it is not for the purpose of making a decision about the dispute, but rather for the purpose of teaching the true meaning.

original: @122a * // 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag kyang rung ba kho na lags so zhes bya ba ni rgyud gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsam mo //
analyzed: @122a * // 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag kyang rung ba kho na lags so zhes bya ba ni rgyud gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsam mo //
translated: “The five sense pleasures are also suitable” means that they are suitable because the mind has been transformed.

original: phung po gcig tu byed ces bya ba ni tshogs gcig tu byed pa'o //
analyzed: phung po gcig tu byed ces bya ba ni tshogs gcig tu byed pa'o //
translated: “To make a single heap” means to make a single collection.

original: phung po gnyis su byed ces bya ba ni tshogs gnyis su byed pa'o //
analyzed: phung po gnyis su byed ces bya ba ni tshogs gnyis su byed pa'o //
translated: “To make two heaps” means to make two collections.

original: ma log ma spangs so sor ma spangs zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'i bya ba bdag gis sbyor ba dang dngos dang mjug dag las so //
analyzed: ma log ma spangs so sor ma spangs zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'i bya ba bdag gis sbyor ba dang dngos dang mjug dag las so //
translated: “Not reversed, not abandoned, not individually abandoned” means that one does not engage in the activities of a householder, in the preparatory, actual, or subsequent stages.

original: gser zhes bya ba ni mngon mtshan can du ma byas pa'i gser nyid do //
analyzed: gser zhes bya ba ni mngon mtshan can du ma byas pa'i gser nyid do //
translated: “Gold” means gold that is not made into an ornament.

original: dngul zhes bya ba ni yang mngon mtshan can du ma byas pa'i dngul nyid do //
analyzed: dngul zhes bya ba ni yang mngon mtshan can du ma byas pa'i dngul nyid do //
translated: “Silver” means silver that is not made into an ornament.

original: dbyig ces bya ba ni gser ram dngul las mngon mtshan can du byas pa'i rdzas so //
analyzed: dbyig ces bya ba ni gser ram dngul las mngon mtshan can du byas pa'i rdzas so //
translated: “Treasure” means a substance made from gold or silver that is made into an ornament.

original: 'thob par 'gyur ba'i phyogs su zhes bya ba ni smra ba po'i mngon sum du ste lag tu 'thob pa'am lag tu blang du rung ba'i phyogs su'o //
analyzed: 'thob par 'gyur ba'i phyogs su zhes bya ba ni smra ba po'i mngon sum du ste lag tu 'thob pa'am lag tu blang du rung ba'i phyogs su'o //
translated: “In a place where it can be obtained” means in a place where the speaker can see it, where it is in his hand or where it can be placed in his hand.

original: de la rang gis bsgo ba nyid yod pas dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //🔽'di zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du snang ba'o //
analyzed: de la rang gis bsgo ba nyid yod pas dngos gzhir 'gyur ro // 'di zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du snang ba'o //
translated: If he has the power to order it himself, it becomes the actual basis.🔽“This” means that which appears directly.

original: de zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du mi snang ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du mi snang ba'o //
translated: “That” means that which does not appear directly.

original: 'thob par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyogs su zhes bya ba ni smra ba po'i mngon sum ma yin par te lag tu 'thob par mi rung ba'am /
analyzed: 'thob par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyogs su zhes bya ba ni smra ba po'i mngon sum ma yin par te lag tu 'thob par mi rung ba'am /
translated: The phrase “in a place where it cannot be obtained” means that it is not directly perceptible to the speaker, that is, it is not available to be taken up in the hand.

original: lag tu blang du mi rung ba'i phyogs su'o //
analyzed: lag tu blang du mi rung ba'i phyogs su'o //
translated: In a place where it cannot be obtained means in a place not accessible to the speaker, where it cannot be taken into the hand or used.

original: de la rang gis bsgo ba nyid med pas nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rang gis bsgo ba nyid med pas nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: There is an offense for the monk who gives the order, since he does not himself give the order.

original: brdungs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyan dang snod spyad la sogs par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: brdungs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyan dang snod spyad la sogs par gnas pa'o //
translated: Beaten means in the form of ornaments, vessels, etc.

original: mngon mtshan can zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du bya ba'i mtshan ma can te zlum po la sogs pa'i dbyibs la mi la sogs pa'i rtags byas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon mtshan can zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du bya ba'i mtshan ma can te zlum po la sogs pa'i dbyibs la mi la sogs pa'i rtags byas pa'o //
translated: Marked means marked with a sign for identification, such as a circle, etc., or with a sign of a human being, etc.

original: nor bu dang mu tig dang beed'u rya dang shi ka shi la dang byi ru dang dngul dang gser dang rdo'i snying po dang / sbug dang dmar po dang g-yas su 'khyal dang sangs rgyas kyi sku gdung la sogs pa'i rin po che'i 'o zhes gsungs pa dag kyang bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: nor bu dang mu tig dang beed'u rya dang shi ka shi la dang byi ru dang dngul dang gser dang rdo'i snying po dang / sbug dang dmar po dang g-yas su 'khyal dang sangs rgyas kyi sku gdung la sogs pa'i rin po che'i 'o zhes gsungs pa dag kyang bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The text also includes the precious substances such as jewels, pearls, lapis lazuli, conch shells, crystals, coral, silver, gold, cat’s eyes, moonstones, and right-coiling conches, as well as the relics of the Buddha.

original: yul gyi tha snyad can zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan gyi tha snyad can te yul 'dir tha snyad gdags su ni mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: yul gyi tha snyad can zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan gyi tha snyad can te yul 'dir tha snyad gdags su ni mi rung ba'o //
translated: The expression “bearing the name of a foreign country” means bearing the name of another country, and it is not suitable to designate it as this country.

original: de ni gas pa dang chag pa dang dum bu dang tshig pa dang / sngon ma spyad pa dang ma byas pa dang mtshan dang mi ldan pa dang bcos pa'o //
analyzed: de ni gas pa dang chag pa dang dum bu dang tshig pa dang / sngon ma spyad pa dang ma byas pa dang mtshan dang mi ldan pa dang bcos pa'o //
translated: It is broken, cracked, chipped, burned, not previously used, not made, not having the characteristics, and artificial.

original: de dag la mngon mtshan gyis nyo tshong la sogs pa byar mi rung yang /
analyzed: de dag la mngon mtshan gyis nyo tshong la sogs pa byar mi rung yang /
translated: It is not suitable to buy and sell with it, etc., because of its obviousness.

original: gser dngul la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de las reg gam reg tu bcug na ci'i phyir dngos gzhir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gser dngul la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de las reg gam reg tu bcug na ci'i phyir dngos gzhir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if it is the nature of gold, silver, etc., why would it not be a basic transgression if one touches it or causes it to be touched?

original: de ni gser dngul la sogs pa'i rang bzhin @122b gyis rin po cher gzhag pa ma yin gyi mngon mtshan btab pa'i sgo nas rin po cher gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gser dngul la sogs pa'i rang bzhin @122b gyis rin po cher gzhag pa ma yin gyi mngon mtshan btab pa'i sgo nas rin po cher gzhag pa yin no //
translated: It is not that it is considered precious because of its nature as gold, silver, etc., but rather it is considered precious because of its obviousness.

original: mngon mtshan nyams te tha snyad gdags su mi rung ba'i phyir de nyid kyis rin po che nyams pa yin pas de'i phyir na smad do //
analyzed: mngon mtshan nyams te tha snyad gdags su mi rung ba'i phyir de nyid kyis rin po che nyams pa yin pas de'i phyir na smad do //
translated: Because the sign is lost, it is not suitable to be designated. Therefore, it is criticized because the jewel is lost.

original: rno lcags zhes bya ba ni lcags bzang po'i rigs so //
analyzed: rno lcags zhes bya ba ni lcags bzang po'i rigs so //
translated: Iron is a type of good iron.

original: khro chu zhes bya ba ni me long gi rgyu'i lcags so //
analyzed: khro chu zhes bya ba ni me long gi rgyu'i lcags so //
translated: Brass is iron that is the cause of a mirror.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro bar chas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro bar chas so //
translated: Desire means one is ready to go.

original: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni rung bar bya ba bdag gir byed pa gcad par bya ba'i phyir dang / mi rung ba las bdag gir bya ba mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni rung bar bya ba bdag gir byed pa gcad par bya ba'i phyir dang / mi rung ba las bdag gir bya ba mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One should not regret this means that in order to cut off the appropriation of what is suitable, the appropriation of what is unsuitable does not arise.

original: dang pa can zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang brtan pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dang pa can zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang brtan pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Faithful means having faith and firmness.

original: gser dngul la reg pa'i spang ba ste bco brgyad pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gser dngul la reg pa'i spang ba ste bco brgyad pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the eighteenth precept on touching gold and silver is complete.

original: // / shes pa can zhes bya ba ni mu stegs gcer bu ba ste /
analyzed: // / shes pa can zhes bya ba ni mu stegs gcer bu ba ste /
translated: The wise are the naked ones of the tīrthikas.

original: rtsis kyi shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsis kyi shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have the knowledge of calculation.

original: cung zad dmigs pas kyang zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang tshad dang dbyings la sogs pa mig dang rna ba la sogs pas shes pa'o //
analyzed: cung zad dmigs pas kyang zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang tshad dang dbyings la sogs pa mig dang rna ba la sogs pas shes pa'o //
translated: Even a little bit of observation means knowing color, size, shape, and so on with the eyes, ears, and so on.

original: cung zad rtog ges kyang shes bya ba ni rtsis kyis byas pa'i rtog pas shes pa'o //
analyzed: cung zad rtog ges kyang shes bya ba ni rtsis kyis byas pa'i rtog pas shes pa'o //
translated: Even a little bit of conceptualization means knowing with conceptual thoughts created by calculation.

original: nags kyi 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni shing tog go //
analyzed: nags kyi 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni shing tog go //
translated: Forest fruits means fruit.

original: slong phor zhes bya ba ni gcer bu pa'i lhung bzed kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: slong phor zhes bya ba ni gcer bu pa'i lhung bzed kyi ming ngo //
translated: A begging bowl is the name of a naked ascetic's alms bowl.

original: la ba srin bu'i mdog lta bu zhes bya ba ni srin bu'i mdog dmar po btsos pa dag gis kha bsgyur ba'i la dmar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: la ba srin bu'i mdog lta bu zhes bya ba ni srin bu'i mdog dmar po btsos pa dag gis kha bsgyur ba'i la dmar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: A cloth the color of a worm means a red cloth dyed with the red color of cooked worms, meaning a red cloth.

original: kha cig na re srin bu nag po'i mdog lta bu zhes kyang zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re srin bu nag po'i mdog lta bu zhes kyang zer ro //
translated: Some say it is the color of a black worm.

original: mgo zlog ste nyal ba zhes bya ba ni khas bub tu nyal ba'o //
analyzed: mgo zlog ste nyal ba zhes bya ba ni khas bub tu nyal ba'o //
translated: Sleeping with the head turned away means sleeping face down.

original: kha cig na re ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say it means corpse.

original: tshul khrims 'tshal ba kun du spyod do zhes bya ba ni gcer bu las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'tshal ba kun du spyod do zhes bya ba ni gcer bu las 'das pa'o //
translated: One who desires morality practices means one who has gone beyond nakedness.

original: khyod kyi ston pa zhes bya ba ni 'dro ba skyong ba'i bu rdzogs byed do //
analyzed: khyod kyi ston pa zhes bya ba ni 'dro ba skyong ba'i bu rdzogs byed do //
translated: Your teacher is called Pūraṇa Kāśyapa, the son of a caravan leader.

original: nur rtsi zhes bya ba ni chang gi tshigs ma'o //
analyzed: nur rtsi zhes bya ba ni chang gi tshigs ma'o //
translated: “Butter” means the dregs of beer.

original: la ba rtsub po zhes bya ba ni la ba sbom po rtsub pa'o //
analyzed: la ba rtsub po zhes bya ba ni la ba sbom po rtsub pa'o //
translated: “Rough cloth” means coarse, rough cloth.

original: gson pas kyang mi dga' ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gson pa tsam gyis kyang mi dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gson pas kyang mi dga' ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gson pa tsam gyis kyang mi dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “He is not happy even when alive” means he is not happy just by being alive.

original: zong zhes bya ba ni na ra ba bzhi'i rin thang ngo //
analyzed: zong zhes bya ba ni na ra ba bzhi'i rin thang ngo //
translated: “Goods” means the value of the four necessities.

original: khrag gi phyis bu zhes bya ba ni khrag srung ngo //
analyzed: khrag gi phyis bu zhes bya ba ni khrag srung ngo //
translated: “Blood-stained cloth” means a cloth stained with blood.

original: gnas nas dbyung ba zhes bya ba ni spang ba'o //🔽tshul shing yang 'byung bar zhes bya ba ni bgrang ba'i don gyi thur ma yang dor bar bya'o //🔽spang leb khri'u yang bsgyur bar bya zhes bya ba ni stan gnas nas gdon par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas nas dbyung ba zhes bya ba ni spang ba'o // tshul shing yang 'byung bar zhes bya ba ni bgrang ba'i don gyi thur ma yang dor bar bya'o // spang leb khri'u yang bsgyur bar bya zhes bya ba ni stan gnas nas gdon par bya ba'o //
translated: “Excommunication” means expulsion.🔽“The voting stick appears” means the counting stick should be discarded.🔽“The bench should be moved” means the seat should be removed.

original: slong phor yang khas @123a * //
analyzed: slong phor yang khas @123a * //
translated: “The alms bowl should be taken away” means the bowl should be taken away.🔽“The robe should be taken away” means the robe should be taken away.

original: dbub par bya ba ni khrims su bca' bas longs spyod nyams par bya zhing zas kyi snod kyang nyams par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dbub par bya ba ni khrims su bca' bas longs spyod nyams par bya zhing zas kyi snod kyang nyams par byed pa'o //
translated: “To be taken away” means to be deprived of property by the law, and to be deprived of the vessel of food.

original: khar ba yang dor bar bya zhes bya ba ni khar ba gnas nas phyi rol du dor bar bya ba'o //🔽bka' mnyan par zad kyi zhes bya ba ni 'da' bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: khar ba yang dor bar bya zhes bya ba ni khar ba gnas nas phyi rol du dor bar bya ba'o // bka' mnyan par zad kyi zhes bya ba ni 'da' bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: “To be thrown away” means to be thrown outside from the place of the staff.🔽“To be obeyed” means not to be transgressed.

original: mi g-yo ste zhes bya ba ni mi 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ste zhes bya ba ni mi 'gal ba'o //
translated: “Not to be shaken” means not to be violated.

original: bzhi ltab tu blta ba ste zhes bya ba ni bzhi rim du'o //
analyzed: bzhi ltab tu blta ba ste zhes bya ba ni bzhi rim du'o //
translated: “To be looked at with four eyes” means to be looked at with four eyes.

original: shugs kyis zhes bya ba ni stobs kyi shugs kyis so //
analyzed: shugs kyis zhes bya ba ni stobs kyi shugs kyis so //
translated: “By force” means by the force of power.

original: de ni ri zhig byung ba yin gyi zhes bya ba ni la ba rtsub pos la ba bzang po bsgrub pas skyed bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ri zhig byung ba yin gyi zhes bya ba ni la ba rtsub pos la ba bzang po bsgrub pas skyed bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “This is the arising of a mountain” means that a good blanket is produced by the production of a rough blanket.

original: kun du sbyor ba byed ces bya ba ni yul gzhan du 'dod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba byed ces bya ba ni yul gzhan du 'dod par byed pa'o //
translated: “To be united” means to be desired in another place.

original: rab tu sbyor bar byed ces bya ba ni dus dang yul la ltos par bskyed pa'i phyir gtong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu sbyor bar byed ces bya ba ni dus dang yul la ltos par bskyed pa'i phyir gtong bar byed pa'o //
translated: “To be applied” means to be given in order to produce in dependence on time and place.

original: bun 'gyed par byed ces bya ba ni rnying pas gsar skyed dang bcas pa spel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bun 'gyed par byed ces bya ba ni rnying pas gsar skyed dang bcas pa spel bar byed pa'o //
translated: “To lend out” means to increase the old by adding new interest.

original: skyed 'gyed par byed ces bya ba ni skyed pa'i phyir rje bar byed pa'o//
analyzed: skyed 'gyed par byed ces bya ba ni skyed pa'i phyir rje bar byed pa'o//
translated: “To increase” means to increase the interest.

original: byas pa zhes bya ba ni mngon mtshan can du byas pa'o //
analyzed: byas pa zhes bya ba ni mngon mtshan can du byas pa'o //
translated: “To make” means to make a loan.

original: ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni mngon mtshan can du ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni mngon mtshan can du ma byas pa'o //
translated: “To not make” means not to make a loan.

original: kun du rtsom par byed ces bya ba ni gzhan dang skad sbyor ba la sogs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun du rtsom par byed ces bya ba ni gzhan dang skad sbyor ba la sogs pa byed pa'o //
translated: “To engage in” means to engage in business with others.

original: yul tshol bar byed ces bya ba ni yul gang du gtang bar bya zhes so //
analyzed: yul tshol bar byed ces bya ba ni yul gang du gtang bar bya zhes so //
translated: “To seek a place” means to seek a place to send the goods.

original: shing rta sogs par byed ces bya ba ni shing rta sta gon byed pa'o //
analyzed: shing rta sogs par byed ces bya ba ni shing rta sta gon byed pa'o //
translated: “To prepare a vehicle” means to prepare a vehicle.

original: brgyad shas zhes bya ba ni gang du brgyad btang na zla ba gcig gis skyed brgyad len pa ste lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: brgyad shas zhes bya ba ni gang du brgyad btang na zla ba gcig gis skyed brgyad len pa ste lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: “To take out a loan” means to take out a loan for one month. The rest should be understood in the same way.

original: nas dang 'bru rnying pa gsar phyed dang nyis sde'i phyir gtong ba zhes bya ba ni rnying khal gcig btang na gsar khal phyed dang gnyis len pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nas dang 'bru rnying pa gsar phyed dang nyis sde'i phyir gtong ba zhes bya ba ni rnying khal gcig btang na gsar khal phyed dang gnyis len pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The giving of the old and new grain is giving one measure of old grain and taking two measures of new grain, and so on.

original: dung gi tshogs kyi phyir nor bu'i tshogs gtong bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni dung bcu la sogs pa'i tshogs thob par bya ba'i phyir nor bu gcig gam gnyis sam gsum la sogs pa'i tshogs gtong bar byed pa ste lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du🔽shes par bya'o ;
analyzed: dung gi tshogs kyi phyir nor bu'i tshogs gtong bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni dung bcu la sogs pa'i tshogs thob par bya ba'i phyir nor bu gcig gam gnyis sam gsum la sogs pa'i tshogs gtong bar byed pa ste lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o ;
translated: The giving of a collection of jewels for a collection of conches is giving a collection of one, two, three, and so on, jewels for the sake of obtaining a collection of ten conches and so on. The rest should be understood in the same way.

original: / mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa ni sbyor ba la sogs pas rnyed pa sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: / mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa ni sbyor ba la sogs pas rnyed pa sgrub pa'o //
translated: The conduct of ostentation is the pursuit of gain by means of display of one's possessions, and so on.

original: gzhal blugs zhes bya ba ni srang dang bre'o //
analyzed: gzhal blugs zhes bya ba ni srang dang bre'o //
translated: The measure is the balance scale.

original: rdib ces bya ba ni zhig pa'o //
analyzed: rdib ces bya ba ni zhig pa'o //
translated: The crushed is the broken.

original: mi zad pa zhes bya ba ni nam yang zad par mi 'gyur ba'i zong ngo //
analyzed: mi zad pa zhes bya ba ni nam yang zad par mi 'gyur ba'i zong ngo //
translated: The inexhaustible is the merchandise that is never exhausted.

original: mthu dang ldan pa la brten zhes bya ba ni 'khras brtsan po rgyab rten @123b 'cha' ba'o //
analyzed: mthu dang ldan pa la brten zhes bya ba ni 'khras brtsan po rgyab rten @123b 'cha' ba'o //
translated: To rely on the powerful means to seek protection and support.

original: dam rgya zhes bya ba ni khrims su bya ba'o //
analyzed: dam rgya zhes bya ba ni khrims su bya ba'o //
translated: To make a solemn promise means to make a vow.

original: mngon mtshan can gyi spang ba ste bcu dgu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad par rdzogs so /
analyzed: mngon mtshan can gyi spang ba ste bcu dgu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad par rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the nineteenth root downfall is finished.

original: // / nyo tshong zhes bya ba ni nyos te 'tshong ba'o //
analyzed: // / nyo tshong zhes bya ba ni nyos te 'tshong ba'o //
translated: To buy and sell means to buy in order to sell.

original: de gnyis kyi snga ma las bye brag tu gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi snga ma las bye brag tu gyur pa yin no //
translated: This is different from the previous one.

original: len par byed ces bya ba ni gzhan nas len par byed pa'o //
analyzed: len par byed ces bya ba ni gzhan nas len par byed pa'o //
translated: To take means to take from another.

original: gtong bar byed ces bya ba ni 'di nas gtong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gtong bar byed ces bya ba ni 'di nas gtong bar byed pa'o //
translated: To give means to give from here.

original: yul gzhan gyi sbyor bar shes par bya ba ni yul gzhan gyi tha snyad kyis so //
analyzed: yul gzhan gyi sbyor bar shes par bya ba ni yul gzhan gyi tha snyad kyis so //
translated: To know to apply to another country means to apply the conventions of another country.

original: snga ma'i rgyud ces bya ba ni sngar bskyis pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma'i rgyud ces bya ba ni sngar bskyis pa'o //
translated: To former stream means the former stream of commerce.

original: byang lam pa zhes bya ba ni byang lam nas 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: byang lam pa zhes bya ba ni byang lam nas 'ongs pa'o //
translated: To northern route means the northern route.

original: mchod ston gyi yo byad ces bya ba ni 'bras thug po che la sogs pa yo byad dag go //
analyzed: mchod ston gyi yo byad ces bya ba ni 'bras thug po che la sogs pa yo byad dag go //
translated: The requisites for a feast are the requisites such as rice and so on.

original: nyo tshong byed pa'i spang ba ste nyi shu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: nyo tshong byed pa'i spang ba ste nyi shu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The twenty-first rule on abandoning buying and selling is completed.

original: // / de ni re zhig byung ba yin gyi zhes bya ba'i lhung bzed lhag pa bsgrub pa'i phyir sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // / de ni re zhig byung ba yin gyi zhes bya ba'i lhung bzed lhag pa bsgrub pa'i phyir sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is indeed the case, but it is a preparation for the purpose of obtaining an extra alms-bowl.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni dngos kho nar lhung bzed lhag ma nye bar ma bzhag pa'i phyir ro //🔽dge slong gis tshes la lhung bzed rnyed na zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam grangs dang por ni lhung bzed lhag ma gcig 'chang ba bstan to //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni dngos kho nar lhung bzed lhag ma nye bar ma bzhag pa'i phyir ro // dge slong gis tshes la lhung bzed rnyed na zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam grangs dang por ni lhung bzed lhag ma gcig 'chang ba bstan to //
translated: He does not establish a training rule means that he does not actually keep an extra alms-bowl.🔽If a monk obtains an alms-bowl on the first day, and so on, in the first enumeration, it shows keeping one extra alms-bowl.

original: dge slong gis tshes la lhung bzed rnyed na zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam grangs gnyis pas ni lhung bzed lhag pa gnyis 'chang ba bstan to //
analyzed: dge slong gis tshes la lhung bzed rnyed na zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam grangs gnyis pas ni lhung bzed lhag pa gnyis 'chang ba bstan to //
translated: If a monk obtains an alms-bowl on the first day, and so on, in the second enumeration, it shows keeping two extra alms-bowls.

original: dge slong gis tshes la lhung bzed mang po rnyed na zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam grangs gsum pas ni lhung bzed lhag pa mang po bstan to //
analyzed: dge slong gis tshes la lhung bzed mang po rnyed na zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam grangs gsum pas ni lhung bzed lhag pa mang po bstan to //
translated: The third category, “If a monk obtains many alms bowls on the first day...,” and so on, explains that many extra alms bowls are allowed.

original: dge slong gis tshes la lhung bzed mang po dag cig rnyed cing des tshes gnyis la yang gzhan mang po dag cig rnyed na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gres bzhi pas ni phyi ma yang mang po dag yin par bstan to //
analyzed: dge slong gis tshes la lhung bzed mang po dag cig rnyed cing des tshes gnyis la yang gzhan mang po dag cig rnyed na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gres bzhi pas ni phyi ma yang mang po dag yin par bstan to //
translated: The fourth category, “If a monk obtains many alms bowls on the first day, and on the second day he obtains many more...,” and so on, explains that many more are allowed.

original: rnam grangs bzhi po dag gi bye brag ni de yin no //🔽lhung bzed chung ngu la sogs pa ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed chung ngu la sogs pa ni rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir byin gyis brlab par bya ba ma yin pas de dag 'chang na nyes byas su 'gyur ba yin gyi dngos gzhi'i
analyzed: rnam grangs bzhi po dag gi bye brag ni de yin no // lhung bzed chung ngu la sogs pa ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed chung ngu la sogs pa ni rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir byin gyis brlab par bya ba ma yin pas de dag 'chang na nyes byas su 'gyur ba yin gyi dngos gzhi'i
translated: This is the difference between the four categories.🔽“There is no offense for a small alms bowl, and so on,” means that if one keeps a small alms bowl, and so on, it is an offense of wrong conduct, because it is not suitable to be consecrated, since it is not suitable.

original: ltung ba med par bstan pa'i phyir ltung ba med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ltung ba med par bstan pa'i phyir ltung ba med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Since it is taught that there is no offense in the root text, it says “there is no offense.”

original: rab tu 'byung ba la ltos pa'i don du lhung bzed 'chang ba la ni bdag gir byed pa med pa'i phyir nyes byas kyang med pas thams cad ltung ba med do zhes gsungs so//
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba la ltos pa'i don du lhung bzed 'chang ba la ni bdag gir byed pa med pa'i phyir nyes byas kyang med pas thams cad ltung ba med do zhes gsungs so//
translated: Since there is no fault in holding a begging bowl for the sake of going forth, and since there is no fault in making it one's own, there is no downfall in any case.

original: @124a * // lhung bzed 'chang ba'i spang ba ste nyi shu gcig pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs sa /
analyzed: @124a * // lhung bzed 'chang ba'i spang ba ste nyi shu gcig pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs sa /
translated: The explanation of the twenty-first rule of training, the rule concerning the begging bowl, is completed.

original: // / nye bar ma zhi tsam du zad kyi zhes bya ba ni the tshom za bas byung rgyal mi dogs pa zhig smras pa tsam du zad kyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: // / nye bar ma zhi tsam du zad kyi zhes bya ba ni the tshom za bas byung rgyal mi dogs pa zhig smras pa tsam du zad kyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase it is merely not pacified means that he merely spoke out of doubt, not out of suspicion.

original: nal gyi bu zhes bya ba ni nal ma'i bu'o //
analyzed: nal gyi bu zhes bya ba ni nal ma'i bu'o //
translated: The phrase son of a slave woman means a son of a slave woman.

original: rin ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni rin med par ro //🔽gal te skyes bus sa snod kyis //
analyzed: rin ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni rin med par ro // gal te skyes bus sa snod kyis //
translated: The phrase without price means without payment.🔽 If a person obtains a golden vessel

original: gser gyi snod ni thob gyur na /
analyzed: gser gyi snod ni thob gyur na /
translated: in exchange for an earthen one,

original: zhes bya ba ni dper na phru bas gser snod thob par gyur pa dang 'dra bar lhung bzed kyi sbyin pas lha dang mi rnams kyi nang na snod du gyur pa'i 'bras bu chen po thob par gyur na zhes bya bar bsams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dper na phru bas gser snod thob par gyur pa dang 'dra bar lhung bzed kyi sbyin pas lha dang mi rnams kyi nang na snod du gyur pa'i 'bras bu chen po thob par gyur na zhes bya bar bsams so //
translated: The meaning is: Just as a pot becomes a golden vessel, so too, by the gift of a begging-bowl, one obtains the great fruit of becoming a vessel among gods and humans.

original: de yis mya ngan ci'i phyir bya //
analyzed: de yis mya ngan ci'i phyir bya //
translated: Why should one grieve over that?

original: zhes bya ba ni mya ngan mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mya ngan mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: one should not grieve.

original: ci'i phyir mya ngan mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mya ngan mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why should one not grieve?

original: de'i phyir bslus pa med par kho bos mthong zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bslus pa med par kho bos mthong zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, I see it as undeceiving.

original: gang gi phyir bslus pa med par kho bos mthong ba de'i phyir mya ngan mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bslus pa med par kho bos mthong ba de'i phyir mya ngan mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: because I see it as undeceiving, therefore I do not grieve.

original: yod cing zhes bya ba ni rdzas tsam du yod pas //
analyzed: yod cing zhes bya ba ni rdzas tsam du yod pas //
translated: As long as it exists means as long as it exists as mere substance.

original: bdog bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bya ba nus pas so //
analyzed: bdog bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bya ba nus pas so //
translated: As long as it is possessed means as long as it is able to function.

original: 'bras chan gsher bar byed pa ni khu ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras chan gsher bar byed pa ni khu ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Wet rice means rice with juice.

original: cal col zhes bya ba ni phan phun no //
analyzed: cal col zhes bya ba ni phan phun no //
translated: The expression useless means: without benefit.

original: lhan pa snyi ba zhes bya ba ni lhan pa mi sra ba'o //
analyzed: lhan pa snyi ba zhes bya ba ni lhan pa mi sra ba'o //
translated: The expression soft patch means: patch that is not hard.

original: lhan rings zhes bya ba ni lcags las byas pa'i lhan pha ring po'o //
analyzed: lhan rings zhes bya ba ni lcags las byas pa'i lhan pha ring po'o //
translated: The expression long patch means: patch made of iron, which is long.

original: tha ma phran zhes bya ba ni bu gu dgag pa'i lcags zer ro //
analyzed: tha ma phran zhes bya ba ni bu gu dgag pa'i lcags zer ro //
translated: The expression small patch means: iron needle used to block a hole.

original: lhan pa zhes bya ba ni lcags kyi lhan pa gru bzhi 'am zlum po'am zur gsum mtha' rad rod med pa'o //
analyzed: lhan pa zhes bya ba ni lcags kyi lhan pa gru bzhi 'am zlum po'am zur gsum mtha' rad rod med pa'o //
translated: The expression patch means: iron patch, square, round or triangular, without edge.

original: chu srin gyi so lta bu zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi mtha' thams cad sog le'i so lta bu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chu srin gyi so lta bu zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi mtha' thams cad sog le'i so lta bu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The expression like the teeth of a crocodile means: all the edges of the patch are like the teeth of a saw.

original: phye ma zhes bya ba ni zhib mo'o //
analyzed: phye ma zhes bya ba ni zhib mo'o //
translated: The expression powder means: fine.🔽The expression without five patches means: without five patches that are not complete.

original: lhan pa lnga med pa zhes bya ba ni lhan pa ldar ma tshang ba dang ldan pa lnga ma glan pa la ma thug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lhan pa lnga med pa zhes bya ba ni lhan pa ldar ma tshang ba dang ldan pa lnga ma glan pa la ma thug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The expression without five patches means: without five patches that are not complete.

original: lhung bzhed 'brel pa med pa zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed sar pa gzhan btsal ba ste rnyed pa de yang dge 'dun la phul nas dge 'dun las thob pa'i lhung bzed tha chad gang yin pa de gnyi ga'i ma yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lhung bzhed 'brel pa med pa zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed sar pa gzhan btsal ba ste rnyed pa de yang dge 'dun la phul nas dge 'dun las thob pa'i lhung bzed tha chad gang yin pa de gnyi ga'i ma yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The alms bowl obtained from the saṅgha is not either of those two.

original: de yang dge slong rnams kyi lhung bzed kyi yul la 'brel ba ni 'di gnyis kho nar zad de //
analyzed: de yang dge slong rnams kyi lhung bzed kyi yul la 'brel ba ni 'di gnyis kho nar zad de //
translated: There are only two types of related alms bowls for monks:🔽one is related to using it oneself without consecration and the other is related to relinquishing it and giving it to another.🔽The unrelated alms bowl is not related to using it oneself without consecration.

original: byin gyis ma brlabs pas bdag nyid kyis spyad pa dang / yongs su spang ba'i dus na yang gtang bar bya ba'am gzhan la @124b sbyin par bya ba rang dbang nyid du bstan par bya ba yin na lhung bzed 'brel ba med pa de ni byin gyis ma brlabs pas bdag nyid kyis spyad pa'i 'brel ba yang med la🔽/ gtang bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: byin gyis ma brlabs pas bdag nyid kyis spyad pa dang / yongs su spang ba'i dus na yang gtang bar bya ba'am gzhan la @124b sbyin par bya ba rang dbang nyid du bstan par bya ba yin na lhung bzed 'brel ba med pa de ni byin gyis ma brlabs pas bdag nyid kyis spyad pa'i 'brel ba yang med la / gtang bar bya ba'am /
translated: It is not related to relinquishing it and giving it to another.

original: gzhan la sbyin par bya bas yongs su spangs pa'i 'grel ba med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin par bya bas yongs su spangs pa'i 'grel ba med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is called “unrelated” because it is not related to relinquishing it and giving it to another.

original: lhung bzed de ni byin gyis brlab par bya ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: lhung bzed de ni byin gyis brlab par bya ba yang ma yin la /
translated: That alms bowl is neither to be consecrated nor to be abandoned.

original: yongs su spang bar bya ba yang ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang de kha bsgyur ba dang bsreg pa dang byi dor la sogs pa lhung bzed kyi nan tan yang bya dgos pas de'i phyir de ni lhung bzed kyang yin la 'brel ba med pa yang yin pas
analyzed: yongs su spang bar bya ba yang ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang de kha bsgyur ba dang bsreg pa dang byi dor la sogs pa lhung bzed kyi nan tan yang bya dgos pas de'i phyir de ni lhung bzed kyang yin la 'brel ba med pa yang yin pas
translated: However, one must still make effort with the alms bowl, such as changing it, burning it, cleaning it, and so on. Therefore, it is an alms bowl and it is also not related.

original: lhung bzed 'brel ba med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed 'brel ba med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is called an unrelated alms bowl.

original: bran nam khol du byung ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bran nam khol du byung ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like being a servant or slave.

original: 'dul ba dang 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba ste btang ba nas yang slong bas gzhan la tho 'tshams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dul ba dang 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba ste btang ba nas yang slong bas gzhan la tho 'tshams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called contrary to the Vinaya because it is a proscribed offense, since one who has given up his bowl and then begs again is contemptible to others.

original: ngos khung zhes bya ba ni bu ga'o //
analyzed: ngos khung zhes bya ba ni bu ga'o //
translated: A hole is a cavity.

original: chad pa'i lam yin te zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed lhag pa tshol ba'i sred pa bcad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: chad pa'i lam yin te zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed lhag pa tshol ba'i sred pa bcad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: It is a path of cutting off because it cuts off craving for seeking an extra alms bowl.

original: / tshul khrims yang dag par rjes su bsrung bas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du spyad par bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par bsnyen pa rjes su srung bar byed na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / tshul khrims yang dag par rjes su bsrung bas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du spyad par bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par bsnyen pa rjes su srung bar byed na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should practice as long as one lives by perfectly guarding morality. This means that if one guards the full ordination.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam grangs la ma glan pa'i rnam grangs bzhi dang glan pa'i rnam grangs bzhi ste brgyad kyi ltung ba rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam grangs la ma glan pa'i rnam grangs bzhi dang glan pa'i rnam grangs bzhi ste brgyad kyi ltung ba rnam par gzhag go //
translated: How does one fall into transgression? and so on. In the enumeration of the four non-rehabilitations and the four rehabilitations, there are eight ways of positing transgressions.

original: lhan pa lnga glan par 'os pa la /
analyzed: lhan pa lnga glan par 'os pa la /
translated: There is no transgression in taking five patches.

original: ltung ba med pa ni bu ga rdol mang ba nyid kyis med pa dang 'dra ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni bu ga rdol mang ba nyid kyis med pa dang 'dra ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is like not having any due to the many holes.🔽There is no transgression in taking with a price.

original: rin gyis len pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin gyis len pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no transgression in taking with a price.🔽There is no transgression in taking with a barter.

original: brji bas len pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba yang spong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brji bas len pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba yang spong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no abandonment.

original: lhung bzed tshol ba'i spang ba ste nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: lhung bzed tshol ba'i spang ba ste nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The twenty-second rule is finished.

original: // / yugs sa mo zhes bya ba ni bud med khyo shi bas so //
analyzed: // / yugs sa mo zhes bya ba ni bud med khyo shi bas so //
translated: A barren woman is a woman whose husband is dead.

original: las bdag gir bya ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni las gzhan gyi dpang dang ldan pa'o //
