analyzed: las bdag gir bya ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni las gzhan gyi dpang dang ldan pa'o //
translated: One who is a witness to an action is one who is a witness to another’s action.

original: thong gshol dkar po zhes bya ba ni rmor spangs pa las bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: thong gshol dkar po zhes bya ba ni rmor spangs pa las bsams pa yin no //
translated: A white plow is a plow that has been abandoned in a field.

original: bsod nams 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi sems dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi sems dang ldan pa'o //
translated: One who desires merit is one who has a mind of merit.

original: 'tsho tshis zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba'i so nam mo //
analyzed: 'tsho tshis zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba'i so nam mo //
translated: A means of livelihood is a means of subsistence.

original: sgyur ba zhes bya ba ni nyo tshong ngo //
analyzed: sgyur ba zhes bya ba ni nyo tshong ngo //
translated: Bartering is buying and selling.

original: bsod nams chung yang brnyas mi bya //
analyzed: bsod nams chung yang brnyas mi bya //
translated: Do not despise one who has little merit.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chung ngu zhig na bsod @125a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chung ngu zhig na bsod @125a * //
translated: And so on. One who has little merit is one who has little merit.

original: nams su mi 'gyur bar dogs par mi bya ba dang / bdag 'jig rten pha rol du son na de mi 'ong bar dogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nams su mi 'gyur bar dogs par mi bya ba dang / bdag 'jig rten pha rol du son na de mi 'ong bar dogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should not doubt that it will not be so in the future, nor should one doubt that it will not come when one has gone to the other world.

original: bde gnas ma zhes bya ba'i bag mar btang nas ring por ma lon pa ste khyim thab dang lhan cig bde bar gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bde gnas ma zhes bya ba'i bag mar btang nas ring por ma lon pa ste khyim thab dang lhan cig bde bar gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having given her in marriage to a husband, not long after, she is living happily with her husband.

original: dog pa phrar khol zhes bya ba ni dog pa phra bdar che ba dang ring cha bzang bar smon pa gcig pa'o //
analyzed: dog pa phrar khol zhes bya ba ni dog pa phra bdar che ba dang ring cha bzang bar smon pa gcig pa'o //
translated: The cloth that is fit for a great man is a large cloth that is fine, smooth, and long.

original: ra ba ga ge mo'i drung zhes bya ba ni ra ba zhig gi drung na'o //
analyzed: ra ba ga ge mo'i drung zhes bya ba ni ra ba zhig gi drung na'o //
translated: In the vicinity of a certain wall means in the vicinity of a certain wall.

original: chen po la 'os pa'i ras yug chen zhes bya ba ni mi che ba ni mi chen pos longs spyod du rung ba ste chen po la 'os pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: chen po la 'os pa'i ras yug chen zhes bya ba ni mi che ba ni mi chen pos longs spyod du rung ba ste chen po la 'os pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Fit for a great man means suitable for a great man to use.

original: / mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni dam pa'o //
analyzed: / mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni dam pa'o //
translated: The wise one means the best.

original: thags gla zhes bya ba ni rngan pa'o //
analyzed: thags gla zhes bya ba ni rngan pa'o //
translated: Wages means payment.

original: pho brang gi yid brtan pa zhes bya ba ni khyim gyi tshes byed pa'o //🔽chang tshong ba zhes bya ba ni chang tshong bar byed pa'i mi'o //
analyzed: pho brang gi yid brtan pa zhes bya ba ni khyim gyi tshes byed pa'o // chang tshong ba zhes bya ba ni chang tshong bar byed pa'i mi'o //
translated: “The palace’s trusted person” is the one who manages the household.🔽“The tavern” is the person who runs the tavern.

original: khu tshur zhes bya ba ni sum pos brdeg pa'o //
analyzed: khu tshur zhes bya ba ni sum pos brdeg pa'o //
translated: “The fist” is the one who strikes with the fist.

original: mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni log par ro /
analyzed: mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni log par ro /
translated: “The opposite” is the wrong way.

original: sdug ces bya ba ni mgu ba'i nor ro //
analyzed: sdug ces bya ba ni mgu ba'i nor ro //
translated: “The beloved” is the one who is dear because of wealth.

original: dge slong pha la nyes byas su 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni dge slong pha'i sbang ba'i char gtogs pa'i nyes byas yin te gleng gzhi'i dbang gis 'dir gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong pha la nyes byas su 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni dge slong pha'i sbang ba'i char gtogs pa'i nyes byas yin te gleng gzhi'i dbang gis 'dir gsungs so //
translated: “It is an offense of wrong conduct for a fully ordained monk” means that it is an offense of wrong conduct for one who is a fully ordained monk. It is stated here because of the context.

original: bdag nyid kyis 'thag pa la yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bzo rjes su bsgrub pa tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis 'thag pa la yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bzo rjes su bsgrub pa tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: “It is also an offense of wrong conduct for one who weaves it himself” means that it is because it is not in accordance with the proper procedure for learning a craft.

original: / thag pa nye du ma yin pa gos 'thag tu 'jug pa dang / thag pa nye du la gos 'thag tu 'jug pa dang / bdag nyid kyis 'thag par byed pa la re re ba'i rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: / thag pa nye du ma yin pa gos 'thag tu 'jug pa dang / thag pa nye du la gos 'thag tu 'jug pa dang / bdag nyid kyis 'thag par byed pa la re re ba'i rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: There are three types of each: having a non-relative weaver weave cloth, having a relative weaver weave cloth, and weaving it oneself.

original: tha ga pa nye du dang nye du ma yin pa la gos 'thag tu 'jug pa dang / bdag nyid dang tha ga pa nye du ma yin pa la gos 'thag tu 'jug pa dang / bdag nyid dang thag pa nye du la gos 'thag tu 'jug pa zhes bya ba 'dren ma'i rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: tha ga pa nye du dang nye du ma yin pa la gos 'thag tu 'jug pa dang / bdag nyid dang tha ga pa nye du ma yin pa la gos 'thag tu 'jug pa dang / bdag nyid dang thag pa nye du la gos 'thag tu 'jug pa zhes bya ba 'dren ma'i rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of mixed: having a relative or non-relative weaver weave cloth, having a non-relative weaver weave cloth oneself, and having a relative weaver weave cloth oneself.

original: de dag ni nye du ma yin pa las dog pa bslangs pa'i 'gres drug yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni nye du ma yin pa las dog pa bslangs pa'i 'gres drug yin no //
translated: These are the six types of requesting cloth from a non-relative.🔽There are three types of requesting cloth from a relative: requesting cloth from a relative alone, requesting cloth from a relative and a non-relative, and requesting cloth from a relative and oneself.

original: nye du la dog pa bslangs pa la 'ba' zhig pa'i rnam pa gsum dang 'dren ma'i rnam pa gsum ste ltung ba'i 'gres drug de bzhin du shes par bya ste nye du las dog pa bslangs kyang thag pa nye du ma yin pa la 'thag pa 'jug na
analyzed: nye du la dog pa bslangs pa la 'ba' zhig pa'i rnam pa gsum dang 'dren ma'i rnam pa gsum ste ltung ba'i 'gres drug de bzhin du shes par bya ste nye du las dog pa bslangs kyang thag pa nye du ma yin pa la 'thag pa 'jug na
translated: There are three types of mixed: requesting cloth from a relative and a non-relative, requesting cloth from a non-relative and oneself, and requesting cloth from a relative and oneself.🔽These are the six types of requesting cloth from a relative.

original: nyes pa 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the fault is similar.

original: gla rngan gyis 'thag tu 'jug pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba 'chol ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gla rngan gyis 'thag tu 'jug pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba 'chol ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no offense if one has a robe made by a weaver for a fee, because there is no free labor.

original: 'thag tu 'jug pa'i spang ba ste nyi shu gsum pa'i tshig rnam par @125b bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'thag tu 'jug pa'i spang ba ste nyi shu gsum pa'i tshig rnam par @125b bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The twenty-third rule, the training rule on having a robe made, is finished.

original: // / dog pa las zhes bya ba ni rgyu bdun gyi dog pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: // / dog pa las zhes bya ba ni rgyu bdun gyi dog pa zad pa'o //
translated: “Tight” means the exhaustion of the seven causes.

original: rung ngam zhes bya ba ni bde ba'am zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rung ngam zhes bya ba ni bde ba'am zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Is it suitable?” means “is it comfortable?”

original: mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni mi bde ba'o //
translated: “It is not suitable” means “it is not comfortable.”

original: ltos bzung bas zhes bya ba ni zas kyi sred pas dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: ltos bzung bas zhes bya ba ni zas kyi sred pas dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: “Having taken a bribe” means being controlled by craving for food.

original: lhag pa zhes bya ba ni skyed pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa zhes bya ba ni skyed pa'o //
translated: “Excess” means adding.

original: 'bri ba zhes bya ba ni phri ba'o //🔽zheng che ba zhes bya ba ni rgya che ba nyid kyis kho lag che ba'o //
analyzed: 'bri ba zhes bya ba ni phri ba'o // zheng che ba zhes bya ba ni rgya che ba nyid kyis kho lag che ba'o //
translated: “Reduction” means subtracting.🔽“Wide” means having a large circumference.

original: khrun ring ba zhes bya ba ni chur ring ba nyid kyis kho la ga che ba'o //
analyzed: khrun ring ba zhes bya ba ni chur ring ba nyid kyis kho la ga che ba'o //
translated: “Long” means having a large length.

original: thar gyis zhag pa zhes bya ba ni 'jur mdud med par thang chad pa'o //
analyzed: thar gyis zhag pa zhes bya ba ni 'jur mdud med par thang chad pa'o //
translated: “Well-stretched” means not slack.

original: thag ran bzang ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu spun 'dzer ba'o //
analyzed: thag ran bzang ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu spun 'dzer ba'o //
translated: “Good warp” means the warp threads are not loose.

original: gla rngan zhes bya ba ni bya dga'o //
analyzed: gla rngan zhes bya ba ni bya dga'o //
translated: “Wages” means a reward.

original: byer zug snyoms pa zhes bya ba ni snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: byer zug snyoms pa zhes bya ba ni snyoms pa'o //
translated: “Evenly taut” means evenly stretched.

original: shas bzang ba zhes bya ba ni mtshams sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: shas bzang ba zhes bya ba ni mtshams sbyor ba'o //
translated: “Good quality” means well-connected.

original: sang seng med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dzer zhing zang bug med pa'o //
analyzed: sang seng med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dzer zhing zang bug med pa'o //
translated: “Without holes” means without gaps or holes.

original: bza' ba 'am zhes bya ba ni bza' ba lnga po dag go //
analyzed: bza' ba 'am zhes bya ba ni bza' ba lnga po dag go //
translated: “Food” refers to the five kinds of food.

original: bza' ba tsam mam zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lnga dag ste bza' ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir bza' ba tsam ste rgyal po dang 'dra ba'i phyir blon po chen po'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bza' ba tsam mam zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lnga dag ste bza' ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir bza' ba tsam ste rgyal po dang 'dra ba'i phyir blon po chen po'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: “Just food” refers to the five kinds of beverages, which are like food.

original: bza' rgyu zhes bya ba ni bza' ba'i rgyu 'bras bu thug po che la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bza' rgyu zhes bya ba ni bza' ba'i rgyu 'bras bu thug po che la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Food ingredients” refers to the raw ingredients of food, such as grain.

original: sngar bstabs par gyur na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni 'drid pa dang slong bdag med pas ltung ba med do //
analyzed: sngar bstabs par gyur na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni 'drid pa dang slong bdag med pas ltung ba med do //
translated: If he has already given it, there is no offense.

original: 'thag pa skyed pa'i spang ba ste nyi shu bzhi pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'thag pa skyed pa'i spang ba ste nyi shu bzhi pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The twenty-fourth training rule on spinning yarn is finished.

original: // / rang bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bslab pa 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: // / rang bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bslab pa 'dod pa'o //
translated: “In good health” means desiring the precepts.

original: sgo 'phar zhes bya ba ni sgo 'phar gyi shing ngo //
analyzed: sgo 'phar zhes bya ba ni sgo 'phar gyi shing ngo //
translated: “Door panel” means a door panel.

original: sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni nor gtong ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni nor gtong ba'o //
translated: “Generosity” means giving wealth.

original: snyan par smra ba zhes bya ba ni tshig snyan par smra ba'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba zhes bya ba ni tshig snyan par smra ba'o //
translated: “Pleasant speech” means speaking pleasantly.

original: don spyod pa zhes bya ba ni dgos pa bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: don spyod pa zhes bya ba ni dgos pa bsgrub pa'o //
translated: “Meaningful conduct” means accomplishing the purpose.

original: don mthun pa zhes bya ba ni dgos pa mthun zhing bya ba gcig pa ste /
analyzed: don mthun pa zhes bya ba ni dgos pa mthun zhing bya ba gcig pa ste /
translated: “Consistency” means having the same purpose and doing the same work.

original: de dag ni 'khor dga' bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas bsdu ba'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'khor dga' bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas bsdu ba'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the means of attraction because they are the causes of delighting the retinue.

original: ngan pa zhes bya ba ni glen pa'o //
analyzed: ngan pa zhes bya ba ni glen pa'o //
translated: “Bad” means foolish.

original: glang po che'i lta stangs kyis zhes bya ba ni dper na glang po che lus thams cad kyis yongs su bsgyur te rgyab logs su rnam par lta bar byed pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang sku'i tshigs sprul gyi mdud pa lta bu yin
analyzed: glang po che'i lta stangs kyis zhes bya ba ni dper na glang po che lus thams cad kyis yongs su bsgyur te rgyab logs su rnam par lta bar byed pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang sku'i tshigs sprul gyi mdud pa lta bu yin
translated: The phrase “with the gaze of an elephant” means that just as an elephant turns its entire body and looks back, in the same way, the Blessed Buddhas, because their bodies are like a knot in a bamboo stalk,

original: pa'i phyir dang / dus thams cad dang thams cad du mthun par 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir glo g-yas phyogs nas snam logs su bsgyur te rnam par @126a * //🔽gzigs pa mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i phyir dang / dus thams cad dang thams cad du mthun par 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir glo g-yas phyogs nas snam logs su bsgyur te rnam par @126a * // gzigs pa mdzad pa yin no //
translated: and because they always and everywhere hold what is suitable, look back by turning to the right side.

original: lhag ma yod pa'i phyir sbyin par bya zhing zhes bya ba ni gos de spyad pa'i lhag ma ci yod pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma yod pa'i phyir sbyin par bya zhing zhes bya ba ni gos de spyad pa'i lhag ma ci yod pa'o //
translated: The phrase “what remains should be given” means that whatever remains of the robe after it has been used should be given.

original: phyir sbyin par bya zhing zhes bya ba ni dge slong de la phyir sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: phyir sbyin par bya zhing zhes bya ba ni dge slong de la phyir sbyin par bya ste /
translated: The phrase “it should be given back” means that it should be given back to the monk.

original: 'dir phyir sbyin par bya ba'i tshul ni de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dir phyir sbyin par bya ba'i tshul ni de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the way in which it should be given back.

original: btang na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe gos de lus las btang zhing bral bar byas pa de'i tshe na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: btang na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe gos de lus las btang zhing bral bar byas pa de'i tshe na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The offense entailing relinquishment and confession is incurred when the robe is given away and separated from the monk’s body.

original: lus g-yo bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni gang la lus g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi las yod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lus g-yo bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni gang la lus g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi las yod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Bodily movement” means that which is done by the body.

original: tshig rjod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni gang la tshig rjod par byed pa zhes bya ba gang gi las yod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshig rjod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni gang la tshig rjod par byed pa zhes bya ba gang gi las yod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Verbal expression” means that which is done by speech.

original: de gnyis ka dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gang la lus dang ngag gi las gnyis ka yod pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ka dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gang la lus dang ngag gi las gnyis ka yod pa'o //
translated: “Both” means that which is done by both the body and speech.

original: gzhan dag gi zhes bya ba ni gang la gzhan khyim pa dang rab tu byung bdag bskos pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: gzhan dag gi zhes bya ba ni gang la gzhan khyim pa dang rab tu byung bdag bskos pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: “Others” means householders and monks who are not the monk’s companions.

original: / dge slong ma dang dge tshul dang dge tshul ma la nyes byas nyid du 'gyur ba ni rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa'i phyir ro //🔽khyim pa dang khyim pa mo la bsod nams ma yin pa mang du skye bar 'gyur ba ni rab tu byung ba nyid ma yin pas ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / dge slong ma dang dge tshul dang dge tshul ma la nyes byas nyid du 'gyur ba ni rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa'i phyir ro // khyim pa dang khyim pa mo la bsod nams ma yin pa mang du skye bar 'gyur ba ni rab tu byung ba nyid ma yin pas ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a wrong-doing for a fully ordained monk or nun, or for a male or female novice, because they are not fully ordained.🔽It is not a downfall for a layperson, because they are not ordained, and there is no downfall for them.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa ches mang du skye bar 'gyur ba ni dngos gzhi bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa ches mang du skye bar 'gyur ba ni dngos gzhi bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a downfall for a fully ordained monk or nun, because it is included in the actual basis.

original: don gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i dgos pa gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: don gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i dgos pa gzhan gyis so //
translated: “Another purpose” means another worldly purpose.

original: gdul ba'i yo byad kyis zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i thabs kyis te de gnyis la ni dbrog pa'i bsam pa med pas ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gdul ba'i yo byad kyis zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i thabs kyis te de gnyis la ni dbrog pa'i bsam pa med pas ltung ba med do //
translated: “By means of the equipment for taming” means by means of the methods for taming. There is no downfall if one has no intention of stealing, and if one is using the equipment for taming.

original: grogs po zhes bya ba ni gcugs pa'o //
analyzed: grogs po zhes bya ba ni gcugs pa'o //
translated: “A friend” is a close person.

original: zla bo zhes bya ba ni don gcig pa'o //
analyzed: zla bo zhes bya ba ni don gcig pa'o //
translated: “An associate” is a person with the same purpose.

original: bsten grogs zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du sdod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsten grogs zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du sdod par byed pa'o //
translated: “A companion” is a person with whom one often stays.

original: 'phrog pa'i sdang ba ste nyi shu lnga pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'phrog pa'i sdang ba ste nyi shu lnga pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the twenty-fifth verse is completed.

original: // / dbyar 'das nas zhes bya ba ni dbyar gyi dus 'das nas ston la bab pa na'o //
analyzed: // / dbyar 'das nas zhes bya ba ni dbyar gyi dus 'das nas ston la bab pa na'o //
translated: After the summer rains retreat, means after the summer season has passed and autumn has arrived.

original: yid kyis bskor ba na zhes bya ba ni de dag la yid dad pa kho na gtso bo yin zhing skor bar byed la yid kyi lus bskyod pa tsam gyis ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yid kyis bskor ba na zhes bya ba ni de dag la yid dad pa kho na gtso bo yin zhing skor bar byed la yid kyi lus bskyod pa tsam gyis ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: When the mind turns, means that faith in them is the primary factor, and it is the mind that turns. It does not mean that the mind merely moves the body.

original: yid kyis 'dren ces bya ba ni sems sngon du 'gro ba ste sems kyi tshor ba dang sems pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams yul rnams 'dren par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yid kyis 'dren ces bya ba ni sems sngon du 'gro ba ste sems kyi tshor ba dang sems pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams yul rnams 'dren par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The mind leads, means that the mind precedes. It means that the mind leads the phenomena of feeling, intention, and so on to the objects.

original: yid @126b gtso bo zhes bya ba ni sems gtso bo yin pa ste sems las su rung na de dag kyang las su rung la sems las su mi rung na de dag kyang las su mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yid @126b gtso bo zhes bya ba ni sems gtso bo yin pa ste sems las su rung na de dag kyang las su rung la sems las su mi rung na de dag kyang las su mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The mind is primary, means that the mind is primary. It means that when the mind is serviceable, they are also serviceable, and when the mind is not serviceable, they are also not serviceable.

original: yid kyi 'gros can zhes bya ba ni yid kyi 'gros dang ldan pa sems la brten pa ste sems skye na de dag kyang skye la sems 'gag na de dag kyang 'gag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yid kyi 'gros can zhes bya ba ni yid kyi 'gros dang ldan pa sems la brten pa ste sems skye na de dag kyang skye la sems 'gag na de dag kyang 'gag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Having the movement of the mind” means having the movement of the mind, being based on the mind. It means that when the mind arises, they also arise, and when the mind ceases, they also cease.

original: lto 'dun can zhes bya ba ni mchog tu bsod pa dang / mang po za bar 'dod pa ste rgya chen po la mos pa lnga phyi la mi lta zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lto 'dun can zhes bya ba ni mchog tu bsod pa dang / mang po za bar 'dod pa ste rgya chen po la mos pa lnga phyi la mi lta zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Having the movement of the stomach” means desiring very good and abundant food, desiring a lot. It means not looking at the five external sense objects.

original: bca' ba rnam pa bco brgyad ces bya ba ni mar khur dang / hvags khur dang / sbrang rtsi'i khur ba la sogs pa khur ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: bca' ba rnam pa bco brgyad ces bya ba ni mar khur dang / hvags khur dang / sbrang rtsi'i khur ba la sogs pa khur ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: “The eighteen kinds of food” means the eighteen kinds of food such as ghee, honey, molasses, etc.

original: khur ya gcig ni 'dug dka' ba yin gyi zhes bya ba ni dper na ma'i phrag rdang gi khur khyer ba'i phrag rdang gi rtse mo ya gcig tu khur btags la /
analyzed: khur ya gcig ni 'dug dka' ba yin gyi zhes bya ba ni dper na ma'i phrag rdang gi khur khyer ba'i phrag rdang gi rtse mo ya gcig tu khur btags la /
translated: “One shoulder is difficult to carry” means, for example, like the tip of a shoulder yoke that carries a load on a mother’s shoulder.

original: ya gcig tu ma btags na phrag par chags par dka' ba de bzhin du bdag cag gis kyang zas kyi rnyed pa la zos la gos kyi rnyed ba la ma bgos par gal te dor nas sems bde bar 'dug par dka' ba yin gyi zhes bya ba'i tha
analyzed: ya gcig tu ma btags na phrag par chags par dka' ba de bzhin du bdag cag gis kyang zas kyi rnyed pa la zos la gos kyi rnyed ba la ma bgos par gal te dor nas sems bde bar 'dug par dka' ba yin gyi zhes bya ba'i tha
translated: If one does not tie it to one shoulder, it is difficult to keep it on the shoulder. In the same way, it is difficult for us to remain at ease if we abandon the acquisition of food and drink and the acquisition of clothing without having eaten and worn them.

original: tshig go // spyod spyod pa zhes bya ba ni za za la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshig go // spyod spyod pa zhes bya ba ni za za la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “having used and used” means “having eaten and eaten.”

original: ltag pa'i spu byi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ltag sgrer 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ltag pa'i spu byi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ltag sgrer 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “the hair of the head will be combed” means “the hair of the head will be disheveled.”

original: 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni nyes byas kyi ltung ba dang bcas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni nyes byas kyi ltung ba dang bcas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “there will be a contradiction” means “there will be a downfall of an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: 'khor rnam par langs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i phyogs kyi phyir brtson par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'khor rnam par langs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i phyogs kyi phyir brtson par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “the retinue will rise up” means “the retinue will strive for virtue.”

original: dmag gi gnas zhes bya ba ni g-yul gyi gnas so //
analyzed: dmag gi gnas zhes bya ba ni g-yul gyi gnas so //
translated: The phrase “the site of a battle” means “the site of a war.”

original: longs spyod dag gis phyug ces bya ba ni grong la sogs pas rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod dag gis phyug ces bya ba ni grong la sogs pas rgyas pa'o //
translated: Rich in possessions means rich in villages, etc.

original: nye bar bsags zhes bya ba ni gos dang rgyan la sogs pas rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar bsags zhes bya ba ni gos dang rgyan la sogs pas rgyas pa'o //
translated: Well-stocked means rich in clothes, ornaments, etc.

original: yongs su ma spyad pas zhes bya ba ni rgyug pa dang gdul ba la sogs pas ma spyad pas so //🔽gnod sbyin gyi dmag dpon chen po nyi shu rtsa brgyad ces bya ba ni dbang po dang / zla ba dang / chu lha dang / skye dgu'i bdag po dang / pa ra dva dza dang / dbang ldan dang / tsan dan dang / 'dod mchog dang /
analyzed: yongs su ma spyad pas zhes bya ba ni rgyug pa dang gdul ba la sogs pas ma spyad pas so // gnod sbyin gyi dmag dpon chen po nyi shu rtsa brgyad ces bya ba ni dbang po dang / zla ba dang / chu lha dang / skye dgu'i bdag po dang / pa ra dva dza dang / dbang ldan dang / tsan dan dang / 'dod mchog dang /
translated: Not used up means not used up by running around, training, etc.🔽The twenty-eight great yaksha generals means Indra, Chandra, Varuna, Prajapati, Paravasu, Ishana, Chandana, Kamadhenu,

original: mgrin ngan dang / mgul nges dang / ba di dang / nor bu dang / nor bu spyod pa dang / sgra rab dang / nye lnga dang / ri mnyam dang / kha ba can dang / gang bo dang / seng ldeng pa dang / @127a * //
analyzed: mgrin ngan dang / mgul nges dang / ba di dang / nor bu dang / nor bu spyod pa dang / sgra rab dang / nye lnga dang / ri mnyam dang / kha ba can dang / gang bo dang / seng ldeng pa dang / @127a * //
translated: Kaksha, Kumbha, Bindu, Manibhadra, Manicara, Mahasvara, Pancasikha, Sumeru, Himalaya, Purnika, Khadira, and Airavana.

original: bi ta dang / gnod sbyin ba lang skyong dang / 'brog gnas dang / mi'i rgyal po rgyal ba khyu mchog dang / lnga len pa dang / bzhin bzangs dang / gnod sbyin ring po 'khor dang bcas pa dang / 'bras bu gsum pa dang /
analyzed: bi ta dang / gnod sbyin ba lang skyong dang / 'brog gnas dang / mi'i rgyal po rgyal ba khyu mchog dang / lnga len pa dang / bzhin bzangs dang / gnod sbyin ring po 'khor dang bcas pa dang / 'bras bu gsum pa dang /
translated: Vaitaṇḍya, the yakṣa Gopālaka, Aṭavika, the human king Jinarṣabha, Pañcāla, Bhadrika, the yakṣa Dīrghāyu with his retinue, the Triphalga,

original: tsher ma gsum pa zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: tsher ma gsum pa zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: and the Trikaṇṭaka.

original: gnod sbyin 'du ba zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin 'du ba zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin 'dus pa'o //
translated: The yakṣa assembly is the gathering of yakṣas.

original: chos kyi spun dag ces bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi rigs kyis lto gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi spun dag ces bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi rigs kyis lto gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Dharma brothers are so called because they are of the same womb by the type of the noble path.

original: ri'i rtse mo lta bu zhes bya ba ni ri'i spo 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: ri'i rtse mo lta bu zhes bya ba ni ri'i spo 'dra ba'o //
translated: The mountain peak is like the peak of a mountain.

original: rnga mo lta bu zhes bya ba ni rde'u 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: rnga mo lta bu zhes bya ba ni rde'u 'dra ba'o //
translated: The camel is like a pebble.

original: gnod sbyin gdug pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin pha rol gnon pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gdug pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin pha rol gnon pa lta bu'o //
translated: The yakṣa is like a powerful yakṣa.

original: gnyis ka bcad byas na zhes bya ba ni yul dang srog gnyis ka la gnod pa btags na'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka bcad byas na zhes bya ba ni yul dang srog gnyis ka la gnod pa btags na'o //
translated: When both are cut off means when both the country and life are harmed.

original: ma legs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi bar chad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma legs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi bar chad du 'gyur ro //
translated: “It will not be good” means it will be an obstacle to merit.

original: brtad pa las byung ba'i gos zhes bya ba ni nyam nga ba'i dus las byung ba'i gos so //🔽gtan pa ma bting ba'i gnas na ni ston zla tha chungs nya tshun chad gos sbyin pa'i dus ma yin no //
analyzed: brtad pa las byung ba'i gos zhes bya ba ni nyam nga ba'i dus las byung ba'i gos so // gtan pa ma bting ba'i gnas na ni ston zla tha chungs nya tshun chad gos sbyin pa'i dus ma yin no //
translated: “Clothing that arises from haste” means clothing that arises from a time of distress.🔽In a place where a rule has not been established, it is not the time to give clothing until the full moon of the last autumn month.

original: gtan pa bting ba'i gnas na ni dpyid zla 'bring po nya tshun chad gos sbyin pa'i dus ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i bar du 'gyed par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan pa bting ba'i gnas na ni dpyid zla 'bring po nya tshun chad gos sbyin pa'i dus ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i bar du 'gyed par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In a place where a rule has been established, it is not the time to give clothing until the full moon of the middle spring month.

original: dbyar gyi rnyed pa dbyar gyi nang du bdag gir byed na dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyar gyi rnyed pa dbyar gyi nang du bdag gir byed na dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If one appropriates the summer goods during the summer, it becomes the actual basis.

original: gos sbyin pa'i dus las 'das par 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed du gsungs pa ni sogs pa lhur len pa'i phyir dang / rdzas chud zos pa'i zhar la gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gos sbyin pa'i dus las 'das par 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed du gsungs pa ni sogs pa lhur len pa'i phyir dang / rdzas chud zos pa'i zhar la gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that if one keeps clothing past the time of giving clothing, it is a downfall because of the fault of being intent on collecting things and because of the fault of wasting material.

original: brtad pa las byung ba'i gos lnga po dag bdag gir byed pa la ltung ba med pa ni brtad pa'i dbang gis dbyar gyi rnyed pa dbyar gyi nang du bdag gir byed pa las nyes byas kyang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brtad pa las byung ba'i gos lnga po dag bdag gir byed pa la ltung ba med pa ni brtad pa'i dbang gis dbyar gyi rnyed pa dbyar gyi nang du bdag gir byed pa las nyes byas kyang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: There is no offense for the five types of robes that arise from haste, because there is no offense for making haste in the summer rains retreat and making the summer retreat's gains one's own.

original: sbyin bdag gis rang gi la gnas sbyin par byed pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni brkam chags kyi rgyus 'ged pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis rang gi la gnas sbyin par byed pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni brkam chags kyi rgyus 'ged pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no offense for a benefactor who gives to his own, because it is distributed due to the cause of greed.

original: gos 'ged pa'i dge slong bskos pas dus las 'das par gzhag pa la ltung ba med pa ni rdzas chud za ba'i nyes par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gos 'ged pa'i dge slong bskos pas dus las 'das par gzhag pa la ltung ba med pa ni rdzas chud za ba'i nyes par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no offense for a monk who distributes robes to go beyond the proper time, because there is no fault of wasting the substance.

original: sbyin bdag 'ongs te bzhes shig dang / rang gi sug pa nyid nas dbul lo zhes zer bar dus las 'das par gzhag pa las ltung ba med pa ni rdzas chud zos kyang dag slong gis ma nyes @127b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin bdag 'ongs te bzhes shig dang / rang gi sug pa nyid nas dbul lo zhes zer bar dus las 'das par gzhag pa las ltung ba med pa ni rdzas chud zos kyang dag slong gis ma nyes @127b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no offense for going beyond the proper time to store it, if the benefactor comes and says, “Please take it and give it to your own hands, I will give it.”

original: brtad pa las byung ba'i spang pa ste nyi shu drug pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: brtad pa las byung ba'i spang pa ste nyi shu drug pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the twenty-sixth chapter is finished.

original: // / khyim gzhan du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: // / khyim gzhan du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should place it in another house.

original: zhes bya ba ni dgon pa pa'i gtsug lag khang gi nye 'khor du gyur pa'i grong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dgon pa pa'i gtsug lag khang gi nye 'khor du gyur pa'i grong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means in a village that is in the vicinity of a forest monastery.

original: thugs mi ches zhes bya ba ni yid mi ches pa'o ;
analyzed: thugs mi ches zhes bya ba ni yid mi ches pa'o ;
translated: One should not trust it means one should not believe it.

original: /'jigs pa tha dad pas 'jigs su rung ba dang bcas par grags pa dag tu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: /'jigs pa tha dad pas 'jigs su rung ba dang bcas par grags pa dag tu zhes bya ba la /
translated: In places that are known to be fearful because of different kinds of fear means

original: 'jigs pa tha dad pas zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa'i rgyus so //
analyzed: 'jigs pa tha dad pas zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa'i rgyus so //
translated: because of different causes of fear.

original: 'jigs su rung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu de las skrag pa'i 'jigs su rung ba skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'jigs su rung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu de las skrag pa'i 'jigs su rung ba skye ba'o //
translated: Fearful means fear arises from that cause.

original: de dang lhan cig 'jigs pa tha dad pas 'jigs su rung ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'jigs pa tha dad pas 'jigs su rung ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Together with that, there are different kinds of fear.

original: de lta bu nyid yin par grags pa dag ni 'jigs pa tha dad pas 'jigs su rung ba dang bcas par grags pa dag go //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid yin par grags pa dag ni 'jigs pa tha dad pas 'jigs su rung ba dang bcas par grags pa dag go //
translated: Those that are known to be like that are known to be fearful because of different kinds of fear.

original: 'di'am zhes bya ba ni dgon pa 'am gtsug lag khang grong dang bcas par ro //
analyzed: 'di'am zhes bya ba ni dgon pa 'am gtsug lag khang grong dang bcas par ro //
translated: Here means in the wilderness or in the monastery with its surrounding area.

original: der zhes bya ba ni gnas gzhan gang du song ba der ro ;
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni gnas gzhan gang du song ba der ro ;
translated: There means in any other place to which one goes.

original: / zhag bdun gyi 'bral ba'i spang ba ste nyi shu bdun pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: / zhag bdun gyi 'bral ba'i spang ba ste nyi shu bdun pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The twenty-seventh permutation of the downfall through transgression of the rule on separation from the three robes for more than six days has been explained.

original: // / snga mas zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa snga mas so //
analyzed: // / snga mas zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa snga mas so //
translated: The former means the former promise to remain in retreat during the rainy season.

original: rang gi dus zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi skabs so //
analyzed: rang gi dus zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi skabs so //
translated: One’s own time means the period of one’s own retreat.

original: phyi mas zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa phyi mas so ;🔽/ so ga rnams kyi zla ba gcig lus na zhes bya ba ni dbyar zla ra ba nya nas dbyar zla 'bring po nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig lus na'o //
analyzed: phyi mas zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa phyi mas so ; / so ga rnams kyi zla ba gcig lus na zhes bya ba ni dbyar zla ra ba nya nas dbyar zla 'bring po nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig lus na'o //
translated: The latter means the latter promise to remain in retreat during the rainy season.🔽One month of the hot season remains means that one month remains from the first day of the rainy month of Āṣāḍha until the full moon of Śravaṇa.

original: dbyar zad nas 'og tu zla ba phyed kyi bar du zhes bya ba ni ston zla tha chungs tshes kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: dbyar zad nas 'og tu zla ba phyed kyi bar du zhes bya ba ni ston zla tha chungs tshes kyi bar du'o //
translated: After the rainy season, for half a month means until the fifteenth day of the month of Kārttika.

original: 'di skad bstan gyi dbyar gyi gos ras chen dbyar gnas pas khas len pa'i dus zla ba gcig gis ma bab pa'i dus nas btsal bar bya zhing dgag dbye byas nas zla ba phyed kyi bar du bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di skad bstan gyi dbyar gyi gos ras chen dbyar gnas pas khas len pa'i dus zla ba gcig gis ma bab pa'i dus nas btsal bar bya zhing dgag dbye byas nas zla ba phyed kyi bar du bcang bar bya'o //
translated: This is the teaching: The large rain cloak should be sought one month before the time of accepting the rainy season, and it should be kept for half a month after the end of the rainy season.🔽One month before the rainy season is when the rainy season is to be accomplished.

original: zla ba gcig na dbyar nye bar bsgrub pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba na'o zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas pa snga ma khas len pa la ni dbyar zla ra ba nya na'o //🔽dbyar gnas pa phyi mar khas len pa la ni dbyar zla 'bring po nya na'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽dgag dbye byas nas zla ba phyed kyi bar du'o zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas pa snga mar khas blangs pa la ni ston zla ba tha chungs tshes kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: zla ba gcig na dbyar nye bar bsgrub pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba na'o zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas pa snga ma khas len pa la ni dbyar zla ra ba nya na'o // dbyar gnas pa phyi mar khas len pa la ni dbyar zla 'bring po nya na'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro // dgag dbye byas nas zla ba phyed kyi bar du'o zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas pa snga mar khas blangs pa la ni ston zla ba tha chungs tshes kyi bar du'o //
translated: This means that for those accepting the earlier rainy season, it is on the full moon of Āṣāḍha.🔽For those accepting the later rainy season, it is on the full moon of Śravaṇa.🔽For half a month after the end of the rainy season means that for those accepting the earlier rainy season, it is until the fifteenth day of Āśvayuja.

original: dbyar gnas pa phyi mar khas blangs pa la ni dgun zla ra ba tshes kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: dbyar gnas pa phyi mar khas blangs pa la ni dgun zla ra ba tshes kyi bar du'o //
translated: For those accepting the later rainy season, it is until the fifteenth day of Kārttika.

original: gang dag @128a * //
analyzed: gang dag @128a * //
translated: Those who have not completed the rainy season

original: dbyar snga mar gnas par khas len pa de dag la ni ha cang yun ring du 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ston zla tha chung tshes kyi bar du 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: dbyar snga mar gnas par khas len pa de dag la ni ha cang yun ring du 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ston zla tha chung tshes kyi bar du 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: This means that it is a downfall to keep it until the fifteenth day of the last autumn month.

original: de bzhin du gang dag dbyar phyi mar gnas par khas blangs pa de dag la dgun zlar ba tshes kyi bar du 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur bar shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dag dbyar phyi mar gnas par khas blangs pa de dag la dgun zlar ba tshes kyi bar du 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur bar shes par bya ba'o //
translated: Similarly, it should be understood that for those who have accepted the later rainy season, it is a downfall to keep it until the fifteenth day of the last winter month.🔽For those who have accepted the later rainy season, it is a downfall to seek robes too soon.

original: gang dag dbyar phyi mar gnas pa khas len pa de dag la ni ha cang myur du tshol na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dbyar zla 'bring po nya phan chad du tshol na'o //
analyzed: gang dag dbyar phyi mar gnas pa khas len pa de dag la ni ha cang myur du tshol na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dbyar zla 'bring po nya phan chad du tshol na'o //
translated: This means that it is a downfall to seek robes after the full moon of the middle month of autumn.

original: de bzhin du gang dag dbyar snga mar gnas par khas len pa de dag la ni dbyar zla ra ba nya phan chad du tshol na spang pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dag dbyar snga mar gnas par khas len pa de dag la ni dbyar zla ra ba nya phan chad du tshol na spang pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: So too, those who agree to stay during the earlier rainy season should understand that if they search for robes after the full moon of the first summer month, they commit a downfall of abandonment.🔽If a monk searches for robes too quickly or stays too long, then in all cases he commits a downfall of abandonment.

original: de lta na dge slong gis ji tsam du ha chang myur du tshol bar byed pa dang / ha cang yun ring du gnas par byed na thams cad du spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sngar tshol na tshol ba'i tshe ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na dge slong gis ji tsam du ha chang myur du tshol bar byed pa dang / ha cang yun ring du gnas par byed na thams cad du spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sngar tshol na tshol ba'i tshe ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: This means that if he searches for robes too quickly, then when he is searching he commits an act of wrong conduct.

original: rnyed pa'i tshe na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba dang / 'das par 'chang na 'chang bar rtsol ba'i tshe ni nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: rnyed pa'i tshe na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba dang / 'das par 'chang na 'chang bar rtsol ba'i tshe ni nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: If he obtains them, he commits a downfall of abandonment. If he keeps them beyond the time limit, then when he is making an effort to keep them he commits an act of wrong conduct.

original: 'das par bcangs pa'i tshe na ni spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'das par bcangs pa'i tshe na ni spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: If he keeps them beyond the time limit, he commits a downfall of abandonment.

original: dbyar gyi ras chen gyi spang ba ste nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dbyar gyi ras chen gyi spang ba ste nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The twenty-eighth rule, the prohibition against the rainy season practice, is completed.

original: // / dad pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan la yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: // / dad pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan la yid ches pa'o //
translated: Faith is confidence in good qualities.

original: gcugs pa zhes bya ba ni byams pa'o //
analyzed: gcugs pa zhes bya ba ni byams pa'o //
translated: Affection is love.

original: dad pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan 'dod pa'o //
translated: Faith is the desire for good qualities.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin du mi rung ba ste rdzas de gzhan la byin zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin du mi rung ba ste rdzas de gzhan la byin zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A gift that is not in accordance with the Dharma is not suitable to be given because that substance has already been given to another.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i len pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni blang du mi rung ba ste de'i bdag po gzhan yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i len pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni blang du mi rung ba ste de'i bdag po gzhan yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A recipient who is not in accordance with the Dharma is not suitable to receive it because the owner of that substance is someone else.

original: longs spyod du mi rung ba zhes bya ba ni spyad du mi rung ba ste spyod par byed pa dag gis de gzhan gyi yin par shes bzhin du spyod pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod du mi rung ba zhes bya ba ni spyad du mi rung ba ste spyod par byed pa dag gis de gzhan gyi yin par shes bzhin du spyod pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: An enjoyment that is not suitable is not suitable to be used because it is not suitable for those who use it to use it while knowing that it belongs to someone else.

original: dge 'dun bye zhing zhes bya ba ni lam gzhan khas blangs pas so //
analyzed: dge 'dun bye zhing zhes bya ba ni lam gzhan khas blangs pas so //
translated: The Saṅgha is divided means that it has accepted another path.

original: gnyis 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni ston pa gzhan khas blangs pas so //
analyzed: gnyis 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni ston pa gzhan khas blangs pas so //
translated: The phrase in two ways refers to the acceptance of another teacher.

original: phyogs dang gzhan gyi phyogs su rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rtsod par gyur pas las bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs dang gzhan gyi phyogs su rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rtsod par gyur pas las bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase in terms of one's own position and the position of others means that one should engage in debate.

original: 'dir rgyu bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dir rgyu bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason for this, the root text states,

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni sbyin pa yin la phyi ma ni ma yin no zhes bya ba @128b gsungs te /🔽'di ltar snga ma nyid gtong ba'i tshe sbyin pa byas pa yin pas de'i tshe na sbyin bdag bdag po yin gyi phyi ma'i tshe na bdag po ma yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni sbyin pa yin la phyi ma ni ma yin no zhes bya ba @128b gsungs te / 'di ltar snga ma nyid gtong ba'i tshe sbyin pa byas pa yin pas de'i tshe na sbyin bdag bdag po yin gyi phyi ma'i tshe na bdag po ma yin te /
translated: Monks, therefore, the first is the donor, but the second is not.

original: de'i tshe na len pa po nyid bdag po yin no //🔽sbyin bdag de nyid thams cad la bdag po yin par dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir rgyal po ni sa bzhi la dbang la ;🔽bdag po ni gnas mal la dbang /
analyzed: de'i tshe na len pa po nyid bdag po yin no // sbyin bdag de nyid thams cad la bdag po yin par dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir rgyal po ni sa bzhi la dbang la ; bdag po ni gnas mal la dbang /
translated: The reason is that at the time when the first is being given, the gift has been given, and at that time the donor is the owner, but not at the time of the second, because at that time the recipient is the owner.

original: dge slong ni lhung bzed la dbang /
analyzed: dge slong ni lhung bzed la dbang /
translated: In order to dispel the doubt that the donor is the owner of everything, the root text states, The king is the owner of the land, the owner of the bed is the owner of the bed, and the monk is the owner of the alms bowl.

original: chos gos la dbang ngo zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos gos la dbang ngo zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: One has power over the Dharma robes.🔽🔽

original: rgyal po ni re zhigs bzhi la dbang ba yin la /
analyzed: rgyal po ni re zhigs bzhi la dbang ba yin la /
translated: The Buddha said, “The king has power over the four.🔽The owner of the monastery has power over the dwelling place, the bed, the seat, and so on.

original: gtsug lag khang gi bdag po ni gnas khang dang khri dang khri'u la sogs pa gnas mal la dbang ngo //🔽gtsug lag khang de na gnas pa'i dge slong ni gtsug lag khang de na yod pa'i lhung bzed dang / chos gos la sogs pa dbang ngo //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi bdag po ni gnas khang dang khri dang khri'u la sogs pa gnas mal la dbang ngo // gtsug lag khang de na gnas pa'i dge slong ni gtsug lag khang de na yod pa'i lhung bzed dang / chos gos la sogs pa dbang ngo //
translated: The monk who resides in the monastery has power over the begging bowl and robes, and so on, that are in the monastery.🔽The donor and benefactor cannot make use of the object to be given, but they cannot give it to another.🔽The donor and benefactor cannot make use of the object to be given, but they cannot give it to another.🔽The donor and benefactor cannot make use of the object to be given, but they cannot give it to another.🔽The donor and benefactor cannot make use of the object to be given, but they cannot give it to another.

original: sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag gis rang gi sbyin par bya ba'i chos mngon par 'du bya bar mi rung gi gzhan la sbyin du ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag gis sngar len pa po la phul ba rang gi sbyin🔽par bya ba'i chos de byi dor la sogs pa mngon par 'du bya bar ni ste bsod nams yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag gis rang gi sbyin par bya ba'i chos mngon par 'du bya bar mi rung gi gzhan la sbyin du ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag gis sngar len pa po la phul ba rang gi sbyin🔽par bya ba'i chos de byi dor la sogs pa mngon par 'du bya bar ni ste bsod nams yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The donor and benefactor cannot make use of the object to be given, but they cannot give it to another.🔽The donor and benefactor cannot make use of the object to be given, but they cannot give it to another.🔽The donor and benefactor cannot make use of the object to be given, but they cannot give it to another.🔽The donor and benefactor cannot make use of the object to be given, but they cannot give it to another.🔽The donor and benefactor cannot make use of the object to be given, but they cannot give it to another.🔽The donor and benefactor cannot make use of the object to be given, but they cannot give it to another.🔽The donor and benefactor cannot make use of the object to be given, but they cannot give it to another.🔽The donor and benefactor cannot make use of the object to be given, but they cannot give it to another.🔽The donor and benefactor cannot make use of the object to be given, but they cannot give it to another.🔽The donor and benefactor cannot make use of the object to be given, but they cannot give it to another.🔽The donor and benefactor cannot make use of the object to be given, but they cannot give it to another.🔽The donor and benefactor cannot make use of the object to be given, but they cannot give it to another.🔽The donor and benefactor cannot make use of the object to be given, but they cannot give it to another.🔽The donor and benefactor cannot make use of the object to be given, but they cannot give it to another.🔽The donor and benefactor cannot make use of the object to be given, but they cannot give it to another.🔽The donor and benefactor cannot make use of the object to

original: gzhan la sbyin du ni mi rung ste de'i tshe na bdag po gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin du ni mi rung ste de'i tshe na bdag po gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not suitable to give to others, because at that time it belongs to another.

original: re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa gang zag bdag la ma bsdos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa gang zag bdag la ma bsdos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha did not establish a training precept for the śrāvakas in the Vinaya, saying, Do not take for yourself the Saṅgha's gain.

original: ris mthun pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: ris mthun pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: Homogeneous group means birth.

original: gcig cig ces bya ba ni phyogs las gcig cig go //
analyzed: gcig cig ces bya ba ni phyogs las gcig cig go //
translated: One means one from the side.

original: gos kyi rnyed pa yin par dgongs so zhes bya ba ni gtso bo yin pas de'i las dngos gzhir 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gos kyi rnyed pa yin par dgongs so zhes bya ba ni gtso bo yin pas de'i las dngos gzhir 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: The intention is that it is a gain of cloth, because it is primary and its action becomes the actual basis.

original: / de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ba'i rnam pa la gang zag gcig dang / gnyis dang / rab tu mang po dang / dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa gang zag bdag la sgyur du 'jud pa la rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: / de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ba'i rnam pa la gang zag gcig dang / gnyis dang / rab tu mang po dang / dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa gang zag bdag la sgyur du 'jud pa la rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: If it is asked, How does a downfall occur in that? there are four types: taking for oneself the gain dedicated to one person, two people, many people, or the Saṅgha.

original: gang zag gcig la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa gang zag gzhan gcig dang / rab tu mang po dang / dge 'dun la sgyur du 'jud pa la yang rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: gang zag gcig la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa gang zag gzhan gcig dang / rab tu mang po dang / dge 'dun la sgyur du 'jud pa la yang rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: There are four types of exchanging the goods dedicated to one person for goods dedicated to another person, to a large number of people, or to the Saṅgha.

original: gang zag gnyis la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa'i gang zag gzhan gcig dang / gnyis dang / rab tu mang po dang / dge 'dun la sgyur du 'jud pa la yang rnam pa bzhi'o //🔽gang zag rab tu mang po dag la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa gang zag gzhan @129a * //🔽gcig dang / gnyis dang / rab tu mang po dang / dge 'dun la sgyur du 'jud pa la yang rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: gang zag gnyis la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa'i gang zag gzhan gcig dang / gnyis dang / rab tu mang po dang / dge 'dun la sgyur du 'jud pa la yang rnam pa bzhi'o // gang zag rab tu mang po dag la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa gang zag gzhan @129a * // gcig dang / gnyis dang / rab tu mang po dang / dge 'dun la sgyur du 'jud pa la yang rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: There are four types of exchanging the goods dedicated to two people for goods dedicated to another person, to two people, to a large number of people, or to the Saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa gang zag gcig dang / gnyis dang / rab tu mang po dang / dge 'dun gzhan la sgyur du 'jud pa la yang rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa gang zag gcig dang / gnyis dang / rab tu mang po dang / dge 'dun gzhan la sgyur du 'jud pa la yang rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: There are four types of exchanging the goods dedicated to a large number of people for goods dedicated to another person, to two people, to a large number of people, or to the Saṅgha.🔽There are four types of exchanging the goods dedicated to the Saṅgha for goods dedicated to another person, to two people, to a large number of people, or to the Saṅgha.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa'i dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la sgyur du 'jud pa dang / dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa dge 'dun la sgyur du 'jud pa la rnam pa gnyis so //🔽gnyis pa'i dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa dag dge slong gi dge 'dun la sgyur du 'jud pa dang ; gnyis ka'i dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la sgyur du 'jud pa la yang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa'i dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la sgyur du 'jud pa dang / dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa dge 'dun la sgyur du 'jud pa la rnam pa gnyis so // gnyis pa'i dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa dag dge slong gi dge 'dun la sgyur du 'jud pa dang ; gnyis ka'i dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la sgyur du 'jud pa la yang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: There are two kinds of turning over of the acquisition dedicated to the community of monks to the community of nuns, and of that dedicated to the community of nuns to the community of monks.🔽There are two kinds of turning over of the acquisition dedicated to the community of both to the community of monks, and of that dedicated to the community of both to the community of nuns.

original: dge 'dun bye ba ni phyogs gcig la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa phyogs gnyis pa la sgyur du 'jud pa la rnam pa gcig ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun bye ba ni phyogs gcig la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa phyogs gnyis pa la sgyur du 'jud pa la rnam pa gcig ste /
translated: There is one kind of turning over of the acquisition dedicated to one faction of the community to the other faction of the community.

original: de ltar de dag ni rab tu byung ba'i yul la ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa'i 'gres nyi shu rtsa lnga yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni rab tu byung ba'i yul la ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa'i 'gres nyi shu rtsa lnga yin no //
translated: Thus, these are the twenty-five permutations of the downfall through violating the objects of the renunciate.

original: de la gang zag gcig dang gnyis dang rab tu mang po dang / dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa gang zag bdag la sgyur du 'jud na ni dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gang zag gcig dang gnyis dang rab tu mang po dang / dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa gang zag bdag la sgyur du 'jud na ni dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If one causes a single person, or two, or many, or the Saṃgha to give up what has been dedicated to the Saṃgha, it is the actual basis.

original: gzhan la sgyur du 'jud na ni nyes byas su 'gyur bar shes par bya'o//
analyzed: gzhan la sgyur du 'jud na ni nyes byas su 'gyur bar shes par bya'o//
translated: If one causes another to give it up, it should be understood that it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gnas khang la sogs pa'i bye brag gis sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i yul la ni rnam pa mang ngo //
analyzed: gnas khang la sogs pa'i bye brag gis sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i yul la ni rnam pa mang ngo //
translated: There are many types of objects that are not sentient beings, such as a dwelling place.

original: mu to ba dang dud 'gro'i yul la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mu to ba dang dud 'gro'i yul la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of objects that are animals:

original: de dag la yang sbyor ba dang / dngos gnyis ka la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: de dag la yang sbyor ba dang / dngos gnyis ka la yang nyes byas so //
translated: In both the preparatory and actual stages, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: g-yar po'i chos zhes bya ba ni brnyan po nyid do //
analyzed: g-yar po'i chos zhes bya ba ni brnyan po nyid do //
translated: “Borrowed goods” means what is on loan.

original: them skas kyi gzhi zhes bya ba ni rkang rten no //
analyzed: them skas kyi gzhi zhes bya ba ni rkang rten no //
translated: “Stairway” means a footrest.

original: me tog khang zhes bya ba ni bang rim bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: me tog khang zhes bya ba ni bang rim bzhi pa ste /
translated: “Flower house” means a four-stepped altar,

original: me tog gi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me tog gi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a place for flowers.

original: yang na me tog gi phreng ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na me tog gi phreng ba yin no //
translated: Or it is a garland of flowers.

original: ba gam zhes bya ba ni gtsang khang phyur bu'o //🔽phu shu zhes bya ba ni mchod rten gyi bre'o //
analyzed: ba gam zhes bya ba ni gtsang khang phyur bu'o // phu shu zhes bya ba ni mchod rten gyi bre'o //
translated: The “tower” is the temple.🔽The “basket” is the stupa.

original: gdugs zhes bya ba ni mchod rten gyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: gdugs zhes bya ba ni mchod rten gyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: The “parasol” is the stupa’s wheel.

original: mu to ba zhes bya ba'i lhag ma za ba'o //
analyzed: mu to ba zhes bya ba'i lhag ma za ba'o //
translated: The “shell” is the remainder of the offering.

original: btsal te ma rnyed pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni des ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / rdzas chud za ba yongs su spang ba'i don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: btsal te ma rnyed pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni des ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / rdzas chud za ba yongs su spang ba'i don gyi phyir ro //
translated: There is no offense if one searches and does not find it, because one has not taken it, and in order to avoid the loss of property.

original: bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba ste nyi shu dgu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba ste nyi shu dgu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The twenty-ninth rule, the prohibition against changing what has been dedicated, has been explained.

original: // / de nas lag nyar @129b blangs pa zhes bya ba ni gnas nas rang gis blangs pa'o //
analyzed: // / de nas lag nyar @129b blangs pa zhes bya ba ni gnas nas rang gis blangs pa'o //
translated: “Having taken it into one’s own hands” means having taken it from its place.

original: de las byin len byas pa zhes bya ba ni byin len stobs pa las byin len byas pa'o //
analyzed: de las byin len byas pa zhes bya ba ni byin len stobs pa las byin len byas pa'o //
translated: “Having received it from that person” means having received it from the one who is giving it.

original: zas kyi phye ma dang 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras kyi gzegs ma la sogs pa dang 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: zas kyi phye ma dang 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras kyi gzegs ma la sogs pa dang 'dres pa'o //
translated: “Mixed with food” means mixed with rice, barley, and so on.

original: phan tshun 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni zhun mar dang bu ram la sogs pa 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni zhun mar dang bu ram la sogs pa 'dres pa'o //
translated: “Mixed” means like clarified butter and molasses, etc.

original: rang gi rgyud kyis myangs pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis zhu ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud kyis myangs pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis zhu ba'o //
translated: “Consumed by one’s own continuum” means naturally digested.

original: rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba ni tha dad par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba ni tha dad par dbye ba'o //
translated: “Distinction” means a division into different parts.

original: gsog 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni bsag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: gsog 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni bsag par bya ba ste /
translated: “Accumulation” means that which is to be accumulated.

original: 'di lta ste sbyin pa de lag nyar blangs pa dang spa ba dang bza' ba dang 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sbyin pa de lag nyar blangs pa dang spa ba dang bza' ba dang 'das pa'o //
translated: For example, that gift is held in the hand, is worn, is eaten, and is passed.

original: ltung byed sum cu pa gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: ltung byed sum cu pa gsog 'jog gi spang ba'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the words of the training precept on accumulation is finished.

original: // /'gags pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug kyang 'gag pa'i phyir ro //🔽bral ba zhes bya ba ni de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems dang bral bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // /'gags pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug kyang 'gag pa'i phyir ro // bral ba zhes bya ba ni de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems dang bral bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Ceased” means that even though it is engaged, it is ceased.🔽“Separated” means that it is separated from the mind that motivates it.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba na kun nas slong bar byed pa dang / mi mthun pa'i sems skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba na kun nas slong bar byed pa dang / mi mthun pa'i sems skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Changed” means that it is changed by the arising of a mind that is incompatible with the motivation.

original: so sor bshags par bya ba zhes bya ba ni ltung ba sbyang pa'i phyir dang / rnam par smin pa 'phangs pa bsrab pa'i phyir bshags pa'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: so sor bshags par bya ba zhes bya ba ni ltung ba sbyang pa'i phyir dang / rnam par smin pa 'phangs pa bsrab pa'i phyir bshags pa'i bya ba'o //
translated: Confession is the action of confessing in order to purify downfalls and to reduce the projected ripening.

original: bsdam pa zhes bya ba ni bsod nams spel ba'i phyir dang sdig pa gzhom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsdam pa zhes bya ba ni bsod nams spel ba'i phyir dang sdig pa gzhom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Restraint is the action of restraint in order to increase merit and to destroy sin.

original: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba'o //
translated: Joy is mental satisfaction.

original: mchog tu dga' ba zhes bya ba ni dga' ba dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i chos la mos pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba zhes bya ba ni dga' ba dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i chos la mos pa'o //
translated: Supreme joy is the aspiration for virtuous qualities that are in harmony with joy.

original: nyin mtshan du rjes su bslab cing zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan thams cad du khyab par ro //
analyzed: nyin mtshan du rjes su bslab cing zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan thams cad du khyab par ro //
translated: One should train in following them day and night means one should train in following them at all times, day and night.

original: dran pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste des ni dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba de la nyon mongs pa skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: dran pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste des ni dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba de la nyon mongs pa skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Mindfulness is the applications of mindfulness. By means of them, one does not generate afflictions towards that joy and supreme joy.

original: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni nye bar gnas pa'i shes rab kyis mi rtag pa nyid la sogs par lta ba ste /
analyzed: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni nye bar gnas pa'i shes rab kyis mi rtag pa nyid la sogs par lta ba ste /
translated: Alertness is the view of impermanence, etc. by means of the wisdom of remaining in that.

original: des ni mchog tu 'dzin par lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: des ni mchog tu 'dzin par lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa skyed par mi byed do //
translated: It does not give rise to the afflictions such as the view that grasps at the extreme of existence.

original: mang du gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni shas cher gnas par bya ba yin gyi bya ba gzhan mi bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mang du gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni shas cher gnas par bya ba yin gyi bya ba gzhan mi bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should abide in it frequently means that one should abide in it to a great degree, but it does not mean that one should not perform other actions.

original: yid ni 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams la brten te skye bas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dmigs pa'i dbang gis yid kyi las rnam pa gsum du 'gyur gyi rang las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yid ni 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams la brten te skye bas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dmigs pa'i dbang gis yid kyi las rnam pa gsum du 'gyur gyi rang las ni ma yin te /
translated: The mind arises in dependence on past formations and so on teaches that the three types of mental karma arise due to the power of the object, not from itself,

original: de ni skyes ma thag tu dngos gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro /🔽@130a * // zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ni skyes ma thag tu dngos gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro / @130a * // zhes bstan to //
translated: because it is the main mind that arises immediately after birth.

original: chos de ni dus thams cad pa yin pa dang / skye bo thams cad kyis bsten par bya ba yin pas de la gus par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir sgra gcan zin dge slong ngam bram ze gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: chos de ni dus thams cad pa yin pa dang / skye bo thams cad kyis bsten par bya ba yin pas de la gus par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir sgra gcan zin dge slong ngam bram ze gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to demonstrate respect for that Dharma, which is present at all times and is to be relied upon by all beings, it is said: Rahula, those who are monks or brahmins...

original: go bla bar bya ba dang las la so sor rtog pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis bka' stsal to //
analyzed: go bla bar bya ba dang las la so sor rtog pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis bka' stsal to //
translated: Two verses on the demonstration of the result of the discrimination of the knowable and of action.

original: sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas gyi bka'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas gyi bka'o //
translated: The teaching of the Buddha is the word of the Buddha.

original: dge ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The virtuous is the noble path and nirvana.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni sgra gcan zin rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni sgra gcan zin rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: He does not establish the bases of training means that he does not do so because Rahula has not yet received full ordination.

original: smra ba dang gzhan gyi smra ba'i rjes su brtson pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smra ba dang gzhan gyi smra ba'i rjes su brtson pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is diligent in teaching and in the pursuit of others' teachings.

original: smra ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin pa'i bstan bcos dag go //
analyzed: smra ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin pa'i bstan bcos dag go //
translated: The teaching is the treatises which are the word of the Buddha.

original: gzhan gyi smra ba zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa can la sogs pa gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' dag ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi smra ba zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa can la sogs pa gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' dag ste /
translated: The pursuit of others' teachings is the pursuit of other tenets such as the Lokayatas.

original: de dag la rjes su brtson zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag la rjes su brtson zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The diligent means that he is intent on those.

original: yang na bstan bcos kyi sgo nas gzhan dang lhan cig rtsod pa smras pas gzhan dang rtsod pa'i rjes su brtson pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na bstan bcos kyi sgo nas gzhan dang lhan cig rtsod pa smras pas gzhan dang rtsod pa'i rjes su brtson pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, he is called one who strives in debate with others because he speaks in debate with others through the treatise.

original: bram ze mchog nyid du 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni bram ze rnams rgyal zhing mchog nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bram ze mchog nyid du 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni bram ze rnams rgyal zhing mchog nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The Brahmins will be supreme means that the Brahmins will be victorious and supreme.

original: rigs bzhi po dag rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni rigs bzhi po dag rnam par thar pa'o //
analyzed: rigs bzhi po dag rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni rigs bzhi po dag rnam par thar pa'o //
translated: The purification of the four castes means the liberation of the four castes.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Desire means strong desire.

original: ston pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu ston pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu ston pa'o //
translated: Teaching means teaching well.

original: 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dzin du 'jud pa'o //
analyzed: 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dzin du 'jud pa'o //
translated: Designation means causing to grasp.

original: rab tu 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su bsgrub tu 'dud pa'o ;
analyzed: rab tu 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su bsgrub tu 'dud pa'o ;
translated: Establishment means causing to practice.

original: slob dpon gyi mtshan zhes bya ba ni sna'i gzangs mtho ba la sogs pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi mtshan zhes bya ba ni sna'i gzangs mtho ba la sogs pa'i rtags so //
translated: The characteristics of a teacher are the signs such as a prominent nose.

original: rnon por bya zhes bya ba ni nges par rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir nges par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rnon por bya zhes bya ba ni nges par rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir nges par gzhag pa'o //
translated: To be sharp means to be established for the sake of certain victory.

original: blon po chen po zhes bya ba ni brjed ngas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blon po chen po zhes bya ba ni brjed ngas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great minister is forgetful.

original: shes pas mi 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba ni dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: shes pas mi 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba ni dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The one who is not disturbed by knowledge is free from doubt.

original: / thos pa gzung ba zhes bya ba ni don dang tshig gi bdag nyid gzung ba'o //
analyzed: / thos pa gzung ba zhes bya ba ni don dang tshig gi bdag nyid gzung ba'o //
translated: The one who grasps what is heard grasps the meaning and the words.

original: tshogs klog du gzhug ces bya ba ni 'khor gyi tshogs klog tu gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs klog du gzhug ces bya ba ni 'khor gyi tshogs klog tu gzhug pa'o //
translated: The one who makes the assembly recite is the one who makes the assembly recite.

original: rnam par dpyad pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par brtags nas so //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par brtags nas so //
translated: The one who analyzes is the one who analyzes after examining.

original: gzhi med par mthong ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhi med par mthong ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The one who sees without a basis is the one who sees without a basis.

original: 'dir mthong ba zhes bya ba ni @130b mthong ba smra ba'o //🔽brdzun smra bar bya'o snyam pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir brdzun smra ba'i sbyor ba yin par shes par bya'o //🔽brdzun smra'o snyam pa zhes bya ba ni dngos so //
analyzed: 'dir mthong ba zhes bya ba ni @130b mthong ba smra ba'o // brdzun smra bar bya'o snyam pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir brdzun smra ba'i sbyor ba yin par shes par bya'o // brdzun smra'o snyam pa zhes bya ba ni dngos so //
translated: Here, the one who sees is the one who speaks of seeing.🔽The one who thinks I will tell a lie is the one who prepares to tell a lie.🔽The one who thinks I am telling a lie is the actual act.

original: brdzun smras so snyam pa zhes bya ba ni mjug go //
analyzed: brdzun smras so snyam pa zhes bya ba ni mjug go //
translated: The one who thinks I have told a lie is the conclusion.

original: brdzun smra ba la rnam pa gcig pu 'ba' zhig ni med do zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'dir gang zag rang bzhin du gnas pa tha snyad du byar rung ba'i dbang du byas pas yin la gang zag dbang du gnas pa la ni brdzun smra ba
analyzed: brdzun smra ba la rnam pa gcig pu 'ba' zhig ni med do zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'dir gang zag rang bzhin du gnas pa tha snyad du byar rung ba'i dbang du byas pas yin la gang zag dbang du gnas pa la ni brdzun smra ba
translated: There is no single instance of lying, because here the person is considered to be a natural fact that can be conventionally designated.

original: na bdag gis brdzun smra'o snyam pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur gyi smras pa na yang brdzun smra'o snyam pa'i sems kyis ma bslangs par brdzun smra bar mi rigs pas de'i phyir rnam pa gcig pa 'ba' zhig ni med do //
analyzed: na bdag gis brdzun smra'o snyam pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur gyi smras pa na yang brdzun smra'o snyam pa'i sems kyis ma bslangs par brdzun smra bar mi rigs pas de'i phyir rnam pa gcig pa 'ba' zhig ni med do //
translated: When a person is considered to be a natural fact, the thought “I am lying” arises, but it is not right to lie without being prompted by the thought “I am lying.” Therefore, there is no single instance of lying.

original: dge 'dun gyi nang na zhes bya ba ni dbye ba'i bsam pas so //🔽chos ma yin pa chos su zhes bya ba ni med pa nyid dang bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa la rigs pa ma yin par rigs par ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang na zhes bya ba ni dbye ba'i bsam pas so // chos ma yin pa chos su zhes bya ba ni med pa nyid dang bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa la rigs pa ma yin par rigs par ro //
translated: In the midst of the Saṅgha means with the intention to divide.🔽Non-Dharma as Dharma means that which is not right is right, such as the views of non-existence and self.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni yod pa nyid dang bdag med pa la sogs pa rigs pa'o ;
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni yod pa nyid dang bdag med pa la sogs pa rigs pa'o ;
translated: Dharma means that which is right, such as the views of existence and selflessness.

original: /'dul ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: /'dul ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Not a monastic” means not a celibate practitioner, and so on.

original: 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa spong ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa spong ba la sogs pa'o //
