translated: “A monastic” means one who has abandoned not being a celibate practitioner, and so on.

original: cang mi smra bar sdod pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas so //
analyzed: cang mi smra bar sdod pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas so //
translated: “Remaining silent” means a fault that should be restrained.

original: kha 'gul ba la sogs pa yod na ni bshags par bya ba yang yin no //
analyzed: kha 'gul ba la sogs pa yod na ni bshags par bya ba yang yin no //
translated: If one speaks, and so on, it is also an offense that should be confessed.

original: sred par byed 'tshed par byed ces bya ba 'dis ni 'tshed par byed pas ltung byed do zhes bya ba ston te /
analyzed: sred par byed 'tshed par byed ces bya ba 'dis ni 'tshed par byed pas ltung byed do zhes bya ba ston te /
translated: “One who causes craving, one who causes burning” shows that “one who causes burning” is a downfall.

original: sreg par byed ces bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dag tu mes so //
analyzed: sreg par byed ces bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dag tu mes so //
translated: “One who causes burning” means in the hells, by fire.

original: 'tshed par byed ces bya ba ni dud 'gro dag tu lus kyi sdug bsngal du mas nyon mongs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'tshed par byed ces bya ba ni dud 'gro dag tu lus kyi sdug bsngal du mas nyon mongs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: “One who causes boiling” means in the animal realm, because of being afflicted by many sufferings of the body.

original: / ltung bar byed ces bya ba 'dis ni ltung bar byed do zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: / ltung bar byed ces bya ba 'dis ni ltung bar byed do zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: “One who causes falling” shows that “one who causes falling” is a downfall.

original: yid dags rnams su mi gtsang ba zag ba la sogs pa'i las shin tu mang bar ltung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid dags rnams su mi gtsang ba zag ba la sogs pa'i las shin tu mang bar ltung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they fall into the many actions of eating excrement, etc. in the unpleasant destinies.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis ni dge ba'i chos la ltung bas ltung byed do zhes bya bar ston te dro bar gyur ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i chos kyi bar du gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis ni dge ba'i chos la ltung bas ltung byed do zhes bya bar ston te dro bar gyur ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i chos kyi bar du gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It obscures the wholesome dharmas because it is an obstruction to the wholesome dharmas, up to the dharmas that are conducive to penetration, such as the stages conducive to insight.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: How does one fall into these?🔽The basis for what is seen, heard, known, or perceived does not exist.🔽The basis for what is forgotten does not exist.🔽The basis for what is doubted does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.

original: mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / rig pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i gzhi med pa nyid ni bzhi pa gcig go //
analyzed: mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / rig pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i gzhi med pa nyid ni bzhi pa gcig go //
translated: The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.

original: brjed pa nyi gnyis pa ste brjod pa yang gzhi med @131a * //
analyzed: brjed pa nyi gnyis pa ste brjod pa yang gzhi med @131a * //
translated: The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.

original: pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽yid gnyis za ba ni gsum pa ste /
analyzed: pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro // yid gnyis za ba ni gsum pa ste /
translated: The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.🔽The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.

original: yid gnyis za bzhin du nges par smra ba yang brdzun nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid gnyis za bzhin du nges par smra ba yang brdzun nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The basis for what is said with uncertainty does not exist.

original: mthong ba la sogs pa la ma mthong ba la sogs par 'du shes pa ni bzhi par ro //
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs pa la ma mthong ba la sogs par 'du shes pa ni bzhi par ro //
translated: The fourth is the notion that one has not seen, etc., in regard to what one has seen, etc.

original: ma mthong zhing thos pa la sogs pa la mthong bar smra ba ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: ma mthong zhing thos pa la sogs pa la mthong bar smra ba ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth is the claim that one has seen what one has not seen or heard, etc.

original: ma thos shing mthong ba la sogs pa la thos par smra ba ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: ma thos shing mthong ba la sogs pa la thos par smra ba ni drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth is the claim that one has heard what one has not heard, but has seen, etc.

original: ma rig cing mthong ba la sogs pa la rig par smra ba ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig cing mthong ba la sogs pa la rig par smra ba ni bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh is the claim that one has known what one has not known, but has seen, etc.

original: rnam par ma shes shing mthong ba la sogs pa la rnam par shes par smra ba ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par ma shes shing mthong ba la sogs pa la rnam par shes par smra ba ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth is the claim that one has perceived what one has not perceived, but has seen, etc.

original: mthong ba la sogs pa brjod pa la ma mthong zhing ma brjod do zhes bya ba la sogs par smra ba ni dgu pa'o //🔽mthong ba la sogs pa yid gnyis za ba la ma mthong zhing yid gnyis mi za'o zhes bya ba la sogs par smra ba ni bcu pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs pa brjod pa la ma mthong zhing ma brjod do zhes bya ba la sogs par smra ba ni dgu pa'o // mthong ba la sogs pa yid gnyis za ba la ma mthong zhing yid gnyis mi za'o zhes bya ba la sogs par smra ba ni bcu pa'o //
translated: The ninth is the claim that one has not seen, etc. in regard to what one has seen, etc.🔽The tenth is the claim that one has not doubted in regard to what one has doubted, etc.

original: mthong ba la ma mthong zhing thos pa la sogs par smra ba ni bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba la ma mthong zhing thos pa la sogs par smra ba ni bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: The eleventh is the claim that one has seen what one has heard, etc.

original: thos pa la ma thos shing mthong ba la sogs par smra ba ni bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa la ma thos shing mthong ba la sogs par smra ba ni bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The twelfth is to say that one has not heard or seen, etc.

original: rig pa la ma rig cing thos pa la sogs par smra ba ni bcu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa la ma rig cing thos pa la sogs par smra ba ni bcu gsum pa'o //
translated: The thirteenth is to say that one has not understood, but that one has heard, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa la rnam par ma shes shing mthong ba la sogs par smra ba ni bcu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la rnam par ma shes shing mthong ba la sogs par smra ba ni bcu bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourteenth is to say that one has not seen, etc., but that one has cognized.

original: bzhi pa bcu bzhi po de dag ji lta ba bzhin du de las bzlog par yang bcu bzhi ste spyir bzhi pa nyi shu rtsa brgyad yod do //
analyzed: bzhi pa bcu bzhi po de dag ji lta ba bzhin du de las bzlog par yang bcu bzhi ste spyir bzhi pa nyi shu rtsa brgyad yod do //
translated: There are fourteen that are the opposite of these fourteen. In total, there are twenty-eight.

original: brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed de dang po'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed de dang po'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the words of the first downfall.

original: // / zhar ba zhes bya ba ni mig ya gcig pa'o //🔽'theng po zhes bya ba ni rkang pa 'theng zhing leg leg por 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: // / zhar ba zhes bya ba ni mig ya gcig pa'o // 'theng po zhes bya ba ni rkang pa 'theng zhing leg leg por 'gro ba'o //
translated: One-eyed means having only one eye.🔽Hunched over means walking bent over with a limp.

original: smad 'chal zhes bya ba ni brla'i phyogs rlung gis kun nas nyams par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: smad 'chal zhes bya ba ni brla'i phyogs rlung gis kun nas nyams par gyur pa'o //
translated: Crippled means having a wind disorder in the hips.

original: lag sor rdum po zhes bya ba ni mkhrig ma'i phyogs na mtshan ma tsam gyi lag pa yod cing cung zad kyang byed mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: lag sor rdum po zhes bya ba ni mkhrig ma'i phyogs na mtshan ma tsam gyi lag pa yod cing cung zad kyang byed mi nus pa'o //
translated: The one-handed is the one who has a hand with only one finger.🔽The one-legged is the one who has only one foot.

original: sgur po zhes bya ba ni brang dang sgal tshigs zhom pa'o //
analyzed: sgur po zhes bya ba ni brang dang sgal tshigs zhom pa'o //
translated: The hunchback is the one whose chest and back are caved in.

original: mi'u thung zhes bya ba ni ha cang lus chung bar grags pa'o //
analyzed: mi'u thung zhes bya ba ni ha cang lus chung bar grags pa'o //
translated: The dwarf is the one who is well known for being very small.

original: lba ba can zhes bya ba ni lkog ma la lba ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: lba ba can zhes bya ba ni lkog ma la lba ba yod pa'o //
translated: The goitered is the one who has a goiter on the neck.

original: lkugs pa zhes bya ba ni smra mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: lkugs pa zhes bya ba ni smra mi nus pa'o //
translated: The mute is the one who cannot speak.

original: 'on pa zhes bya ba ni don dang bcas pa'i sgra thos par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: 'on pa zhes bya ba ni don dang bcas pa'i sgra thos par mi nus pa'o //
translated: The deaf is the one who cannot hear meaningful sounds.

original: rten 'phye zhes bya ba ni lag pa gnyis lag rten la brten nas gzugs bzhis 'phye ba'o //
analyzed: rten 'phye zhes bya ba ni lag pa gnyis lag rten la brten nas gzugs bzhis 'phye ba'o //
translated: The cripple is the one who moves about by crawling on one's hands and feet.

original: rkang @131b bam zhes bya ba ni rkang pa la nad kyi rigs rkang bam zhes bya ba ni skrangs pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: rkang @131b bam zhes bya ba ni rkang pa la nad kyi rigs rkang bam zhes bya ba ni skrangs pa yod pa'o //
translated: The one with elephantiasis is the one who has a swelling called elephantiasis on the foot.

original: gyol po zhes bya ba ni rkang yon no //
analyzed: gyol po zhes bya ba ni rkang yon no //
translated: The lame is the one who limps.

original: mchu 'phyangs zhes bya ba ni mchu ring ba'o //
analyzed: mchu 'phyangs zhes bya ba ni mchu ring ba'o //
translated: The one with a pendulous lower lip is the one who has a long lower lip.

original: mgo bo che zhes bya ba ni mgo tshad las 'das par che ba'o //
analyzed: mgo bo che zhes bya ba ni mgo tshad las 'das par che ba'o //
translated: “Large head” means the head is larger than normal.

original: sba gong ba zhes bya ba ni bag 'khums pa'o //
analyzed: sba gong ba zhes bya ba ni bag 'khums pa'o //
translated: “Bent over” means stooped.

original: gzengs dma' ba zhes bya ba ni sbung nyams pa'o //
analyzed: gzengs dma' ba zhes bya ba ni sbung nyams pa'o //
translated: “Slumped” means lacking in dignity.

original: zhum pa zhes bya ba ni sems zhum pa'o //🔽grong gi bya ba zhes bya ba ni khyim gyi bsam pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhum pa zhes bya ba ni sems zhum pa'o // grong gi bya ba zhes bya ba ni khyim gyi bsam pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Depressed” means the mind is depressed.🔽“Village business” means thoughts of home, etc.

original: dgon pa'i bya ba zhes bya ba ni zhing rmo ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dgon pa'i bya ba zhes bya ba ni zhing rmo ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Business in the wilderness” means plowing fields, etc.

original: zhing tshigs zhes bya ba ni zhing gi bar ro //
analyzed: zhing tshigs zhes bya ba ni zhing gi bar ro //
translated: “Between fields” means in the interval between fields.

original: du ba gtul te zhes bya ba ni sbrang ma la sogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ba gtul te zhes bya ba ni sbrang ma la sogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Smoke hole” means for the purpose of keeping out flies, etc.

original: zhing zan zhes bya ba ni lo thog za ba'o //
analyzed: zhing zan zhes bya ba ni lo thog za ba'o //
translated: “Field food” means eating the crops.

original: zhing la spros nas zhes bya ba ni zhing la zhugs nas so //
analyzed: zhing la spros nas zhes bya ba ni zhing la zhugs nas so //
translated: “Having entered the field” means having gone into the field.

original: bag rdzangs zhes bya ba ni bag ma btang ba la dgos pa'i rdzas so //
analyzed: bag rdzangs zhes bya ba ni bag ma btang ba la dgos pa'i rdzas so //
translated: “Allowance” means the necessary goods given without restriction.

original: 'jig rten gnas zhes bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gnas zhes bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten gnas pa'o //
translated: “Worldly dwelling” means the dwelling of the world of the environment.

original: chags nas ring po ma lon par zhes bya ba ni yun mi ring ba'o //
analyzed: chags nas ring po ma lon par zhes bya ba ni yun mi ring ba'o //
translated: Not long after he became attached means not a long time.

original: bden pas gsol ba zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i tshig gis lha la sogs pa gsol ba'o //
analyzed: bden pas gsol ba zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i tshig gis lha la sogs pa gsol ba'o //
translated: He prayed with a true word means he prayed to the gods and so forth with a true word.

original: nub phyogs nas nyi ma shar tam ji na zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten log par gyur tam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nub phyogs nas nyi ma shar tam ji na zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten log par gyur tam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The sun rose in the west, or what? means the world was turned upside down.

original: kham zhes bya ba ni za ba'o //🔽ru 'del zhes bya ba ni rva thad kar 'dug pa'o ;
analyzed: kham zhes bya ba ni za ba'o // ru 'del zhes bya ba ni rva thad kar 'dug pa'o ;
translated: Kha means to eat.🔽Rudra means horns that stick straight up.

original: / khu yu zhes bya ba ni mon ru'o //
analyzed: / khu yu zhes bya ba ni mon ru'o //
translated: Khu means a kind of grain.

original: chang gral zhes bya ba ni chang ba'i khyim mo //
analyzed: chang gral zhes bya ba ni chang ba'i khyim mo //
translated: Chang means a house for drinking beer.

original: lam dma' ba nas zhes bya ba ni dma' ba nas gyen gshor ro //🔽skugs su 'dzugs zhes bya ba ni yal zug 'khras pa'o //
analyzed: lam dma' ba nas zhes bya ba ni dma' ba nas gyen gshor ro // skugs su 'dzugs zhes bya ba ni yal zug 'khras pa'o //
translated: From a low road means from a low place to a high place.🔽To plant a stake means to plant a stake in the ground.

original: bda' ba zhes bya ba ni gdab pa'o //
analyzed: bda' ba zhes bya ba ni gdab pa'o //
translated: To shoot means to shoot an arrow.

original: ming mi snyan pa zhes bya ba ni smad pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ming mi snyan pa zhes bya ba ni smad pa'i ming ngo //
translated: A bad name means a contemptible name.

original: myur ba zhes bya ba ni skyen pa'o //
analyzed: myur ba zhes bya ba ni skyen pa'o //
translated: Quickly means quickly.

original: byams pa'i rgyun zhes bya ba ni gcugs pa'i rgyun nam chung zad do //
analyzed: byams pa'i rgyun zhes bya ba ni gcugs pa'i rgyun nam chung zad do //
translated: The term “stream of affection” means a stream of affection or a little affection.

original: byung ba'i mtha' snga mas ni chung la grub pa bstan to //
analyzed: byung ba'i mtha' snga mas ni chung la grub pa bstan to //
translated: The former limit of arising is taught to be a little.

original: phyi mas ni nor grub pa bstan to //
analyzed: phyi mas ni nor grub pa bstan to //
translated: The latter is taught to be a great deal.

original: mi'i skyon nas smra ba'i bsam pas zhes bya ba ni mi'i yon tan smra bar 'dod pas bshung ba nyid smra'o snyam pa'i bsam pas nyon mongs pa can gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi'i skyon nas smra ba'i bsam pas zhes bya ba ni mi'i yon tan smra bar 'dod pas bshung ba nyid smra'o snyam pa'i bsam pas nyon mongs pa can gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: With the intention of speaking about the faults of a person means with the intention of speaking about the faults of a person while desiring to speak about the good qualities of a person.

original: spa gong ba nyid du gyur kyang rung ma gyur kyang rung zhes bya ba ni skyon nas smra ba nyid nyes pa yin par dgongs so //🔽bram ze dang rgyal rigs la nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de gnyis 'jig rten na khyad par du 'phags @132a * //
analyzed: spa gong ba nyid du gyur kyang rung ma gyur kyang rung zhes bya ba ni skyon nas smra ba nyid nyes pa yin par dgongs so // bram ze dang rgyal rigs la nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de gnyis 'jig rten na khyad par du 'phags @132a * //
translated: Whether or not one is discouraged means that speaking about faults is a fault.

original: pa yin pa'i skyon du mi brtsi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa yin pa'i skyon du mi brtsi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a wrong-doing for a brahmin or a kshatriya means that because those two are considered to be superior in the world, their faults are not considered to be faults.

original: rje'u rigs la sogs pa ni skyon du brtsi ba yin pa'i phyir dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rje'u rigs la sogs pa ni skyon du brtsi ba yin pa'i phyir dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: For a vaishya and so on, it is a basis since their faults are considered to be faults.

original: khab ris mkhan zhes bya ba ni skud ris mkhan no //
analyzed: khab ris mkhan zhes bya ba ni skud ris mkhan no //
translated: A weaver is one who weaves with thread.

original: ba lang srung ba zhes bya ba ni phyugs rdzi'o //
analyzed: ba lang srung ba zhes bya ba ni phyugs rdzi'o //
translated: A cowherd is one who tends cattle.

original: zor ba zhes bya ba ni brda spyad do //
analyzed: zor ba zhes bya ba ni brda spyad do //
translated: A sickle is a tool.

original: phrag gdang zhes bya ba ni phrag pa'i khur ro //🔽be'u ras zhes bya ba ni ras bal gyi snam bu spu can no //🔽dar la zhes bya ba ni ras srab mo'o //
analyzed: phrag gdang zhes bya ba ni phrag pa'i khur ro // be'u ras zhes bya ba ni ras bal gyi snam bu spu can no // dar la zhes bya ba ni ras srab mo'o //
translated: A shoulder-yoke is a load for the shoulders.🔽A woolen blanket is a woolen cloth with nap.🔽Silk is a fine cloth.

original: be'u ras yug chen zhes bya ba ni gos kyi rigs spu can yin no //🔽bar tang zhes bya ba ni gos kyi rigs khra bo sdug pa'o //
analyzed: be'u ras yug chen zhes bya ba ni gos kyi rigs spu can yin no // bar tang zhes bya ba ni gos kyi rigs khra bo sdug pa'o //
translated: A woolen blanket is a cloth of woolen nap.🔽A varṇaka is a beautiful variegated cloth.

original: khri'u tshe zhes bya ba ni thags ma kha dog can no //
analyzed: khri'u tshe zhes bya ba ni thags ma kha dog can no //
translated: A checkered cloth is a cloth of various colors.

original: gor bu zhes bya ba ni khri ru stan no //🔽zhva sgra'o zhes bya ba ni rna ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gor bu zhes bya ba ni khri ru stan no // zhva sgra'o zhes bya ba ni rna ba med pa'o //
translated: A mat is a seat on a couch.🔽A shoe is a foot covering.

original: byis pa'i gos zhes bya ba ni byis pa chung ngu'i gos so //
analyzed: byis pa'i gos zhes bya ba ni byis pa chung ngu'i gos so //
translated: A child’s garment is a garment for a small child.

original: shing nga dpung chad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: shing nga dpung chad ces bya ba ni /
translated: A piece of wood is a piece of wood.

original: shing nga dpung chad du bgo ba dras te drubs pa'o //
analyzed: shing nga dpung chad du bgo ba dras te drubs pa'o //
translated: A piece of wood is a piece of wood that is cut to size and sewn together.

original: dor ma zhes bya ba ni rkang gos so //
analyzed: dor ma zhes bya ba ni rkang gos so //
translated: A pair of trousers is a lower garment.

original: rdu sa mgar zhes bya ba ni khar ba la sogs pa rdu sa mgar ro //
analyzed: rdu sa mgar zhes bya ba ni khar ba la sogs pa rdu sa mgar ro //
translated: A goad is a hook, etc.

original: cha lang zhes bya ba ni rol mo'i sgra 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: cha lang zhes bya ba ni rol mo'i sgra 'byin pa'o //
translated: A cymbal is a musical instrument.

original: skom phor zhes bya ba ni skom gyi snod do //
analyzed: skom phor zhes bya ba ni skom gyi snod do //
translated: A drinking vessel is a vessel for drinking.

original: sga zhes bya ba ni rta zhon pa'i sga'o //
analyzed: sga zhes bya ba ni rta zhon pa'i sga'o //
translated: A saddle is a saddle for a horse.

original: dong pa zhes bya ba ni mda' snod do //🔽kha spu bregs pa zhes bya ba ni smar bcos pa'o //🔽byin pa bcos pa zhes bya ba ni rje ngar gyi spu bcos pa'o //
analyzed: dong pa zhes bya ba ni mda' snod do // kha spu bregs pa zhes bya ba ni smar bcos pa'o // byin pa bcos pa zhes bya ba ni rje ngar gyi spu bcos pa'o //
translated: A quiver is a container for arrows.🔽To shave the beard is to trim the beard.🔽To trim the calves is to trim the hair on the calves.

original: dud gzeb pa zhes bya ba ni gos du bas bdug pa'i gzeb bo //
analyzed: dud gzeb pa zhes bya ba ni gos du bas bdug pa'i gzeb bo //
translated: A smoke-purification tent is a tent for purifying with smoke.

original: pho nyar 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid mngag par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: pho nyar 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid mngag par 'gro ba'o //
translated: To go as a messenger is to go as one's own messenger.

original: mdag pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan bslabs te mdag par btang ba'o //🔽son pa zhes bya ba ni son ma'o //
analyzed: mdag pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan bslabs te mdag par btang ba'o // son pa zhes bya ba ni son ma'o //
translated: To send is to send after training.🔽A pregnant woman is a woman who is pregnant.

original: dru bu zhes bya ba ni phud bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dru bu zhes bya ba ni phud bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: A weaver is one who weaves cloth.

original: brgyad zhing zhes bya ba ni btsem pa'i phyir gos brgyad ba la dgos pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad zhing zhes bya ba ni btsem pa'i phyir gos brgyad ba la dgos pa'o //
translated: The eight garments are for the purpose of covering.

original: tshon zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'o //🔽phur pa zhes bya ba ni bcing ba'i shing ngo //
analyzed: tshon zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'o // phur pa zhes bya ba ni bcing ba'i shing ngo //
translated: The dyes are blue and so on.🔽 The awls are wooden awls for sewing.

original: so mngas zhes bya ba ni cha mnyam par bya ba la dgos pa'i shing so mngas so //🔽sbu ba mo zhes bya ba ni sor mo la bskon pa'i ko ba'o //
analyzed: so mngas zhes bya ba ni cha mnyam par bya ba la dgos pa'i shing so mngas so // sbu ba mo zhes bya ba ni sor mo la bskon pa'i ko ba'o //
translated: The needles are for sewing.🔽 The leather thongs are for the fingers.

original: sbud ru zhes bya ba ni sbud pa'i sna la gdags pa'i sbu bu'o //🔽ti tsha zhes bya ba ni 'og gzhi'i rdo'o //
analyzed: sbud ru zhes bya ba ni sbud pa'i sna la gdags pa'i sbu bu'o // ti tsha zhes bya ba ni 'og gzhi'i rdo'o //
translated: The blowpipes are for blowing the fire.🔽 The stones are for the hearth.

original: tho ba zhes bya ba ni lcags tho'o //
analyzed: tho ba zhes bya ba ni lcags tho'o //
translated: The hammers are for metal work.

original: rgyus pa zhes bya ba ni 'tshem pa'i skud pa'o //
analyzed: rgyus pa zhes bya ba ni 'tshem pa'i skud pa'o //
translated: The threads are for sewing.

original: smyung bu zhes bya ba ni smyung phra mo'o //
analyzed: smyung bu zhes bya ba ni smyung phra mo'o //
translated: The needles are for piercing.

original: 'khor lo'i rten ma zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo'i gzhi ste 'khor gtan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i rten ma zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo'i gzhi ste 'khor gtan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The wheel bases are the bases for the wheels, meaning the wheel tracks.

original: gzhal @132b zhes bya ba ni kha dog byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhal @132b zhes bya ba ni kha dog byed pa'o //
translated: The colors are for coloring.

original: sog le zhes bya ba ni be'u so lta bu'o //
analyzed: sog le zhes bya ba ni be'u so lta bu'o //
translated: A saw is like the teeth of a cow.

original: smyig tho zhes bya ba ni smyig ma rung ba'i shing ngo //
analyzed: smyig tho zhes bya ba ni smyig ma rung ba'i shing ngo //
translated: A bamboo is a bamboo tree.

original: lhang tsher zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i snabs so //
analyzed: lhang tsher zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i snabs so //
translated: A sunshade is the mucus of the sun.

original: ngal skyen pa zhes bya ba ni dub skyen pa'o //
analyzed: ngal skyen pa zhes bya ba ni dub skyen pa'o //
translated: A quick fatigue is a quick tiredness.

original: khyi rdo zhes bya ba'i skrang ba'o //🔽glog pa zhes bya ba ni glog pa skya bo g-ya' ba'o //
analyzed: khyi rdo zhes bya ba'i skrang ba'o // glog pa zhes bya ba ni glog pa skya bo g-ya' ba'o //
translated: A dog’s stone is a swelling.🔽A white leprosy is a white, itchy leprosy.

original: bkres dab zhes bya ba ni bru ba tsha ba'o //
analyzed: bkres dab zhes bya ba ni bru ba tsha ba'o //
translated: A hot hunger is a burning hunger.

original: tshil po che zhes bya ba ni tshil gyis tsho ba'o //
analyzed: tshil po che zhes bya ba ni tshil gyis tsho ba'o //
translated: A fatness is a fatness.

original: khon du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis kun nas mnar sems kyi rgyu stsogs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: khon du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis kun nas mnar sems kyi rgyu stsogs pa byed pa'o //
translated: A resentment is that by which one makes a cause of anger, etc.

original: 'chab pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis kha na ma tho ba 'chab par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'chab pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis kha na ma tho ba 'chab par byed pa'o //
translated: A concealment is that by which one conceals a downfall.

original: ngan dus zhes bya ba ni gang gis bya ba ma yin pa gtong bar mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ngan dus zhes bya ba ni gang gis bya ba ma yin pa gtong bar mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: A bad time is that by which one does not wish to give up what is not to be done.

original: mi'i skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed de gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad par rdzogs so /
analyzed: mi'i skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed de gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad par rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the explanation of the words of the second downfall: speaking of the faults of a human being.

original: // / phra ma zhes bya ba ni 'byed 'dod pa'i sred pa la sogs pa las byung ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: // / phra ma zhes bya ba ni 'byed 'dod pa'i sred pa la sogs pa las byung ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Slander means the desire to divide, and so on.

original: phyi bzhin 'brang zhes bya ba ni phi na lus pa'o //
analyzed: phyi bzhin 'brang zhes bya ba ni phi na lus pa'o //
translated: Following means being left behind.

original: 'khor zhes bya ba ni bsten pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor zhes bya ba ni bsten pa'o //
translated: Attendants means those who serve.

original: rab tu gdung ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par dga' bas rtag tu rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu gdung ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par dga' bas rtag tu rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: Torment means always following with delight.

original: tshang zhes bya ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: tshang zhes bya ba ni gnas so //
translated: Nest means a dwelling.

original: rlung tsha ba dag ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dag go //
analyzed: rlung tsha ba dag ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dag go //
translated: Hot winds means causes of suffering.

original: bya rmyangs zhes bya ba ni lus brkyangs pa'o //
analyzed: bya rmyangs zhes bya ba ni lus brkyangs pa'o //
translated: Yawning means stretching the body.

original: glal zhes bya ba ni kha gdangs pa'o //
analyzed: glal zhes bya ba ni kha gdangs pa'o //
translated: Gaping means opening the mouth.

original: rtsa ba'i seng ge zhes bya ba ni stobs chung ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i seng ge zhes bya ba ni stobs chung ba'o //
translated: Base lion means weak.

original: phug trig ces bya ba ni rkang lag gis sa 'thor ba'o //
analyzed: phug trig ces bya ba ni rkang lag gis sa 'thor ba'o //
translated: Pukkasika means throwing dust with the hands and feet.

original: rngam pa zhes bya ba ni tsham ngam mo //
analyzed: rngam pa zhes bya ba ni tsham ngam mo //
translated: Fierce means threatening.

original: bzang po zhes bya ba ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: bzang po zhes bya ba ni dge ba'o //
translated: Good means virtuous.

original: skye bo ngan pa zhes bya ba ni skye bo dman pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo ngan pa zhes bya ba ni skye bo dman pa'o //
translated: Bad people means inferior people.

original: wa zhes bya ba ni srog chags kyi rigs wa'o //
analyzed: wa zhes bya ba ni srog chags kyi rigs wa'o //
translated: The word “fox” refers to a species of animal.

original: dbyen gyi tshig mi nyan pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir byung ba'i mtha' gnyis pa bka' stsal to //
analyzed: dbyen gyi tshig mi nyan pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir byung ba'i mtha' gnyis pa bka' stsal to //
translated: The second part of the verse was spoken to show the benefits of not listening to divisive speech.

original: phru gu zhes bya ba ni bu'o //
analyzed: phru gu zhes bya ba ni bu'o //
translated: The word “child” refers to a son.

original: lhag rol zhes bya ba ni god ma'o //
analyzed: lhag rol zhes bya ba ni god ma'o //
translated: The word “remainder” refers to a widow.

original: chu zheng zhes bya ba ni lus kyi bong ngo //
analyzed: chu zheng zhes bya ba ni lus kyi bong ngo //
translated: The word “height” refers to the size of the body.

original: rtsa la zhes bya ba ni brtson pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa la zhes bya ba ni brtson pa'o //
translated: The word “root” refers to effort.

original: shugs zhes bya ba ni myur ba'o //
analyzed: shugs zhes bya ba ni myur ba'o //
translated: The word “speed” refers to swiftness.

original: rgol ba zhes bya ba ni gsod pa'o //
analyzed: rgol ba zhes bya ba ni gsod pa'o //
translated: The word “opponent” refers to a killer.

original: mi spang ba zhes bya ba ni mi gtang ba'o //
analyzed: mi spang ba zhes bya ba ni mi gtang ba'o //
translated: The word “not to be abandoned” means not to be given up.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa dag ces bya ba ni 'byed par byed pa'i tshig dag go //
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa dag ces bya ba ni 'byed par byed pa'i tshig dag go //
translated: The words “spoken by others” refer to the words of the one who is creating the division.

original: brtag par bya ba ni dpyad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: brtag par bya ba ni dpyad par bya ba'o //
translated: The word “to be examined” means to be analyzed.

original: skabs zhes bya ba ni glags so //
analyzed: skabs zhes bya ba ni glags so //
translated: The word “opportunity” means a chance.

original: tshol zhes bya ba ni lta ba'o //
analyzed: tshol zhes bya ba ni lta ba'o //
translated: The word “to seek” means to look.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
translated: How does one come to have a downfall in this context?

original: bram ze dang rgyal rigs gnyis ni @133a * //
analyzed: bram ze dang rgyal rigs gnyis ni @133a * //
translated: The brahmin and the kṣatriya

original: smad par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi skyon nas smra ba med pa'i phyir ming dang rigs dang rus brjod pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: smad par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi skyon nas smra ba med pa'i phyir ming dang rigs dang rus brjod pa la nyes byas so //
translated: Because there is no fault in not speaking about what should not be criticized, there is an offense for mentioning name, caste, and clan.

original: rje'u'i rigs la sogs pa skyon nas smra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ming dang rigs dang rus brjod na dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rje'u'i rigs la sogs pa skyon nas smra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ming dang rigs dang rus brjod na dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If one mentions name, caste, and clan, it is the actual basis because it is the fault of speaking about the faults of the lower castes and so on.

original: dmangs rigs la sogs pa bran gyi mthar thug pa thams cad la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dmangs rigs la sogs pa bran gyi mthar thug pa thams cad la yang de bzhin no //
translated: It is the same for all, up to the lowest servants of the lower castes and so on.

original: dge slong la phra ma byed pa'i ltung byed de gsum pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dge slong la phra ma byed pa'i ltung byed de gsum pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the third downfall of divisive speech against a fully ordained monk is complete.

original: // / shad kyis ma byung zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi nang du snying thag pa nas ma smras pa'o //
analyzed: // / shad kyis ma byung zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi nang du snying thag pa nas ma smras pa'o //
translated: Not spoken from the heart in the midst of the Saṅgha means not spoken sincerely.

original: legs par shad kyis ma byang zhes bya ba ni phyogs gcig ma smras pa'o //
analyzed: legs par shad kyis ma byang zhes bya ba ni phyogs gcig ma smras pa'o //
translated: Not spoken well means not spoken in one direction.

original: yang shad kyis byang bar bya zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang shad kyis byang bar bya zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Again, to be spoken means to be spoken to the end.

original: nges par ma brtags zhes bya ba ni rnam par ma dpyad ba'o //
analyzed: nges par ma brtags zhes bya ba ni rnam par ma dpyad ba'o //
translated: “Not definitely examined” means not analyzed.

original: nye bar ma zhi ba zhes bya ba ni ma btang ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar ma zhi ba zhes bya ba ni ma btang ba'o //
translated: “Not pacified” means not given up.

original: yang las kyis skyo sngogs byed ces bya ba ni yang las byas par sngar las byas pa spong bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang las kyis skyo sngogs byed ces bya ba ni yang las byas par sngar las byas pa spong bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Again, one who is weary of activity” means one who has previously done an action and then gives up that action.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la /🔽'thab pa'i phyir rtsod pa dang / mi gdams pa'i phyir rtsod pa dang / ltung ba'i phyir rtsod pa dang / bya ba'i phyir rtsod par 'du shes nas /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la / 'thab pa'i phyir rtsod pa dang / mi gdams pa'i phyir rtsod pa dang / ltung ba'i phyir rtsod pa dang / bya ba'i phyir rtsod par 'du shes nas /
translated: “How does one come to have a downfall?”🔽One who perceives a dispute as a dispute, a non-instruction as a dispute, a downfall as a dispute, and an action as a dispute,

original: shad kyis byang ba la der 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba dang / shad kyis ma byang ba la shad kyis byang bar 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la bzhi pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: shad kyis byang ba la der 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba dang / shad kyis ma byang ba la shad kyis byang bar 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la bzhi pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: and who perceives a settled matter as settled, has doubt, and perceives an unsettled matter as settled, and has doubt, has four sets of four.

original: mi gdams pa'i phyir rtsod pa dang / ltung ba'i phyir rtsod pa dang / byang ba'i phyir rtsod pa dang / yang de bzhin du bzhi pa bzhi ste /🔽spyir bzhi pa bcu drug pa bstan to //
analyzed: mi gdams pa'i phyir rtsod pa dang / ltung ba'i phyir rtsod pa dang / byang ba'i phyir rtsod pa dang / yang de bzhin du bzhi pa bzhi ste / spyir bzhi pa bcu drug pa bstan to //
translated: The quarrel about the purification is the dispute in which the purification is the object of the dispute.🔽The quarrel about the person is the dispute in which the person is the object of the dispute.🔽The quarrel about the teaching is the dispute in which the teaching is the object of the dispute.🔽The quarrel about the meaning is the dispute in which the meaning is the object of the dispute.🔽The quarrel about the letter is the dispute in which the letter is the object of the dispute.🔽The quarrel about the interpretation is the dispute in which the interpretation is the object of the dispute.

original: 'dir rtsod pa la skyo sdogs byed pa nyid nyes pa yin pas ;
analyzed: 'dir rtsod pa la skyo sdogs byed pa nyid nyes pa yin pas ;
translated: The quarrel about the transgression is the dispute in which the transgression is the object of the dispute.🔽The quarrel about the purification is the dispute in which the purification is the object of the dispute.🔽The quarrel about the person is the dispute in which the person is the object of the dispute.🔽The quarrel about the teaching is the dispute in which the teaching is the object of the dispute.🔽The quarrel about the meaning is the dispute in which the meaning is the object of the dispute.🔽The quarrel about the letter is the dispute in which the letter is the object of the dispute.

original: rtsod pa gzhan la gzhan du 'du shes shing yang las kyis skyo sngogs byed pa la yang de bzhin du ltung ba 'dra bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa gzhan la gzhan du 'du shes shing yang las kyis skyo sngogs byed pa la yang de bzhin du ltung ba 'dra bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The quarrel about the interpretation is the dispute in which the interpretation is the object of the dispute.🔽The quarrel about the transgression is the dispute in which the transgression is the object of the dispute.

original: 'dun pa 'bul ba zhes bya ba ni nye bar zhi ba'i las de bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa phul ba'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa 'bul ba zhes bya ba ni nye bar zhi ba'i las de bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa phul ba'o //
translated: The quarrel about the purification is the dispute in which the purification is the object of the dispute.

original: lta ba smra ba zhes bya ba ni kho bo 'di ltar 'dod pa 'di ltar mi 'dod do zhes rang gi bsam pas smras pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba smra ba zhes bya ba ni kho bo 'di ltar 'dod pa 'di ltar mi 'dod do zhes rang gi bsam pas smras pa'o //
translated: The

original: gang zag dang po gsum la ltung byed du 'gyur ba ni rang nyid nye bar zhi bar byas nas yang skyo sngogs byed pa de mi brtan pa la sogs par gyur pa nyid yin pas nyes pa rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag dang po gsum la ltung byed du 'gyur ba ni rang nyid nye bar zhi bar byas nas yang skyo sngogs byed pa de mi brtan pa la sogs par gyur pa nyid yin pas nyes pa rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: For the first three persons, it is a downfall because they have not attained peace themselves, and then they incite others to do so.

original: gang zag tha ma gnyis la nyes byas su 'gyur ba ni gzhan gyis byas @133b pa'i rjes su 'brang ba tsam gyis tho 'tshams ba nyid yin pas kha na ma tho ba na smad do //
analyzed: gang zag tha ma gnyis la nyes byas su 'gyur ba ni gzhan gyis byas @133b pa'i rjes su 'brang ba tsam gyis tho 'tshams ba nyid yin pas kha na ma tho ba na smad do //
translated: For the last two persons, it is a minor offense because they are just following what others have done, and they are censured for the wrongdoing.

original: skyo sngogs byed pa'i ltung ba byed de bzhi pa'i tshig rnam par bshad par rdzogs so /
analyzed: skyo sngogs byed pa'i ltung ba byed de bzhi pa'i tshig rnam par bshad par rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the explanation of the fourth root downfall.

original: // / sha mtshan gyi rig pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma'i bstan bcos gang gis lus kyi phyogs na yod pa'i sha rmen la sogs pa sha mtshan du gyur pa'i rnam par gyur pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: // / sha mtshan gyi rig pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma'i bstan bcos gang gis lus kyi phyogs na yod pa'i sha rmen la sogs pa sha mtshan du gyur pa'i rnam par gyur pa shes pa'o //
translated: The “science of physical signs” is a treatise on signs by which one can know the physical changes that occur in the body, such as moles and so on.

original: ri bong mo mdas phog pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar de mda'i shugs kyis shin tu gtum par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ri bong mo mdas phog pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar de mda'i shugs kyis shin tu gtum par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Rabbit-struck” means that it is like an arrow shot by a rabbit, because it is very fierce due to the force of the arrow.

original: sha rmen zhes bya ba ni sbrang bu'i rnam pa lta bu'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: sha rmen zhes bya ba ni sbrang bu'i rnam pa lta bu'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: “Wart” means a sign like a bee.

original: mdzer bu zhes bya ba ni sha 'bur ba'o //
analyzed: mdzer bu zhes bya ba ni sha 'bur ba'o //
translated: “Mole” means a fleshy lump.

original: sme ba zhes bya ba ni khrag las gyur pa'i mtshan ma nag po'o //
analyzed: sme ba zhes bya ba ni khrag las gyur pa'i mtshan ma nag po'o //
translated: “Birthmark” means a black sign that comes from blood.

original: sme ba dmar po zhes bya ba ni khrag las gyur pa'i mtshan ma ti la gyi rnam pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sme ba dmar po zhes bya ba ni khrag las gyur pa'i mtshan ma ti la gyi rnam pa lta bu'o //
translated: “Red birthmark” means a sign that comes from blood, like the shape of a tilaka.

original: spu 'khyil pa zhes bya ba ni gtsug go //
analyzed: spu 'khyil pa zhes bya ba ni gtsug go //
translated: “Hairy” means a topknot.

original: seg gdar zhes bya ba ni lcags bdar ba'i gar bu rtsub po'o //
analyzed: seg gdar zhes bya ba ni lcags bdar ba'i gar bu rtsub po'o //
translated: “Scar” means a rough scar from a metal saw.

original: des pa zhes bya ba ni bgrungs pa'o //
analyzed: des pa zhes bya ba ni bgrungs pa'o //
translated: “Smooth” means a scar that is not rough.

original: dpal be'u zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i rtse mo lta bu'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: dpal be'u zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i rtse mo lta bu'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: “Svastika” means a sign like the point of a vajra.

original: bkra shis zhes bya ba ni zla gam lta bu'i mtshan ma kha bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bkra shis zhes bya ba ni zla gam lta bu'i mtshan ma kha bzhi pa'o //
translated: “Auspicious” means a sign like a four-sided moon.

original: g-yung drung zhes bya ba ni ri mo 'khyil pa'o //
analyzed: g-yung drung zhes bya ba ni ri mo 'khyil pa'o //
translated: “Swastika” means a coiled line.

original: smra bar byed dam zhes bya ba ni thab mo rgol lam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: smra bar byed dam zhes bya ba ni thab mo rgol lam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase to speak means to argue.

original: ji tsam 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni ci dga' ba'o //
analyzed: ji tsam 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni ci dga' ba'o //
translated: The phrase to the extent that one wishes means as much as one wants.

original: gnas skabs de 'dra zhes bya ba ni bstan pa la zhe 'gras pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnas skabs de 'dra zhes bya ba ni bstan pa la zhe 'gras pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase in such circumstances means when one is hostile to the teaching.

original: rig pa'i skyes pa zhes bya ba ni skad brda sprad pa'i skyes ba'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i skyes pa zhes bya ba ni skad brda sprad pa'i skyes ba'o //
translated: The phrase a person who is learned means a person who is skilled in the use of language.

original: steng gi khang thog la sogs pa gnas tha dad par bstan pa'i tshig tha dad pa'i phyir snga mar bstan pa'i phyir ma dang tha dad par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: steng gi khang thog la sogs pa gnas tha dad par bstan pa'i tshig tha dad pa'i phyir snga mar bstan pa'i phyir ma dang tha dad par shes par bya'o //
translated: The phrase in different places means in different rooms, such as the upper and lower floors of a building, etc., because the words of the teaching are different in each place.

original: dris pa zhes bya ba ni don gyi the tshom gcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dris pa zhes bya ba ni don gyi the tshom gcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase to ask questions means to resolve doubts about the meaning of the teaching.

original: slob gnyer gsod ba zhes bya ba ni sngar phog pa'o //
analyzed: slob gnyer gsod ba zhes bya ba ni sngar phog pa'o //
translated: The phrase to study means to learn.

original: kha ton zhu ba zhes bya ba ni kha ton 'don pa'o //
analyzed: kha ton zhu ba zhes bya ba ni kha ton 'don pa'o //
translated: The phrase to recite means to recite aloud.

original: dmigs kyis 'dri ba zhes bya ba ni tshig la the tshom za ba'i gnas rnam par nges par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs kyis 'dri ba zhes bya ba ni tshig la the tshom za ba'i gnas rnam par nges par byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase to ask for clarification means to resolve doubts about the words of the teaching.

original: bkag pa zhes bya ba ni spangs pa'o //
analyzed: bkag pa zhes bya ba ni spangs pa'o //
translated: The phrase to prohibit means to reject.

original: ldab ldib can zhes bya ba ni lce 'khrul ba'o //
analyzed: ldab ldib can zhes bya ba ni lce 'khrul ba'o //
translated: “Stammering” means faltering speech.

original: smra ba nyung ba zhes bya ba ni nyung du smra ba'o //
analyzed: smra ba nyung ba zhes bya ba ni nyung du smra ba'o //
translated: “Speaking little” means speaking little.

original: ston pa'i ltung byed lnga pa'i tshig rnam par bshad par rdzogs so /
analyzed: ston pa'i ltung byed lnga pa'i tshig rnam par bshad par rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the fifth downfall in the training of the master of teachings is complete.

original: // / tshig gis zhes bya ba ni tshig dang tshig gis so //
analyzed: // / tshig gis zhes bya ba ni tshig dang tshig gis so //
translated: “With words” means with words and phrases.

original: kun dga'i mthar zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi phyogs gcig tu'o //
analyzed: kun dga'i mthar zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi phyogs gcig tu'o //
translated: “In the presence of the assembly” means in one part of the monastery.

original: bram ze'i gsang tshig ces bya ba ni rig byed kyi sngags so//
analyzed: bram ze'i gsang tshig ces bya ba ni rig byed kyi sngags so//
translated: “Brahmin spells” means the mantras of the Vedas.

original: @134a * // 'don pa zhes bya ba ni klog pa'o //
analyzed: @134a * // 'don pa zhes bya ba ni klog pa'o //
translated: “Reciting” means reading.

original: rtsis mkhan zhes bya ba ni skar mkhan no //
analyzed: rtsis mkhan zhes bya ba ni skar mkhan no //
translated: “Astrologers” means astrologers.

original: tshig mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni tshig dus gcig tu 'don pa'o //
analyzed: tshig mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni tshig dus gcig tu 'don pa'o //
translated: “The same words” means the same words spoken at the same time.

original: tshig snga ma zhes bya ba ni tshig sngan ma tshogs su smra ba'o //
analyzed: tshig snga ma zhes bya ba ni tshig sngan ma tshogs su smra ba'o //
translated: “The previous words” means the previous words spoken in the assembly.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: “How does one commit a downfall in this case?”

original: rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa la bzhi pa gnyis so //
analyzed: rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa la bzhi pa gnyis so //
translated: “In the case of one who is not fully ordained, two of the four.”

original: rdzogs par bsnyen pa la yang bzhi pa gnyis so //🔽ldab ldib can zhes bya ba ni slob dpon no //
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen pa la yang bzhi pa gnyis so // ldab ldib can zhes bya ba ni slob dpon no //
translated: There are also two four-line verses for the full ordination.🔽The one who is stammering is the preceptor.🔽The one who is quick-witted is the interviewer.🔽The one who is slow is the novice.

original: sgra myur ba zhes bya ba ni nye gnas so //🔽rjes su bsgrags te zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa dang sngar ma 'don cing ces bsgo ste'o //
analyzed: sgra myur ba zhes bya ba ni nye gnas so // rjes su bsgrags te zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa dang sngar ma 'don cing ces bsgo ste'o //
translated: The one who is fast is the student.🔽The one who is slow is the teacher.🔽The one who is fast is the pupil.🔽The one who is slow is the preceptor.

original: 'don pa'i ltung byed de drug pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'don pa'i ltung byed de drug pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The one who is fast is the interviewer.🔽The one who is slow is the monk who is equal or superior.🔽The one who is fast is the monk who is inferior.🔽The one who is slow is the monk who is equal or superior.

original: // / lam gol bar rgal ba zhes bya ba ni ma bslabs pa'o //🔽lag pas bya ba min pa byas te zhes bya ba ni chang ba 'chang ba la sogs pa nye bar bstan te'o //
analyzed: // / lam gol bar rgal ba zhes bya ba ni ma bslabs pa'o // lag pas bya ba min pa byas te zhes bya ba ni chang ba 'chang ba la sogs pa nye bar bstan te'o //
translated: The one who is fast is the monk who is inferior.🔽The one who is slow is the monk who is equal or superior.🔽The one who is fast is the monk who is inferior.🔽The one who is slow is the monk who is equal or superior.🔽The one who is fast is the monk who is inferior.🔽The one who is slow is the monk who is equal or superior.🔽The one who is fast is the monk who is inferior.🔽The one who is slow is the monk who is equal or superior.🔽The one who is fast is the monk who is inferior.🔽The one who is slow is the monk who is equal or superior.🔽The one who is fast is the monk who is inferior.🔽The one who is slow is the monk who is equal or superior.

original: nyes pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa las 'das pa'o //
translated: The one who is fast is the monk who is inferior.🔽The one who is slow is the monk who is equal or superior.

original: skyon zhes bya ba ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: skyon zhes bya ba ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba las 'das pa'o //
translated: The one who is fast is the monk who is inferior.🔽The one who is slow is the monk who is equal or superior.

original: kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa'o //
translated: The one who is fast is the monk who is inferior.🔽The one who is slow is the monk who is equal or superior.

original: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni 'khral 'khrul med pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni 'khral 'khrul med pa'o //
translated: The one who is fast is the monk who is inferior.

original: gsungs zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase it is said means it is taught.🔽The phrase they will be known as lacking faith means that they will experience a lack of interest in the teaching.

original: ma dad par rig par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni bstan pa la mi phyogs pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma dad par rig par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni bstan pa la mi phyogs pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase they will be known as householders means that they will be known as householders who are not true ascetics.🔽The phrase they will be known as monks means that they will be known as monks who are not true ascetics.🔽The phrase they will be known as householders means that they will be known as householders who are not true ascetics.🔽The phrase they will be known as monks means that they will be known as monks who are not true ascetics.

original: khyim rnams su so sor gro par byed pa zhes bya ba ni de'i dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa sgrogs par byed pa ste /🔽bstan pa thams cad la ma dad pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //🔽khyim sun par byed pa zhes bya ba ni khyim bdag go //
analyzed: khyim rnams su so sor gro par byed pa zhes bya ba ni de'i dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa sgrogs par byed pa ste / bstan pa thams cad la ma dad pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro // khyim sun par byed pa zhes bya ba ni khyim bdag go //
translated: The phrase they will be known as householders means that they will be known as householders who are not true ascetics.🔽The phrase they will be known as monks means that they will be known as monks who are not true ascetics.🔽The phrase they will be known as householders means that they will be known as householders who are not true ascetics.🔽The phrase they will be known as monks means that they will be known as monks who are not true ascetics.

original: gnas sun par byed pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba dag go //🔽'khor lo mi bzad pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: gnas sun par byed pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba dag go // 'khor lo mi bzad pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'khrug pa'o //
translated: The phrase they will be known as householders means that they will be known as householders who are not true ascetics.🔽The phrase they will be known as monks means that they will be known as monks who are not true ascetics.🔽The phrase they will be known as householders means that they will be known as householders who are not true ascetics.🔽The phrase they will be known as monks means that they will be known as monks who are not true ascetics.🔽The phrase they will be known as householders means that they will be known as householders who are not true ascetics.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste'o //
translated: The phrase they will be known as monks means that they will be known as monks who are not true ascetics.

original: shin te ma zhes bya ba ni mthu chung ba ste mi 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: shin te ma zhes bya ba ni mthu chung ba ste mi 'phel ba'o //
translated: The phrase they will be known as householders means that they will be known as householders who are not true ascetics.🔽The phrase they will be known as monks means that they will be known as monks who are not true ascetics.

original: chung za ba zhes bya ba ni skam pa'o //
analyzed: chung za ba zhes bya ba ni skam pa'o //
translated: The phrase they will be known as householders means that they will be known as householders who are

original: tshul ma yin pas ma rung bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin pas drungs phyung ba'o //
analyzed: tshul ma yin pas ma rung bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin pas drungs phyung ba'o //
translated: “It is ruined by improper conduct” means it is destroyed by what is not right.

original: dmar po zhes bya ba ni nad kyi rigs dmar breng breng pa'o //
analyzed: dmar po zhes bya ba ni nad kyi rigs dmar breng breng pa'o //
translated: “Red” means the color of a rash.

original: bstan pa'i tshong ma 'dzin cig ces bya ba ni bstan pa yang 'dra ba zhig yin no snyam du ma sems shig pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i tshong ma 'dzin cig ces bya ba ni bstan pa yang 'dra ba zhig yin no snyam du ma sems shig pa'o //
translated: “Do not hold on to the teaching” means do not think that the teaching is the same.

original: yos tshig pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni thal bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yos tshig pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni thal bar gyur pa'o //
translated: “Like a burnt rice cake” means like ashes.

original: skyer mi rung ba'i chos can zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi myu gu mi skye ba'o//
analyzed: skyer mi rung ba'i chos can zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi myu gu mi skye ba'o//
translated: “It is not suitable for growth” means the sprout of the noble path does not grow.

original: @134b sun 'byin zhes bya ba ni dgong tor du 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: @134b sun 'byin zhes bya ba ni dgong tor du 'byin pa'o //
translated: “It is destroyed” means it is destroyed by criticism.

original: 'bru mar gyi snod ces bya ba ni 'bru mar blugs pa'i snod do //
analyzed: 'bru mar gyi snod ces bya ba ni 'bru mar blugs pa'i snod do //
translated: “An oil vessel” means a vessel for pouring oil.

original: gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las zhes bya ba ni las brjod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las zhes bya ba ni las brjod pa med pa'o //
translated: “A legal procedure consisting only of the announcement” means a procedure without the motion.

original: so sor rig pa'i khyim dag ces bya ba ni de'i skyon so sor rig cing ma dad par gyur ba'i khyim dag go //
analyzed: so sor rig pa'i khyim dag ces bya ba ni de'i skyon so sor rig cing ma dad par gyur ba'i khyim dag go //
translated: “The families that know about it” means the families that know about its faults and have lost their faith.

original: so sor ma rig pa'i khyim dag ces bya ba ni de'i skyon so sor ma rig cing ma dad par ma gyur pa'i khyim dag go //
analyzed: so sor ma rig pa'i khyim dag ces bya ba ni de'i skyon so sor ma rig cing ma dad par ma gyur pa'i khyim dag go //
translated: The phrase in a household that does not know means in a household that does not know and does not believe in the faults of that.

original: dge 'dun gyis gnang ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis spang ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gnang ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis spang ba byas pa'o //
translated: The phrase with the approval of the community means with the approval of the community.

original: de lta ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'du shes dang yid gnyis kyis dngos gzhir gzhag pa gnyis dang nyes byas su gzhag pa gnyis te bzhi po bstan to //
analyzed: de lta ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'du shes dang yid gnyis kyis dngos gzhir gzhag pa gnyis dang nyes byas su gzhag pa gnyis te bzhi po bstan to //
translated: The phrase how is there a downfall? refers to the four cases that were taught: the two that are established as the basis and the two that are established as misdeeds, by way of the ideas and doubts.

original: de dag kyang dge 'dun gyis gnang ba med par de ltar 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang dge 'dun gyis gnang ba med par de ltar 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: And it should be understood that those are the cases when there is no approval of the community.

original: gnas ngan len brjod pa'i ltung byed de bdun pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gnas ngan len brjod pa'i ltung byed de bdun pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the words of the seventh downfall, the downfall of accusing one of evil views, is finished.

original: // / gdos bu dang pho long gi sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni gnyid bsang ba'i phyir rna ba la gdos bu gdags pa dang / pho long tha gus gdags pa 'phang ba'o //
analyzed: // / gdos bu dang pho long gi sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni gnyid bsang ba'i phyir rna ba la gdos bu gdags pa dang / pho long tha gus gdags pa 'phang ba'o //
translated: The phrase the application of a stick and a water bag means the application of a stick to the ear and the application of a water bag with a rope, in order to wake up from sleep.

original: gcig gis gcig gi yang dag pa'i yon tan bsgrag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi sems med pa'i 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gcig gis gcig gi yang dag pa'i yon tan bsgrag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi sems med pa'i 'gal ba med do //
translated: The phrase one should proclaim the true virtues of the other does not contradict the absence of afflicted mind.

original: yang dag par brjod na ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni yang dag par yin du zin kyang gdul ba ma yin pa'i sems can rnams yid mi ches pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa yod pas dgag pa mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag par brjod na ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni yang dag par yin du zin kyang gdul ba ma yin pa'i sems can rnams yid mi ches pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa yod pas dgag pa mdzad do //
translated: The phrase if one speaks falsely, there is an offense means that even if it is true, it is prohibited because there is the fault of lack of confidence in sentient beings who are not to be disciplined.

original: mi'i mchog bla ma brjod pa'i ltung byed de brgyad pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: mi'i mchog bla ma brjod pa'i ltung byed de brgyad pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The eighth downfall in the training of the monks is concluded.

original: // / mi g-yo bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: // / mi g-yo bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase one should not be unsteady means one should not be unstable.

original: gcig gi zhes bya ba ni gcig gi phyogs na gnas na ste btsun pa gyad bu nor gyi phyogs shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gcig gi zhes bya ba ni gcig gi phyogs na gnas na ste btsun pa gyad bu nor gyi phyogs shes par bya'o //
translated: The phrase of one means of one side, and one should understand the side of the venerable Purna.

original: bshes ngor byas te zhes bya ba ni gang gi bshes gang yin pa'i gang zag de la stobs par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bshes ngor byas te zhes bya ba ni gang gi bshes gang yin pa'i gang zag de la stobs par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase through favoritism means that one should not give to a person who is a friend of the person who is a friend.

original: legs par rung bar byas nas zhes bya ba ni dad pa phul ba ste legs par rjes su gnang ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par rung bar byas nas zhes bya ba ni dad pa phul ba ste legs par rjes su gnang ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having made it suitable means having offered it with faith, because it has been properly approved.

original: gos gyi rnyed pa yin par dgongs so zhes bya ba ni de dkon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gos gyi rnyed pa yin par dgongs so zhes bya ba ni de dkon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of “having obtained clothing” is that it is rare.

original: dge 'dun gyi nang du zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi yul la ste dge 'dun la brten nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang du zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi yul la ste dge 'dun la brten nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the midst of the Saṅgha means in the Saṅgha’s domain. The meaning is that it is based on the Saṅgha.

original: 'di ni slu bar byed pa'i phyir dgag pa mdzad do //🔽skur ba 'debs @135a * //
analyzed: 'di ni slu bar byed pa'i phyir dgag pa mdzad do // skur ba 'debs @135a * //
translated: This is prohibited because it is deceptive.

original: pa'i ltung byed de dgu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: pa'i ltung byed de dgu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The ninth downfall is finished.

original: // / zla ba phyed phyed cing zhes bya ba ni zla ba ngo phyed phyed cing ngo //
analyzed: // / zla ba phyed phyed cing zhes bya ba ni zla ba ngo phyed phyed cing ngo //
translated: Every half month means every half month.

original: 'khod do zhes bya ba ni sdod pa'o //
analyzed: 'khod do zhes bya ba ni sdod pa'o //
translated: They stay means they remain.

original: gzhi nges pa zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba'i rgyu khu ba 'byin pa la sogs pa'i gzhi nges pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi nges pa zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba'i rgyu khu ba 'byin pa la sogs pa'i gzhi nges pa yod pa'o //
translated: The basis is definite means the basis of the cause of the training precept, such as emitting semen, is definite.

original: gang zag pa zhes bya ba ni tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la sogs pa byed pa po nges pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag pa zhes bya ba ni tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la sogs pa byed pa po nges pa yod pa'o //
translated: The one called “defilement” is the one who is the definite agent, such as the venerable Udāyin.

original: rma sos pa sos pa dag ci'i phyir 'dral bar byed ces bya ba ni nyes pa tshang zin pa dag ci'i phyir gleng bar byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: rma sos pa sos pa dag ci'i phyir 'dral bar byed ces bya ba ni nyes pa tshang zin pa dag ci'i phyir gleng bar byed ces bya'o //
translated: Why do you tear open the healed and healed wounds? means why do you bring up the already-completed faults?

original: bdag nyid kyi don med par smras nas gzhan gyi don med pa bstan pa'i phyir gang dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi don med par smras nas gzhan gyi don med pa bstan pa'i phyir gang dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Having spoken of the useless for oneself, in order to teach the useless for others, he says “Those who, etc.”

original: phran tshegs zhes bya ba phra ba'o //
analyzed: phran tshegs zhes bya ba phra ba'o //
translated: The so-called “minor” is the subtle.

original: rab tu phar ba zhes bya ba ni ches phra ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu phar ba zhes bya ba ni ches phra ba'o //
translated: The so-called “very minor” is the extremely subtle.

original: gnod pa zhes bya ba ni gdung ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa zhes bya ba ni gdung ba'o //
translated: The so-called “harm” is the torment.

original: 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dngos po'o /
analyzed: 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dngos po'o /
translated: The so-called “change” is the causal state.

original: bslab pa khyad du gsod na zhes bya ba ni bslab pa rnams dang mi mthun par gnye'u rengs byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bslab pa khyad du gsod na zhes bya ba ni bslab pa rnams dang mi mthun par gnye'u rengs byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If one despises the training, means if one is not in accord with the trainings, one is called “one who acts like a cripple.”

original: gdung ba dang kun du gdung ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi yongs su gdung ba chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po'o //
analyzed: gdung ba dang kun du gdung ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi yongs su gdung ba chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po'o //
translated: Agitation and anxiety are lesser, middling, and greater physical anxiety.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni khyim na gnas par 'dod pa'o //🔽mngon par mi dga' ba zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung bas yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni khyim na gnas par 'dod pa'o // mngon par mi dga' ba zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung bas yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: Desire is the desire to live in a household.🔽Discontent is the unhappiness of one who has gone forth.

original: rnam par 'byam pa zhes bya ba ni phyir 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'byam pa zhes bya ba ni phyir 'bab pa'o //
translated: Dissatisfaction is the turning back of one who has gone forth.

original: gleng gzhi dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhung phyi mo'i rnam pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gleng gzhi dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhung phyi mo'i rnam pa dag yin no //
translated: The bases and so on are the later parts of the text.

original: 'dul ba'i ma mo dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dul ba'i ma mo dag ces bya ba la /
translated: The Vinaya texts

original: 'dul ba smos pa ni chos mngon pa'i ma mo dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dul ba smos pa ni chos mngon pa'i ma mo dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of the Vinaya is to exclude the Abhidharma texts.

original: 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i mdo dag ces bya ba ni 'dul ba'i don dang ldan pa'i mdo sde dag ste dmar po'i mdo sde la sogs pa dag go ;
analyzed: 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i mdo dag ces bya ba ni 'dul ba'i don dang ldan pa'i mdo sde dag ste dmar po'i mdo sde la sogs pa dag go ;
translated: The sutras that are related to the Vinaya are those sutras that are related to the meaning of the Vinaya, such as the Red Sutra and so on.

original: / de las gzhan pa'i mdo sde dag ces bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bstan pa la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: / de las gzhan pa'i mdo sde dag ces bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bstan pa la sogs pa dag go //
translated: The other sutras are those that teach the noble truths and so on.

original: 'di ni dge slong gi dngos po la ma gus pa'i phyir bca' ba mdzad do //
analyzed: 'di ni dge slong gi dngos po la ma gus pa'i phyir bca' ba mdzad do //
translated: This rule was laid down because of disrespect for the status of a monk.🔽The tenth chapter on the downfall of despising the training is finished.🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk

original: bslab pa khyad du gsod pa'i ltung byed de bcu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: bslab pa khyad du gsod pa'i ltung byed de bcu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk

original: // / nga sngon shing mkhan zhes bya ba ni sngon shing mkhan gyi rigs yin pa'o //🔽gnas zhes bya ba ni khyim ste 'dug pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // / nga sngon shing mkhan zhes bya ba ni sngon shing mkhan gyi rigs yin pa'o // gnas zhes bya ba ni khyim ste 'dug pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk

original: gling zhes bya ba yang grang ba la sogs pa yongs su skyob pa'i phyir ro //🔽skyob pa zhes bya ba ni yang bde ba dang bskyed pa'i phyir ro //🔽skyabs zhes bya ba yang gzhan dag gis zil @135b gyis mi gnon pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: gling zhes bya ba yang grang ba la sogs pa yongs su skyob pa'i phyir ro // skyob pa zhes bya ba ni yang bde ba dang bskyed pa'i phyir ro // skyabs zhes bya ba yang gzhan dag gis zil @135b gyis mi gnon pa'i phyir ro//
translated: The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk🔽The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk

original: dpung gnyen zhes bya ba ni yang thag ring por song ba yang 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpung gnyen zhes bya ba ni yang thag ring por song ba yang 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The chapter on the downfall of not giving up the wrong views of a fellow monk

original: gnas mal zhes bya ba yang lus kyi rgyun gyis der gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas mal zhes bya ba yang lus kyi rgyun gyis der gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The chapter on

original: gzhi zhes bya ba yang 'dug pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi zhes bya ba yang 'dug pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term basis is also a place of rest.

original: rten zhes bya ba yang gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten zhes bya ba yang gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term support is also a place of rest for the basis.

original: rnam grangs kyi tshig de dag ni phan yon bstan pa'i phyir smos so //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi tshig de dag ni phan yon bstan pa'i phyir smos so //
translated: These synonyms are mentioned in order to show the benefits.

original: bu zhes bya ba ni gzhon nu'o //
analyzed: bu zhes bya ba ni gzhon nu'o //
translated: The term son refers to a youth.

original: phru gu zhes bya ba ni byis pa'o //
analyzed: phru gu zhes bya ba ni byis pa'o //
translated: The term child refers to an infant.

original: lha de ni sa la rgyu ba'i gnod sbyin yin te grang ba'i gnod pa la sogs pas tshugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha de ni sa la rgyu ba'i gnod sbyin yin te grang ba'i gnod pa la sogs pas tshugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term god refers to a yakṣa who moves on the earth, because he is affected by the harm of cold, etc.

original: kye ma zhes bya ba ni zhum pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: kye ma zhes bya ba ni zhum pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The term alas is a word of dejection.

original: shing med pas zhes bya ba ni shing mi bdog pa'o //
analyzed: shing med pas zhes bya ba ni shing mi bdog pa'o //
translated: The term without trees means without trees.

original: 'gyur ba rten zhes bya ba ni khrag 'byung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba rten zhes bya ba ni khrag 'byung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term change of support refers to the occurrence of blood, etc.

original: re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' ba ni mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni rang gi bcad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' ba ni mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni rang gi bcad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Vinaya does not yet lay down the bases of training for the śrāvakas means that there is no individual prohibition.

original: sa bon gyi tshogs zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi yo byad do //
analyzed: sa bon gyi tshogs zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi yo byad do //
translated: The term collection of seeds means the requisites of seeds.

original: 'byung po'i gnas zhes bya ba ni 'byung po gnas shing ljon pa la sogs pa'i shing skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung po'i gnas zhes bya ba ni 'byung po gnas shing ljon pa la sogs pa'i shing skye ba'o //
translated: The “abode of spirits” is a tree in which spirits dwell and which is withered, etc.

original: sa bon dang skye ba nyid ni tha mi dad pa'i phyir ltung ba gcig tu bca' ba mdzad do //
analyzed: sa bon dang skye ba nyid ni tha mi dad pa'i phyir ltung ba gcig tu bca' ba mdzad do //
translated: Because the seed and the sprout are not different, the offense is considered to be one.

original: sdong bu zhes bya ba ni bar gyi cha'o //
analyzed: sdong bu zhes bya ba ni bar gyi cha'o //
translated: The “stalk” is the middle part.

original: tho gu zhes bya ba ni rtse mo'o //
analyzed: tho gu zhes bya ba ni rtse mo'o //
translated: The “top” is the tip.

original: 'gas pa zhes bya ba ni tshal ba'o //
analyzed: 'gas pa zhes bya ba ni tshal ba'o //
translated: “Splitting” is the breaking of the stalk.

original: sa bon zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: sa bon zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The “seed” is the fruit.

original: aardza ka zhes bya ba ni ldum bu ku te ra'o //
analyzed: aardza ka zhes bya ba ni ldum bu ku te ra'o //
translated: The “arjuna” is the kutaja tree.

original: sa rdza zhes bya ni ldum bu ko re tha ga'o //
analyzed: sa rdza zhes bya ni ldum bu ko re tha ga'o //
translated: The “sarja” is the korata tree.

original: pa ni rdza ka zhes bya ba ni ldum bu ku re te ra'i rnam pa lta bu dri zhim pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni rdza ka zhes bya ba ni ldum bu ku re te ra'i rnam pa lta bu dri zhim pa'o //
translated: The “panjara” is a fragrant creeper like the kuruvinda.

original: bu srin zhes bya ba ni ldum bu bha ya na ka'o //
analyzed: bu srin zhes bya ba ni ldum bu bha ya na ka'o //
translated: The “pūti” is the bhayānaka creeper.

original: dzambhi ra zhes bya ba ni ldum bu dum bu ru'o //
analyzed: dzambhi ra zhes bya ba ni ldum bu dum bu ru'o //
translated: The “jamvira” is the dhumbura creeper.

original: 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni rtsa thon du 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni rtsa thon du 'byin pa'o //
translated: “To pull out” means to pull out by the root.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: How does one commit a downfall in regard to these?

original: rtsa ba'i sa bon dang / sdong bu'i sa bon dang / tho gu'i sa bon dang / 'gas pa'i sa bon dang / sa bon gyi sa bon rnam pa lnga la re re la yang bzhi pa lnga lnga ste spyir bzhi pa nyid shu rtsa lnga bstan to //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sa bon dang / sdong bu'i sa bon dang / tho gu'i sa bon dang / 'gas pa'i sa bon dang / sa bon gyi sa bon rnam pa lnga la re re la yang bzhi pa lnga lnga ste spyir bzhi pa nyid shu rtsa lnga bstan to //
translated: The five types of seeds are: root seeds, stem seeds, joint seeds, cutting seeds, and seed seeds. Each of these has five parts, making twenty-five downfalls in all.

original: nyams pa zhes bya ba ni brang pa'i phyogs gcig nyams so//
analyzed: nyams pa zhes bya ba ni brang pa'i phyogs gcig nyams so//
translated: “ Damaged” means that one part of the seed is damaged.

original: rnam par nyams pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid thams cad nyams pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par nyams pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid thams cad nyams pa'o //
translated: “ Destroyed” means that the whole seed is destroyed.

original: ltung byed lngar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltung byed lngar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ One commits five offenses requiring confession” means that there are five offenses because of the different objects.

original: tsha sgo zhes bya ba ni sa tshos pa 'bus ba'o //
analyzed: tsha sgo zhes bya ba ni sa tshos pa 'bus ba'o //
translated: “ A crack” means that the seed is cracked by frost.

original: nyug pa'i bsam pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni gzhig pa'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyug pa'i bsam pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni gzhig pa'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ There is no offense if one has the intention to replant” means that there is no offense if one has no intention to destroy.

original: sha bal zhes bya ba ni sa dreg ste sa gzhi @136a * //
analyzed: sha bal zhes bya ba ni sa dreg ste sa gzhi @136a * //
translated: “ A covering of earth” means a covering of dirt.

original: btsog pa'i steng sngo ba dang sha bal la sogs pa dag go //🔽rtsa rgyun zhes bya ba ni rtsa'i rgyun phra mo'o //🔽shun pa zhes bya ba ni phyi shun rnying pa'o //
