analyzed: btsog pa'i steng sngo ba dang sha bal la sogs pa dag go // rtsa rgyun zhes bya ba ni rtsa'i rgyun phra mo'o // shun pa zhes bya ba ni phyi shun rnying pa'o //
translated: The “outer skin” is the outer bark.

original: phri zhes bya ba ni nang phri sra ba'o //
analyzed: phri zhes bya ba ni nang phri sra ba'o //
translated: The “inner skin” is the inner bark.

original: snying po zhes bya ba ni shing dang 'brel pa'i rgyan no //
analyzed: snying po zhes bya ba ni shing dang 'brel pa'i rgyan no //
translated: The “pith” is the core of the tree.

original: nya lcibs zhes bya ba ni chu na 'phyo ba'i rdzas so //
analyzed: nya lcibs zhes bya ba ni chu na 'phyo ba'i rdzas so //
translated: The “fish egg” is a substance that floats in water.

original: nya tshang zhes bya ba ni nya lcibs dang 'dra ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: nya tshang zhes bya ba ni nya lcibs dang 'dra ba'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: The “fish roe” is a root that resembles a fish egg.

original: da gnyis ni sgrogs chung ngu dang 'brel ba yin pas chu nas bton na 'jig go //
analyzed: da gnyis ni sgrogs chung ngu dang 'brel ba yin pas chu nas bton na 'jig go //
translated: These two are connected to small animals and disintegrate when removed from the water.

original: sha mo zhes bya ba ni sha mo zho lu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sha mo zhes bya ba ni sha mo zho lu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The “fungus” is a mushroom, etc.

original: pha ba dgo dgo zhes bya ba ni 'brug gi sgras bslang ba phrum gyi rnam pa lta bu'i ldum mo'o //
analyzed: pha ba dgo dgo zhes bya ba ni 'brug gi sgras bslang ba phrum gyi rnam pa lta bu'i ldum mo'o //
translated: The “foam” is a plant that resembles a foam and is produced by the sound of thunder.

original: rung bar byas te spyod pa la ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni me la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung bas so //
analyzed: rung bar byas te spyod pa la ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni me la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung bas so //
translated: The “downfall” is incurred by using any of these after having made them suitable.

original: sa bon dang skye ba 'jig pa'i ltung byed de bcu gcig pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sa bon dang skye ba 'jig pa'i ltung byed de bcu gcig pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The eleventh downfall of a novice monk, “The downfall of seeds and birth,” is finished.

original: // /'du 'dzi'i gtam zhes bya ba ni bre mo'i gtam mo //
analyzed: // /'du 'dzi'i gtam zhes bya ba ni bre mo'i gtam mo //
translated: “Idle talk” means foolish talk.

original: grangs su chug shig ces bya ba ni rnam par zhog ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: grangs su chug shig ces bya ba ni rnam par zhog ces bya ba ste /
translated: “Put it in the count” means “put it aside.”

original: ngo tsha skyed pa'i phyir de'i grangs su gzhug go //
analyzed: ngo tsha skyed pa'i phyir de'i grangs su gzhug go //
translated: It is put in the count in order to generate shame.

original: gzhogs 'phyas zhes bya ba ni gzhogs kyis smod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhogs 'phyas zhes bya ba ni gzhogs kyis smod pa'o //
translated: “Slander” means to disparage by the side.

original: ngor 'phya ba dang gzhogs 'phyas gnyis ni ngo bo nyid gcig pas ltung byed gcig tu bstan to //
analyzed: ngor 'phya ba dang gzhogs 'phyas gnyis ni ngo bo nyid gcig pas ltung byed gcig tu bstan to //
translated: Slander and disparagement are taught as one downfall because they have the same nature.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dge 'dun gyis bgrangs pas gang zag bcu gnyis mu bskos pa sbyor bam btang ba las kyang ltung byed gsum mo //
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dge 'dun gyis bgrangs pas gang zag bcu gnyis mu bskos pa sbyor bam btang ba las kyang ltung byed gsum mo //
translated: “How does one commit a downfall?” and so forth. If one does not give up the preparation for the twelve topics that the Saṅgha has counted, one commits three downfalls.

original: gang zag bcu gnyis su ma bskos pa sbyor ba ma btang ba las kyang ltung byed gsum mo //
analyzed: gang zag bcu gnyis su ma bskos pa sbyor ba ma btang ba las kyang ltung byed gsum mo //
translated: If one does not give up the preparation for the twelve topics that the Saṅgha has not counted, one commits three downfalls.

original: gang zag bcu gnyis su ma bskos pa sbyor ba btang ba las kyang ltung byed gsum ste /
analyzed: gang zag bcu gnyis su ma bskos pa sbyor ba btang ba las kyang ltung byed gsum ste /
translated: Also, there are three additional downfalls from forsaking the training, making twelve downfalls.

original: spyir ltung byed bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: spyir ltung byed bcu gnyis so //
translated: In general, there are twelve downfalls.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis bgrangs pas de dag gnyis las nyes byas te spyir ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi bstan to //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis bgrangs pas de dag gnyis las nyes byas te spyir ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi bstan to //
translated: The Saṅgha of fully ordained monks enumerates two faults from those, making twenty-four downfalls in general.

original: nyes pa dang ldan pa nyid du bgrangs kyang nyes pa de las phyir mi ldog pa ni shin tu ngo tsha med pa'i phyir bgrangs pa las dngos gzhir gzhag la ma bgrangs pa las nyes byas su bzhag go //
analyzed: nyes pa dang ldan pa nyid du bgrangs kyang nyes pa de las phyir mi ldog pa ni shin tu ngo tsha med pa'i phyir bgrangs pa las dngos gzhir gzhag la ma bgrangs pa las nyes byas su bzhag go //
translated: Even though one is enumerated as having a fault, if one does not turn away from that fault, one is placed in the actual basis of a downfall because of having no shame at all. If one is not enumerated, one is placed in a minor downfall.

original: dge 'dun gyis bgrangs shing zhes bya ba ni 'phya ba dang gzhogs 'phyas byed pa'i grangs su gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis bgrangs pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis bgrangs shing zhes bya ba ni 'phya ba dang gzhogs 'phyas byed pa'i grangs su gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis bgrangs pa'o //
translated: The Saṅgha enumerates means that one is enumerated by the Saṅgha through a mere formal procedure of requesting to be enumerated as one who is contemptuous and deceitful.

original: gang zag bcu gnyis zhes bya ba ni gnas khang bsko ba dang / zas la bsko ba dang / thug pa 'brim pa dang / bag chos 'brim pa dang / phran @136b tshegs 'brim pa la sogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: gang zag bcu gnyis zhes bya ba ni gnas khang bsko ba dang / zas la bsko ba dang / thug pa 'brim pa dang / bag chos 'brim pa dang / phran @136b tshegs 'brim pa la sogs pa dag ste /
translated: The twelve persons are those appointed to distribute the living quarters, those appointed to distribute food, those appointed to distribute the soup, those appointed to distribute the pastries, those appointed to distribute the small cakes, and so on.

original: de dag ni zhal ta byed pa'i las gzhan thams cad kyi dpe yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni zhal ta byed pa'i las gzhan thams cad kyi dpe yin te /
translated: These are examples of all the other service positions.

original: sge'u chung srung ba la sogs pa gzhan dag la 'phya ba dang gzhogs 'phyas byed na yang dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sge'u chung srung ba la sogs pa gzhan dag la 'phya ba dang gzhogs 'phyas byed na yang dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If one disparages and slanders those who guard the windows, and so on, it is also a basis of the actual.

original: bsko ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis bskos pa'o //
analyzed: bsko ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis bskos pa'o //
translated: Appointed means appointed by the Saṅgha.

original: sbyor ba ma btang ba zhes bya ba ni las byed bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ma btang ba zhes bya ba ni las byed bzhin pa'o //
translated: Not giving up the activity means while the activity is being done.

original: sbyor ba btang ba zhes bya ba ni re zhig ngal so ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba btang ba zhes bya ba ni re zhig ngal so ba'o //
translated: Giving up the activity means taking a break for a while.

original: ma bskos pa zhes bya ba ni rang zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: ma bskos pa zhes bya ba ni rang zhugs pa'o //
translated: Not appointed means to do it oneself.

original: 'phya ba dang / gzhogs 'phyas dang / 'phya ba dang gzhogs 'phyas gnyis ka las rnam pa gsum du gzhag go //
analyzed: 'phya ba dang / gzhogs 'phyas dang / 'phya ba dang gzhogs 'phyas gnyis ka las rnam pa gsum du gzhag go //
translated: Disparaging and slandering are established as three types: disparaging, slandering, and both disparaging and slandering.

original: 'phya ba'i ltung byed de bcu gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'phya ba'i ltung byed de bcu gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The twelfth downfall in the ethical code of monks is now complete.

original: // / kho bo'i mdun du ma chags par zhes bya ba ni kho bo'i ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: // / kho bo'i mdun du ma chags par zhes bya ba ni kho bo'i ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The phrase “in my presence” means that the other monk thinks, “I have a downfall.”

original: ngag rnam pa bzhi po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngag rnam pa bzhi po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “four types of speech” refers to

original: brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: lying, slander, harsh speech, and idle speech.

original: gong ma sreg zhes bya ba ni bya'i rigs so //
analyzed: gong ma sreg zhes bya ba ni bya'i rigs so //
translated: The phrase “a bird called ‘the one who burns the upper part of the body’” refers to a type of bird.

original: bsgo ba rna la gzon pa zhes bya ba ni chos dang ldan pa'i bsgo ba dang mi mthun par byed pa'o //🔽kyis 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir gyis zhes smos pas so //
analyzed: bsgo ba rna la gzon pa zhes bya ba ni chos dang ldan pa'i bsgo ba dang mi mthun par byed pa'o // kyis 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir gyis zhes smos pas so //
translated: The phrase “disobeys a command” means that he acts contrary to a command that is in accord with the Dharma.🔽The phrase “and so forth” is used to indicate that the monk is also disobedient if he does not obey a command that is not in accord with the Dharma.

original: rkang pa gnyis kyis 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu bstan pa'i phyir gyis zhes smos so //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis kyis 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu bstan pa'i phyir gyis zhes smos so //
translated: The phrase “and so forth” is used to indicate that the monk is also disobedient if he does not obey a command that is not in accord with the Dharma.

original: cang mi smra bas kha gzon pa'o zhes bya ba ni na smad pa'i nyes byas su gsungs so //🔽smra 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni gcor ba'o //
analyzed: cang mi smra bas kha gzon pa'o zhes bya ba ni na smad pa'i nyes byas su gsungs so // smra 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni gcor ba'o //
translated: The phrase by remaining silent, he acquiesces is a reference to the offense of wrong conduct that is a downfall through others' accusations.🔽The phrase if he is inclined to speak means if he is inclined to say something.

original: tho 'tshams pa zhes bya ba ni co 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: tho 'tshams pa zhes bya ba ni co 'dri ba'o //
translated: The phrase if he is inclined to tease means if he is inclined to joke.

original: ltung zhes bya ba ni sa la ltung ba'o //
analyzed: ltung zhes bya ba ni sa la ltung ba'o //
translated: The phrase if he is inclined to fall means if he is inclined to fall to the ground.

original: las zhes bya ba ni phyi na las pa'o //
analyzed: las zhes bya ba ni phyi na las pa'o //
translated: The phrase if he is inclined to work means if he is inclined to do some work.

original: bsgo ba rna la gzon pa'i ltung byed de bcu gsum pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: bsgo ba rna la gzon pa'i ltung byed de bcu gsum pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The thirteenth downfall in the ethical code of the monks who uphold the three bases of training is explained.

original: // / dus ma yin pa'i sprin zhes bya ba ni dbyar ma yin pa'i sprin no //
analyzed: // / dus ma yin pa'i sprin zhes bya ba ni dbyar ma yin pa'i sprin no //
translated: The phrase at an inappropriate time means at a time when there is no rain.

original: phyir dgag pa zhes bya ba ni phyir bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: phyir dgag pa zhes bya ba ni phyir bzlog pa'o //
translated: The phrase if he is inclined to stop means if he is inclined to turn back.

original: dbyar gyi na bza' ras chen zhes bya ba ni khrus ras so //🔽slar bsdu ba zhes bya ba ni brtul ba'o //
analyzed: dbyar gyi na bza' ras chen zhes bya ba ni khrus ras so // slar bsdu ba zhes bya ba ni brtul ba'o //
translated: The phrase the rainy season robe means a robe for bathing.🔽The phrase if he is inclined to collect means if he is inclined to gather.

original: don mthun pa la rag las pa zhes bya ba ni don mthun pa dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: don mthun pa la rag las pa zhes bya ba ni don mthun pa dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: The phrase dependent on the caravan means dependent on the caravan.

original: glang tha ma zhes bya ba ni thams cad gyi mjug na mo'o //
analyzed: glang tha ma zhes bya ba ni thams cad gyi mjug na mo'o //
translated: The phrase the last of the cows means the last of all the cows.

original: mdza' bshes dang dgra bo dang tha mal pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni de gsum yod pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mdza' bshes dang dgra bo dang tha mal pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni de gsum yod pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase because of being a friend, an enemy, or a neutral person means because of the existence of those three.

original: rjes su 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni zin pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni zin pa'o //
translated: The phrase a connection means a possession.

original: bcol ba ni rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bcol ba ni rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase a request is of five types means the following.

original: gtsug lag khang 'di re zhes @137a * //🔽bya ba dang / gtsug lag khang ltos shig ces bya ba 'di gnyis kyis ni gzhi bcol bas gzhag pa yang bcol ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang 'di re zhes @137a * // bya ba dang / gtsug lag khang ltos shig ces bya ba 'di gnyis kyis ni gzhi bcol bas gzhag pa yang bcol ba yin par bstan to //
translated: The phrase Look at the monastery!🔽and the phrase Repair the monastery! indicate that a request is also a request that is made by means of a basis.

original: sgo lcags chug shig ces bya ba ni bsdom bcol bas bsdams pa yang bcol ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: sgo lcags chug shig ces bya ba ni bsdom bcol bas bsdams pa yang bcol ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: The phrase Lock the door! indicates that a request is also a request that is made by means of an action.

original: sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod pa ste zhes bya ba ni ma gus pa bzlog pa'i phyir dang gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod pa ste zhes bya ba ni ma gus pa bzlog pa'i phyir dang gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase One should generate the thought and also utter the words indicates that a request is also a request that is made by means of speech.

original: ltung ba de chos bzhin du phyir bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa dang tshig tu brjod pas ltung ba mi 'byang ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltung ba de chos bzhin du phyir bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa dang tshig tu brjod pas ltung ba mi 'byang ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “that downfall should be confessed in accordance with the Dharma” is stated in order to show that a downfall is not purified by merely generating the mind and reciting the words.

original: 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa yal bar bor ba'i phyir nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa yal bar bor ba'i phyir nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “one becomes guilty of an offense” means that one becomes guilty of a minor offense because of having abandoned the commitment.

original: mnyam par gzhag go snyam pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i sa mngon du byas so snyam pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag go snyam pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i sa mngon du byas so snyam pa'o //
translated: The phrase “one thinks, ‘I am abiding in meditative absorption’” means that one thinks, “I have attained the meditative absorption of the formless realm.”

original: rnam par grol bar bya'o snyam pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o snyam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol bar bya'o snyam pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o snyam pa'o //
translated: The phrase “one thinks, ‘I am attaining freedom’” means that one thinks, “I am abandoning the mental afflictions.”

original: phan phun zhes bya ba ni ma rung ba'o //
analyzed: phan phun zhes bya ba ni ma rung ba'o //
translated: The phrase “a misfortune” means a calamity.

original: nyi ma'i brgyad cha shar ba zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i phyogs 'gro ba'i lam gyi brgyad cha chod pa'am yang na nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi brgyad cha shar ba'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i brgyad cha shar ba zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i phyogs 'gro ba'i lam gyi brgyad cha chod pa'am yang na nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi brgyad cha shar ba'o //
translated: The phrase “when the sun has risen one-eighth of the way” means that the sun has risen one-eighth of the distance along the path that it travels across the sky or that one-eighth of the sun’s disk has risen above the horizon.

original: skyes 'bul ba zhes bya ba ni pho nya'o //
analyzed: skyes 'bul ba zhes bya ba ni pho nya'o //
translated: “The messenger” is the one who is sent.

original: gcig gis chos bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spyod yul gcig tu'o //
analyzed: gcig gis chos bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spyod yul gcig tu'o //
translated: “In the same place” means in the same place where the Dharma is being taught.

original: mchil ma'i snod gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni seng gi'i khri la'o //
analyzed: mchil ma'i snod gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni seng gi'i khri la'o //
translated: “The spittoon” is the one who is placed on the lion throne.

original: gnas pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni slob ma dang nye gnas dag gis so //
analyzed: gnas pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni slob ma dang nye gnas dag gis so //
translated: “The residents” are the disciples and the pupils.

original: gand'i chung ngu zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i phyir las kyi gand'i chung ngu brdungs pa'o //
analyzed: gand'i chung ngu zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i phyir las kyi gand'i chung ngu brdungs pa'o //
translated: “The small gong” is the small gong for summoning the saṅgha.

original: de dag phyir chos nyan pa mi byed nas zhes bya ba ni bar chad nas so //
analyzed: de dag phyir chos nyan pa mi byed nas zhes bya ba ni bar chad nas so //
translated: “They do not listen to the Dharma” means they do not listen to the Dharma in the middle.

original: nor bus spras pa zhes bya ba ni rin po ches glan pa'o //
analyzed: nor bus spras pa zhes bya ba ni rin po ches glan pa'o //
translated: “Adorned with jewels” means decorated with jewels.

original: brgyan pa zhes bya ba ni mdzes par byas pa'o //
analyzed: brgyan pa zhes bya ba ni mdzes par byas pa'o //
translated: “Ornament” means beautiful.

original: zil gyis mnan nas zhes bya ba ni khyad du bsad nas so //
analyzed: zil gyis mnan nas zhes bya ba ni khyad du bsad nas so //
translated: “Having disregarded” means having despised.

original: dus ston zhes bya ba ni mchod ston no //
analyzed: dus ston zhes bya ba ni mchod ston no //
translated: “Festival” means a great celebration.

original: char 'bab tu dogs na zhes bya ba ni mngon du phyogs na'o //
analyzed: char 'bab tu dogs na zhes bya ba ni mngon du phyogs na'o //
translated: “If there is a danger of rain” means if it is imminent.

original: 'dzam bu'i grib ma la bzhugs pa'i sku gzugs zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' lang tsho gsar la bab pa'i tshe shing 'dzam bu'i grib ma la bzhugs pa'i sku gzugs kha spu ma skyes pa'i rab tu ma byung ba'i cha lugs can no //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i grib ma la bzhugs pa'i sku gzugs zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' lang tsho gsar la bab pa'i tshe shing 'dzam bu'i grib ma la bzhugs pa'i sku gzugs kha spu ma skyes pa'i rab tu ma byung ba'i cha lugs can no //
translated: The image called “seated in the shade of the rose-apple tree” is the Bodhisattva in the prime of youth, seated in the shade of a rose-apple tree, with a beard and moustache not yet shaved off, and dressed as a householder.

original: dge slong rnams kyis de bor te dong ba ni rin po che la reg gam reg tu 'jud du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis de bor te dong ba ni rin po che la reg gam reg tu 'jud du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The monks left it behind because it was not proper for them to touch or cause another to touch a precious object.

original: ston pa'i 'du shes skyed de zhes @137b bya ba ni ston pa'i 'du shes bskyed na rin po che'i 'du shes med pas rin po che la reg pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur ro //🔽nad par dus gsum du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo'i gnas skabs brtag pa'i phyir nang par blta'o //
analyzed: ston pa'i 'du shes skyed de zhes @137b bya ba ni ston pa'i 'du shes bskyed na rin po che'i 'du shes med pas rin po che la reg pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur ro // nad par dus gsum du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo'i gnas skabs brtag pa'i phyir nang par blta'o //
translated: “They should generate the perception of the Teacher” means that if they generate the perception of the Teacher, then they will not have the perception of a precious object, and so there will be no offense in touching a precious object.🔽“They should look at the sick person three times a day” means that they should look in the morning to examine the condition of the night,

original: kha zas kyi gnas skabs brtag pa'i phyir dro kar blta'o //
analyzed: kha zas kyi gnas skabs brtag pa'i phyir dro kar blta'o //
translated: and in the afternoon to examine the condition of the day.

original: ma zhu ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs brtag pa'i phyir dgongs kar blta'o //
analyzed: ma zhu ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs brtag pa'i phyir dgongs kar blta'o //
translated: In order to examine the condition of the sick, etc., one should look in the evening.

original: nad pa dag la nyam nga bar gyur na zhes bya ba ni rjes byed pas gnod pa'o //
analyzed: nad pa dag la nyam nga bar gyur na zhes bya ba ni rjes byed pas gnod pa'o //
translated: “If the sick are in distress” means if they are afflicted by a helper.

original: ngo tsha med pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims 'chal ba'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims 'chal ba'o //
translated: “Shameless” means immoral.

original: nad dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni zhe 'gras pa'o //
analyzed: nad dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni zhe 'gras pa'o //
translated: “With disease” means with hostility.

original: rgas pa ni 'khogs shing nyam chung bas bye brag tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rgas pa ni 'khogs shing nyam chung bas bye brag tu bstan pa'o //
translated: “Old age” is taught separately because of being decrepit and weak.

original: na ba ni sbyor mi bzod pas bye brag tu bstan to //
analyzed: na ba ni sbyor mi bzod pas bye brag tu bstan to //
translated: “Sickness” is taught separately because of being unable to apply oneself.

original: mkhar len byed par bskos na ni ltung ba med pa'o zhes bya ba ni chad pa'i las la sogs pa byed na'o //
analyzed: mkhar len byed par bskos na ni ltung ba med pa'o zhes bya ba ni chad pa'i las la sogs pa byed na'o //
translated: “If one is appointed to do the work of a monk, there is no offense” means if one does the work of punishment, etc.

original: sngar zhugs pa de nyid kyis /
analyzed: sngar zhugs pa de nyid kyis /
translated: “If one has previously entered” means that very one.

original: thams cad zhus pa ni yin no zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi las ni spyi gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad zhus pa ni yin no zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi las ni spyi gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “All are questioned” means that the work of the Saṅgha is for the sake of the community.

original: dus snga tshogs su zhes bya ba ni gdugs tshod ma bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus snga tshogs su zhes bya ba ni gdugs tshod ma bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Before the time of the assembly” means because the meal time has not arrived.

original: gya tshom du zan gcad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni zan gcad pa'i rgyu med na'o //
analyzed: gya tshom du zan gcad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni zan gcad pa'i rgyu med na'o //
translated: Do not fast thoughtlessly means: if there is no reason for fasting.

original: tshig la thug ces bya ba ni tshig par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshig la thug ces bya ba ni tshig par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: To be at the end of one’s rope means: to be at the end of one’s words.

original: de 'dra ma zhes bya ba ni smad pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ma zhes bya ba ni smad pa'o //
translated: To be like that means: to be contemptible.

original: ser che ba zhes bya ba ni chu dang bcas pa'o//
analyzed: ser che ba zhes bya ba ni chu dang bcas pa'o//
translated: To be full of water means: to be full of water.

original: ri ka zhes bya ba ni ri'i spo'o //
analyzed: ri ka zhes bya ba ni ri'i spo'o //
translated: To be a mountain means: to be a mountain.

original: khyer zhes bya ba ni chus so //
analyzed: khyer zhes bya ba ni chus so //
translated: To be carried away means: to be carried away by water.

original: gnas mal gyi ltung byed de bcu bzhi pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gnas mal gyi ltung byed de bcu bzhi pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The fourteenth downfall in the section on furniture is finished.

original: // /'khor lo dang bkra shis dang g-yung drung gi lcags kyo dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni lcags kyo zhes bya ba ni mtshan te /
analyzed: // /'khor lo dang bkra shis dang g-yung drung gi lcags kyo dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni lcags kyo zhes bya ba ni mtshan te /
translated: To have a wheel, a swastika, and a thunder-bolt sign means: a thunder-bolt sign is a mark.

original: de ni 'khor lo la sogs pa re re dang so sor sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni 'khor lo la sogs pa re re dang so sor sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: That is to be applied individually to each of the wheel, etc.

original: des na 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is to have a wheel mark.

original: bkra shis kyi mtshan dang ldan pa dang / g-yung drung gi mtshan dag dang ldan zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bkra shis kyi mtshan dang ldan pa dang / g-yung drung gi mtshan dag dang ldan zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is to have a swastika mark, and to have a thunder-bolt mark.

original: bsod nams brgya zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mngon sum du gyur pa la byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa brgya lus pa dag gis dmigs pa'i sems pas bsod nams brgya bsags pa las byung ba ste /🔽sems pa brgya ni bcom ldan 'das ni srog gcod pa spangs pa dang / de spangs pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / gzhan dag de spangs pa yang dag par @138a * //
analyzed: bsod nams brgya zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mngon sum du gyur pa la byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa brgya lus pa dag gis dmigs pa'i sems pas bsod nams brgya bsags pa las byung ba ste / sems pa brgya ni bcom ldan 'das ni srog gcod pa spangs pa dang / de spangs pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / gzhan dag de spangs pa yang dag par @138a * //
translated: One hundred merits is the accumulation of one hundred merits from the bodhisattvas who are one hundred eons away from buddhahood, through the intention of focusing on the bhagavan buddhas who are directly manifest.

original: 'dzin du 'jud pa dang / de spangs pa gzigs na thugs dgyes pa dang / de spangs pa las byung ba'i bsod nams thar par 'ong ba'i sems pa lnga dang bdag nyid kyis kyang de ltar bya'o snyam pa'i sems pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'dzin du 'jud pa dang / de spangs pa gzigs na thugs dgyes pa dang / de spangs pa las byung ba'i bsod nams thar par 'ong ba'i sems pa lnga dang bdag nyid kyis kyang de ltar bya'o snyam pa'i sems pa lnga ste /
translated: The ten intentions of the Bhagavan are the intention to abandon taking life, the intention to praise the abandonment of taking life, the intention to induce others to abandon taking life, the intention to rejoice in seeing the abandonment of taking life, the intention to dedicate the merit of abandoning taking life to the attainment of liberation, the intention to contemplate the abandonment of taking life, the intention to contemplate the abandonment of taking life, the intention to contemplate the abandonment of taking life, the intention to contemplate the abandonment of taking life, and the intention to contemplate the abandonment of taking life.

original: de ltar srog gcod pa spangs pa la sems pa bcu'o ;
analyzed: de ltar srog gcod pa spangs pa la sems pa bcu'o ;
translated: Thus there are ten intentions regarding the abandonment of taking life.

original: / de bzhin du log par lta ba spangs pa'i bar gyi dge ba bcu po dag la sems pa bcu bcu ste /
analyzed: / de bzhin du log par lta ba spangs pa'i bar gyi dge ba bcu po dag la sems pa bcu bcu ste /
translated: Similarly, there are ten intentions regarding each of the ten virtues, up to and including the abandonment of wrong views.

original: spyir sems pa brgya po dag yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: spyir sems pa brgya po dag yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: In general, it should be understood that there are one hundred thoughts.

original: rtsva'i gding ba zhes bya ba smos pas ni ras bal gyis brdzangs pa dang / rin po che la sogs pa'i gding ba dag sel bar byed pa de dag nyes pa de lta bu'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsva'i gding ba zhes bya ba smos pas ni ras bal gyis brdzangs pa dang / rin po che la sogs pa'i gding ba dag sel bar byed pa de dag nyes pa de lta bu'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By mentioning the straw mat, the cotton-stuffed and jeweled mats are excluded, because they are the basis for such faults.

original: 'jig rten la bdag nyid mkhas par bgrang zhes bya ba ni mi dag la bdag nyid mkhas pa'i grangs su bgrangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten la bdag nyid mkhas par bgrang zhes bya ba ni mi dag la bdag nyid mkhas pa'i grangs su bgrangs pa'o //
translated: As for counted as wise in the world, it means counted as wise among people.

original: glongs te zhes bya ba ni sngas kyi mtha' dang rten ma'i mtha' zlog pa tsam byas te'o //
analyzed: glongs te zhes bya ba ni sngas kyi mtha' dang rten ma'i mtha' zlog pa tsam byas te'o //
translated: As for to turn over, it means to turn over just the edge of the pillow and the edge of the support.

original: gal te mi 'di zhes zer na sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyis sril dag skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te mi 'di zhes zer na sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyis sril dag skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If he says this person, it should not be given, because later the thread may grow.

original: skabs 'dir gzhung kha cig las bcom ldan 'das kyis tshon rtsi'i las bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshon rtsi'i las kyi skabs bdag bshad pa ni 'dir skabs ma yin pas gzhung lhug pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir gzhung kha cig las bcom ldan 'das kyis tshon rtsi'i las bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshon rtsi'i las kyi skabs bdag bshad pa ni 'dir skabs ma yin pas gzhung lhug pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: In this context, some texts say, “The Blessed One said, ‘Do the work of painting,’ and so on. The explanation of the work of painting is not relevant here, so it should be understood as an omission in the text.🔽If one wishes to do so in every way,

original: gal te thams cad kyi thams cad du 'dod na zhes bya ba ni phyir ye mi 'ong ba'i sems kyis sam yun ring zhig gis phyir 'ong ba'i sems so //🔽rdo ba'i gzhi can zhes bya ba ni rdo ba mang po'o //
analyzed: gal te thams cad kyi thams cad du 'dod na zhes bya ba ni phyir ye mi 'ong ba'i sems kyis sam yun ring zhig gis phyir 'ong ba'i sems so // rdo ba'i gzhi can zhes bya ba ni rdo ba mang po'o //
translated: means with the mind of a non-returner or with the mind of a once-returner after a long time.🔽A stone base means many stones.

original: bye ma'i gzhi can zhes bya ba yang bye ma mang po'o //
analyzed: bye ma'i gzhi can zhes bya ba yang bye ma mang po'o //
translated: A sand base means many sands.

original: nyes dmigs de lta bu zhes bya ba ni phan tshun rnam gnyis so //
analyzed: nyes dmigs de lta bu zhes bya ba ni phan tshun rnam gnyis so //
translated: Such a disadvantage means two kinds of mutual.

original: 'ding ba'i ltung byed de bco lnga pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'ding ba'i ltung byed de bco lnga pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the fifteenth downfall in the training of the novice monks is completed.

original: // / khron pa zhig gi drung du zhes bya ba ni khron pa dang nye bar ro //
analyzed: // / khron pa zhig gi drung du zhes bya ba ni khron pa dang nye bar ro //
translated: Near a well means near a well.

original: 'dam bu thibs po'i gseb ces bya ba ni 'dam bu stug po'i gnas so //
analyzed: 'dam bu thibs po'i gseb ces bya ba ni 'dam bu stug po'i gnas so //
translated: A thicket of reeds is a place with a dense growth of reeds.

original: sprin gyi kha dog lnga pa'i zhes bya ba ni ser po dang / dmar po dag la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sprin gyi kha dog lnga pa'i zhes bya ba ni ser po dang / dmar po dag la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Five-colored clouds are those that have yellow, red, and so on.

original: skrod pa'i ltung byed de bcu drug pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: skrod pa'i ltung byed de bcu drug pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The sixteenth case of the downfall of expulsion has been explained.

original: // / gru mos bsnun zhes bya ba ni gru phrugs kyis brdegs pa'o //
analyzed: // / gru mos bsnun zhes bya ba ni gru phrugs kyis brdegs pa'o //
translated: To strike with the elbow means to strike with the elbow.

original: phyis gnon zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byas te zil gyis gnon @138b pa'o ;
analyzed: phyis gnon zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byas te zil gyis gnon @138b pa'o ;
translated: To press down on means to harm and overpower.

original: / de nyid rkyen du byas te zhes bya ba ni gnas nas 'gro ba nyid kyi rgyu la brten te'o //
analyzed: / de nyid rkyen du byas te zhes bya ba ni gnas nas 'gro ba nyid kyi rgyu la brten te'o //
translated: To make that the condition means to make the reason for leaving the place.

original: zung ngu zhes bya ba ni skad mthun pa'o //
analyzed: zung ngu zhes bya ba ni skad mthun pa'o //
translated: To chant in unison means to chant in the same voice.

original: dge slong gis ji tsam cung zad dge slong la tho 'tshams par byed na thams cad du ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyis gnod pa byed pa ni dge slong la tho 'tshams par byed pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: dge slong gis ji tsam cung zad dge slong la tho 'tshams par byed na thams cad du ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyis gnod pa byed pa ni dge slong la tho 'tshams par byed pa'i dpe ste /
translated: To the extent that a monk harms a monk, in every case it is a downfall. This is an example of harming a monk by pressing down on him.

original: gzhan yang dge slong gis ji tsam cung zad dge slong la tho 'tshams par byed na de dag thams cad kyang bslab pa'i gzhi 'dir gtogs pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong gis ji tsam cung zad dge slong la tho 'tshams par byed na de dag thams cad kyang bslab pa'i gzhi 'dir gtogs pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, whatever a monk does to harass a monk, all of that is a downfall that is part of this rule.

original: mkhos su ma phab ces bya ba ni ngal so pa la sogs pas mgron du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: mkhos su ma phab ces bya ba ni ngal so pa la sogs pas mgron du gnyer ba'o //
translated: “Not in a relaxed manner” means to invite someone to a meal by having someone else do it.

original: chol zangs can zhes bya ba ni gang na chol zangs mang ba'am chol zangs gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: chol zangs can zhes bya ba ni gang na chol zangs mang ba'am chol zangs gzhag pa'o //
translated: “With a large copper pot” means in a place where there are many copper pots or where a copper pot is set out.

original: wa'i kha zhes bya ba ni wa'i bu gu dag go //
analyzed: wa'i kha zhes bya ba ni wa'i bu gu dag go //
translated: “With a dog’s mouth” means with a dog’s opening.

original: bul ba zhes bya ba ni thogs par ro //
analyzed: bul ba zhes bya ba ni thogs par ro //
translated: “Slowly” means with delay.

original: gand'i bsu zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir gand'i brdungs zhes brtags pa'o //
analyzed: gand'i bsu zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir gand'i brdungs zhes brtags pa'o //
translated: “Why is the gong beaten?” means “Why is the gong struck?”

original: dga' ba'i zhes bya ba ni 'dod kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba'i zhes bya ba ni 'dod kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “With pleasure” means “with a desire.”

original: them skas kyi gzhi zhes bya ba ni 'dzeg pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: them skas kyi gzhi zhes bya ba ni 'dzeg pa'i gnas so //
translated: “The base of the stairs” means the place where one climbs up.

original: phyis gnon gyi ltung byed de bcu bdun pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: phyis gnon gyi ltung byed de bcu bdun pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the seventeenth downfall is finished.

original: // / lo 'das pa zhes bya ba ni gnas bca' ba'i lo dag las thal ba'o //
analyzed: // / lo 'das pa zhes bya ba ni gnas bca' ba'i lo dag las thal ba'o //
translated: “The year has passed” means that the year of probation has passed.

original: steng gi nam mkha' la zhes bya ba ni khang pa'i steng gi nam mkha' la'o //
analyzed: steng gi nam mkha' la zhes bya ba ni khang pa'i steng gi nam mkha' la'o //
translated: “In the sky above” means in the sky above the building.

original: rtsa ba 'byung zhes bya ba ni gang la rtsa ba dgos pa'i drung du 'phral la 'jud cing rang nyid rkyen gzhan med par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rtsa ba 'byung zhes bya ba ni gang la rtsa ba dgos pa'i drung du 'phral la 'jud cing rang nyid rkyen gzhan med par 'byung ngo //
translated: “The root appears” means that it appears in front of the one who needs the root, immediately, and by itself, without other conditions.

original: de ni dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gis gzhi ma rung bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gis gzhi ma rung bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is to prevent the foundation of the Saṅgha’s monastery from being damaged.

original: spang leb ces bya ba ni spang leb zheng chen po'o //🔽spang leb chung ngu zhes bya ba ni spang leb srab mo'o //🔽shing leb ces bya ba ni shing srab mo'o //
analyzed: spang leb ces bya ba ni spang leb zheng chen po'o // spang leb chung ngu zhes bya ba ni spang leb srab mo'o // shing leb ces bya ba ni shing srab mo'o //
translated: “A plank” means a large plank.🔽“A small plank” means a thin plank.🔽“A wooden board” means a thin piece of wood.

original: shing leb 'bur chen zhes bya ba ni shing leb 'bur du brkos pa'o //🔽byin gyis gzhol ba zhes bya ba ni sa phag dag gis byin gyis gzhol ba de g-yogs pa'o //
analyzed: shing leb 'bur chen zhes bya ba ni shing leb 'bur du brkos pa'o //🔽byin gyis gzhol ba zhes bya ba ni sa phag dag gis byin gyis gzhol ba de g-yogs pa'o //
translated: “A wooden board with a raised edge” means a wooden board with a raised edge.🔽“A wooden board that is covered” means a wooden board that is covered with bricks.

original: rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'i ltung byed de bco brgyad pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'i ltung byed de bco brgyad pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the eighteenth root downfall.

original: // / gang dag mig gis mthong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni mi'i mig tha mal pas mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: // / gang dag mig gis mthong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni mi'i mig tha mal pas mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Those that are seen by the eye” means those that are seen by the ordinary human eye.

original: gang dag chu tshags kyis zin par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni ras thags ran bzang pos zin par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag chu tshags kyis zin par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni ras thags ran bzang pos zin par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Those that are caught in a strainer” means those that are caught in a fine cloth.

original: gang dag mi mthong ba dang / mi zin pa de dag ni yod kyang srog chags dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dag mi mthong ba dang / mi zin pa de dag ni yod kyang srog chags dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: “Those that are not seen and not caught” are present but are not living beings.

original: @139a * // gsad par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽dud 'gro gsad pa'i sems kyis dud 'gro gsod pa'i ltung byed yin no //
analyzed: @139a * // gsad par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // dud 'gro gsad pa'i sems kyis dud 'gro gsod pa'i ltung byed yin no //
translated: They cannot be killed, this is the meaning.🔽The downfall is to kill an animal with the intention to kill an animal.

original: phyi rol du bcas pa'i sems kyis srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa ni srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa ni srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed 'di yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol du bcas pa'i sems kyis srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa ni srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa ni srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed 'di yin no //
translated: The downfall is to use water that contains living beings with the intention to kill the living beings.

original: nang du spyad pa'i sems kyis srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa ni srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa'i ltung byed 'og ma'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: nang du spyad pa'i sems kyis srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa ni srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa'i ltung byed 'og ma'i skabs yin no //
translated: The inner mental act of using water containing living beings is the context of the offense of using water containing living beings.

original: srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed de bcu dgu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed de bcu dgu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the words of the nineteenth offense entailing expulsion is finished.

original: // / mtshams mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni gang la pha gu'i mtshams mnyam zhing ma bsnol bar brtsigs pa'o //
analyzed: // / mtshams mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni gang la pha gu'i mtshams mnyam zhing ma bsnol bar brtsigs pa'o //
translated: “Equal boundaries” means where the boundaries of the enclosure are equal and not overlapping.

original: lag gi bla bsko ba zhes bya ba ni blo mthun par bya ba'o //
analyzed: lag gi bla bsko ba zhes bya ba ni blo mthun par bya ba'o //
translated: “To lay out the site” means to do it in a way that is agreeable.

original: log ste zhes bya ba ni thams cad 'dus te'o //
analyzed: log ste zhes bya ba ni thams cad 'dus te'o //
translated: “To turn back” means that everyone has gathered.

original: phya mkhan zhes bya ba ni thig skud la lta ba'i bstan bcos shes pa'o //
analyzed: phya mkhan zhes bya ba ni thig skud la lta ba'i bstan bcos shes pa'o //
translated: “A surveyor” is someone who knows the treatises on how to look at the strings of a grid.

original: shing mkhan zhes bya ba ni shing 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: shing mkhan zhes bya ba ni shing 'jog pa'o //
translated: “A carpenter” is someone who sets up the wood.

original: chu klung zhes bya ba ni chu phyir 'byung ba'i srol lo //
analyzed: chu klung zhes bya ba ni chu phyir 'byung ba'i srol lo //
translated: “A river” is a channel for the flow of water.

original: gtsug lag khang 'di de nyid du rdib par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bram ze de ma byin par len pa'i las byas pa'i rgyu mthun pa nges par myong bar 'gyur ba yin pas bzlog par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang 'di de nyid du rdib par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bram ze de ma byin par len pa'i las byas pa'i rgyu mthun pa nges par myong bar 'gyur ba yin pas bzlog par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This temple will collapse right here means that the karma of stealing committed by the brahmin is certain to be experienced as a natural outcome and cannot be averted.

original: gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni zhi bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir sems kyi rgyud snyoms par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni zhi bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir sems kyi rgyud snyoms par sgrub pa'o //
translated: The meditative attainment of abiding is the attainment of meditative equipoise of the mindstream in order to abide in peace.

original: sgo'i sbubs dang gtan pa dang snang ba'i gnas ji tsam pa'i 'du shes kyis zhes bya ba'i sgo'i sbubs kyi gnas ji tsam pa'i 'du shes dang / gtan pa'i gnas ji tsam pa'i 'du shes dang / skar khung dang chu khung gi snang ba'i gnas ji tsam pa'i 'du shes bzhin brtsig par bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgo'i sbubs dang gtan pa dang snang ba'i gnas ji tsam pa'i 'du shes kyis zhes bya ba'i sgo'i sbubs kyi gnas ji tsam pa'i 'du shes dang / gtan pa'i gnas ji tsam pa'i 'du shes dang / skar khung dang chu khung gi snang ba'i gnas ji tsam pa'i 'du shes bzhin brtsig par bya ba'o //
translated: The perception of the extent of the cavity of the door, the extent of the door frame and the extent of the light of the window and ventilation hole is the perception of the extent of the cavity of the door, the extent of the door frame and the extent of the light of the window and ventilation hole.

original: sa brtag pa zhes bya ba ni brkos nas phyir dgang pa la sogs pas sa brtag pa'o //
analyzed: sa brtag pa zhes bya ba ni brkos nas phyir dgang pa la sogs pas sa brtag pa'o //
translated: The examination of the earth is the examination of the earth by digging it up and filling it in again.

original: nas bzung ste zhes bya ba ni de nas brtsams te'o //
analyzed: nas bzung ste zhes bya ba ni de nas brtsams te'o //
translated: “From that time on” means from that time forward.

original: gnyis sam gsum brtsigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyi ma gcig pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis sam gsum brtsigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyi ma gcig pa'o //
translated: “Two or three layers” means one day.

original: de las lhag pa'i bar brtsigs pa zhes bya ba ni rim pa bzhi la sogs pa brtsigs na'o //
analyzed: de las lhag pa'i bar brtsigs pa zhes bya ba ni rim pa bzhi la sogs pa brtsigs na'o //
translated: “More than that” means four layers, and so on.

original: sgo'i sbubs kyi gnas gtan pa'i gnas dang snang ba'i gnas ji tsam pa'i 'du shes med pa ni mi rigs par byed pa yin pas nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sgo'i sbubs kyi gnas gtan pa'i gnas dang snang ba'i gnas ji tsam pa'i 'du shes med pa ni mi rigs par byed pa yin pas nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “The perception of the size of the space for the door frame and the space for the light” means that it is not right to make it larger than that, so it is a minor offense.

original: 'di ni rdib pa dang gas pa dang 'drum pa la sogs pa spang ba'i phyir bca' ba mdzad do //
analyzed: 'di ni rdib pa dang gas pa dang 'drum pa la sogs pa spang ba'i phyir bca' ba mdzad do //
translated: This rule was laid down in order to prevent collapse, cracks, and other damage.

original: rdo 'ba' zhig la sogs pa la ni @139b 'gas pa la sogs pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur bas ltung ba med do //
analyzed: rdo 'ba' zhig la sogs pa la ni @139b 'gas pa la sogs pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur bas ltung ba med do //
translated: If it is only stone, and so on, there is no offense if there are cracks, and so on.

original: sbyin bdag rings par 'dod pas ni rdib na yang ltung ba med de /
analyzed: sbyin bdag rings par 'dod pas ni rdib na yang ltung ba med de /
translated: If the donor wants it quickly, there is no offense if it collapses.

original: gtsug lag khang ni de la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang ni de la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the monastery depends on him.

original: gtsug lag khang gi ltung byed de nyid shu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /🔽// / de dag dang gzhan yang zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi ltung byed de nyid shu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so / // / de dag dang gzhan yang zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The explanation of the words of the downfall of a temple is finished.

original: 'jig rten la ma grags pa gzhan dag gi ming yang gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten la ma grags pa gzhan dag gi ming yang gzung ngo //
translated: “Those and others” means that the names of others who are not well known are also included.

original: goo ta ma'i zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i dge slong ma rnams la bod pa'o //
analyzed: goo ta ma'i zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i dge slong ma rnams la bod pa'o //
translated: “Gautamī” refers to the Śākya bhikṣuṇīs.

original: khyod kyi dus yin gyi zhes bya ba ni khyod 'gro ba'i dus yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyod kyi dus yin gyi zhes bya ba ni khyod 'gro ba'i dus yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “It is your turn” means “it is your time to go.”

original: skul ba mdzad do zhes bya ba ni 'gro bar spro ba mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: skul ba mdzad do zhes bya ba ni 'gro bar spro ba mdzad pa'o //
translated: “She exhorts” means she encourages them to go.

original: ngal ba zhes bya ba ni chad pa'o //
analyzed: ngal ba zhes bya ba ni chad pa'o //
translated: “Exhausted” means tired.

original: res kyis zhes bya ba ni re mos so //
analyzed: res kyis zhes bya ba ni re mos so //
translated: “By turns” means in order.

original: res bab pa na dge slong ma la ston par mi btub po zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pas rjes bya ba dang mi 'jigs pa ma yin pa gnyis dben pa la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir dang / dge slong ma'i 'du 'dzi spang bar 'dod pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: res bab pa na dge slong ma la ston par mi btub po zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pas rjes bya ba dang mi 'jigs pa ma yin pa gnyis dben pa la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir dang / dge slong ma'i 'du 'dzi spang bar 'dod pa'i phyir dang /
translated: This is because the Blessed One, who is not afraid of being served, is not alone, because he delights in solitude, and because he wishes to avoid the distractions of the nuns.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa'i sems bsrung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa'i sems bsrung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is in order to protect the minds of his fellow practitioners of pure action.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis shig ces bya ba ni skyo bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i gtam mo //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis shig ces bya ba ni skyo bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i gtam mo //
translated: With a Dharma discourse means with a discourse that is not boring, etc.

original: nga 'am khyod kyis gtam kyang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dge slong ma de dag ni gnyi gas gdul ba yin pas 'phags pa dga' byed spro bar bya ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: nga 'am khyod kyis gtam kyang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dge slong ma de dag ni gnyi gas gdul ba yin pas 'phags pa dga' byed spro bar bya ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: With a discourse by me or by you and so on means that since those nuns are to be disciplined by both, it is a statement to encourage the noble Nanda.

original: rnam par sel ba yongs su dris zhes bya ba ni gtam gang dris pa dag gis the tshom rnam par sel bar byed pa de lta bu'i gtam yongs su dris shig pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par sel ba yongs su dris zhes bya ba ni gtam gang dris pa dag gis the tshom rnam par sel bar byed pa de lta bu'i gtam yongs su dris shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase ask about the removal means: ask about the kind of conversation that removes doubts by asking questions.

original: kun shes pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun shes pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase all-knowing means: understanding.

original: smras pa 'di'i don ci lags zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa brtag pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa 'di'i don ci lags zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa brtag pa'o //
translated: The phrase what is the meaning of this? means: investigating the intention.

original: 'di ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba ni rigs pa brtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba ni rigs pa brtag pa'o //
translated: The phrase what is this like? means: investigating the reasoning.

original: de dag ni dge slong ma rnams mi 'jigs pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni dge slong ma rnams mi 'jigs pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These are for the purpose of generating fearlessness in the nuns.

original: btsun pa dga' byed chos gsungs shig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dam bca' ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: btsun pa dga' byed chos gsungs shig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dam bca' ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: The phrase Venerable Nandaka, please teach the Dharma and so on are the words of commitment.

original: 'phags pas chos rnams kyi bdag med pa bstan pa la /
analyzed: 'phags pas chos rnams kyi bdag med pa bstan pa la /
translated: The noble one, in teaching the selflessness of phenomena,

original: nang gi skye mched drug gi dbang du mdzad na ;
analyzed: nang gi skye mched drug gi dbang du mdzad na ;
translated: in terms of the six internal sense bases,

original: sring mo dag khyed kyi nang gi skye mched mig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sring mo dag khyed kyi nang gi skye mched mig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: says Sisters, in your internal sense base of the eye and so on.

original: nang gi zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du 'byung ba'i phyir sems ni nang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du 'byung ba'i phyir sems ni nang zhes bya'o //
translated: The inner is the mind, because it arises again and again.

original: de la nye bar brten pa'i dngos pos 'jug pa'i phyir nang gi zhes bya ba ni sems kyi mjug thogs su zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽skye mched @140a * //
analyzed: de la nye bar brten pa'i dngos pos 'jug pa'i phyir nang gi zhes bya ba ni sems kyi mjug thogs su zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // skye mched @140a * //
translated: The inner is the mind, because it is the basis of the arising of the mind.

original: ces bya ba ni sems skye ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni sems skye ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The sense-fields are the causes of the mind.🔽The sense-fields are the causes of the mind, because they are the characteristics of the arising of the mind.

original: skye zhing mched par byed pas skye mched de sems kyi rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽'di ni bdag gi'o zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid gzhan zhig nyid la mig ni bdag gi yin pa'o //
analyzed: skye zhing mched par byed pas skye mched de sems kyi rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'di ni bdag gi'o zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid gzhan zhig nyid la mig ni bdag gi yin pa'o //
translated: The sense-fields are the causes of the mind, because they are the causes of the arising and development of the mind.🔽This is mine is the eye, which is the self of another.

original: 'di ni bdag go zhes bya ba ni /🔽mig gang yin pa de bdag nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag go zhes bya ba ni / mig gang yin pa de bdag nyid yin pa'o //
translated: This is the self is the eye, which is the self of the self.🔽This is the self of the self is the eye, which is the self of the self.🔽The rest is mine, because it is subordinate to the self.

original: 'di ni bdag gi bdag go zhes bya ba ni mig ni bdag gi bdag yin la lhag ma ni bdag gi yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi bdag go zhes bya ba ni mig ni bdag gi bdag yin la lhag ma ni bdag gi yin te /
translated: The self is the self of the self.🔽The self is the self of the self, because it is the self of the self.

original: de'i rjes su 'jug par byed pa gzhan la bdag gi'o snyam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'jug par byed pa gzhan la bdag gi'o snyam pa'o //
translated: The rest is mine, because it is subordinate to the self.

original: dang po nyid nas zhes bya ba ni thog ma nyid nas te mthong ba'i lam gyi tshe'o //
analyzed: dang po nyid nas zhes bya ba ni thog ma nyid nas te mthong ba'i lam gyi tshe'o //
translated: From the very beginning means from the very outset, at the time of the path of seeing.

original: nang gi skye mched drug po 'di dag bdag ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid kyis bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid yin te rang dbang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched drug po 'di dag bdag ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid kyis bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid yin te rang dbang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These six internal sense spheres are without self means that they are characterized by selflessness due to impermanence, because they are not independent.

original: yang dag pa'i zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: Correctly means without error.

original: shes rab kyis zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i blos so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i blos so //
translated: With wisdom means with uncontaminated wisdom.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de kho na'i rjes su 'brang bas so ;
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de kho na'i rjes su 'brang bas so ;
translated: Just as it is means in accordance with reality.

original: / de la mos pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam las langs pa dag la yang bdag med pa'i shes pa nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de la mos pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam las langs pa dag la yang bdag med pa'i shes pa nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to believe that means in order to not lose the knowledge of selflessness that arises from the path of seeing.

original: phyi rol gyi skye mched drug gi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi skye mched drug gi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the six external sense spheres,

original: sring mo dag khyed kyis phyi rol gyi skye mched gzugs dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sring mo dag khyed kyis phyi rol gyi skye mched gzugs dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it says, “Sisters, you should see the external forms that are the sense spheres as empty, as they are in reality, with correct wisdom, in order to believe that.”

original: phyi rol gyis zhes bya ba ni sems kyi bdag nyid kyi yul gyi dngos pos phyi rol du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyis zhes bya ba ni sems kyi bdag nyid kyi yul gyi dngos pos phyi rol du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: External means that the object that is the nature of mind becomes external.

original: 'di ltar dbang po rnam par gyur pas sems rnam par 'gyur gyi yul rnam par 'gyur bas sems rnam par mi 'gyur ba dang / sems rnam par 'gyur bas kyang dbang po rnam par 'gyur gyi yul rnam par 'gyur bas dbang po rnam par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir yul nyid phyi rol gyi dbang po rnams ni phyi rol ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po rnam par gyur pas sems rnam par 'gyur gyi yul rnam par 'gyur bas sems rnam par mi 'gyur ba dang / sems rnam par 'gyur bas kyang dbang po rnam par 'gyur gyi yul rnam par 'gyur bas dbang po rnam par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir yul nyid phyi rol gyi dbang po rnams ni phyi rol ma yin pa'o //
translated: Thus, the mind changes due to the change of the sense faculty, but the mind does not change due to the change of the object. And the sense faculty changes due to the change of the mind, but the sense faculty does not change due to the change of the object. Therefore, the object is external, but the sense faculties are not external.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With reference to the six collections of consciousness,

original: sring mo dag khyod kyis mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sring mo dag khyod kyis mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “Sisters, the eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms.”

original: brten nas zhes bya ba ni ltos nas so //
analyzed: brten nas zhes bya ba ni ltos nas so //
translated: In dependence means in reliance.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni mig la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni mig la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eye consciousness is so called because it is based on the eye.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs zhes bya ba la /🔽tshogs zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs zhes bya ba la / tshogs zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa ste /
translated: The group of consciousnesses.

original: rdzas gcig pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas gcig pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A group is a collection, because they are not one substance.

original: reg pa'i tshogs drug gi dbang du mdzad nas sring mo @140b khyod kyis mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: reg pa'i tshogs drug gi dbang du mdzad nas sring mo @140b khyod kyis mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: With reference to the group of six contacts, it is said: “Sister, the eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms.”

original: gsum 'dus pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang / yul dang / rnam par shes pa rnams kyi bya ba gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang / yul dang / rnam par shes pa rnams kyi bya ba gcig pa nyid do //
translated: The meeting of the three is the single activity of the faculty, the object, and the consciousness.

original: reg pa zhes bya ba ni yul la reg pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: reg pa zhes bya ba ni yul la reg pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir te /
translated: Contact is so called because it is like a contact with the object,

original: de'i rjes su 'brangs pas bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa yul gyi 'bras bu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brangs pas bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa yul gyi 'bras bu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the result of the object, such as pleasure, arises in dependence on it.

original: tshor ba'i tshogs drug gi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: tshor ba'i tshogs drug gi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With reference to the group of six feelings, it is said:

original: sring mo dag khyod kyis mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye zhing gsum 'dus pa las reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sring mo dag khyod kyis mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye zhing gsum 'dus pa las reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Sisters, you should know that the eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms. From the union of the three, contact. Due to the condition of contact, there is feeling.

original: sred pa'i tshogs drug gi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: sred pa'i tshogs drug gi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the six collections of craving,

original: sring mo dag khyed kyis mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye zhing gsum 'dus pa las reg pa //
analyzed: sring mo dag khyed kyis mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye zhing gsum 'dus pa las reg pa //
translated: Sisters, you should know that the eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms. From the union of the three, contact.

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Due to the condition of contact, there is feeling. Due to the condition of feeling, there is craving.

original: gang zag bdag med pa bstan nas rtag pa'i chos spangs pas chos bdag med par bstan par bzhed pas chos rnams kyis mi rtag pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zag bdag med pa bstan nas rtag pa'i chos spangs pas chos bdag med par bstan par bzhed pas chos rnams kyis mi rtag pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the selflessness of persons, in order to teach the selflessness of phenomena, in order to abandon the view of permanence, he taught the impermanence of phenomena.

original: sring mo dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sring mo dag 'di lta ste /
translated: Sisters, it is like this.

original: dper na 'bru mar dang mar me'i snying po la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dper na 'bru mar dang mar me'i snying po la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: For example, in dependence on oil and a wick,

original: 'bru mar gyi mar me zhes bya ba ni 'bru mar gyi mar me'o //
analyzed: 'bru mar gyi mar me zhes bya ba ni 'bru mar gyi mar me'o //
translated: The lamp of oil means the lamp of oil.

original: 'bar bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gnas par 'gyur mched par 'gyur ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bar bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gnas par 'gyur mched par 'gyur ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It burns means it abides, that is, it continues.

original: de la brten pa'i zhes bya ba ni mar me la brten pa'i'o //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i zhes bya ba ni mar me la brten pa'i'o //
translated: It is based on that means it is based on the lamp.

original: snang ba zhes bya ba ni 'od do //
analyzed: snang ba zhes bya ba ni 'od do //
translated: Light means radiance.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam grangs nyid do //
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam grangs nyid do //
translated: Permanent, etc. are synonyms.

original: yang na rtag pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rtag pas so //
analyzed: yang na rtag pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rtag pas so //
translated: Or, permanent means permanent in its functioning.

original: brtan pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun brtan pas so //
analyzed: brtan pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun brtan pas so //
translated: Stable means stable in its continuum.

original: ther zug pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs rtag pas te rim gyis 'byung ba'i so so'i skye bo'i skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ther zug pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs rtag pas te rim gyis 'byung ba'i so so'i skye bo'i skye ba bzhin no //
translated: Eternal means permanent in its synonyms, like the birth of an ordinary person that occurs in stages.

original: rnam par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can zhes bya ba ni rnam par gnas par rtag pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can zhes bya ba ni rnam par gnas par rtag pa ste /
translated: Having an unchanging nature means permanent in its mode of being.

original: mi snang bar gyur kyang sa bon nyid kyis 'byung ba s'a lu'i sa bon bzhin no //
analyzed: mi snang bar gyur kyang sa bon nyid kyis 'byung ba s'a lu'i sa bon bzhin no //
translated: Even when it is not manifest, it exists by means of its seed, like the seed of rice.

original: yang dag pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: “Correct” means non-erroneous.

original: chos de dang de dag skyes pas zhes bya ba ni nang dang phyi rol gyi rgyu rnams so //
analyzed: chos de dang de dag skyes pas zhes bya ba ni nang dang phyi rol gyi rgyu rnams so //
translated: “By the arising of this and that thing” refers to internal and external causes.

original: chos de dang de dag skye bar 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rnams so //
analyzed: chos de dang de dag skye bar 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rnams so //
translated: “This and that thing will arise” refers to effects.

original: dgag par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni don nyams pa'o //🔽nye bar 'gyur zhi bar @141a * //
analyzed: dgag par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni don nyams pa'o // nye bar 'gyur zhi bar @141a * //
translated: “Will cease” means the loss of the object.

original: 'gyur zhes bya ba ni grub pa nyams so //
analyzed: 'gyur zhes bya ba ni grub pa nyams so //
translated: “Will come near” means the loss of accomplishment.

original: bsil bar gyur zhes bya ba ni shugs nyams pa ste mnyen par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bsil bar gyur zhes bya ba ni shugs nyams pa ste mnyen par gyur pa'o //
translated: “Will become cool” means the loss of force, i.e., becoming soft.

original: nub par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rgyun 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: nub par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rgyun 'chad pa'o //
translated: “Will disappear” means the cessation of the continuum.

original: nang gi skye mched rnams la khang pa'i nang gi mar me'i dpes bstan nas phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams la khang pa'i phyi rol gyi shing ljon pa'i dpes bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams la khang pa'i nang gi mar me'i dpes bstan nas phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams la khang pa'i phyi rol gyi shing ljon pa'i dpes bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Having taught the internal sense bases with the example of the lamp inside the house, he wishes to teach the external sense bases with the example of the tree outside the house.

original: sring mo dag 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: sring mo dag 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: “Sisters, it is like this.

original: shing ljon pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: shing ljon pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The great tree and so on are mentioned.

original: de ltar bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis bstan nas da ni nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched ji ltar gnas pa dag la sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis bstan nas da ni nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched ji ltar gnas pa dag la sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, after teaching the two kinds of selflessness, now, in order to show how the mind becomes liberated in the inner and outer sense bases as they are,

original: sring mo dag 'di na skyes bu mkhas pa dag dpes smras pa'i don kun shes par 'gyur bas de'i phyir re zhig dpe nyon cig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sring mo dag 'di na skyes bu mkhas pa dag dpes smras pa'i don kun shes par 'gyur bas de'i phyir re zhig dpe nyon cig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the text says, Sisters, here, wise people understand the meaning of what is said through examples. Therefore, listen to the example and so on.

original: skyes bu mkhas pa dag ces bya ba ni skye bo mkhas pa dag go //
analyzed: skyes bu mkhas pa dag ces bya ba ni skye bo mkhas pa dag go //
translated: Wise people means the wise ones.

original: dpes zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i dpes so //
analyzed: dpes zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i dpes so //
translated: By example, it means by a worldly example.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na'o //🔽ba lang gsod pa zhes bya ba ni gdol pa'o //🔽ba lang gsod pa'i slob ma zhes bya ba ni lto khol lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na'o // ba lang gsod pa zhes bya ba ni gdol pa'o // ba lang gsod pa'i slob ma zhes bya ba ni lto khol lo //
translated: Therefore means for that reason.🔽A cow killer is an outcaste.🔽A cow killer's student is a pot-bellied one.

original: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni slud bur 'chu ba la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni slud bur 'chu ba la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Skilled means skilled in milking.

original: ba lang bsha' ba'i gri zhes bya ba ni ba lang gsod pa'i mtshon no //
analyzed: ba lang bsha' ba'i gri zhes bya ba ni ba lang gsod pa'i mtshon no //
translated: The knife of a butcher is the weapon for killing cows.

original: sha'i tshogs zhes bya ba ni sha'i tshoms so //
analyzed: sha'i tshogs zhes bya ba ni sha'i tshoms so //
translated: A heap of flesh is a collection of flesh.

original: ma nyams pa zhes bya ba ni dum bur ma gyur ba'o //🔽bar gyi zhes bya ba ni pags pa dang sha'i tshogs kyi bar gyi'o //
analyzed: ma nyams pa zhes bya ba ni dum bur ma gyur ba'o // bar gyi zhes bya ba ni pags pa dang sha'i tshogs kyi bar gyi'o //
translated: Not cut up means not divided into pieces.🔽In between means between the collection of skin and the collection of flesh.

original: chu rgyus zhes bya ba ni mjug ma la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i chu ba dang rgyus pa'o //
analyzed: chu rgyus zhes bya ba ni mjug ma la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i chu ba dang rgyus pa'o //
translated: Tendons are sinews that connect the tail, etc.

original: glo ba dang mchin pa'o zhes bya ba ni khong pa na 'dug pa'i sha'i rdo gu'o //
analyzed: glo ba dang mchin pa'o zhes bya ba ni khong pa na 'dug pa'i sha'i rdo gu'o //
translated: The lungs and liver are the flesh of the internal organs.

original: rtsa rgyun zhes bya ba ni rtsa'i chu ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa rgyun zhes bya ba ni rtsa'i chu ba'o //
translated: The channels are the channels of the body.

original: yang ba lang gi ko bas g-yogs par gyur ba zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas skabs bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang ba lang gi ko bas g-yogs par gyur ba zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas skabs bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Covered with cowhide means that it is covered with the skin of a cow.

original: ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa ste /
translated: Possessed means connected.

original: phan tshun 'byar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phan tshun 'byar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Mutually joined is the meaning of the compound.

original: bral ba zhes bya ba ni chad pa ste dum bu du mar gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bral ba zhes bya ba ni chad pa ste dum bu du mar gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Separation” means “annihilation,” i.e., the destruction of the continuum.

original: don rnam par rig par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dpes sems rnam par grol pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don go bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don rnam par rig par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dpes sems rnam par grol pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don go bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “In order to make known the object” means in order to make known the supramundane object, the mind liberated from the obscurations.

original: gzugs can zhes bya ba smos pas ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs can zhes bya ba smos pas ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “material” excludes the aggregates of consciousness, etc.

original: rags @141b pa zhes bya ba smos pas ni bar ma do'i srid pa'i lus cha phra mo bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rags @141b pa zhes bya ba smos pas ni bar ma do'i srid pa'i lus cha phra mo bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “gross” excludes the subtle parts of the body of the intermediate existence.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa las gyur pa yin gyi dbang phyug la sogs pa las gyur pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa las gyur pa yin gyi dbang phyug la sogs pa las gyur pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Derived from the four great elements” means derived from earth, etc., not from Īśvara, etc.

original: pha ma'i mi gtsang ba mer mer po las gyur ba zhes bya ba ni pha ma chags par gyur pa'i khu ba dang khrag 'dus pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: pha ma'i mi gtsang ba mer mer po las gyur ba zhes bya ba ni pha ma chags par gyur pa'i khu ba dang khrag 'dus pa las byung ba ste /
translated: “Derived from the parents’ impure substances” means derived from the parents’ semen and blood, which are united when the parents are in sexual union.

original: de ni rdzus te skye ba nyid bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rdzus te skye ba nyid bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the very one who is born supernaturally.

original: 'bye ba zhes bya ba ni 'gas pa'o //
analyzed: 'bye ba zhes bya ba ni 'gas pa'o //
translated: Split means to be split.

original: rnam par 'thor ba zhes bya ba ni dum bu dum bur chad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'thor ba zhes bya ba ni dum bu dum bur chad pa'o //
translated: Scattered means to be broken into pieces.

original: rnam par 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni skam pa la sogs pa chud za ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni skam pa la sogs pa chud za ba'o //
translated: Destruction means to be dried up, etc.

original: tshig bla dags zhes bya ba ni ming ngo //
analyzed: tshig bla dags zhes bya ba ni ming ngo //
translated: Designation means name.

original: dga' pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: dga' pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba ni sred pa'o //
translated: Attachment to pleasure means craving.

original: 'phags pa'i zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'o //🔽nyan thos zhes bya ba ni gus pas nyan pa'i slob ma'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'o // nyan thos zhes bya ba ni gus pas nyan pa'i slob ma'o //
translated: Noble means the Tathagata, etc.🔽Hearer means a disciple who listens respectfully.

original: thos pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag mnos pa'i mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag mnos pa'i mkhas pa'o //
translated: Endowed with learning means a wise person who has received instructions.

original: shes rab kyis mtshon zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab bo ;
analyzed: shes rab kyis mtshon zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab bo ;
translated: Indicated by wisdom means uncontaminated wisdom.

original: / bag la nyal zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / khong khro ba dang / sred pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / the tshom zhes bya ba bdun no //
analyzed: / bag la nyal zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / khong khro ba dang / sred pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / the tshom zhes bya ba bdun no //
translated: The seven latent tendencies are desire, anger, pride, ignorance, views, doubt, and craving.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni khro ba dang khon du 'dzin pa dang / g-yo la sogs pa'i rgyu mthun pa dag go //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni khro ba dang khon du 'dzin pa dang / g-yo la sogs pa'i rgyu mthun pa dag go //
translated: The secondary afflictions are the natural outflow of anger, resentment, guile, and so on.

original: kun nas dkris pa zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The entanglements are shamelessness, lack of abashment, and so on.

original: shes rab kyi mtshon gyis thabs bstan pa'i sring mo dag de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mtshon gyis thabs bstan pa'i sring mo dag de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The sword of wisdom is the means of cutting through them.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa nye bar len pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyis len par byed pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa nye bar len pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyis len par byed pa'i phung po'o //
