translated: The aggregates are so called because they are appropriated by the afflictions, such as the appropriation of desire.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig par rjes su lta zhes bya ba ni gang gis 'du byed rnams skad cig re re la skye ba dang 'gag par lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig par rjes su lta zhes bya ba ni gang gis 'du byed rnams skad cig re re la skye ba dang 'gag par lta ba'o //
translated: The phrase one observes the arising and passing away means that one observes the arising and passing away of conditioned factors of existence in each moment.

original: kun 'byung ba dang nub par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang nub par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The phrase one observes the origination and cessation should be understood in the same way.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni lus dang / tshor ba dang sems dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o ;
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni lus dang / tshor ba dang sems dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o ;
translated: The phrase the four applications of mindfulness refers to the applications of mindfulness directed toward the body, sensation, thought, and the dharmas.

original: / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun zhes bya ba ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun zhes bya ba ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase the seven members of enlightenment refers to the members of enlightenment that consist of the mind of enlightenment, etc.

original: byang chub rnam gsum gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub rnam gsum gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the cause of the three types of enlightenment.

original: legs par yid la byas zhes bya ba ni rtag tu bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: legs par yid la byas zhes bya ba ni rtag tu bsgom pa'o //
translated: The phrase one properly attends to them means that one cultivates them constantly.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba ni thabs kyi rgyu'o //🔽'dod pa'i zag pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod @142a * //
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba ni thabs kyi rgyu'o // 'dod pa'i zag pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod @142a * //
translated: The phrase the cause refers to the cause that is the means.

original: pa'i nyon mongs pa dag go //
analyzed: pa'i nyon mongs pa dag go //
translated: The phrase the impurity of desire refers to the mental afflictions that pertain to the desire realm.

original: srid pa'i zag pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dag go //
analyzed: srid pa'i zag pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dag go //
translated: The “outflow of existence” is the afflictions that operate in the form realm.

original: ma rig pa'i zag pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i zag pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi mi shes pa'o //
translated: The “outflow of ignorance” is the unknowing of the three realms.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Free from attachment” means that the afflictions that focus on the afflictions have been abandoned.

original: rnam par grol zhing zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams la'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol zhing zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams la'o //
translated: “Liberated” means from the desire realm.

original: mthar thug pa nyid ma thob ces bya ba la /
analyzed: mthar thug pa nyid ma thob ces bya ba la /
translated: “Not having attained the final goal” means

original: 'dir mi slob pa nyid ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir mi slob pa nyid ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: that the state of no learning is the final goal.

original: 'jig rten 'dir zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dir zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: “In this world” means in the desire realm.

original: 'ong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'ong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Will come” means will be born.

original: gnyis su 'byed pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa ma yin pa gnyis su'o //
analyzed: gnyis su 'byed pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa ma yin pa gnyis su'o //
translated: “Will be divided” means into two: afflictions and non-afflictions.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba nyid du lung bstan pa'o zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba nyid du lung bstan pa'o zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa'o //
translated: “Will be predicted as a non-returner” means will attain the fruit of non-returning.

original: rnam par grol zhing zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa las so //
analyzed: rnam par grol zhing zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa las so //
translated: Liberated means liberated from the three realms.

original: mthar thug pa nyid thob ces bya ba ni mi slob pa nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa nyid thob ces bya ba ni mi slob pa nyid thob pa'o //
translated: Attained the ultimate means attained the state of no-more-learning.

original: lam gdags su med de zhes bya ba ni skye ba gzhan gzhag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: lam gdags su med de zhes bya ba ni skye ba gzhan gzhag tu med pa ste /
translated: The path is not imputed means that there is no other rebirth.

original: nyon mongs pa dang las kyi rgyu 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las kyi rgyu 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no cause of afflictions and karma.

original: mchog nyid du lung bstan to zhes bya ba ni dam pa nyid du ste mi slob pa nyid du'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mchog nyid du lung bstan to zhes bya ba ni dam pa nyid du ste mi slob pa nyid du'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is declared to be supreme means it is declared to be the highest, meaning the state of no-more-learning.

original: re zhig 'dul ba'i nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mdzad do zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i don nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir 'dul bas dus las yol bar gyur na mi rung ngo snyam du dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig 'dul ba'i nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mdzad do zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i don nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir 'dul bas dus las yol bar gyur na mi rung ngo snyam du dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said, For now, the bases of training for the disciples to be tamed are established, because it is in accordance with the meaning of taming, thinking that it would not be appropriate for the time of taming to pass.

original: bsko bar mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma'i ston par ro //
analyzed: bsko bar mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma'i ston par ro //
translated: It is not to be appointed means as the teacher of nuns.

original: 'brel par byas pas zhes bya ba ni gzhan du 'gro bar byas nas so //
analyzed: 'brel par byas pas zhes bya ba ni gzhan du 'gro bar byas nas so //
translated: “Having made a connection” means having gone elsewhere.

original: gso sbyong bco lnga pa zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong bco lnga pa nyid la gdams ngag tshol bar nges pa'i phyir dang / de'i tshe dge 'dun thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gso sbyong bco lnga pa zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong bco lnga pa nyid la gdams ngag tshol bar nges pa'i phyir dang / de'i tshe dge 'dun thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fifteenth day of the fortnight is the day of the poṣadha ceremony, because the instruction is certain to be sought on the fifteenth day of the fortnight, and because at that time the entire saṃgha is assembled.

original: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa na zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma la bstan pa ni dge 'dun mthun pa'i bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa na zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma la bstan pa ni dge 'dun mthun pa'i bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “When the entire saṃgha is seated and in agreement” means that the instruction of the bhikṣuṇīs is the activity of the saṃgha in agreement.

original: ma dul ba zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang gnyis kyis nye bar ma zhi ba'o //
analyzed: ma dul ba zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang gnyis kyis nye bar ma zhi ba'o //
translated: “Untamed” means not pacified in body and speech.

original: ma zhi ba zhes bya ba ni yid kyis so //
analyzed: ma zhi ba zhes bya ba ni yid kyis so //
translated: “Unpacified” means not pacified in mind.

original: 'dam las ma rgal ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dam las so //
analyzed: 'dam las ma rgal ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dam las so //
translated: “Not having crossed the swamp” means not having crossed the swamp of desire.

original: yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa ma zhi ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa ma zhi ba'o //
translated: “Not having attained complete nirvāṇa” means not having pacified the afflictions.

original: rgya cher thon pa zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa lnga po gleng gzhi gdon @142b pa nas rtsod pa zhi bar byed pa'i chos bdun gdon pa'i bar dag rgya cher thon pa'o //
analyzed: rgya cher thon pa zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa lnga po gleng gzhi gdon @142b pa nas rtsod pa zhi bar byed pa'i chos bdun gdon pa'i bar dag rgya cher thon pa'o //
translated: The phrase in a condensed form means that they are recited in a condensed form, from the recitation of the nidana up to the recitation of the seven principles for settling disputes.

original: lobs pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du byas shing lce'i rtse mos gnas par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lobs pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du byas shing lce'i rtse mos gnas par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase in a memorized form means that they are recited from memory and are retained at the tip of the tongue.

original: de dag ni blang ba dang dor ba yongs su shes pas bdag nyid bsrung ba la dgongs pa'i chos su bstan to //
analyzed: de dag ni blang ba dang dor ba yongs su shes pas bdag nyid bsrung ba la dgongs pa'i chos su bstan to //
translated: These are taught as the Dharma that is intended for the protection of oneself through the complete knowledge of what is to be adopted and what is to be rejected.

original: rgyal tshab lta bu zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshul khrims kyis bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i bka'i sras zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyal tshab lta bu zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshul khrims kyis bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i bka'i sras zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase like a regent means that, through the morality of the teaching, one becomes the son of the Lord by the power of the Dharma.

original: grong khyer ba'i skad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni skad mkhas pa'i phyir rgyal tshab la sogs pa'i sgra mi brjod pa'o //
analyzed: grong khyer ba'i skad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni skad mkhas pa'i phyir rgyal tshab la sogs pa'i sgra mi brjod pa'o //
translated: The phrase in the language of the city means that, because of one's skill in languages, one does not use the language of the regent, etc.

original: sun ma phyung ba zhes bya ba ni dang po nas so //
analyzed: sun ma phyung ba zhes bya ba ni dang po nas so //
translated: The phrase without reproach means that one is so from the very beginning.

original: sun phyung na yang ltung ba de chos bzhin du phyir byas pas ni sun ma phyung ba nyid kyi gnas skabs gsal bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sun phyung na yang ltung ba de chos bzhin du phyir byas pas ni sun ma phyung ba nyid kyi gnas skabs gsal bar bstan pa'o //
translated: And if he is censured, he is restored to his former status by the confession of that offense in accordance with the Dharma.

original: rjes dang bcas zhes bya ba ni 'dzem pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rjes dang bcas zhes bya ba ni 'dzem pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: With respect means with modesty.

original: gus pa dang bcas zhes bya ba ni rje dpon du byas pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gus pa dang bcas zhes bya ba ni rje dpon du byas pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: With reverence means with the attitude of a servant.

original: reg pa zhes bya ba ni khrus dang nye reg dang 'thor 'thung gi reg pa'o //🔽yun ring du 'tshe bar gyur cig ce bya ba ni 'phags pa'i chos so //
analyzed: reg pa zhes bya ba ni khrus dang nye reg dang 'thor 'thung gi reg pa'o // yun ring du 'tshe bar gyur cig ce bya ba ni 'phags pa'i chos so //
translated: With contact means with the contact of bathing, anointing, and sprinkling.🔽May he live long means may he live a long time.

original: tshe ring du skyong bar gyur cig ces bya ba ni tshe lhag par 'phel bar 'gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: tshe ring du skyong bar gyur cig ces bya ba ni tshe lhag par 'phel bar 'gyur cig pa'o //
translated: May he live a hundred years means may he live a long time.

original: lam phran ces bya ba ni lam srang phra mo'o //
analyzed: lam phran ces bya ba ni lam srang phra mo'o //
translated: A narrow path means a small path.

original: bul zhes bya ba ni brjed ngas pa'o //
analyzed: bul zhes bya ba ni brjed ngas pa'o //
translated: Forgetful means absent-minded.

original: chung ba zhes bya ba ni blo chung ba'o //
analyzed: chung ba zhes bya ba ni blo chung ba'o //
translated: Small means of little intelligence.

original: rigs gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal rigs so //
analyzed: rigs gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal rigs so //
translated: A member of the warrior class means a member of the kṣatriya class.

original: lugs su 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'khor bar 'jug pa'i lugs su 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: lugs su 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'khor bar 'jug pa'i lugs su 'byung ba'o //
translated: The forward order is the order in which samsara occurs, i.e., “Conditioned by ignorance, the karmic forces arise,” etc.

original: lugs las bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed rnams 'gag ces bya ba la sogs pa 'khor ba'i lugs las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: lugs las bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed rnams 'gag ces bya ba la sogs pa 'khor ba'i lugs las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The reverse order is the order in which samsara is reversed, i.e., “Through the cessation of ignorance, the karmic forces cease,” etc.

original: bsrabs pa zhes bya ba ni chung ba'o //
analyzed: bsrabs pa zhes bya ba ni chung ba'o //
translated: “Thinning out” means “lessening.”

original: yongs su zad pa zhes bya ba ni zhing la sogs pa dag las 'bras bu mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su zad pa zhes bya ba ni zhing la sogs pa dag las 'bras bu mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: “Complete exhaustion” means that the fruit does not arise from the field, etc.

original: yongs su gtugs zhes bya ba ni gzhi nyams pa ste zhing la sogs pa mi rung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yongs su gtugs zhes bya ba ni gzhi nyams pa ste zhing la sogs pa mi rung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Complete destruction” means the destruction of the basis, i.e., the field, etc., becomes unfit.

original: sgrub pa gces pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sgrub pa gces pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Cherishing the practice” means

original: tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa gtso bo yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa gtso bo yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that morality, learning, meditation, etc., are the most important things.

original: 'dod bral zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa bsten pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod bral zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa bsten pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: “Free from desire” means free from the enjoyment of desire.

original: dran pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gnas pa'o //🔽shes bzhin can zhes bya ba ni shes rab @143a * //
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gnas pa'o // shes bzhin can zhes bya ba ni shes rab @143a * //
translated: “Possessed of mindfulness” means that mindfulness is present.

original: nye bar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa ste /
translated: “Possessed of awareness” means that wisdom is present.

original: de gnyis kyis ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa sgom pa ston to //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa sgom pa ston to //
translated: These two show the cultivation of the applications of mindfulness, etc.

original: gnod ldan zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa gnod pa brgya dag gis gang ba'o //🔽sdug bsngal gang yin bsten mi bya //
analyzed: gnod ldan zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa gnod pa brgya dag gis gang ba'o // sdug bsngal gang yin bsten mi bya //
translated: “Full of harm” means that it is filled with the hundreds of harms of birth, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba la snying por gzung bar mi bya'o ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba la snying por gzung bar mi bya'o ;
translated: “One should not attend to any suffering” means that one should not grasp cyclic existence as having an essence.

original: / bstan to zhes bya ba ni lung phog pa'o //🔽sten par byed bsnyen par byed /
analyzed: / bstan to zhes bya ba ni lung phog pa'o // sten par byed bsnyen par byed /
translated: “Taught” means that the scriptures are imparted.

original: bsnyen bkur byed ces bya ba ni bsnyen bkur byed pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur byed ces bya ba ni bsnyen bkur byed pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'o //
translated: “One should attend to, serve, and honor” means that one should attend to, serve, and honor with a small, medium, or great attitude.

original: smad pa zhes bya ba ni spa gong ba'o //
analyzed: smad pa zhes bya ba ni spa gong ba'o //
translated: “Disparage” means to discourage.

original: bstod pa zhes bya ba ni gzengs bstod pa'o //
analyzed: bstod pa zhes bya ba ni gzengs bstod pa'o //
translated: “Praise” means to encourage.

original: byis pa bstod pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni smad pa'i zhar la bdag nyid chen po la smod pa bas kyang byis pa la bstod pa 'bras bus zil gyis gnon par 'gyur bar ston to //🔽'dir ni zhes bya ba ni /🔽bstod pa dang smod pa'i skabs 'dir ro //
analyzed: byis pa bstod pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni smad pa'i zhar la bdag nyid chen po la smod pa bas kyang byis pa la bstod pa 'bras bus zil gyis gnon par 'gyur bar ston to // 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni / bstod pa dang smod pa'i skabs 'dir ro //
translated: Here, the praise of the wise is superior to the disparagement of the magnanimous.🔽Here, in this context of praise and disparagement, the praise of the wise is superior to the disparagement of the magnanimous.

original: mkhas smod mchog yin gyi zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu las mtho ris dang byan grol la sogs pa'i 'bras bu chen po thob pa'i phyir ro //🔽byis pa bstod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mchog ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: mkhas smod mchog yin gyi zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu las mtho ris dang byan grol la sogs pa'i 'bras bu chen po thob pa'i phyir ro // byis pa bstod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mchog ma yin pa ste /
translated: Because it is the cause of the great result of high rebirth, liberation, etc.🔽The praise of the foolish is not superior, because the foolish are ignorant and engage in only evil conduct.

original: byis pa ni mi shes pa yin pas nyes pa 'ba' zhig spyod pa yin pa'i phyir des bstod na ngan song la sogs pa dag tu ltung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byis pa ni mi shes pa yin pas nyes pa 'ba' zhig spyod pa yin pa'i phyir des bstod na ngan song la sogs pa dag tu ltung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, when they praise, one falls into evil destinies, etc.

original: gang gis byis pa nyid reg ces bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni nyes pa nyid du shes te yongs su spangs nas yon tan mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ba khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir bstan to //
analyzed: gang gis byis pa nyid reg ces bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni nyes pa nyid du shes te yongs su spangs nas yon tan mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ba khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir bstan to //
translated: The fool is known as a fool by his lack of skill in action, by his addiction to faults, and by his lack of addiction to virtues.🔽The wise man is known as wise by his skill in action, by his lack of addiction to faults, and by his addiction to virtues.

original: byis pa nyid rig ces bya ba ni bdag nyid byis pa nyid du rig pa'o //🔽de la zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid byis pa nyid yin pa de la'o //
analyzed: byis pa nyid rig ces bya ba ni bdag nyid byis pa nyid du rig pa'o // de la zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid byis pa nyid yin pa de la'o //
translated: The fool is known as a fool by his lack of skill in action, by his addiction to faults, and by his lack of addiction to virtues.🔽The wise man is known as wise by his skill in action, by his lack of addiction to faults, and by his addiction to virtues.🔽The fool is known as a fool by his lack of skill in action, by his addiction to faults, and by his lack of addiction to virtues.🔽The wise man is known as wise by his skill in action, by his lack of addiction to faults, and by his addiction to virtues.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni byis pa nyid du rig pa des na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni byis pa nyid du rig pa des na'o //
translated: The fool is known as a fool by his lack of skill in action, by his addiction to faults, and by his lack of addiction to virtues.🔽The wise man is known as wise by his skill in action, by his lack of addiction to faults, and by his addiction to virtues.

original: mkhas par rlom byed pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid mkhas par nga rgyal byed pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas par rlom byed pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid mkhas par nga rgyal byed pa'o //
translated: The fool is known as a fool by his lack of skill in action, by his addiction to faults, and by his lack of addiction to virtues.🔽The wise man is known as wise by his skill in action, by his lack of addiction to faults, and by his addiction to virtues.🔽The fool is known as a fool by his lack of skill in action, by his addiction to faults, and by his lack of addiction to virtues.🔽The wise man is known as wise by his skill in action, by his lack of addiction to faults, and by his addiction to virtues.

original: de 'dir shin tu byis pa yin zhes bya ba ni mkhas pa ma yin par mkhas par rlom par byed pas mkhas pa las thag ring du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dir shin tu byis pa yin zhes bya ba ni mkhas pa ma yin par mkhas par rlom par byed pas mkhas pa las thag ring du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fool is known as a fool by his lack of skill in action, by his addiction to faults, and by his lack of addiction to virtues.🔽The wise man is known as wise by his skill in action, by his lack of addiction to faults, and by his addiction to virtues.

original: rdul zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags chen po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdul zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags chen po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The fool is known as a fool by his lack of skill in action, by his addiction to

original: dri ma zhes bya ba ni chung du ste shin tu mi mngon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma zhes bya ba ni chung du ste shin tu mi mngon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The so-called “stain” is the lesser, because it is very subtle.

original: nang gi rdul zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi rdul zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The so-called “inner dust” is the fault of passion, etc.

original: phyir rol gyi rdul zhes bya ba ni sa @143b rdul lo //
analyzed: phyir rol gyi rdul zhes bya ba ni sa @143b rdul lo //
translated: The so-called “outer dust” is the dust of the earth.

original: blo la snang bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: blo la snang bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
translated: “Appears to the mind” means it is manifest.

original: rdul 'dir 'dod chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rdul 'dir 'dod chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “This dust is called passion, etc.”

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rdul spangs so //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rdul spangs so //
translated: “This” refers to the dust that is abandoned.

original: dri ma spang ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis po 'di la'o //
analyzed: dri ma spang ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis po 'di la'o //
translated: The two words “stain” and “abandon” are to be supplied.

original: ci phyir zha na /
analyzed: ci phyir zha na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir rdul ni 'dod chags ming ste rdul gyi ming zhes bya ba gsungs te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir rdul ni 'dod chags ming ste rdul gyi ming zhes bya ba gsungs te ;
translated: Therefore, it is said that “dust is the name of passion, the name of dust.”

original: 'di ltar rdul zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dod chags kyi ming yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dod chags kyi ming yin te /
translated: Thus, the word “dust” is the name of passion,

original: rab tu 'byung ba ni de spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba ni de spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the one who goes forth abandons that.

original: rdul zhes bya ba'i sgra sa rdul gyi sgra ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul zhes bya ba'i sgra sa rdul gyi sgra ma yin te /
translated: The word “dust” is not the word for the dust of the earth.

original: gtso bo ma yin pas de spangs kyang dgos pa ci yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo ma yin pas de spangs kyang dgos pa ci yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the main thing, and there is no need to abandon it.

original: de bas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dir rdul zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa yin par dgongs kyi de sa rdul ni ma yin no //🔽de bas na mkhas pa gang gis 'dod chags kyi mtshan nyid rdul de rnam par spangs te rgyud las rtsa ba dang bcas pa 'byin par byed pa'i mkhas pa de dag bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bstan pa la rtag tu bag yod par
analyzed: de bas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dir rdul zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa yin par dgongs kyi de sa rdul ni ma yin no // de bas na mkhas pa gang gis 'dod chags kyi mtshan nyid rdul de rnam par spangs te rgyud las rtsa ba dang bcas pa 'byin par byed pa'i mkhas pa de dag bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bstan pa la rtag tu bag yod par
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One thought that “dust” here means desire, not dust on the ground.🔽Therefore, those wise ones who have abandoned that dust, which is the characteristic of desire, and who have extracted it from the continuum together with its root, they are always heedful

original: 'gyur te rjes su bsgrub pa lhur len par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gyur te rjes su bsgrub pa lhur len par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: in the teaching of the Sugata, the teaching of the āryas’ truths. The meaning is that they are intent on practicing it.

original: zag pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi lta bar mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi lta bar mi nus pa ste /
translated: “Defilement” means that which cannot be borne by oneself.

original: ldog pa'i chos ni ldog pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa'i chos ni ldog pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Dharma of reversal appears as just reversal.

original: zab par snang ba zhes bya ba ni yul de'i shes pa dkon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zab par snang ba zhes bya ba ni yul de'i shes pa dkon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Appearance of profundity” means that the knowledge of that object is rare.

original: mthong bar dka' ba zhes bya ba ni gang dag gis mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa nas mthong ba de dag gis kyang dka' bas mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong bar dka' ba zhes bya ba ni gang dag gis mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa nas mthong ba de dag gis kyang dka' bas mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Difficult to see means that even those who see it see it with difficulty, such as on the path of seeing.

original: rtogs par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni rtogs par byed pa de dag gis kyang bsgom pa'i lam la sogs pa la dka' bas rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni rtogs par byed pa de dag gis kyang bsgom pa'i lam la sogs pa la dka' bas rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Difficult to realize means that even those who realize it realize it with difficulty, such as on the path of cultivation.

original: brtag par mi nus pa zhes bya ba ni byis pa dag gis srid pa tsam du yang brtag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtag par mi nus pa zhes bya ba ni byis pa dag gis srid pa tsam du yang brtag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Incapable of being examined means that fools are incapable of examining it even in terms of mere existence.

original: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni skar mkhan dang rtsis mkhan la sogs pa byis pa'i rtog ges de la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni skar mkhan dang rtsis mkhan la sogs pa byis pa'i rtog ges de la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not the domain of sophists means that sophists, such as astrologers and mathematicians, do not engage in it with their childish sophistry.

original: zhib mo brtags pa mkhas pa mdzangs pas rig par bya ba ni blo zhib mo dag dang blo brtan pa dag dang / bstan bcos mkhas pa'i mkhas pa dang / bstan bcos ma thos kyang sngon goms pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa mdzangs pa dag gis rig par bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhib mo brtags pa mkhas pa mdzangs pas rig par bya ba ni blo zhib mo dag dang blo brtan pa dag dang / bstan bcos mkhas pa'i mkhas pa dang / bstan bcos ma thos kyang sngon goms pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa mdzangs pa dag gis rig par bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “to be known by the wise, the learned, and the discerning” means to be known by those who are wise, learned, and discerning.

original: smas pa zhes bya ba ni sems rab tu bsdangs pa'o //
analyzed: smas pa zhes bya ba ni sems rab tu bsdangs pa'o //
translated: The word “please” means “to be attentive.”

original: lo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi gnas pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: lo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi gnas pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The word “tell” is a non-standard form.

original: gsol lo zhes bya ba ni gsol ba @144a * //
analyzed: gsol lo zhes bya ba ni gsol ba @144a * //
translated: The word “tell” means “to request.”

original: 'debs pa'o // ya mtshan can zhes bya ba ni gzhan mu stegs can rab tu byung ba spyi'i ming yin te /
analyzed: 'debs pa'o // ya mtshan can zhes bya ba ni gzhan mu stegs can rab tu byung ba spyi'i ming yin te /
translated: The word “heretics” is a general term for non-Buddhist renunciants.🔽Why are they called “heretics”?

original: ci'i phyir ya mtshan can zhes bya zhe na 'dul ba rnam par bshad pa las p'a sha na ti ka zhes bya ba ni rdo'i rgyab yin te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ya mtshan can zhes bya zhe na 'dul ba rnam par bshad pa las p'a sha na ti ka zhes bya ba ni rdo'i rgyab yin te /
translated: In the Vinaya Commentary, the word pāśāṇṭika means “one who has a stone on his back.”

original: ji ltar rdo'i rgyab tu sa bon btab pas myu gu skye mi nus pa de bzhin du gzhan mu stegs can dag gis kyang thar pa'i myu gu skyed mi nus pas rdo rgyab pa zhes bya bar gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar rdo'i rgyab tu sa bon btab pas myu gu skye mi nus pa de bzhin du gzhan mu stegs can dag gis kyang thar pa'i myu gu skyed mi nus pas rdo rgyab pa zhes bya bar gsungs so //
translated: Just as a seed planted behind a rock cannot grow, so the tirthikas cannot grow the sprout of liberation.

original: dgu bcu rtsa drug ces bya ba ni rdzogs byed la sogs pa ston pa drug dang / de dag re re las ya mtshan can bco lnga bco lngar gyes pa'i phyir bsdoms na dgu bcu rtsa drug yod pa'o ;
analyzed: dgu bcu rtsa drug ces bya ba ni rdzogs byed la sogs pa ston pa drug dang / de dag re re las ya mtshan can bco lnga bco lngar gyes pa'i phyir bsdoms na dgu bcu rtsa drug yod pa'o ;
translated: The sixty-nine are the six teachers such as Purana, and each of them has fifteen different kinds of heterodoxies, so in total there are sixty-nine.

original: / brid ces bya ba ni bslus pa'o //
analyzed: / brid ces bya ba ni bslus pa'o //
translated: Deceit is deception.

original: tshig gzhan dag ces bya ba ni rdzas kyi mtha' pa dang bya ba'i mtha' ba dag go //🔽yi ge gzhan dag ces bya ba ni tshig 'dra yang yi ge gzhan dag gis so //
analyzed: tshig gzhan dag ces bya ba ni rdzas kyi mtha' pa dang bya ba'i mtha' ba dag go // yi ge gzhan dag ces bya ba ni tshig 'dra yang yi ge gzhan dag gis so //
translated: Other words are the substantialists and the nihilists.🔽Other letters are the same words with different letters.

original: tshig dang yi ge gzhan dag gis zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga dag gis so //
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge gzhan dag gis zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga dag gis so //
translated: Other words and letters are both.

original: lus kyis nyes par spyod pa gsum zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyod pa gsum zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa'o //
translated: The three physical misdeeds are killing, taking what is not given, and sexual misconduct.

original: ngag gis nyes par spyod pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gis nyes par spyod pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal pa'o //
translated: The four verbal misdeeds are lying, slander, harsh speech, and idle talk.

original: yid kyis nyes par spyod pa gsum zhes bya ba ni brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyis nyes par spyod pa gsum zhes bya ba ni brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba'o //
translated: The three mental misdeeds are covetousness, malice, and wrong views.

original: yongs su 'dzin zhes bya ba ni skyon de phung po lnga yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin zhes bya ba ni skyon de phung po lnga yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Possession” means the possession of the aggregates that are the basis of the faults.

original: rjes su bskor to zhes bya ba ni yang bskor ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su bskor to zhes bya ba ni yang bskor ba'o //
translated: “Surrounded” means surrounded by the faults.

original: sems bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni sems yongs su bsgyur ba ste rnon por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni sems yongs su bsgyur ba ste rnon por gyur pa'o //
translated: “Mind turned” means the mind is turned to the faults, that is, it is intent on them.

original: chos 'di lta bu dang ldan pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'i bya ba dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos 'di lta bu dang ldan pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'i bya ba dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Except for those who possess such qualities” means those who are connected with the activity of being disciplined.

original: gang dag bsko bar byed pa de dag la nyes byas su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus dang / tshogs pa dang / gang zag las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag bsko bar byed pa de dag la nyes byas su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus dang / tshogs pa dang / gang zag las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba der 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who ordain her commit an offense means that they incur an offense because they have transgressed the rules regarding place, time, assembly, and person.

original: der bskos pas des dge slong ma la ston pa ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa'i rnam pas byas pa ni ma byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de ma bskos pa nyid yin pas dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der bskos pas des dge slong ma la ston pa ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa'i rnam pas byas pa ni ma byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de ma bskos pa nyid yin pas dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho par 'gyur ro //
translated: If she is ordained by them, then the monk who teaches her incurs a downfall. means that because the act is done in an improper manner, it is as if it were not done. Since she is not ordained, the monk incurs a root downfall.

original: pham par 'gyur ba'i chos brgyad ces bya ba ni thun mong ba bzhi dang / reg pa dang / lus bkan pa dang / 'chab pa dang / zlog pa @144b zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa bzhi ste brgyad do //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba'i chos brgyad ces bya ba ni thun mong ba bzhi dang / reg pa dang / lus bkan pa dang / 'chab pa dang / zlog pa @144b zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa bzhi ste brgyad do //
translated: The eight defeating offenses means the four common defeating offenses and the four uncommon ones: touching, physical contact, concealing, and turning back.

original: lci ba'i chos brgyad ces bya ba ni dge slong rnams las rab tu 'byung ba dang rdzogs par bsnyen pa dge slong ma'i dngos po yongs su btsal ba dang / dge slong rnams la zla ba phyed phyed cing gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa yongs su btsal pa dang /
analyzed: lci ba'i chos brgyad ces bya ba ni dge slong rnams las rab tu 'byung ba dang rdzogs par bsnyen pa dge slong ma'i dngos po yongs su btsal ba dang / dge slong rnams la zla ba phyed phyed cing gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa yongs su btsal pa dang /
translated: To seek advice and instruction from monks every half month,🔽Not to agree to stay in retreat in a place without monks,🔽To request the end of the retreat from both the community of monks and nuns,

original: dge slong med pa'i gnas su dbyar gnas par khas blang bar mi bya ba dang / gnyi ga'i dge 'dun las gnas gsum gyi dgag dbye bya ba dang / dge slong la tshul khrims dang / lta ba dang / cho ga dang / 'tsho ba nyams pas gleng ba dang /
analyzed: dge slong med pa'i gnas su dbyar gnas par khas blang bar mi bya ba dang / gnyi ga'i dge 'dun las gnas gsum gyi dgag dbye bya ba dang / dge slong la tshul khrims dang / lta ba dang / cho ga dang / 'tsho ba nyams pas gleng ba dang /
translated: To not accuse a monk of having faulty morality, view, conduct, or livelihood,🔽To not remind a monk of a transgression,🔽To not scold, be angry, or speak harshly to a monk,

original: dran par mi bya ba dang / dge slong la spyo ba dang / khro ba dang / tshig rtsub po mi bya ba dang / dge slong gsar bu la yang gus par smra ba dang / phyag dang ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyar ba dang /
analyzed: dran par mi bya ba dang / dge slong la spyo ba dang / khro ba dang / tshig rtsub po mi bya ba dang / dge slong gsar bu la yang gus par smra ba dang / phyag dang ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyar ba dang /
translated: And to respectfully speak, bow, rise, and join one’s palms to a new monk.

original: gus pa'i las bya ba dang / lci ba'i chos las 'das pas zla ba phyed du gnyis ka'i dge 'dun la mgu bar bya ba spyad par bya ba'o//
analyzed: gus pa'i las bya ba dang / lci ba'i chos las 'das pas zla ba phyed du gnyis ka'i dge 'dun la mgu bar bya ba spyad par bya ba'o//
translated: and to perform the act of respect and to perform the observance of the community of both for a half month, because he has transgressed the heavy rule.

original: ston pa phyi ma zhes bya ba ni snga ma lta bu mtshams kyi nang na ye med na de'i 'og tu gzod 'di phyis bsko bar bya ba yin pas phyi ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ston pa phyi ma zhes bya ba ni snga ma lta bu mtshams kyi nang na ye med na de'i 'og tu gzod 'di phyis bsko bar bya ba yin pas phyi ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The latter teacher is called the latter because, if there is no former teacher at all within the boundary, then this one is to be appointed later.

original: snga ma gcig tsam zhig yod na yang phyi ma 'di bskos na bsko ba'i dge 'dun la yang nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: snga ma gcig tsam zhig yod na yang phyi ma 'di bskos na bsko ba'i dge 'dun la yang nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: If there is just one former teacher, then if this latter one is appointed, there is an offense of wrong conduct for the Saṅgha that appoints him.

original: de bskos pa'i las kyang mi 'chags la ;
analyzed: de bskos pa'i las kyang mi 'chags la ;
translated: The rite of appointing him is not accomplished.

original: des bstan na yang ltung byed nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des bstan na yang ltung byed nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And if he teaches, there is a downfall.

original: tshogs sam zhes bya ba ni bya ba gcig gam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshogs sam zhes bya ba ni bya ba gcig gam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “The assembly” means “one action.”

original: yongs su dag gam zhes bya ba ni pham par 'gyur ba ma byung ngam /
analyzed: yongs su dag gam zhes bya ba ni pham par 'gyur ba ma byung ngam /
translated: “Is pure” means “has not occurred.”

original: ltung ba gzhan dag kyang bshags pa dang / byin gyis brlab pa gnyis kyis phyir bcos pa byas sam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba gzhan dag kyang bshags pa dang / byin gyis brlab pa gnyis kyis phyir bcos pa byas sam zhes bya'o //
translated: And the other downfalls are confessed and restored by both confession and consecration.

original: mthun nam zhes bya ba ni lta ba mthun nam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthun nam zhes bya ba ni lta ba mthun nam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Are you in harmony? means Are you in agreement?

original: kha na ma tho ba med dam zhes bya ba ni thab mo la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral lam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med dam zhes bya ba ni thab mo la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral lam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Are you without offense? means Are you free from the fault of quarreling, and so on?

original: khyed cag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyis ni khyed cag dge slong ma'i gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa ni dge 'dun kho na las 'thob kyi ji skad bstan pa bzhin du zung la bag yod par sgrubs shig ces bstan to //🔽'bras chan rtsub mo zhes bya ba 'bras rtsub mo'i chan no //
analyzed: khyed cag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyis ni khyed cag dge slong ma'i gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa ni dge 'dun kho na las 'thob kyi ji skad bstan pa bzhin du zung la bag yod par sgrubs shig ces bstan to // 'bras chan rtsub mo zhes bya ba 'bras rtsub mo'i chan no //
translated: The rest of the verse, You who are . . . , and so on, teaches that you should receive the instructions and teachings of the nuns' order, and that you should practice them heedfully, as they are taught.🔽Rough rice means rice that is hard to cook.

original: rtsa bas bskol ba zhes bya ba ni rtsab mo bskol ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa bas bskol ba zhes bya ba ni rtsab mo bskol ba'o //
translated: Boiled with roots means boiled with tubers.

original: rje'u kha gcig la nang gnyis yod pa zhes bya ba ni rdze'u kha gcig la lto gnyis @145a * //
analyzed: rje'u kha gcig la nang gnyis yod pa zhes bya ba ni rdze'u kha gcig la lto gnyis @145a * //
translated: A single vessel with two openings is a single vessel with two mouths.

original: yod pa'o // zho'i tshod ma zhes bya ba ni gzhi zho las blangs pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa'o // zho'i tshod ma zhes bya ba ni gzhi zho las blangs pa'o //
translated: Milk-rice is rice boiled in milk.

original: tshang bang zhes bya ba ni g-yos kyi gnas so //
analyzed: tshang bang zhes bya ba ni g-yos kyi gnas so //
translated: A kitchen is a place for cooking.

original: pho sha'i khu sha zhes bya ba ni sha'i dum bu dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: pho sha'i khu sha zhes bya ba ni sha'i dum bu dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Meat broth is meat with pieces of flesh.

original: bu lon 'phrog pa zhes bya ba ni bu lon ded pa'o //
analyzed: bu lon 'phrog pa zhes bya ba ni bu lon ded pa'o //
translated: To seize a debt is to collect a debt.

original: nor 'phrog pa zhes bya ba ni nor spyod spyod pa'o //
analyzed: nor 'phrog pa zhes bya ba ni nor spyod spyod pa'o //
translated: To seize property is to use property.

original: nye du'i stobs zhes bya ba ni nye du'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: nye du'i stobs zhes bya ba ni nye du'i tha snyad do //
translated: The power of relatives is the convention of relatives.

original: lag stobs zhes bya ba ni 'khal 'thag la sogs pa lag pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: lag stobs zhes bya ba ni 'khal 'thag la sogs pa lag pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: The power of one’s hands is the convention of weaving and so on with one’s hands.

original: gru bo che spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho'i gru bo cher 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gru bo che spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho'i gru bo cher 'jug pa'o //
translated: To engage in seafaring is to enter the great ocean in a ship.

original: bdag nyid 'dzin par zhes bya ba ni srung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'dzin par zhes bya ba ni srung bar byed pa'o //
translated: To be a bodyguard is to be a protector.

original: rin med par zhes bya ba ni rin gyis ma bslus par ro //
analyzed: rin med par zhes bya ba ni rin gyis ma bslus par ro //
translated: Without payment means without being bribed.

original: khur zhes bya ba ni bam po'o //
analyzed: khur zhes bya ba ni bam po'o //
translated: “Burden” means a load.

original: bsdoms te zhes bya ba ni bsdus te'o //
analyzed: bsdoms te zhes bya ba ni bsdus te'o //
translated: “Collected” means gathered.

original: shing gis shing gi zhes bya ba ni snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: shing gis shing gi zhes bya ba ni snying po med pa'o //
translated: “Wood” means without essence.

original: bza' ba'i zong zhes bya ba ni til dang gron dang zhun mar la sogs pa btsong ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: bza' ba'i zong zhes bya ba ni til dang gron dang zhun mar la sogs pa btsong ba'i gnas so //
translated: “Merchandise” means sesame, rice, oil, and so on, which are sold.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni mi'i 'tshe ba nyid do //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni mi'i 'tshe ba nyid do //
translated: “Dharma” means human injury.

original: rigs pas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi tshul gyis so //
analyzed: rigs pas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi tshul gyis so //
translated: “Reason” means by worldly custom.

original: dbyig tshong ba zhes bya ba ni gser dngul 'tshong ba'o //
analyzed: dbyig tshong ba zhes bya ba ni gser dngul 'tshong ba'o //
translated: “Dealer in gold” means a seller of gold and silver.

original: long gtam smra ba zhes bya ba ni rang dgar gtam zer ba'o //
analyzed: long gtam smra ba zhes bya ba ni rang dgar gtam zer ba'o //
translated: “Gossip” means talking at will.

original: glang po che'i gnyar zhon pa zhes bya ba ni glang po che'i rgyab tu zhon pa'o //
analyzed: glang po che'i gnyar zhon pa zhes bya ba ni glang po che'i rgyab tu zhon pa'o //
translated: “Riding an elephant” means riding on the back of an elephant.

original: khyogs spyi la zhes bya ba ni mis bskur ba'o //
analyzed: khyogs spyi la zhes bya ba ni mis bskur ba'o //
translated: “Palanquin” means carried by men.

original: byi dor ba zhes bya ba ni bcos legs byed pa'o ;
analyzed: byi dor ba zhes bya ba ni bcos legs byed pa'o ;
translated: “Barber” means one who does good work.

original: / chu 'phyag par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gru'i nang du 'ongs pa 'phyag par bye pa'o //
analyzed: / chu 'phyag par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gru'i nang du 'ongs pa 'phyag par bye pa'o //
translated: “Washing clothes” means washing clothes that have come into the boat.

original: rin po che chen po zhes bya ba ni rin thang che ba'o //
analyzed: rin po che chen po zhes bya ba ni rin thang che ba'o //
translated: “Great jewel” means of great value.

original: che ba zhes bya ba ni dug la sogs pa sel ba'i mthu che ba'o //
analyzed: che ba zhes bya ba ni dug la sogs pa sel ba'i mthu che ba'o //
translated: “Great” means having the great power to remove poison, etc.

original: mthon por 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni ya rabs kyi rigs 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthon por 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni ya rabs kyi rigs 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Going high” means establishing the family of the virtuous.

original: skal ba can du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu gzhon pa la sogs pa skal ba dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skal ba can du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu gzhon pa la sogs pa skal ba dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Becoming fortunate” means becoming endowed with good fortune, such as being very young, etc.

original: rnam par smin pa bde ba zhes bya ba ni longs spyod che ba la sogs pa'i bde ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa bde ba zhes bya ba ni longs spyod che ba la sogs pa'i bde ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Pleasurable evolution” means producing the pleasure of great wealth, etc.

original: phyi ma la mtho ris su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang brgyud pa dag gis mtho ris su 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma la mtho ris su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang brgyud pa dag gis mtho ris su 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Going to heaven in the future” means establishing heaven directly and indirectly.

original: 'jigs pa chen po zhes bya ba ni srog 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pa chen po zhes bya ba ni srog 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Great fear” means because of the cutting off of life.

original: che ba zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin rgya chen po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: che ba zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin rgya chen po'i phyir ro //
translated: “Great” means because of the vast nature.

original: nya chen dang nya chen mid dang nya chen mid pa mid ces bya ba dag ni /
analyzed: nya chen dang nya chen mid dang nya chen mid pa mid ces bya ba dag ni /
translated: The great fish, the fish-swallower, and the fish-swallower-swallower are

original: nya bo che'i bye brag go //
analyzed: nya bo che'i bye brag go //
translated: different kinds of large fish.

original: chu rlabs zhes bya ba ni rlabs 'phyo ba'o //
analyzed: chu rlabs zhes bya ba ni rlabs 'phyo ba'o //
translated: The waves are the moving water.

original: dba' klong zhes bya ba ni chu @145b 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: dba' klong zhes bya ba ni chu @145b 'khor ba'o //
translated: The whirlpools are the circular motions of the water.

original: ri dag la thug pa zhes bya ba ni gdong thug tu thug pa'o //
analyzed: ri dag la thug pa zhes bya ba ni gdong thug tu thug pa'o //
translated: The mountains are the obstacles.

original: rlung nag po zhes bya ba ni rlung nag po drag pa'o //
analyzed: rlung nag po zhes bya ba ni rlung nag po drag pa'o //
translated: The black wind is the strong black wind.

original: nyag thag gcig bkrol zhing zhes bya ba ni skams la 'dug pa'i phur pa las so //
analyzed: nyag thag gcig bkrol zhing zhes bya ba ni skams la 'dug pa'i phur pa las so //
translated: The single rope is the stake in the dry land.

original: 'gyod pa zhes bya ba ni yid la gcags pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa zhes bya ba ni yid la gcags pa'o //
translated: The regret is the remorse.

original: tho 'tshams pa zhes bya ba ni log pa'i la sogs pa'i byams pa rmongs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tho 'tshams pa zhes bya ba ni log pa'i la sogs pa'i byams pa rmongs par byed pa'o //
translated: The harm is the delusion of the wrong love, etc.

original: rin po che bzhi zhes bya ba ni gser dang / dngul dang / beed'urya dang / shel lo /
analyzed: rin po che bzhi zhes bya ba ni gser dang / dngul dang / beed'urya dang / shel lo /
translated: The four jewels are gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: gcig la gcig sbrel te zhes bya ba ni phan tshun bcings te'o //
analyzed: gcig la gcig sbrel te zhes bya ba ni phan tshun bcings te'o //
translated: The mutual binding is the binding of each other.

original: nub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni log pa'o //
analyzed: nub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni log pa'o //
translated: The sinking is the falling.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed nas zhes bya ba ni 'du shes bcas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bsgom pas so //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed nas zhes bya ba ni 'du shes bcas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bsgom pas so //
translated: Having generated the meditative attainment of non-perception means by cultivating the meditative attainment of perception.

original: gzhan dag kyang yod de zhes bya ba ni sems 'khrug pa la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang yod de zhes bya ba ni sems 'khrug pa la sogs pa dag go //
translated: Others also exist means such things as the disturbance of the mind.

original: stan phyed las 'phags pa byas te zhes bya ni bcom ldan 'das la gus pas stan phyed las 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: stan phyed las 'phags pa byas te zhes bya ni bcom ldan 'das la gus pas stan phyed las 'phags pa'o //
translated: Having risen from half of the seat means having risen from half of the seat out of respect for the Blessed One.

original: bsel dad yon tan ldan zhes bya ba ni bsil ba'i mthu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bsel dad yon tan ldan zhes bya ba ni bsil ba'i mthu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Endowed with the power of coolness means endowed with the power of coolness.

original: dri med gser rtag gsal zhes bya ba ni dri ma med pa'i gser yang rtag tu gsal ba ste /
analyzed: dri med gser rtag gsal zhes bya ba ni dri ma med pa'i gser yang rtag tu gsal ba ste /
translated: Stainless gold is always radiant means stainless gold is always radiant.

original: dper na dag pa'i beed'urya rtag tu 'od gsal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dag pa'i beed'urya rtag tu 'od gsal ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, a pure beryl is always radiant.

original: byis pa'i skye bo kun zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang mi ldan pa'i so so'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo kun zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang mi ldan pa'i so so'i skye bo'o //
translated: All foolish beings means ordinary beings who are not learned.

original: sdig pa rtag tu mtshungs med ces bya ba ni dgra bcom pa dag la sems sdang ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa rtag tu mtshungs med ces bya ba ni dgra bcom pa dag la sems sdang ba'o //
translated: Always equal in sin means having a mind that is hostile to arhats.

original: gor ma'i ri mo rtag pa bzhin zhes bya ba na sems sdang ba brtan pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: gor ma'i ri mo rtag pa bzhin zhes bya ba na sems sdang ba brtan pa nyid du ston to //
translated: “Like the figures on a checkerboard” shows the firmness of the mind of the bodhisattva.

original: 'phags pa'i skye bo zhes bya ba ni bden pa mthong ba dag go //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i skye bo zhes bya ba ni bden pa mthong ba dag go //
translated: “Noble persons” are those who have seen the truth.

original: rtag tu thugs rje mnga' zhes bya ba ni snying rje dang thugs rje chen po gnyis cig car bstan to //
analyzed: rtag tu thugs rje mnga' zhes bya ba ni snying rje dang thugs rje chen po gnyis cig car bstan to //
translated: “Always compassionate” shows both compassion and great compassion.

original: dgra bcom pa dag gi bzod pa brtan pa lags zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dag gi bzod pa brtan pa lags zhes bya ba la /
translated: “The arhats have firm patience”

original: bzod pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis skur ba btab pa la sogs pa bzod pa ste /
analyzed: bzod pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis skur ba btab pa la sogs pa bzod pa ste /
translated: “Patience” is the patience with regard to the abuse, etc., of others.

original: de yang dgra bcom pa dag gi rgyud la rtag tu gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang dgra bcom pa dag gi rgyud la rtag tu gnas pa yin te /
translated: And that is always present in the mental continuum of the arhats.

original: de'i slad du bdag gis byas pa lta bu la bzod pa mdzad du gsol zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i slad du bdag gis byas pa lta bu la bzod pa mdzad du gsol zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is as if I had done it myself.

original: lnga brgya zhes bya ba ni grangs so //
analyzed: lnga brgya zhes bya ba ni grangs so //
translated: “Five hundred” is the number.

original: rta cang shes zhes bya ba ni rta'i gtso bo gces pa'o //
analyzed: rta cang shes zhes bya ba ni rta'i gtso bo gces pa'o //
translated: “A thoroughbred horse” is the best of horses.

original: skad 'byin par mi byed ces bya ba ni de'i mthus zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad 'byin par mi byed ces bya ba ni de'i mthus zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “He does not make a sound” means that he is not overcome by that.

original: rte'u zhes bya ba ni phru gu'o //🔽sna sgra zhes bya ba ni phrva phrva @146a * //
analyzed: rte'u zhes bya ba ni phru gu'o // sna sgra zhes bya ba ni phrva phrva @146a * //
translated: “Calf” means a young one.

original: zer ba'o // rtsva zhes bya ba ni rtsi bo'o //
analyzed: zer ba'o // rtsva zhes bya ba ni rtsi bo'o //
translated: “Grass” means straw.

original: tshangs zhes bya ba ni nas la sogs pa 'bru'o //
analyzed: tshangs zhes bya ba ni nas la sogs pa 'bru'o //
translated: “Grain” means barley, etc.

original: de na gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gnas de na 'khod pa'o //
analyzed: de na gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gnas de na 'khod pa'o //
translated: “Living there” means living in that place.

original: 'dod pa na gnas zhes bya ba ni dga' na'o //🔽sgro ba zhes bya ba ni ko lpags kyi snod do //
analyzed: 'dod pa na gnas zhes bya ba ni dga' na'o // sgro ba zhes bya ba ni ko lpags kyi snod do //
translated: “Living in the desire realm” means living in the desire realm.🔽“Leather bag” means a container made of leather.

original: sran thub ces bya ba ni mo sran sde'u'i phub ma'o ;
analyzed: sran thub ces bya ba ni mo sran sde'u'i phub ma'o ;
translated: “Bean” means a bean.

original: / bzangs chas zhes bya ba ni sran ma dang 'bru ma yos shatha ka dag bkrus te btsos pa'o //
analyzed: / bzangs chas zhes bya ba ni sran ma dang 'bru ma yos shatha ka dag bkrus te btsos pa'o //
translated: “Well-dressed” means beans, grains, and sesame seeds that have been washed and cooked.

original: zil gyis smin pa zhes bya ba ni sbrang rtsis sbrus pa'o //
analyzed: zil gyis smin pa zhes bya ba ni sbrang rtsis sbrus pa'o //
translated: “Over-cooked” means mixed with honey.

original: gser 'bum zhes bya ba ni zho gnyis kyi tshad 'bum mo //
analyzed: gser 'bum zhes bya ba ni zho gnyis kyi tshad 'bum mo //
translated: “One hundred thousand in gold” means one hundred thousand in value.

original: chas zhes bya ba ni 'bru la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chas zhes bya ba ni 'bru la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Goods” means grains, etc.

original: rma'o zhes bya ba ni dri'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rma'o zhes bya ba ni dri'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word mo means to smell.

original: 'dul sbyong ba zhes bya ba ni 'dul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul sbyong ba zhes bya ba ni 'dul bar byed pa'o //
translated: The word tamer means one who tames.

original: mgyogs 'gro zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: mgyogs 'gro zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
translated: The word swift means one who carries.

original: ran chas chu med pa'i rdza mkhan bres sna zhes bya ba ni rdza mkhan gyi bres rtsa dang chas dang chu med pa na'o //🔽mgo ska ma rus pa gas tsam zhes bya ba ni khyod bza' ba dang btung ba med pas mgo skams shing rus pa dang pags pa tsam du gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ran chas chu med pa'i rdza mkhan bres sna zhes bya ba ni rdza mkhan gyi bres rtsa dang chas dang chu med pa na'o // mgo ska ma rus pa gas tsam zhes bya ba ni khyod bza' ba dang btung ba med pas mgo skams shing rus pa dang pags pa tsam du gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word potter's wheel means without water.🔽The word head means bones and skin.🔽The word eating means eating grass cut with one's own teeth.

original: rang sos gtubs pa'i rtsva dag za ba zhes bya ba ni tshong dus la sogs pa dag nas rang gi so dag gis rtsva dang lo tog dag bcad cing za bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rang sos gtubs pa'i rtsva dag za ba zhes bya ba ni tshong dus la sogs pa dag nas rang gi so dag gis rtsva dang lo tog dag bcad cing za bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The word market means having no food and drink.

original: de tshe mang pos bsams ma gyur zhes bya ba ni khyod sngon rte'u tsam dang sa khal pa tsam du bsams pas skye bo mang po dag gis gces par bsams par ma gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de tshe mang pos bsams ma gyur zhes bya ba ni khyod sngon rte'u tsam dang sa khal pa tsam du bsams pas skye bo mang po dag gis gces par bsams par ma gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “At that time, many did not think of you” means that because you were thought of as just a calf and a plow ox, many people did not think of you as precious.

original: de ltar sngon phongs pa dang ma bkur bar nye bar bstan nas da ltar phun sum tshogs pa dang / bkur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar sngon phongs pa dang ma bkur bar nye bar bstan nas da ltar phun sum tshogs pa dang / bkur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the former poverty and lack of respect, in order to teach the present abundance and respect,

original: 'di na mgyogs 'gro stong gi thog 'dren zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te rta bzang po stong phrag gi thu bor byas shing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di na mgyogs 'gro stong gi thog 'dren zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te rta bzang po stong phrag gi thu bor byas shing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: he said, “Here, you are the leader of a thousand swift horses,” and so on. It means that you are made the chief of a thousand excellent horses.

original: rgyal pos chibs ran mchog dag nyer bstabs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal pos rtsva bzang po dag byin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal pos chibs ran mchog dag nyer bstabs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal pos rtsva bzang po dag byin pa'o //
translated: “The king has given you the best fodder” means that the king has given you excellent grass.

original: ci'i phyir mi za ba dris pa bdag la smros zhes bya ba ni de ci'i phyir de mi za ba de /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi za ba dris pa bdag la smros zhes bya ba ni de ci'i phyir de mi za ba de /
translated: “Tell me why you do not eat it” means that for what reason do you not eat that?

original: kho bos 'dris bdag la legs par smros shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kho bos 'dris bdag la legs par smros shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: I will tell you about the one who is well-trained.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni 'dul sbyong bas dris nas so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni 'dul sbyong bas dris nas so //
translated: Then, after the trainer asked,

original: rab mgyogs zhes bya ba ni 'gros rab tu mgyogs pa'o //
analyzed: rab mgyogs zhes bya ba ni 'gros rab tu mgyogs pa'o //
translated: swift means very fast.

original: drang po zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems drang po'o //
analyzed: drang po zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems drang po'o //
translated: Straight means straight body and mind.

original: brtan ldan pa zhes bya ba ni brtson pa @146b dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: brtan ldan pa zhes bya ba ni brtson pa @146b dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Steady means having effort.

original: mi bzod ces bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid kyis 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: mi bzod ces bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid kyis 'khrug pa'o //
translated: Intolerant means agitated internally.

original: 'khrug bcas zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'khrug bcas zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: Agitated means agitated externally.

original: mgyogs 'gro mchog gis ni zhes bya ba ni rta cang shes kyis so //
analyzed: mgyogs 'gro mchog gis ni zhes bya ba ni rta cang shes kyis so //
translated: The best horse means a thoroughbred.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni 'dul sbyong ba la go bar byas pa de las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni 'dul sbyong ba la go bar byas pa de las so //
translated: From that, from what was understood by the trainer.

original: nyer zhi zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid rim pa ma yin pas nyon mongs par byas pa'i nyes pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nyer zhi zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid rim pa ma yin pas nyon mongs par byas pa'i nyes pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Tranquil means the fault of agitating oneself in an improper way is pacified.

original: legs par bsams byas nas zhes byas nas zhes bya ba ni rta rnams kyi nang na gtso bo yin par ngo shes pa'i blo dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: legs par bsams byas nas zhes byas nas zhes bya ba ni rta rnams kyi nang na gtso bo yin par ngo shes pa'i blo dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Having well considered, having well considered, means having the mind that recognizes as the chief of horses.

original: mi mchog ces bya ba ni rgyal ba'i kha lo sgyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mi mchog ces bya ba ni rgyal ba'i kha lo sgyur ba yin no //
translated: The best of men is the charioteer of the Victor.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni ma nor bar shes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni ma nor bar shes pa'o //
translated: The truth is the non-erroneous knowledge.

original: ma rig min zhes bya ba ni khyod kyis kho bo ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma rig min zhes bya ba ni khyod kyis kho bo ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The non-ignorance is the very knowledge of me as I am, that is the meaning.

original: shes na don ci yod ce na /
analyzed: shes na don ci yod ce na /
translated: If one knows, what is the purpose?

original: mkhas pas brnyas nas steng mi rgyu zhing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mkhas pas brnyas nas steng mi rgyu zhing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said, The wise will despise, and will not go on high.

original: mkhas pas brnyas na zhes bya ba ni nga'i yon tan zhes bya ba'i mkhas pa dag gis nga la ma gus shing rta phal gyi thang du chas byin pa la sogs pa byas na'o //
analyzed: mkhas pas brnyas na zhes bya ba ni nga'i yon tan zhes bya ba'i mkhas pa dag gis nga la ma gus shing rta phal gyi thang du chas byin pa la sogs pa byas na'o //
translated: The wise will despise means that the wise who say my virtues will not respect me, and will do such things as give me the price of an ordinary horse.

original: sa steng mi rgyu zhing zhes bya ba ni sa'i steng na 'dug par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: sa steng mi rgyu zhing zhes bya ba ni sa'i steng na 'dug par mi bya ba'o //
translated: Will not go on high means will not stay on the surface of the earth.

original: myur du shi yang bla zhes bya ba ni yon tan rgyus shes bya bas brnyas shing sa'i steng na 'dug pa bas ni myur du shing yang bla zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: myur du shi yang bla zhes bya ba ni yon tan rgyus shes bya bas brnyas shing sa'i steng na 'dug pa bas ni myur du shing yang bla zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: The meaning of better to die quickly is that it is better to die quickly than to be despised by those who know the cause of good qualities and to remain on the ground.

original: / shes pas brnyas pa nas khyod ci'i phyir mi dga' zhe na /
analyzed: / shes pas brnyas pa nas khyod ci'i phyir mi dga' zhe na /
translated: If you are despised by the wise, why are you unhappy?

original: de'i phyir / skye bo ngan pas yun ring brnyas gyur kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / skye bo ngan pas yun ring brnyas gyur kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, Even if a bad person despises for a long time, etc.

original: skye bo ngan pas zhes bya ba ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa nga'i yon tan mi shes pas so //
analyzed: skye bo ngan pas zhes bya ba ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa nga'i yon tan mi shes pas so //
translated: The phrase a bad person refers to a potter, etc., who does not know my good qualities.

original: yun ring gnas gyur kyang zhes bya ba ni yun ring du phub ma dang sran phub la sogs pa byin par gyur kyang ngo //
analyzed: yun ring gnas gyur kyang zhes bya ba ni yun ring du phub ma dang sran phub la sogs pa byin par gyur kyang ngo //
translated: The phrase even if he remains for a long time means even if he gives me chaff, beans, etc., for a long time.

original: gal te yon tan khyod ldan zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dul sbyong ba khyod legs nyes shes pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin na'o //
analyzed: gal te yon tan khyod ldan zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dul sbyong ba khyod legs nyes shes pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin na'o //
translated: If you have good qualities, etc., means if you, the trainer, have the good qualities of knowing right and wrong.

original: de brnyas min zhes bya ba ni skye bo ngan pas yun ring du gnas pa'i grangs su ma brtsi shig / de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: de brnyas min zhes bya ba ni skye bo ngan pas yun ring du gnas pa'i grangs su ma brtsi shig / de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: des nga'i yon tan mi shes so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des nga'i yon tan mi shes so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means he does not know my good qualities.

original: skye bo mdzes pas zhes bya ba ni 'dul sbyong ba khyod la sogs pa nga'i yon tan shes pas so //
analyzed: skye bo mdzes pas zhes bya ba ni 'dul sbyong ba khyod la sogs pa nga'i yon tan shes pas so //
translated: The phrase by a beautiful person means by you, a horse trainer, who knows my good qualities.

original: skad cig brnyas par gyur na zhes bya ba ni skad cig tsam zhig rta phal gyi thang du rtsva la sogs pa byin na'o //🔽zhi ba zhes bya ba ni 'dul @147a * //
analyzed: skad cig brnyas par gyur na zhes bya ba ni skad cig tsam zhig rta phal gyi thang du rtsva la sogs pa byin na'o // zhi ba zhes bya ba ni 'dul @147a * //
translated: The phrase if he is despised for a moment means if he is given grass, etc. for a moment in the pasture of ordinary horses.

original: sbyong ba la bod pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: sbyong ba la bod pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The word peaceful is a Tibetan word for horse trainer.

original: des pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means gentle.

original: gal te yon tan ldan zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dul sbyong ba khyod legs nyes shes pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te yon tan ldan zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dul sbyong ba khyod legs nyes shes pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase if he has good qualities means if you, a horse trainer, have the good qualities of knowing what is right and wrong.

original: de brnyas min zhes bya ba ni skye bo mdzangs pas skad cig brnyas par gyur pa de'i ni brnyas pa'i grangs su rtsis shig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de brnyas min zhes bya ba ni skye bo mdzangs pas skad cig brnyas par gyur pa de'i ni brnyas pa'i grangs su rtsis shig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: des nga'i yon tan shes bzhin du brnyas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des nga'i yon tan shes bzhin du brnyas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because he knows my virtues and still slights me, as if he were saying this.

original: rim pa zhes bya ba ni lam dang grong khyer mdzes par bya ba dang / bsu ba la sogs pa bsnyen bkur bya ba'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa zhes bya ba ni lam dang grong khyer mdzes par bya ba dang / bsu ba la sogs pa bsnyen bkur bya ba'i rim pa'o //
translated: The word order refers to the order of the path and the order of the city, and to the order of the service, such as welcoming.

original: srog shing rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni rtsibs kyi shing bu brgya dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: srog shing rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni rtsibs kyi shing bu brgya dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The word pillar refers to the hundred spokes.

original: rnga yab gser can nor bus sgras pa zhes bya ba ni yu ba gser las byas pa nor bu rin po ches spras pa'o //
analyzed: rnga yab gser can nor bus sgras pa zhes bya ba ni yu ba gser las byas pa nor bu rin po ches spras pa'o //
translated: The word golden refers to the shaft, and the word jewel refers to the gem.

original: 'das pa zhes bya ba ni lam dang grong khyer mdzes par byas pa dang bsu ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa zhes bya ba ni lam dang grong khyer mdzes par byas pa dang bsu ba'o //
translated: The word past refers to the path and the city, and to the service, such as welcoming.

original: lhag ma zhes bya ba ni phyogs de gang du gzhag pa'i phyogs de zangs ma'i glegs bu dag gis g-yogs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma zhes bya ba ni phyogs de gang du gzhag pa'i phyogs de zangs ma'i glegs bu dag gis g-yogs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The “remainder” is the place where that direction is located, which is covered with copper plates, and so on.

original: sa bdag 'dul sbyong bcas pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal po 'dul sbyong ba'i mi dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: sa bdag 'dul sbyong bcas pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal po 'dul sbyong ba'i mi dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The “king with his taming and training” is the king together with his taming and training men.

original: de la chags zhes bya ba ni rta cang shes la dga' zhing drung na 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: de la chags zhes bya ba ni rta cang shes la dga' zhing drung na 'dug pa'o //
translated: “Attached to him” means delighting in the thoroughbred horse and staying near it.

original: shin tu dri zhim byug pa mchog 'chang zhing zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba'i lus gyi bye brag ste shin tu dri zhim po'i byug pa mchog gis byugs pa'i lus dang ldan zhing de na sdod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽sa bdag btsun mo zil dang bzang chas kyi //
analyzed: shin tu dri zhim byug pa mchog 'chang zhing zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba'i lus gyi bye brag ste shin tu dri zhim po'i byug pa mchog gis byugs pa'i lus dang ldan zhing de na sdod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // sa bdag btsun mo zil dang bzang chas kyi //
translated: “Bearing the supreme, very fragrant unguent” is a particular feature of the Victor’s body, which has a body anointed with the supreme, very fragrant unguent, and the meaning is that he stays there.🔽The king, with his queen, outshines

original: snod bkang mgyogs 'gro mchog phyir 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: snod bkang mgyogs 'gro mchog phyir 'dzin par byed /
translated: the vessel filled with good qualities, and holds the supreme swift-walker.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: This is said.

original: rgyal po'i btsun mo dam pas zil dngar gyis sbyin pa'i bzang chas kyis gser gyi snod bkang ste rta cang shes kyi drung na 'dzin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rgyal po'i btsun mo dam pas zil dngar gyis sbyin pa'i bzang chas kyis gser gyi snod bkang ste rta cang shes kyi drung na 'dzin par byed pa ste /
translated: The chief queen, with tears of generosity, filled a golden vessel and held it in front of the thoroughbred horse.

original: 'di yang de la chags pa'i rnam pa gzhan yin na //
analyzed: 'di yang de la chags pa'i rnam pa gzhan yin na //
translated: This is another form of attachment to it.

original: rkang pa gzhag ste zhes bya ba ni gom pa bor te'o //
analyzed: rkang pa gzhag ste zhes bya ba ni gom pa bor te'o //
translated: Placing the foot means taking a step.

original: dus ma yin pa ku mu da'i dus ston zhes bya ba ni glo bur du ku mu da'i dus ston dang 'dra ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: dus ma yin pa ku mu da'i dus ston zhes bya ba ni glo bur du ku mu da'i dus ston dang 'dra ba byas pa'o //
translated: The untimely Kumuda festival means suddenly acting like a Kumuda festival.

original: ma bskos par ston pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu gcig pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: ma bskos par ston pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu gcig pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the twenty-first downfall is finished.

original: // / ae sbye zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge slong ma dag gi ming nas bod pa'o //
analyzed: // / ae sbye zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge slong ma dag gi ming nas bod pa'o //
translated: The e-sva and so forth are the names of the nuns.

original: 'dre ba zhes bya ba ni lan 'ga' mnyam pa'i phyir tshangs par spyod pa dang tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa 'dre ba'o //
analyzed: 'dre ba zhes bya ba ni lan 'ga' mnyam pa'i phyir tshangs par spyod pa dang tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa 'dre ba'o //
translated: Mixing means mixing the pure conduct with the impure conduct, because they are equal once.

original: lhag par 'dre zhes bya ba ni lan @147b 'ga' lhag pa'i phyir tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa shas cher spyod pa'o //
analyzed: lhag par 'dre zhes bya ba ni lan @147b 'ga' lhag pa'i phyir tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa shas cher spyod pa'o //
translated: In particular, a “demon” is one who is not celibate for the most part, because he is not celibate for a long time.

original: mtshan thog thag chos nyan pa la ltung ba med pa ni 'pho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan thog thag chos nyan pa la ltung ba med pa ni 'pho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no offense for listening to the Dharma all night, because there is no transference.

original: gtsug lag khang gi sgo drung du ston pa la ltung ba med pa ni gnas dang nye bas 'phos par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi sgo drung du ston pa la ltung ba med pa ni gnas dang nye bas 'phos par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no offense for listening to the Dharma in the doorway of the temple, because it is near the place and there is no transference.

original: nyi ma nub kyi bar du ston pa'i ltung byad de nyi shu gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: nyi ma nub kyi bar du ston pa'i ltung byad de nyi shu gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the twenty-second downfall.

original: // / zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni zas chung ngu zhig gi phyir te bca' ba la sogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: // / zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni zas chung ngu zhig gi phyir te bca' ba la sogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: For a small amount of food means for a small amount of food, such as for a small amount of cooked food, and so on.

original: zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu gsum pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu gsum pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the twenty-third downfall.

original: // / sred pa spyad pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa mang ba'o //
analyzed: // / sred pa spyad pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa mang ba'o //
translated: The term one who indulges in craving means one who has many desires.

original: rab rlag byung ba la sbyin pa la ltung ba med de /
analyzed: rab rlag byung ba la sbyin pa la ltung ba med de /
translated: There is no offense if one gives to someone who is in the process of being ordained.

original: phongs pa'i dus yin pa'i phyir dang / skyon du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phongs pa'i dus yin pa'i phyir dang / skyon du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is a time of need and because there is no fault.

original: legs par smra ba la sbyin pa la sogs pa ltung ba med pa ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / skyon du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par smra ba la sbyin pa la sogs pa ltung ba med pa ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / skyon du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no offense if one gives to someone who is a good speaker, etc., because this is a cause that is accepted in the world and because there is no fault.

original: gos sbyin pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu bzhi pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gos sbyin pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu bzhi pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the twenty-fourth root downfall, the root downfall that is similar to a root downfall in that it involves giving away the Dharma, is now complete.

original: // / rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba ni ngo shes pa'o //
analyzed: // / rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba ni ngo shes pa'o //
