translated: The term one who is known means one who is recognized.

original: brgyangs te zhes bya ba ni gtan pa bting ste'o //
analyzed: brgyangs te zhes bya ba ni gtan pa bting ste'o //
translated: The term to stretch out means to lay out.

original: byed na zhes bya ba ni 'tshem na'o //
analyzed: byed na zhes bya ba ni 'tshem na'o //
translated: The term to make means to sew.

original: khab srubs brtsams nas mthar zin pa'i bar du byed na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khab srubs brtsams nas mthar zin pa'i bar du byed na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term from the beginning of the needle's hole means from the beginning of the sewing.

original: gos byed pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu lnga pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gos byed pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu lnga pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the twenty-fifth offense with restitution is finished.

original: // / dus zhes bya ba ni dus bya bar brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: // / dus zhes bya ba ni dus bya bar brtsams pa'o //
translated: “Time” means the time when the work is begun.

original: mgo snang tsam zhes bya ba ni thag ring po nas mgo tsam snang ba'o //
analyzed: mgo snang tsam zhes bya ba ni thag ring po nas mgo tsam snang ba'o //
translated: “The head is just visible” means that the head is just visible from a distance.

original: dge slong rnams kyis dge slong ma rnams kyi lam brgyags bskur bar bya zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mtshan tha dad yin pas lag nyar blang ba dang / byin len bya ba'i cho ga de yin no //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis dge slong ma rnams kyi lam brgyags bskur bar bya zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mtshan tha dad yin pas lag nyar blang ba dang / byin len bya ba'i cho ga de yin no //
translated: “The monks should send provisions for the nuns” and so on refers to the ritual for taking possession of and receiving the gifts, since they are of different genders.

original: dge slong ma'i don mthun zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma dang 'dres pa'i don mthun te dge slong ma gcig pus kyang nyes pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i don mthun zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma dang 'dres pa'i don mthun te dge slong ma gcig pus kyang nyes pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “A group of nuns” means a group of nuns mixed with monks, because even a single nun can give rise to an offense.

original: 'thams nas zhes bya ba ni brda byas nas so zhes bya ba 'dus nas so //
analyzed: 'thams nas zhes bya ba ni brda byas nas so zhes bya ba 'dus nas so //
translated: “Embracing” means making a sign.

original: grong rgyang grags kyis bar du tshad pa bdun zhes bya ba ni ltung byed du mar bstan pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: grong rgyang grags kyis bar du tshad pa bdun zhes bya ba ni ltung byed du mar bstan pa'i dpe'o //
translated: “Seven villages apart” is an example of a downfall.

original: grong smos pas ni rgyang grags kyi mtha' bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽dge slong ma dang 'gron lam du 'jug pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu drug pa'i tshig rnam par bshad @148a * //
analyzed: grong smos pas ni rgyang grags kyi mtha' bstan pa'i phyir ro // dge slong ma dang 'gron lam du 'jug pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu drug pa'i tshig rnam par bshad @148a * //
translated: The term village indicates the limit of an earshot.

original: pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: pa rdzogs so /
translated: The twenty-sixth downfall is finished.

original: // / sho gam gcig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gru du ma yin yang sho gam la sogs pa gcig na gcig pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: // / sho gam gcig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gru du ma yin yang sho gam la sogs pa gcig na gcig pa nyid du ston to //
translated: The term “one toll” and so forth indicates that even if there are many boats, they are considered to be one if they pay the same toll and so forth.

original: grong rgyang grags kyis bar du chod pa bdun bdun zhes bya ba ni chu'i nang na 'dug kyang rung chu'i 'gram na 'dug kyang rung bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: grong rgyang grags kyis bar du chod pa bdun bdun zhes bya ba ni chu'i nang na 'dug kyang rung chu'i 'gram na 'dug kyang rung bar shes par bya'o //
translated: The term “seven villages separated by an earshot” means that whether the boats are in the water or on the bank, they should be understood to be separated by seven villages separated by an earshot.

original: yo ba zhes bya ba ni chu'i gzhung yo ba'o //
analyzed: yo ba zhes bya ba ni chu'i gzhung yo ba'o //
translated: The term “crooked” means that the river is winding.

original: gtib chad pa zhes bya ba ni chu klung gi 'gram gtib chad pa nyid do //
analyzed: gtib chad pa zhes bya ba ni chu klung gi 'gram gtib chad pa nyid do //
translated: The term “rapids” means that the river is shallow.

original: dpa' klong zhes bya ba ni chu srubs chen po gcig tu 'khyil zhing 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' klong zhes bya ba ni chu srubs chen po gcig tu 'khyil zhing 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: The term “whirlpool” means that the river is swirling in one place.

original: ru skya zhes bya ba ni gru smad kyi skya ba chen po'o //
analyzed: ru skya zhes bya ba ni gru smad kyi skya ba chen po'o //
translated: The term “oar” means a large oar on the lower part of the boat.

original: gdos pa zhes bya ba ni gsog shing ngo//
analyzed: gdos pa zhes bya ba ni gsog shing ngo//
translated: “A boat” means a raft.

original: ru skya 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rlung g-yor thogs pa'o //
analyzed: ru skya 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rlung g-yor thogs pa'o //
translated: “A boatman” means one who holds a flag.

original: dge slong ma dang lhan cig grur 'jug pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu bdun pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dge slong ma dang lhan cig grur 'jug pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu bdun pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The twenty-seventh case of an offense entailing suspension is finished.

original: // / don gyis na zhes bya ba ni nor dag 'char ka'i yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // / don gyis na zhes bya ba ni nor dag 'char ka'i yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “In fact” means that the wealth belongs to Udayaka.

original: stan la zhes bya ba ni gzhi la'o //
analyzed: stan la zhes bya ba ni gzhi la'o //
translated: “A seat” means a place.

original: sa dang khri dang khri'u la sogs pa gzhi gang yang rung ba la'o //
analyzed: sa dang khri dang khri'u la sogs pa gzhi gang yang rung ba la'o //
translated: Any place, such as the ground, a bed, a bench, or a chair.

original: 'dom gang gi nang zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhir 'dom gang gi nang ngo //
analyzed: 'dom gang gi nang zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhir 'dom gang gi nang ngo //
translated: “A distance of an arrow-flight” means a distance of an arrow-shot in any of the four directions.

original: sgo gang la sogs pa ltung ba med pa ni dben pa nyid ma yin pas lam kha dang 'dra ba'i phyir dngos gzhi med do //
analyzed: sgo gang la sogs pa ltung ba med pa ni dben pa nyid ma yin pas lam kha dang 'dra ba'i phyir dngos gzhi med do //
translated: There is no offense if the place is not secluded, like a road or a crossroads, because it is like an open place.

original: sman 'thag tu 'jug pa ni chos dang ldan pa'i phyir nyes byas kyang med do //
analyzed: sman 'thag tu 'jug pa ni chos dang ldan pa'i phyir nyes byas kyang med do //
translated: There is no offense if one has a nun weave cloth, because it is in accordance with the Dharma.

original: gcig pu 'dug pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu brgyad pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gcig pu 'dug pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu brgyad pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the twenty-eighth downfall that requires confession alone is finished.

original: // / phyag dar dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni phyag dar gyis gang ba'o //
analyzed: // / phyag dar dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni phyag dar gyis gang ba'o //
translated: “With refuse” means filled with refuse.

original: 'greng na zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa ste spyod lam gang yang rung bas lhan cig 'dug na'o //
analyzed: 'greng na zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa ste spyod lam gang yang rung bas lhan cig 'dug na'o //
translated: “Standing” is an example; it means sitting in any posture.

original: gcig pu 'greng ba'i ltung byed de nyi shu dgu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gcig pu 'greng ba'i ltung byed de nyi shu dgu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the twenty-ninth downfall that requires confession alone is finished.

original: // / nga'i smad g-yogs zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis der rab tu byung ba'i tshe gang gi na bza' de dag la stsal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // / nga'i smad g-yogs zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis der rab tu byung ba'i tshe gang gi na bza' de dag la stsal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “My lower robe” means the one that the Blessed One gave to him when he went forth.

original: mtshon gyis dras pa zhes bya ba ni mtshon gyis kha tshar dang phun tshang dag bcad pa'o //
analyzed: mtshon gyis dras pa zhes bya ba ni mtshon gyis kha tshar dang phun tshang dag bcad pa'o //
translated: “Cut with a knife” means cut with a knife to the right.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'od srungs chen pos cang mi smra bas bcom ldan 'das las mnyan to zhes bya ba ni khyim bdag 'og nas 'byung ba de la phan gdags pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan can dag la rkyen gyi dbang gis yi dam brtan du rung ba'i skabs dbye ba gling ba dang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'od srungs chen pos cang mi smra bas bcom ldan 'das las mnyan to zhes bya ba ni khyim bdag 'og nas 'byung ba de la phan gdags pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan can dag la rkyen gyi dbang gis yi dam brtan du rung ba'i skabs dbye ba gling ba dang /
translated: The Venerable Mahakasyapa listened to the Blessed One in silence.

original: bcom @148b ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa rig pa'i phyir te mnyan to //
analyzed: bcom @148b ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa rig pa'i phyir te mnyan to //
translated: The Blessed One said, Because of knowledge, I listened.

original: sh'akya'i bu mo zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu sring ngo //
analyzed: sh'akya'i bu mo zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu sring ngo //
translated: Shakyaputra means a daughter of the Shakyas.

original: dbyig gi gdangs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gser snod ltar sgra mtho zhing zab pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyig gi gdangs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gser snod ltar sgra mtho zhing zab pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Endowed with the sound of wealth means having a voice as deep as a golden vessel.

original: klu'i ming can zhes bya ba ni klu'i rgyal po 'od srungs dang ming mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: klu'i ming can zhes bya ba ni klu'i rgyal po 'od srungs dang ming mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Named Naga means having the same name as the Naga king Kasyapa.

original: sgra thrig thrig zer ba zhes bya ba ni rkang pa gzhag pa'i shugs las byung ba'i sgra'o //
analyzed: sgra thrig thrig zer ba zhes bya ba ni rkang pa gzhag pa'i shugs las byung ba'i sgra'o //
translated: With the sound of tinkle-tinkle means the sound arising from the force of placing the feet.

original: don gyi dbang zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: don gyi dbang zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The “powerful meaning” is the result.

original: snang ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sgo mo mthong ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sgo mo mthong ba'o //
translated: “Appearance” is seeing the door of the Dharma.

original: rab tu byung nas yun ring du lags pa zhes bya ba ni gzhon nu nas tshangs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung nas yun ring du lags pa zhes bya ba ni gzhon nu nas tshangs par spyod pa'o //
translated: “Having gone forth for a long time” is celibacy from youth.

original: tshangs par spyod pa mngon bar spyad pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa mngon bar spyad pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam rtogs pa'o //
translated: “Practicing celibacy” is realizing the noble path.

original: bkur ba zhes bya ba ni yid ches par byas pa'o //
analyzed: bkur ba zhes bya ba ni yid ches par byas pa'o //
translated: “Honored” is having confidence.

original: 'di ni re zhig byung ba yin te zhes bya ba ni dge slong mas klu'i ming can zhes bya ba tsam gyis bsngags pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig byung ba yin te zhes bya ba ni dge slong mas klu'i ming can zhes bya ba tsam gyis bsngags pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “This is what happened” is because the nun praised the one named Nāga merely by name.

original: re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni dge slong mas sbyar du bcug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni dge slong mas sbyar du bcug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “For now, the basis of training for the hearers in the Vinaya is not established” is because the nun did not engage in union.

original: sbyor du bcug ces bya ba ni bskul te sbyor du bcug pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor du bcug ces bya ba ni bskul te sbyor du bcug pa'o //
translated: “Engaged in union” means urged to engage in union.

original: bkra shis zhes bya ba ni nang gi bde ba'o //
analyzed: bkra shis zhes bya ba ni nang gi bde ba'o //
translated: “Auspicious” is inner bliss.

original: bde ba zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi bde ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi bde ba'o //
translated: The so-called happiness is external happiness.

original: sa bon gyi skyin pa zhes bya ba ni sa bon bsab pa tsam mo //🔽gal te khyod kyi tshig snga ma bden na ni phyi ma brdzun la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brdzun du smra ba'i phyir de'i tshig la nges pa ma skyes pas the tshom dang bcas bzhin du mi 'jug pa ste ltung ba dang bcas na mi rung
analyzed: sa bon gyi skyin pa zhes bya ba ni sa bon bsab pa tsam mo // gal te khyod kyi tshig snga ma bden na ni phyi ma brdzun la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brdzun du smra ba'i phyir de'i tshig la nges pa ma skyes pas the tshom dang bcas bzhin du mi 'jug pa ste ltung ba dang bcas na mi rung
translated: The so-called seed-exchange is merely the exchange of seeds.

original: ngo snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: ngo snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: If the former statement is true, the latter is false, etc. means that because of the lie, certainty in his words is not produced. Thus, with doubt, one does not engage. If it is not proper to do so with doubt, one should think, It is not proper to do so with a downfall.

original: sngar khyim du bos pa zhes bya ba ni sngar khyim du mgron du bos zin pa'o //
analyzed: sngar khyim du bos pa zhes bya ba ni sngar khyim du mgron du bos zin pa'o //
translated: Previously invited to the house means previously invited to the house as a guest.

original: tshul khrims kyi sbyor du bcug pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir tshul khrims zhes smos pas ni tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu dgra bcom pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i bar dang bcas pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sbyor du bcug pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir tshul khrims zhes smos pas ni tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu dgra bcom pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i bar dang bcas pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Engaged in the application of morality means that by mentioning morality here, it shows up to the limit of the fruit of morality, which is arhatship.

original: thos pa dang zhes bya ba ni de dag 'thob pa'i thabs bstan to //
analyzed: thos pa dang zhes bya ba ni de dag 'thob pa'i thabs bstan to //
translated: Learning shows the means of attaining those.

original: gang phye zhes bya ba ni nas drus pa'i phye'o //
analyzed: gang phye zhes bya ba ni nas drus pa'i phye'o //
translated: Flour means flour made from barley.

original: tha mar zhes bya ba ni sar pa zhus pa'o //
analyzed: tha mar zhes bya ba ni sar pa zhus pa'o //
translated: At the end means after it has been cooked.

original: 'gyur byed kyi lan tshva zhes bya ba ni dring zhing btso ma yin pa'o //🔽rgyam tsha zhes bya ba ni tsha dkar po'o //
analyzed: 'gyur byed kyi lan tshva zhes bya ba ni dring zhing btso ma yin pa'o // rgyam tsha zhes bya ba ni tsha dkar po'o //
translated: Vinegar means sour and unfermented.🔽Salt is white salt.

original: ba tsha zhes bya ba ni 'bus pa'o //
analyzed: ba tsha zhes bya ba ni 'bus pa'o //
translated: Black salt is salt from a salt mine.

original: rgya mtsho'i tsha zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho'i nang nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i tsha zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho'i nang nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: Sea salt is salt from the ocean.

original: zan spags zhes bya ba ni zan dang lhan cig bza' ba ldum la sogs pa'o /
analyzed: zan spags zhes bya ba ni zan dang lhan cig bza' ba ldum la sogs pa'o /
translated: Cooked rice means vegetables and so on that are eaten together with rice.

original: @149a * // tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni sha tshog go //
analyzed: @149a * // tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni sha tshog go //
translated: Meat is a collection of flesh.

original: btsos pa zhes bya ba ni ju tshe'i rnam pa'o //🔽zho thug ces bya ba ni zho ska'o //
analyzed: btsos pa zhes bya ba ni ju tshe'i rnam pa'o // zho thug ces bya ba ni zho ska'o //
translated: Cooked means the form of jujube.🔽Yogurt is curdled milk.

original: mon khur zhes bya ba ni ba lam mun bu phu the'u'o //🔽brngo tshod zhes bya ba ni ldam ldum gyis brngos pa'i tshod ma'o //
analyzed: mon khur zhes bya ba ni ba lam mun bu phu the'u'o // brngo tshod zhes bya ba ni ldam ldum gyis brngos pa'i tshod ma'o //
translated: Monkhur is a kind of grain.🔽Cooked vegetables means vegetables cooked with a lid.

original: hags tshod ces bya ba ni hvags dang bsres pa'i tshod ma'o //
analyzed: hags tshod ces bya ba ni hvags dang bsres pa'i tshod ma'o //
translated: Cooked greens means vegetables cooked with greens.

original: gal te de shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa nyid du shes bzhin te gzhan du na ma yin no //🔽bden pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni sgro btags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te de shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa nyid du shes bzhin te gzhan du na ma yin no // bden pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni sgro btags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If she knows it is a nun who is the preparer, but does not know it is a nun who is the instigator, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If she knows it is a nun who is both the instigator and the preparer, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If she is unsure that it is a nun who is the instigator, but knows it is a nun who is the preparer, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa za ba'i ltung byed de sum cu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /🔽// / dbyung ba zhes bya ba ni lag pa la sogs pas dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa za ba'i ltung byed de sum cu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so / // / dbyung ba zhes bya ba ni lag pa la sogs pas dbyung ba'o //
translated: If she is unsure that it is a nun who is the preparer, but knows it is a nun who is the instigator, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If she is unsure that it is a nun who is both the instigator and the preparer, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If she does not know that it is a nun who is the instigator, but knows it is a nun who is the preparer, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If she does not know that it is a nun who is the preparer, but knows it is a nun who is the instigator, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If she does not know that it is a nun who is both the instigator and the preparer, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If she does not know that it is a nun who is the instigator, but is unsure that it is a nun who is the preparer, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If she is unsure that it is a nun who is the instigator, but does not know that it is a nun who is the preparer, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If she is unsure that it is a nun who is both the instigator and the preparer, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If she does not know that it is a nun who is the instigator, but is unsure that it is a nun who is the preparer, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: ltung ba zhes bya ba ni 'og tu 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba zhes bya ba ni 'og tu 'gro ba'o //
translated: If she is unsure that it is a nun who is the preparer, but does not know that it is a nun who is the instigator, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: rnam par 'thor ba zhes bya ba ni thad kar 'gro ba'am /🔽sdug bsngal ba'i lus rnam par 'thor ba'o //🔽rnam par 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni 'dor ba ste 'chi 'pho ba'i mtshan ma byung nas skye bo byams pa la sogs pas yongs su spong bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par 'thor ba zhes bya ba ni thad kar 'gro ba'am /🔽sdug bsngal ba'i lus rnam par 'thor ba'o //🔽rnam par 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni 'dor ba ste 'chi 'pho ba'i mtshan ma byung nas skye bo byams pa la sogs pas yongs su spong bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If she is unsure that it is a nun who is both the instigator and the preparer, she commits an

original: tshol ba dang chags pa zhes bya ba ni longs spyod la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshol ba dang chags pa zhes bya ba ni longs spyod la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Seeking and attachment” refers to wealth, etc.

original: gong du khyad par zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gong du khyad par zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Superior” refers to the stream-enterer, etc.

original: cha lnga pa zhes bya ba ni rig pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: cha lnga pa zhes bya ba ni rig pa lnga pa'o //
translated: “Five parts” refers to the five superknowledges.

original: shar gyi lus 'phags zhes bya ba'i gling gi ming ste /
analyzed: shar gyi lus 'phags zhes bya ba'i gling gi ming ste /
translated: The eastern continent is called Videha,

original: 'di nas shar phyogs yin pa'i phyir dang / mi lus 'phags pa dag na gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di nas shar phyogs yin pa'i phyir dang / mi lus 'phags pa dag na gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is east of India, and because the people there have superior bodies.

original: nub kyi ba lang spyod ces bya ba ni 'di nas nub phyogs yin pa'i phyir dang / de na nyo tshong gi tha snyad la ba lang dang spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nub kyi ba lang spyod ces bya ba ni 'di nas nub phyogs yin pa'i phyir dang / de na nyo tshong gi tha snyad la ba lang dang spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The western continent is called Godaniya, because it is west of India, and because the people there conduct their business with cattle.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan zhes bya ba ni 'di nas byang phyogs yin pa'i phyir dang / mi'i seng ge steng na sgra sgrogs pa dag gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan zhes bya ba ni 'di nas byang phyogs yin pa'i phyir dang / mi'i seng ge steng na sgra sgrogs pa dag gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The northern continent is called Kuru, because it is north of India, and because the people there live on the backs of lions.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten mngon par 'grub pa'i tshe na skyes pa'i shing chen po 'dzam bu zhes bya bas mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten mngon par 'grub pa'i tshe na skyes pa'i shing chen po 'dzam bu zhes bya bas mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Jambudvīpa is so called because it is marked by a great tree called Jambu which arises when the world is formed.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dag bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba nyon mongs pa'i dbang du bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dag bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba nyon mongs pa'i dbang du bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Greed, hatred, and delusion should be drawn as the root of affliction because samsara is taught to be under the power of affliction.

original: 'dod chags ni phug ron gyi gzugs sam bud med kyi gzugs su bri zhe sdang ni sbrul gyi gzugs su bri /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni phug ron gyi gzugs sam bud med kyi gzugs su bri zhe sdang ni sbrul gyi gzugs su bri /
translated: Greed is drawn in the form of a pigeon or a woman, hatred is drawn in the form of a snake, and delusion is drawn in the form of a pig.

original: gti mug ni phag gi gzugs su bri'o zhes bya ba 'dul ba rnam par @149b bshad pa las gsungs so //
analyzed: gti mug ni phag gi gzugs su bri'o zhes bya ba 'dul ba rnam par @149b bshad pa las gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in the Vinaya Vyakhya.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs mya ngan las 'das pa'i dkyil 'khor dkar po ston pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba'i thabs ston par mdzad pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs mya ngan las 'das pa'i dkyil 'khor dkar po ston pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba'i thabs ston par mdzad pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The form of the Buddha should be drawn in the mandala of nirvana, which is white, in order to demonstrate the method of deliverance from samsara.

original: rdzus te skye ba'i sems can zhes bya ba ni bar mdo'i srid pa'i sems can no //
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba'i sems can zhes bya ba ni bar mdo'i srid pa'i sems can no //
translated: The term “beings born supernaturally” refers to beings in the intermediate state.

original: zo chun khyud mo'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni ji ltar chu bcu pa'i 'khrul 'khor gyi zo chun khyud mo'i zo ba kha cig 'byung bar byed pa de bzhin du 'gro ba lnga pa'i 'khor lo'i khor khor yug tu rdzus te skyes pa'i sems can 'chi 'pho
analyzed: zo chun khyud mo'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni ji ltar chu bcu pa'i 'khrul 'khor gyi zo chun khyud mo'i zo ba kha cig 'byung bar byed pa de bzhin du 'gro ba lnga pa'i 'khor lo'i khor khor yug tu rdzus te skyes pa'i sems can 'chi 'pho
translated: “In the manner of a waterwheel” means that just as a waterwheel is turned by the buckets being filled and emptied, in the same way, beings born supernaturally in the cycle of the five destinies are born and die.

original: ba dang skye ba dag kyang bri bar bya ste skyo ba bskyed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ba dang skye ba dag kyang bri bar bya ste skyo ba bskyed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “They should be drawn in such a way as to generate disgust” means that they should be drawn in such a way as to generate disgust.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis lugs su 'byung ba dang lugs las zlog pa dag bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'khor bar 'jug pa dang 'khor ba las bzlog pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis lugs su 'byung ba dang lugs las zlog pa dag bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'khor bar 'jug pa dang 'khor ba las bzlog pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: “The twelve members of dependent origination should be drawn in forward and reverse progressions” means that they should be drawn in order to show the cause of entry into cyclic existence and the cause of turning away from cyclic existence.

original: de la ma rig pa ni bud med nyid ma 'dres par bri bar bya'o ;
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ni bud med nyid ma 'dres par bri bar bya'o ;
translated: “Ignorance should be drawn as a woman” means that ignorance should be drawn as a woman who is not beautiful.🔽“The wheel of cyclic existence should be drawn in the middle” means that the wheel of cyclic existence should be drawn in the middle of the twelve members of dependent origination.

original: /'du byad rnams ni rdza mkhan snod dag mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: /'du byad rnams ni rdza mkhan snod dag mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
translated: The compositional factors are the potter creating the vessels.

original: rnam par shes pa ni spre'u'i gzugs su'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni spre'u'i gzugs su'o //
translated: Consciousness is the form of the monkey.

original: ming dang gzugs ni bud med dang skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni bud med dang skyes pa'o //
translated: Name and form are the woman and man.

original: skye mched drug ni skye mched drug po dag yul tha dad pa la chags pa dag go //
analyzed: skye mched drug ni skye mched drug po dag yul tha dad pa la chags pa dag go //
translated: The six sense spheres are the six sense spheres attached to different objects.

original: reg pa ni bud med dang skyes pa lus gyi rig pa kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa ni bud med dang skyes pa lus gyi rig pa kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: Contact is the woman and man engaging in physical contact.

original: tshor ba ni skyes pa sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ni skyes pa sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong bar byed pa'o //
translated: Sensation is the man experiencing the sensation of suffering.

original: sred pa ni bud med bu 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: sred pa ni bud med bu 'tsho ba'o //
translated: Craving is the woman who is pregnant.

original: len pa ni bud med la mngal gnas pa 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: len pa ni bud med la mngal gnas pa 'jug pa'o //
translated: Grasping is the woman who is entering the womb.

original: srid pa ni mang la na gnas pa de nyid 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa ni mang la na gnas pa de nyid 'brang ba'o //
translated: Becoming is the one who is in the womb following after it.

original: skye ba ni 'brangs pa de nyid skye ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni 'brangs pa de nyid skye ba'o //
translated: Birth is the birth of that which is being followed after.

original: rga ba ni skyes pa rgas shing 'khogs pa'o //
analyzed: rga ba ni skyes pa rgas shing 'khogs pa'o //
translated: Aging is the one who is born growing old and decrepit.🔽Death is the death of the man.

original: shi ba ni mi shi ba'i gzugs su bri'o zhes 'dul ba rnam par bshad pa las gsungs so //
analyzed: shi ba ni mi shi ba'i gzugs su bri'o zhes 'dul ba rnam par bshad pa las gsungs so //
translated: This is what is said in the Vinaya Commentary.

original: thams cad ni mi rtag pas gzung bar bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba thams cad la byang chub kyi mthar thug pa man chad la 'ga' yang rtag par gnas pa med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad ni mi rtag pas gzung bar bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba thams cad la byang chub kyi mthar thug pa man chad la 'ga' yang rtag par gnas pa med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All is impermanent, so one should draw near to it and write it down. This is said in order to show that there is no one in all of cyclic existence who remains permanent, up to the end of samsara.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis bri bar bya ba ni 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba'i thabs rgyu dang bcas pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis bri bar bya ba ni 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba'i thabs rgyu dang bcas pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Two verses should be written down, in order to show the means of deliverance from cyclic existence together with its cause.

original: 'jig rten gyi gtam rgyud ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i don dang 'brel ba'i gtam rgyud de ka tam pa'i ri la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi gtam rgyud ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i don dang 'brel ba'i gtam rgyud de ka tam pa'i ri la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The stories of the world are stories connected with worldly matters, such as the story of Katamoras son.

original: @150a * // cher zhes bya ba ni lhag par ro //
analyzed: @150a * // cher zhes bya ba ni lhag par ro //
translated: Great means excessive.

original: ches bsrab pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor bas so //
analyzed: ches bsrab pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor bas so //
translated: Very slight means by application.

original: ches chung ba zhes bya ba ni bsams pas so //
analyzed: ches chung ba zhes bya ba ni bsams pas so //
translated: Very small means by reflection.

original: kun shes pa rtogs par gyur na zhes bya ba ni byang chub rtogs par gyur na'o //
analyzed: kun shes pa rtogs par gyur na zhes bya ba ni byang chub rtogs par gyur na'o //
translated: When one has realized complete knowledge means when one has realized enlightenment.

original: lnga pa tshangs par spyod pa bslab pa'i gzhi dag ces bya ba ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bslab pa'i gzhi lnga yang dag par blangs pa'i dge bsnyen gyi bye brag ste /
analyzed: lnga pa tshangs par spyod pa bslab pa'i gzhi dag ces bya ba ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bslab pa'i gzhi lnga yang dag par blangs pa'i dge bsnyen gyi bye brag ste /
translated: The fifth is called the basis of training in pure conduct. This is a specific type of layperson who has taken the five basic precepts for as long as he lives.🔽Other laypeople take the five basic precepts of abandoning taking life, abandoning taking what is not given, abandoning false speech, abandoning intoxicating fermented liquors which lead to carelessness, and abandoning sex. This person abandons the fifth, sexual activity, which arises from attachment.

original: de la dge bsnyen gzhan ni srog gcod pa spong ba dang / ma byin par len pa spong ba dang / brdzun smra ba spong ba dang / chang dang bcos pa'i chang myos par 'gyur ba bag med pa'i gnas spong ba dang / lnga pa 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa spong ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi dag blangs pa yin gyi 'di ni lnga pa mi tshangs par spyod pa spros pa las byung ba'i chos gtan spangs pa yin pas lnga pa tshangs par spyod ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la dge bsnyen gzhan ni srog gcod pa spong ba dang / ma byin par len pa spong ba dang / brdzun smra ba spong ba dang / chang dang bcos pa'i chang myos par 'gyur ba bag med pa'i gnas spong ba dang / lnga pa 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa spong ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi dag blangs pa yin gyi 'di ni lnga pa mi tshangs par spyod pa spros pa las byung ba'i chos gtan spangs pa yin pas lnga pa tshangs par spyod ces bya ba ste /
translated: This is called the fifth pure conduct.

original: khyim spangs pa'i dge bsnyen bslab pa'i gzhi lnga blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: khyim spangs pa'i dge bsnyen bslab pa'i gzhi lnga blangs pa yin no //
translated: This is a layperson who has abandoned the household life and taken the five basic precepts.

original: skra yengs zhes bya ba ni skra dag 'dzings pa'o //
analyzed: skra yengs zhes bya ba ni skra dag 'dzings pa'o //
translated: Hair matted means matted hair.

original: khyim gcig pa zhes bya ba ni khang pa slong ba'o //
analyzed: khyim gcig pa zhes bya ba ni khang pa slong ba'o //
translated: “One who lives in the same house” is one who begs for a house.

original: gsar du dul ba zhes bya ba ni dang por zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gsar du dul ba zhes bya ba ni dang por zhugs pa'o //
translated: “One who is newly disciplined” is one who has just entered the order.

original: snod spyad ces bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snod spyad ces bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Utensils” are magical powers, etc.

original: gnas mal zhes bya ba ni khye'u la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas mal zhes bya ba ni khye'u la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Beds and seats” are boys, etc.

original: lhag pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni 'jur lhag pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni 'jur lhag pa'o //
translated: “Extra Dharma” is extra money.

original: de ni me tog gi yin gyi zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i dbang phyug go //
analyzed: de ni me tog gi yin gyi zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i dbang phyug go //
translated: “This is the flower” is the lord of cyclic existence.

original: 'bras bu gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: “Another fruit will arise” is the fruit of the undefiled stream-enterer, etc., which is a supramundane fruit.

original: grong khyer gyi tshong dpon zhes bya ba ni grong khyer na gnas pa thams cad kyi tshong pa rnams kyi dpon po'o //
analyzed: grong khyer gyi tshong dpon zhes bya ba ni grong khyer na gnas pa thams cad kyi tshong pa rnams kyi dpon po'o //
translated: “The head merchant of the city” is the chief of all the merchants who live in the city.

original: bsod nams che bar grags pa zhes bya ba ni bsod nams lhag pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams che bar grags pa zhes bya ba ni bsod nams lhag pa'o //
translated: “Renowned for his great merit” is one who has superior merit.

original: 'phral la zhes bya ba ni rim pa ma yin par yin te myur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'phral la zhes bya ba ni rim pa ma yin par yin te myur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Immediately means not in order, that is, quickly.

original: mngon par mtho bas zhes bya ba ni dar ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par mtho bas zhes bya ba ni dar ba'o //
translated: By prosperity is meant flourishing.

original: dpal gyis 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni shin pa bzang po'o //
analyzed: dpal gyis 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni shin pa bzang po'o //
translated: By wealth is meant good fortune.

original: 'di ni re zhig byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni mgron du pos pas gnyis pa zos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni mgron du pos pas gnyis pa zos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is what happened means this is what happened to him because he ate the second invitation.

original: re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dag kha zer bar ma gyur pas tshul dang mi mthun pa ma skyes pa dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dag kha zer bar ma gyur pas tshul dang mi mthun pa ma skyes pa dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha did not immediately establish a precept for the disciples in the Vinaya, thinking, Let the unpleasantness that has not arisen not arise.

original: aa mra na'i khur ba zhes bya ba'i aa mra'i @150b 'bras bu gzhon nu dag las byas pa'i bca' ba'o //
analyzed: aa mra na'i khur ba zhes bya ba'i aa mra'i @150b 'bras bu gzhon nu dag las byas pa'i bca' ba'o //
translated: The word cake means a confection made from unripe mango fruit.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bzhed ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das dang mi nye ba na khyim bdag drag shul can gyi tshul dang mi mthun par smod par nus kyi gzhan du na mi nus pas de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das der ma gshegs so zhes bya bar
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bzhed ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das dang mi nye ba na khyim bdag drag shul can gyi tshul dang mi mthun par smod par nus kyi gzhan du na mi nus pas de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das der ma gshegs so zhes bya bar
translated: The phrase “they assert that the bases of training should be established” means that the Buddha did not go to the house of the householder Caṇḍa because he was not able to criticize the householder’s conduct in a way that would be acceptable to him, since the householder was not in the presence of the Buddha.

original: bsams so ; / klan ka zhes bya ba ni gleng ba'o //
analyzed: bsams so ; / klan ka zhes bya ba ni gleng ba'o //
translated: The phrase “he would find fault with him” means that he would criticize him.

original: spyos zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: spyos zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'o //
translated: The phrase “he would scold him” means that he would reproach him.

original: yang yang za ba zhes bya ba ni gong nas gong du mgron du bos pa'i zas za ba'o //
analyzed: yang yang za ba zhes bya ba ni gong nas gong du mgron du bos pa'i zas za ba'o //
translated: The phrase “he would eat again and again” means that he would eat the food that had been offered to him again and again.

original: gcig tu brtson par bgyi ba zhes bya ba ni nges par brtsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: gcig tu brtson par bgyi ba zhes bya ba ni nges par brtsal bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase “he should strive single-mindedly” means that he should strive with certainty.

original: dge 'dun bkrabs pa dag ces bya ba ni bsngos pa dag go //🔽zan gcad pa bsgrubs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge 'dun bkrabs pa dag ces bya ba ni bsngos pa dag go // zan gcad pa bsgrubs zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “the Saṅgha that had been invited” means the Saṅgha that had been dedicated.🔽The phrase “he would observe the fast” means that he would perform the fast.

original: bsgrubs zhes bya ba ni byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsgrubs zhes bya ba ni byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “he would perform” means that he would do.

original: ngos kyi khyim tshes dag ces bya ba ni ngos kyi phyogs dag na 'khod pa'i sdum tshes dag go //
analyzed: ngos kyi khyim tshes dag ces bya ba ni ngos kyi phyogs dag na 'khod pa'i sdum tshes dag go //
translated: My neighbors are the neighbors in my area.

original: phyag dar re lde tsam zhes bya ba ni khru bzhi tsam phyags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyag dar re lde tsam zhes bya ba ni khru bzhi tsam phyags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: A broom is the size of four cubits.

original: ba mal zhes bya ba ni pa lang gcig gi gnas nas so //🔽de'i phyed du song ste phyir log ces bya ba ni dpag tshad phyed kyi phyed du song ste phyir log na ste /
analyzed: ba mal zhes bya ba ni pa lang gcig gi gnas nas so // de'i phyed du song ste phyir log ces bya ba ni dpag tshad phyed kyi phyed du song ste phyir log na ste /
translated: A cowpen is the size of a cow’s living space.

original: dpag tshad kyi bzhi char song zhing phyir yang log na'o //
analyzed: dpag tshad kyi bzhi char song zhing phyir yang log na'o //
translated: Having gone half the distance, he turns back: having gone half the distance of a half-league, he turns back.🔽Having gone the whole league and turned back: having gone the whole league and turned back.

original: ras yug phran nam ras yug chen po thob na zhes bya ba ni khru gang gi tshad yan chad do //
analyzed: ras yug phran nam ras yug chen po thob na zhes bya ba ni khru gang gi tshad yan chad do //
translated: If he obtains a small or large piece of cloth: more than one cubit.

original: gos dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gos yod pa'o //
analyzed: gos dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gos yod pa'o //
translated: With cloth: with cloth.

original: gos med pa zhes bya ba ni gos kyis stongs pa'o //
analyzed: gos med pa zhes bya ba ni gos kyis stongs pa'o //
translated: Without cloth: without cloth.

original: gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gos kyang yod cing gos kyi rin yang yod pa'o //
analyzed: gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gos kyang yod cing gos kyi rin yang yod pa'o //
translated: With cloth and the price of cloth: with cloth and with the price of cloth.

original: gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med pa zhes bya ba ni gos kyis kyang stongs shing gos kyi rin gyis kyang stong pa'o ;🔽/ de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas snga ma gos dang bcas shing gnyis pa gos dang bcas pa'am gos med pa'am /
analyzed: gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med pa zhes bya ba ni gos kyis kyang stongs shing gos kyi rin gyis kyang stong pa'o ; / de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas snga ma gos dang bcas shing gnyis pa gos dang bcas pa'am gos med pa'am /
translated: Lacking clothing and lacking the price of clothing means empty of clothing and empty of the price of clothing.🔽The first one is wearing clothing and the second one is wearing clothing or not wearing clothing.

original: gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas pa'am gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med pa'i mu bzhi pa gcig dang / snga ma gos med cing gnyis pa yang gos med pa dang gos dang bcas pa 'am /🔽gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang bcas pa'am /🔽gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med pa'i mu bzhi pa gcig dang / snga ma gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas shing /🔽gnyis pa yang gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas @151a * //
analyzed: gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas pa'am gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med pa'i mu bzhi pa gcig dang / snga ma gos med cing gnyis pa yang gos med pa dang gos dang bcas pa 'am / gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang bcas pa'am / gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med pa'i mu bzhi pa gcig dang / snga ma gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas shing / gnyis pa yang gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas @151a * //
translated: The second one is wearing clothing or not wearing clothing.🔽The first one is wearing clothing and the second one is wearing clothing or not wearing clothing.

original: pa'am ; gos dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: pa'am ; gos dang bcas pa'am /
translated: The first one is wearing clothing and the second one is wearing clothing or not wearing clothing.

original: gos med pa 'am /
analyzed: gos med pa 'am /
translated: The first one is wearing clothing and the second one is wearing clothing or not wearing clothing.

original: gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med pa'i mu bzhi pa gcig dang / snga ma gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med cing gnyis pa yang gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med pa 'am /
analyzed: gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med pa'i mu bzhi pa gcig dang / snga ma gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med cing gnyis pa yang gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med pa 'am /
translated: There is one possibility that is both not having robes and not having the price of robes,

original: gos dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: gos dang bcas pa'am /
translated: or having robes,

original: gos med pa'am gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas pa'i mu bzhi pa gcig ste /
analyzed: gos med pa'am gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas pa'i mu bzhi pa gcig ste /
translated: or not having robes, or having robes and having the price of robes.

original: spyir mu bzhi pa bzhi bstan to //🔽gnyis pa spang bar bya ba 'am /
analyzed: spyir mu bzhi pa bzhi bstan to // gnyis pa spang bar bya ba 'am /
translated: In general, four possibilities are taught.🔽The second is to be abandoned or given to another.

original: gzhan la sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yang gos med pa dang / gos kyi rin yang med pa nyid yin na nyes byas dang ltung byed du 'gyur bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yang gos med pa dang / gos kyi rin yang med pa nyid yin na nyes byas dang ltung byed du 'gyur bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: If the second is both not having robes and not having the price of robes, it is to be abandoned because it would be a wrong action and a downfall.

original: snga ma ni ltung ba med ces bya ba ni gos dang bcas pa'am /🔽gos med pa'am gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas pa 'am /
analyzed: snga ma ni ltung ba med ces bya ba ni gos dang bcas pa'am / gos med pa'am gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas pa 'am /
translated: The first is said to be without downfall.🔽If one has robes,🔽or does not have robes, or has robes and has the price of robes,

original: gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med pa gang yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med pa gang yin yang rung ste /
translated: or does not have robes and does not have the price of robes,

original: dang po yin pas de la yang yang za ba'i nyes par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po yin pas de la yang yang za ba'i nyes par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the first, there is no fault in eating it again and again.

original: yang yang za ba'i ltung byed de sum cu gcig pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: yang yang za ba'i ltung byed de sum cu gcig pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The thirty-first downfall, that of eating again and again, has been explained.

original: // /'dug gnas so zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa dang gzhan mu stegs can dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams kyi gnas thun mong ngo //
analyzed: // /'dug gnas so zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa dang gzhan mu stegs can dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams kyi gnas thun mong ngo //
translated: A dwelling place means a place shared by Buddhists and non-Buddhists, ascetics and brahmins.

original: cho 'phrul chen po zhes bya ba ni sems can sdud par mdzad pa'i ya mtshan bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: cho 'phrul chen po zhes bya ba ni sems can sdud par mdzad pa'i ya mtshan bla na med pa'o //
translated: Great miracle means the unsurpassed wonder of attracting sentient beings.

original: tshar gcad ces bya ba ni bsdigs pa'o //
analyzed: tshar gcad ces bya ba ni bsdigs pa'o //
translated: To subdue means to threaten.

original: kun du dga' bar mdzad ces bya ba ni rab tu dad par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: kun du dga' bar mdzad ces bya ba ni rab tu dad par mdzad pa'o //
translated: To delight means to inspire faith.

original: rangs par mdzad ces bya ba ni tha mal bar gnas par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rangs par mdzad ces bya ba ni tha mal bar gnas par mdzad pa'o //
translated: To please means to make them remain ordinary.

original: chos thob par gyur cig ces bya ba ni shis pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: chos thob par gyur cig ces bya ba ni shis pa brjod pa'o //
translated: May they obtain the Dharma means to utter words of auspiciousness.

original: ngo tsha dang khrel yod bor ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gnyis ka la ltos pa'i 'dzem pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha dang khrel yod bor ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gnyis ka la ltos pa'i 'dzem pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The phrase having abandoned shame and abashment means being devoid of the sense of shame and abashment that is directed toward both oneself and the world.

original: tshva sgo can zhes bya ba ni log par g-yem pa ste yon tan gyi zhing nyid la byas pa lta bu'i 'bras bu mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshva sgo can zhes bya ba ni log par g-yem pa ste yon tan gyi zhing nyid la byas pa lta bu'i 'bras bu mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase having a salty taste means that the result of sexual misconduct does not produce a virtuous field, just as salt does not produce a good-tasting sprout.

original: dgon dung zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha med pa'i sgrib pas zil gyis non pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgon dung zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha med pa'i sgrib pas zil gyis non pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase a wilderness means that one is overcome by the obscurations of shamelessness.

original: tha chad ces bya ba ni dam pa rnams kyis smad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha chad ces bya ba ni dam pa rnams kyis smad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase a vile thing means that it is despised by the holy ones.

original: sdig pa can gyis gzhi zhes bya ba ni dam pa ma yin pa'i chos nyan pa la sogs pa don med pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdig pa can gyis gzhi zhes bya ba ni dam pa ma yin pa'i chos nyan pa la sogs pa don med pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase a basis for sin means that it is the cause of meaningless activities, such as listening to the teachings of non-Buddhists.

original: phri zhes bya ba ni gcad pa'o //
analyzed: phri zhes bya ba ni gcad pa'o //
translated: The phrase cut it off means to eliminate it.

original: shes pa can rem cig ces bya ba ni brda'i tshig ste brdeg go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes pa can rem cig ces bya ba ni brda'i tshig ste brdeg go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase you who are wise is a conventional expression that means you who are wise, strike it!

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag shin tu rim @151b cig ces bya ba ni drug sde dag gi brda'i tshig ste de ngag brdeg par bskul ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag shin tu rim @151b cig ces bya ba ni drug sde dag gi brda'i tshig ste de ngag brdeg par bskul ba'i tshig go //
translated: “You are very slow,” Venerable Ones, is a code word of the group of six, which is a word urging them to be quiet.

original: dge sbyong g-yul 'gyed pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba dag rdol thabs 'gyed pas so //
analyzed: dge sbyong g-yul 'gyed pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba dag rdol thabs 'gyed pas so //
translated: “The ascetics are fighting” means that the renunciates are fighting with abusive words.

original: char 'bab par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba rdol thabs 'gyed pa ngo mtshar che bar snang ba las bsams so //
analyzed: char 'bab par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba rdol thabs 'gyed pa ngo mtshar che bar snang ba las bsams so //
translated: “It will rain” means that it is amazing that the renunciates are fighting with abusive words.

original: me ma dag zhi bar ma gyur cing ces bya ba ni me ma shi ba'o //
analyzed: me ma dag zhi bar ma gyur cing ces bya ba ni me ma shi ba'o //
translated: “The fires have not been extinguished” means that the fires have not gone out.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i bstan bcos klog pa ste med par lta ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i bstan bcos klog pa ste med par lta ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “The Lokāyatas” means the reading of the treatises of the Lokāyatas, which means the view of non-existence.

original: 'gyed 'dod ces bya ba ni rtsod par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyed 'dod ces bya ba ni rtsod par 'dod pa'o //
translated: “Desire to fight” means desire to dispute.

original: 'gyed pa yo byad ces bya ba ni 'gyed pa'i tshogs te shang lang dang gzu bo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyed pa yo byad ces bya ba ni 'gyed pa'i tshogs te shang lang dang gzu bo la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Fighting equipment” means the assembly for fighting, such as sticks and clubs.

original: kho bo khyod dang lhan cig 'gyed par mi 'dod kyi zhes bya ba ni kho bo dang 'gyed pas 'dul ba ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: kho bo khyod dang lhan cig 'gyed par mi 'dod kyi zhes bya ba ni kho bo dang 'gyed pas 'dul ba ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: I do not wish to debate with you means I do not wish to debate with you because you are not to be disciplined by debate.

original: 'gyed pa lhag ma dang bcas par btang zhes bya ba ni de'i phyogs thams cad du sun ma phyung bar btang bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gyed pa lhag ma dang bcas par btang zhes bya ba ni de'i phyogs thams cad du sun ma phyung bar btang bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He gave up the debate with an incomplete victory means that he gave up the debate without completely defeating him in every way.

original: tshogs can gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la ltos nas tshogs dang spyod pa gnyis pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshogs can gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la ltos nas tshogs dang spyod pa gnyis pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The second assembly means that it was the second assembly in relation to the Tathagata, that is, in relation to the Buddha.

original: chos kyi dmag dpon zhes bya ba ni lam gyi chos dang bshad pa'i chos kyi yongs su 'dren pa ste yang dag par rjes su bsrung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dmag dpon zhes bya ba ni lam gyi chos dang bshad pa'i chos kyi yongs su 'dren pa ste yang dag par rjes su bsrung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The general of the Dharma means the leader of the Dharma of the path and the Dharma of the scriptures, because he perfectly protects them.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo rjes bskor ba //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo rjes bskor ba //
translated: The wheel of the Dharma was turned by the Lord in the Deer Park at Ṛṣivadana in Bārāṇasī.

original: zhes bya ba ni lam gyi mtshan nyid kyi chos kyi 'khor lo dang po bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul ba'i rgyud dag la 'jug par mdzad pa de phyis 'dis yang 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lam gyi mtshan nyid kyi chos kyi 'khor lo dang po bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul ba'i rgyud dag la 'jug par mdzad pa de phyis 'dis yang 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because this wheel of the Dharma, which has the characteristics of the path, was first set in motion by the Lord in the mindstreams of those to be guided, and it is set in motion again by this wheel.

original: rig pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos so //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos so //
translated: The “fields of knowledge” are the treatises.

original: dbyug pa'i rig pa zhes bya ba ni dbyug pa dag gis brdeg pas so ;
analyzed: dbyug pa'i rig pa zhes bya ba ni dbyug pa dag gis brdeg pas so ;
translated: The “science of the stick” is the science of striking with sticks.

original: / lus la chos bshad ces bya ba ni lus gnang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: / lus la chos bshad ces bya ba ni lus gnang bar bya ba'o //
translated: “Explaining the Dharma to the body” means giving the body.

original: 'dug gnas gcig tu zhes bya ba ni mang po dag gi gnas thun mong ba gcig tu'o //
analyzed: 'dug gnas gcig tu zhes bya ba ni mang po dag gi gnas thun mong ba gcig tu'o //
translated: “In one dwelling place” means in one place that is shared by many.

original: gdugs tshod yol zhes bya ba ni zan gyi dus las so //
analyzed: gdugs tshod yol zhes bya ba ni zan gyi dus las so //
translated: “After the meal” means after the time for eating.

original: pus 'khyud ces bya ba ni rked chings so //
analyzed: pus 'khyud ces bya ba ni rked chings so //
translated: “Waist-band” means belt.

original: der gnas shing zhes bya ba ni nub gnyis par ro //
analyzed: der gnas shing zhes bya ba ni nub gnyis par ro //
translated: “Staying there” means for two nights.

original: der gnas pa la nyes byas su 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gnas pa tsam gyis longs spyod yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur bas nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der gnas pa la nyes byas su 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gnas pa tsam gyis longs spyod yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur bas nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase “there is an offense of wrong conduct for staying there” means that there is an offense of wrong conduct because merely staying there does not complete the enjoyment.

original: der za ba la ltung byed du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni za bas longs spyod yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dngos gzhi nyid do //🔽tshogs kyi zhes bya ba @152a * //
analyzed: der za ba la ltung byed du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni za bas longs spyod yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dngos gzhi nyid do // tshogs kyi zhes bya ba @152a * //
translated: The phrase “there is a downfall for eating there” means that eating there is a basis of a downfall because it completes the enjoyment.

original: ni tshogs kyi 'dug gnas te rab tu byung ba'i tshogs kha cig rnam par bcad pa la phul ba'i 'dug gnas yin na thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir de la mi mthun par mi 'gyur bas ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ni tshogs kyi 'dug gnas te rab tu byung ba'i tshogs kha cig rnam par bcad pa la phul ba'i 'dug gnas yin na thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir de la mi mthun par mi 'gyur bas ltung ba med do //
translated: The phrase “in a community” means in a community dwelling. If a dwelling is offered to a group of renunciates who have been excluded, there is no offense because it is not shared.

original: nye du'i zhes bya ba ni nye dus byed du bcug pa'i 'dug gnas te /
analyzed: nye du'i zhes bya ba ni nye dus byed du bcug pa'i 'dug gnas te /
translated: The phrase “in a relative’s” means in a dwelling that has been built by a relative.

original: de la bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de la mi mthun par mi 'gyur bas ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de la bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de la mi mthun par mi 'gyur bas ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense because it is one’s own.

original: sbyin bdag na re de nyid du 'dug shig ces zer ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: sbyin bdag na re de nyid du 'dug shig ces zer ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the host says, “Stay here.”

original: der sbyin bdag gis mgron du bos na de der gang zag nyid du 'gyur bas thun mong pa'i phyir ltung ba med do //
analyzed: der sbyin bdag gis mgron du bos na de der gang zag nyid du 'gyur bas thun mong pa'i phyir ltung ba med do //
translated: If the host invites him to a meal, he becomes a person who is there, and so there is no offense because it is shared.

original: 'dug gnas su za ba'i ltung byed de sum cu gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'dug gnas su za ba'i ltung byed de sum cu gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The thirty-second downfall is finished.

original: // / rtsub pa'i ri zhes bya ba ni ri rtsub mo mi mnyam pa ste des ni byang lam gyi ri rtsub mo dag gi nyes pa brjod do //
analyzed: // / rtsub pa'i ri zhes bya ba ni ri rtsub mo mi mnyam pa ste des ni byang lam gyi ri rtsub mo dag gi nyes pa brjod do //
translated: The “rough mountain” is an uneven mountain. This refers to the fault of the rough mountain paths of the northern route.

original: 'dir rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the cause, it is said:

original: rtsub pa'i ri dag ji bzhin du //🔽ri la 'khod pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rtsub pa'i ri dag ji bzhin du // ri la 'khod pa'ang de bzhin no //
translated: “Just like the rough mountain,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the people on the mountain are also like that.”

original: 'dis ni byang lam gyi ri rtsub po dag ji lta ba bzhin du ri la 'khod pa'i mi dag kyang de bzhin no zhes byang lam pa'i tshong pa dag la mdza' gcugs kyi 'jam pa nyid med par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni byang lam gyi ri rtsub po dag ji lta ba bzhin du ri la 'khod pa'i mi dag kyang de bzhin no zhes byang lam pa'i tshong pa dag la mdza' gcugs kyi 'jam pa nyid med par bstan to //
translated: This teaches that the people on the mountain are just like the rough mountain paths of the northern route. It teaches that the merchants on the northern route are not friendly and gentle.

original: bcos med mdza' gcugs can nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcos med mdza' gcugs can nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that they are not friendly and gentle, it is said:

original: ri la 'khod pa dang por ni //
analyzed: ri la 'khod pa dang por ni //
translated: The first to settle in the mountains

original: gser dag bdar ba ji bzhin te //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gser dag bdar ba ji bzhin te // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: are like gold that is being refined.

original: ri la 'khod pa'i mi byang lam pa ri khrod pa dag ni dang po mthong ba'i tshe na gser bzang bdar gyis bdar ba mdzes shing 'od chags pa bzhin du tshig 'jam pa dang lus kyi tshul gus par ston to //
analyzed: ri la 'khod pa'i mi byang lam pa ri khrod pa dag ni dang po mthong ba'i tshe na gser bzang bdar gyis bdar ba mdzes shing 'od chags pa bzhin du tshig 'jam pa dang lus kyi tshul gus par ston to //
translated: The first to settle in the mountains, the forest dwellers on the path of the Bodhisattva, when seen, are like beautiful, shining refined gold. They show themselves to be gentle in speech and respectful in manner.

original: mi la 'tshe ba rnam brtags na //
analyzed: mi la 'tshe ba rnam brtags na //
translated: When one examines people who are harmful,

original: ri dag ji ltar de bzhin no//
analyzed: ri dag ji ltar de bzhin no//
translated: they are like mountains.

original: zhes bya ba ni byang lam pa'i tshong pa kha byams shing snying sdang ba'i mi la 'tshe ba dag ni gzhan gyis bag phab ste rang bzhin ji 'dra ba rnam par brtags na ri dag brkos shing brtags na nang na dbyig la sogs pa'i snying po ji yang
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang lam pa'i tshong pa kha byams shing snying sdang ba'i mi la 'tshe ba dag ni gzhan gyis bag phab ste rang bzhin ji 'dra ba rnam par brtags na ri dag brkos shing brtags na nang na dbyig la sogs pa'i snying po ji yang
translated: When one examines people who are harmful, who are not friendly and are hostile, and who are on the path of the Bodhisattva, like merchants, if one relaxes and examines their nature, they are like mountains. When one digs into and examines mountains, there is no essence of gold or anything else inside.

original: med do // sa rdul dang rdo ba la sogs pa byung ba bzhin du mdza' gcugs kyi gzugs mad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: med do // sa rdul dang rdo ba la sogs pa byung ba bzhin du mdza' gcugs kyi gzugs mad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are just earth, dust, rocks, and so forth. This is the meaning of the statement, “The form of a friend is false.”

original: thab snod lta bu zhes bya ba ni snod chen po ste thabs kyi sgyed po la gzugs pa'i snod chen po dang 'dra ba'i lhung bzed tshad las 'das pa che bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thab snod lta bu zhes bya ba ni snod chen po ste thabs kyi sgyed po la gzugs pa'i snod chen po dang 'dra ba'i lhung bzed tshad las 'das pa che bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase like a cooking vessel means a large vessel, like a large pot placed on a stove. The phrase exceeds the proper size means it is larger than the proper size.

original: nye 'khor thibs po zhes bya ba ni khor ra khor yug na tshang tshing la sogs pa @152b 'dzings pa'i thibs po dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye 'khor thibs po zhes bya ba ni khor ra khor yug na tshang tshing la sogs pa @152b 'dzings pa'i thibs po dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase thickets nearby means that there are thickets of vines and so on nearby.

original: g-yar zhes bya ba ni bkra mi shis pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: g-yar zhes bya ba ni bkra mi shis pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase in an inauspicious place means an inauspicious place.

original: bu mos yongs su dub pa zhes bya ba ni bu mos skyo ba'o //
analyzed: bu mos yongs su dub pa zhes bya ba ni bu mos skyo ba'o //
translated: The phrase weary with children means tired with children.

original: des tshigs su bcad pa dag smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: des tshigs su bcad pa dag smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase she spoke these verses and so on means:🔽I am weary with children, and my husband is always away from home.

original: rgya skyegs shing gi so shing byed pa dang / nub tu sngas bstan te nyal ba dang / shin tu gnyid che ba zho 'thung ba dang / chung ma g-yas zhar len par byed pa na de dag ni bkra mi shis pa yin pa'i phyir lha chen po zhi ba'ang gnas nas nyams shing drungs nas 'byin par 'gyur na gzhan dag lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgya skyegs shing gi so shing byed pa dang / nub tu sngas bstan te nyal ba dang / shin tu gnyid che ba zho 'thung ba dang / chung ma g-yas zhar len par byed pa na de dag ni bkra mi shis pa yin pa'i phyir lha chen po zhi ba'ang gnas nas nyams shing drungs nas 'byin par 'gyur na gzhan dag lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If they cause the decline and destruction of the great god Shiva, what need is there to speak of other men?🔽When one who stops is stopped by another,

original: 'gog la 'gog byed bab pa dang // rdo la lcags ni bab pa ltar //
analyzed: 'gog la 'gog byed bab pa dang // rdo la lcags ni bab pa ltar //
translated: like a stone sinking in iron,

original: zhes bya ba ni dpe ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dpe ste /
translated: This is an example.

original: ji ltar chom rkun pa la lam 'gog par byed pa la chom rkun pa las 'gog par byed pa gzhan bab pa na gang rgyal gang pham par the tshom za ba dang / rdo la lcags bab pa na gang gang gis choms the tshom za ba ltar ro ;
analyzed: ji ltar chom rkun pa la lam 'gog par byed pa la chom rkun pa las 'gog par byed pa gzhan bab pa na gang rgyal gang pham par the tshom za ba dang / rdo la lcags bab pa na gang gang gis choms the tshom za ba ltar ro ;
translated: Just as when a thief is stopped by another thief, it is uncertain who will win and who will lose, and when a stone sinks in iron, it is uncertain who will sink and who will not,

original: / khyod kyang chung ma gsod byed ma //
analyzed: / khyod kyang chung ma gsod byed ma //
translated: you are a killer of your wife.

original: de yang g-yas zhar yin pas na //
analyzed: de yang g-yas zhar yin pas na //
translated: And since the girl is a left-handed one,

original: khyed gnyis gang rgyal gang pham lta'o //
analyzed: khyed gnyis gang rgyal gang pham lta'o //
translated: we will see who wins and who loses.

original: zhes bya ba ni don de dpe de bzhin du khyod kyang chung ma gsod par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don de dpe de bzhin du khyod kyang chung ma gsod par byed pa yin la /
translated: The meaning is that you are like the man who kills his wife,

original: bu mo de g-yas zhar yin pas na khyod gnyis 'dus na gang gson gang 'chi ba the tshom gyi gnas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bu mo de g-yas zhar yin pas na khyod gnyis 'dus na gang gson gang 'chi ba the tshom gyi gnas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and since the girl is a left-handed one, if you two come together, it will be a matter of doubt who will live and who will die.

original: 'bras thug po che drus pa skam po yul ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung gang la ni 'bras thug po che drus pa skam po ma ga dh'a'i srang bcu drug ste /
analyzed: 'bras thug po che drus pa skam po yul ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung gang la ni 'bras thug po che drus pa skam po ma ga dh'a'i srang bcu drug ste /
translated: One Magadha-drona of dry, crushed rice is sixteen Magadha-palas of dry, crushed rice.

original: yul ma ga dh'a'i srang gcig la bod kyi srang gnyis yod do //
analyzed: yul ma ga dh'a'i srang gcig la bod kyi srang gnyis yod do //
translated: One Magadha-pala is two Tibetan-palas.

original: bod kyi srang tshad du brtsi ba ni sum cu rtsa gnyis yod ;
analyzed: bod kyi srang tshad du brtsi ba ni sum cu rtsa gnyis yod ;
translated: When calculated in Tibetan-palas, there are thirty-two.

original: / phul tshad du brtsi ba ni bdun phul do dang khyor gang yod do //
analyzed: / phul tshad du brtsi ba ni bdun phul do dang khyor gang yod do //
translated: When calculated in Tibetan-khal, there are seven khal and one khyor.

original: ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung do la ni de nyis 'gyur yod do //
analyzed: ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung do la ni de nyis 'gyur yod do //
translated: Two Magadha-droṇas are double that.

original: btsos pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras skam btsos pa'i chan no //
analyzed: btsos pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras skam btsos pa'i chan no //
translated: “Cooked” means rice that is cooked and then dried.🔽“With soup and with vegetables” means that if soup and vegetables are added,

original: sran tshod dang bcas tshong ma dang bcas pa blugs na zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar tshod ma mang ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sran tshod dang bcas tshong ma dang bcas pa blugs na zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar tshod ma mang ba yin mod kyi /
translated: it is as if there is a lot of vegetables.

original: 'on kyang tshod ma ji tsam gyis 'bras chan spags nus pa de tsam kho na'i tshod ma 'dir gzung gi lhag ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshod ma ji tsam gyis 'bras chan spags nus pa de tsam kho na'i tshod ma 'dir gzung gi lhag ma ni ma yin no //
translated: However, only as much vegetables as can be mixed with the rice is meant here, not more.🔽“With soup” means with liquid soup.

original: sran tshod dang bcas zhes bya ba ni gsher tshod dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: sran tshod dang bcas zhes bya ba ni gsher tshod dang bcas pa'o //
translated: “With vegetables” means with cooked vegetables such as greens.🔽“From the very edge of the mouth” means from the very edge of the mouth of the begging bowl, not from the inside, the bottom, and so on.🔽“With the palm of the hand” means with the whole palm.

original: tshod ma dang bcas zhes bya ba ni shol tshod la sogs pa sngo tshod kyi bya na dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: tshod ma dang bcas zhes bya ba ni shol tshod la sogs pa sngo tshod kyi bya na dang bcas pa'o //
translated: “With the fingers” means with the fingers.🔽“With the back of the hand” means with the back of the hand.🔽“With the wrist” means with the wrist.🔽“With the forearm” means with the forearm.🔽“With the upper arm” means with the upper arm.🔽“With the shoulder” means with the shoulder.

original: kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na nas zhes bya ba @153a * //
analyzed: kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na nas zhes bya ba @153a * //
translated: “With the neck” means with the neck.🔽“With the head” means with the head.🔽“With the body” means with the body.🔽“With the foot” means with the foot.🔽“With the ankle” means with the ankle.🔽“With the calf” means with the calf.🔽“With the thigh” means with the thigh.🔽“With the hip” means with the hip.🔽“With the buttocks” means with the buttocks.🔽“With the back” means with the back.🔽“With the chest” means with the chest.🔽“With the ribs” means with the ribs.🔽“With the armpit” means with the armpit.🔽“With the side” means with the side.🔽“With the belly” means with the belly.

original: ni lhung bzed kyi kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na nas nang rol gyi zhabs la sogs su'o //
analyzed: ni lhung bzed kyi kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na nas nang rol gyi zhabs la sogs su'o //
translated: “With the navel” means with the navel.🔽“With the heart” means with the heart.🔽“With the ribs” means with the ribs.🔽“With the throat” means with the throat.🔽“With the chin” means with the chin.🔽“With the mouth” means with the mouth.

original: mthe bo'i lto gang gis mi rag pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthe bo'i lto gang gis mi rag pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: “With the nose” means with the nose.🔽“With the forehead” means with the forehead.🔽“With the head” means with the head.🔽“With the hair” means with the hair.🔽“With the top of the head” means with the top of the head.🔽“With the crown” means with

original: mthe bo'i lto gang zhes bya ba ni mthe bo'i tshigs dang po'i phyogs gcig nas brtsams te tshigs de nyid kyi phyogs gcig gi bar ni mthe bo'i lto ste /
analyzed: mthe bo'i lto gang zhes bya ba ni mthe bo'i tshigs dang po'i phyogs gcig nas brtsams te tshigs de nyid kyi phyogs gcig gi bar ni mthe bo'i lto ste /
translated: The palm of the thumb is the area from one side of the first joint of the thumb to the other side of that joint.

original: mthe bo'i zheng chad kyi sor gcig gi tshad kyis kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na nas zas la mi reg mi thug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mthe bo'i zheng chad kyi sor gcig gi tshad kyis kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na nas zas la mi reg mi thug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The measure of the width of the palm of the thumb is one finger width. The meaning of the statement “one should not touch the food with the mouth” is that one should not touch the food with the mouth up to the edge of the mouth.

original: 'di skad bstan te dge slong gi lhung bzed che tshad byin gyis brlab tu rung ba ni 'bras thug po che drus pa skam yul ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung do btsos pa'i chan de'i rkyen gyi tshod ma gang yang rung ba dang bcas pa blugs na mthe bo'i
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te dge slong gi lhung bzed che tshad byin gyis brlab tu rung ba ni 'bras thug po che drus pa skam yul ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung do btsos pa'i chan de'i rkyen gyi tshod ma gang yang rung ba dang bcas pa blugs na mthe bo'i
translated: This is explained as follows: A monk’s alms bowl that is the right size for a blessing is one that is not filled with dry, uncooked rice from Magadha, which is the size of a small Magadhan bushel, together with any type of vegetable dish that is cooked.

original: sor gcig gis ma gang ba yin no //🔽lhung bzed chung tshad ni de'i phyed shong ba'o //
analyzed: sor gcig gis ma gang ba yin no // lhung bzed chung tshad ni de'i phyed shong ba'o //
translated: The bowl is not filled with one finger width of rice.🔽A small alms bowl is one that holds half that amount.

original: lhung bzed 'bring tshad ni de gnyis kyi bar gang yang rung ba shod pa'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed 'bring tshad ni de gnyis kyi bar gang yang rung ba shod pa'o //
translated: A medium alms bowl is one that holds any amount between those two.

original: dge slong gis ci tsam du bre'u chung phyed dang lnga las lhag pa'i bsod snyoms len na thams cad bu ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lhang bzed gang ngam gnyis sam gsum mam lhag pa zhes bya ba ni spyi'i tshad yin te 'bras thug po
analyzed: dge slong gis ci tsam du bre'u chung phyed dang lnga las lhag pa'i bsod snyoms len na thams cad bu ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lhang bzed gang ngam gnyis sam gsum mam lhag pa zhes bya ba ni spyi'i tshad yin te 'bras thug po
translated: If a fully ordained monk accepts alms that exceed half an Indian medium sized container, then he commits a downfall.🔽The phrase “one, two, three, or more begging bowls” is a general measure.

original: che skam yul ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung phyed dang lnga btsos pa'i cha tshod ma ma gtogs pa las lhag pa'i bsod snyoms ni ltung byed 'di'i dngos gzhi'i byed pa po'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: che skam yul ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung phyed dang lnga btsos pa'i cha tshod ma ma gtogs pa las lhag pa'i bsod snyoms ni ltung byed 'di'i dngos gzhi'i byed pa po'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “a dry measure of medium sized Indian bushels” is connected to the phrase “except for a measure of boiled vegetables,” which means that if a monk accepts alms that exceed a dry measure of half an Indian medium sized bushel of boiled rice, then he commits a root downfall of this class of precepts.

original: tshod ma ni ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshod ma ni ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase “except for a measure of boiled vegetables” means that

original: dge slong ji snyed yod kyang rung 'bras thug po che skam yul ma ga dh'a'i 'bru chung phyed dang lnga btsos pa'i chan tshod ma ma gtogs pa de las lhag pa'i bsod snyoms len na thams cad du ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong ji snyed yod kyang rung 'bras thug po che skam yul ma ga dh'a'i 'bru chung phyed dang lnga btsos pa'i chan tshod ma ma gtogs pa de las lhag pa'i bsod snyoms len na thams cad du ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: if a monk accepts alms that exceed a dry measure of half an Indian medium sized bushel of boiled rice, then he commits a downfall.

original: sbyin bdag gis ci bder byas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam mi dgos par bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis ci bder byas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam mi dgos par bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase as the donor wishes means without regard to one's own wishes.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ni tshod mi shes pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir bca' ba mdzad do //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ni tshod mi shes pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir bca' ba mdzad do //
translated: This rule was formulated in order to prohibit the excessive consumption of food.

original: lhung bzed do gsum tsam las lhag par len pa'i ltung byed de sum cu gsum pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: lhung bzed do gsum tsam las lhag par len pa'i ltung byed de sum cu gsum pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The thirty-third chapter, on the downfall of accepting more than three begging bowls, is completed.

original: // / stan gcig pa'i zas zhes bya ba ni gnas btang ba'i mtshan nyid kyis spang pa ma byas par bza' ba'o //
analyzed: // / stan gcig pa'i zas zhes bya ba ni gnas btang ba'i mtshan nyid kyis spang pa ma byas par bza' ba'o //
translated: The phrase food of a single sitting means food that is eaten without abandoning the place of eating by the characteristic of having left the place.

original: snying las chung ngu zhes bya ba ni bya ba nyung ba nyid gyis mngon par brtson pa'o //
analyzed: snying las chung ngu zhes bya ba ni bya ba nyung ba nyid gyis mngon par brtson pa'o //
translated: The phrase with little desire means with little activity and with little engagement.
